Nous avons passé un très bon sejour chez John. C'est l'occasion unique de résider dans un château ancien avec tout le confort moderne. L'appartement proposé par John est très propre, très agréable et totalement conforme à la description. Nous recommandons vivement et nous y reviendrons avec beaucoup de plaisir.
Thank you John. It was amazing!

If you want the quintessential experience of staying in a castle in Scotland, this place is it! You enter through a quaint walled courtyard in the back of the castle and follow the blue doors into your apartment. The beautiful walled private outdoor area is perfect for letting your kids play without worrying they’ll wander off, and the space has everything you could need. The host greeted us and was so friendly and great with our kids. We enjoyed the local walking trail, and we met the super friendly neighbor who gave us a tour of the absolutely stunning gatehouse bridge you cross on the way to the castle. The river was so fun for the kids, and John provided a fishing pole and my son was thrilled to catch a crawfish! As we walked the grounds back to the apartment, we saw what seemed like the largest tree In Scotland! It was like a small sequoia! The apartment was comfortable, clean and so fun to experience after touring castle ruins and castle museums! Highly recommend!

Great little flat in the bottom floor of the castle but you don’t get to really see much of the castle. Clean, well stocked and nice layout. Great walks around the area. Very clean. A great quiet place to recharge and relax.

description.summary: Self contained ground floor apartment in a romantic Scottish Castle in beautiful Strathardle, miles of forest and hill walks, easy access to local restaurants, Balmoral and St Andrews, a place for quiet contemplation or full on outdoor activities.
description.space: The Garden Apartment is a modest space accessed via the small courtyard.  The apartment has a kitchen/living room, two twin bedrooms, one with ensuite and a further bathroom. It has its own garden area and a shared utility room.
description.access: The majority of the gardens are available to visitors, with the front of the castle being reserved for the owners. There is also half a mile of fishing for guests to use, although they will be required to bring their own fishing tackle.
description.notes: DIRECTIONS Located a few miles from Bridge of Cally on the A924, arriving guests should look out for a set of stone gate pillars with sleeping dogs on top and a gatehouse that signals the Blackcraig Castle entrance road. Following this they should proceed down the tree-lined driveway and over one of the few remaining Bridge Houses in Scotland. Access to the Apartments is the SECOND turn on the left after crossing the bridge house.
description.neighborhood: Ground floor apartment in a romantic Scottish Castle in beautiful Strathardle, miles of forest and hill walks, easy access to local restaurants, Balmoral and St Andrews, a place for quiet contemplation or full on outdoor activities.
description.transit:
Best accessed by car as  the bus service is limited, and the nearest Bus Station is Blairgowrie (14km) and railway station is Perth (40km).

Chauffeur driven private tours are available if required.
description.interaction: When at the Castle we are happy to assist our guests with information about local amenities. There is also the possibility of arranging a tour of the Castle (unfortunately this is temporarily unavailable due to the current covid guidelines)
description.house_rules:
We expect guests to treat the property with respect and leave it in a clean and tidy state.
There is a no smoking allowed and no pets to be kept in the apartments.

This is not a review; this is a "love letter" to the Santa Marta de Portuzelo castle. 
What started as looking for accommodations for a 17 people group visit to Portugal, turned into an unforgettable experience and this location had a lot to do with that.
This is a GREAT location for large groups with plenty of rooms (each with its own bathroom); multiple spaces for the entire group (large living room, a great pool and plenty other spaces for adults to take a break while kids play on the grounds. The large dining room allowed us to hire a chef via the Supper Chefs sites to cook for us one evening .
We had the BEST host ever!  Ana Maria made us feel welcomed before we got there and even after we left. She made sure we had all info we needed for our stay, was very clear and promptly responded our questions, and provided great recommendations for day trips, shopping, etc.
BOTTOM LINE, the only downside was leaving and not booking more days there. We are comining back for sure for Part 2!
I totally recommend this place. The castle is magical. This was an experience to remember. We had an amazing experience. Ana María is super nice, she is a great hostess.
10/10 would 100% recommend to anyone looking in the future

I rented the castle for my 30th birthday and invited 11 of my closest friends. We could not have been happier with the experience - days by the pool! Hikes in the area! A day trip to Porto! Some of them even are talking about coming back next year, which, of course, I fully endorse! Can’t recommend this place enough.

Ana Maria was a wonderful host. She was proactive and responsive to all our needs.

The castle itself was beautiful, and the perfect spot for a group trip. We spent many hours near the pool and enjoying the Castle grounds.

The castle itself was lovely, with lots of character and many details to explore. Ammenities were as described, and we'll updated considering the age of the property. Showers were warm and had good water pressure. Clothes dried quickly in the sun on the clothesline. 

Bugs can get bad near dusk due to proximity to the river, so we'd recommend guests get some bug spray at the local Continente, which is very close. If anything else is needed during your stay, like extra pool towels, the store is very close and easy to get to!

Everything was lovely and we hope to come back in the future!!

description.summary: The Castle is located 40 minutes from Porto (Francisco Sa Carneiro) airport, with a variety of cultural experiences near the city. You will love this place because of the location, the beautiful grounds and landscaping, the peaceful atmosphere and the unique construction of the house. My house is great for big families (including young children) and large groups of friends who want to disconnect in a quiet environment, while having convenient access to the city center (1.2 miles).
description.space:
"Santa Marta de Portuzelo Castle".
 
It is a Manueline style house that has elements from the 12th to the 19th centuries.
It is approximately 2000 m2 (approximately 21,528 sq ft), distributed over two floors and a tower. Access to the first floor is through a stone stairway that starts from a hallway, from which you access the chapel, on the right hand side and a hall of about 50 m2 on the left. 
It consists of 12 bedrooms, with 9 available to guests. The rooms are approximately 50m2 (approximately 538 sq ft), all of them have a en suite bathroom and two of them have a fireplace. There are three living rooms, two dining rooms, a huge kitchen, toilets , large hallways, a chapel and plenty of extra space to enjoy your leisure!
On the lower floor there is a hallway, a chapel, a staircase leading to the first floor, a living room that communicates with a dining room, another living room, communicated with another dining room, a bedroom with bathroom, kitchens and auxiliary units .. 
On the first floor  there is a hall, a living room and 9 bedrooms all of them with en suite bathrooms. Tower and Chapel are closed to the public
The garden expands out about 17,000 m2 (approximately 4.2 acres), with its most outstanding features: the manuelino-style watchtower, the dovecote, the 16th century fountain and a tunnel that leads to the  fontain patio giving way to the main facade of the property.
In the garden there are a variety of ornamental trees: orange, lemon, olive, chestnut, palm, cypress, walnut and fig.
There is an outdoor pool approximately 17x8 m (55x26 feet) and sufficient parking.
You access the property by a traditional Portuguese stone paved road, between high stone walls in a rural setting, with olive groves and small chapels at the crossroads.
From the first floor of the Castle you can soak in views of the Lima river and the Atlantic Ocean.
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire house, except the chapel and the tower, which are private access only.
description.notes: In the chapel you can not officiate weddings but if you choose Santa Marta de Portucelo to get married, there is a very nice church in the village of Santa Marta de Portucelo, which is a 5 minute walk from the house.
description.neighborhood: Santa Marta de Portuzelo Castel is located in a village called Santa Marta. It is a quiet place, surrounded by nature and typical Portuguese stone houses. The house is located a few meters from the Rio Lima and the Atlantic Ocean making it an ideal place to rest.
description.transit: The best option to enjoy a complete vacation is to rent a car / micro bus with or without driver to move around the area, as well as to move to nearby cities and get to know the North of Portugal to the fullest.
description.interaction: I am available to my guests 24 hours a day to resolve any issues that may arise during their stay. If you are traveling by plane, I am available to assist you with your transportation: I will greet you at the airport, assist you in the rental car process, and then guide you to the house. If you are traveling by car, we can arrange a meeting point to make it easier for you to get to the house without problems. Regardless of how you arrive, I will be there to give you a personal tour of the castle, answer any questions, highlight points of interest, and help you in any other way that I can.
description.house_rules:
- It is absolutely forbbiden the use of the image of  "Castelo de Portuzelo" for promotional activities or professional activity  and it is not authorized to: film, disclose, photograph and use said goods for personal benefit in any format or audiovisual broadcast, on social networks ( Facebook, TikTok, instagram, LinkedIn, etc…), web pages, or in any other way without the prior commercial agreement with Landlord in this regard and without paying the amounts that are usually received.

recent.comments: Karen and her castle were amazing.  The Castle was the most unique, historic and entertaining place my family has ever stayed at and we travel a lot.  Karen is very responsive and her dogs were wonderfully friendly.   Great location as well.

items.comments: Karen and her castle were amazing.  The Castle was the most unique, historic and entertaining place my family has ever stayed at and we travel a lot.  Karen is very responsive and her dogs were wonderfully friendly.   Great location as well.

great location! We loved staying here with our kids. We all had a great time. The one thing that you may not realize: it is really close to many good restaurants and other locations. the host is quite accommodating and friendly. the castle is larger than we thought. if you want a castle-like experience that is close to a town, this should be top of your list. thank you!!
Amazing castle near Galway with a wonderful host and family of greyhounds who our children loved! Amazing views and a great location to make day trips to historical sites or the coast.

Words can’t not describe just how amazing Karen’s castle is!! My family of five - husband 3 small children and I had the most magical time. To stay in our own castle in Ireland is something some only dream of and I’m so blessed it worked out. And Karen was the best host! She introduced us to her 6, four month old greyhound puppies that my kiddos got to play with, let my kids feed her chickens and horse and was just so kind and welcoming. There were toys in the castle for the kids to play with and on one of the rainy days, my kids had fun playing hide and go seek in the castle, having an amazing tea party in the dining room and playing cards in the parlor. I wish we would have stayed longer-3 nights was not enough! We will be back! Thank you again Karen!!

We took our 3 kids to a Castle and stayed there for 3 days.    This was amazing.  
You can stay at a 5 star hotel anytime but you cant stay at a real castle.  Kids loved the animals and Karen is a perfect host.

The castle is really an unreal experience.
How many people can say they stayed at a castle!!!

I hope this place is around for another 200 years for people to enjoy.
Karen was amazing! The castle was beautiful and private, Karen answered all of our questions and was very responsive. We loved our stay!

Karen was very slow to respond to our messages if she responded at all. Our GPS took us to the wrong place , and when we finally found her, we couldn't wait to get settled as we had been driving all day. However, there was no food, no drink, no wifi.  everything was closed . The castle itself was very musty and cramped with stuff, and our rooms were up flights of stairs . she suggested leaving our luggage downstairs, which I thought was another inconvenience.  I really looked forward to this stay based on listing, but we left the keys and didn't go back .

description.summary:
Kilcolgan Castle offers guests privacy and advice on touring the area if wanted. Close to the Burren, Connemara, Aran Islands and Cliffs of Moher for day trips. Short drive to Galway City. Homely atmosphere where you have full use of our spacious kitchen and all rooms but ours.
We also have a farmyard cottage on grounds suitable for five extra guests if needed
Ask about the special three night rates for two guests
Special for winter months...1 or 2 day stays at reduced rates for up to 5 guests
description.space:
Access to several reception rooms with open fires and spacious kitchen dining area. Horses on the grounds. Exclusive fishing on our private water out the back. 9 acres of fields to walk. Very tranquil place.

Historical tour of the Castle included. Browse the library full of old books

access to bedrooms on floor below or wing off kitchen as these are private

hosts.about: Sykes Holiday Cottages is an independent holiday cottage rental agency, with the finest selection of holidays across the UK and Ireland. Whether it’s a family-friendly holiday, a pet-friendly holiday or an activity and adventure-filled holiday, find your ideal UK break with Sykes Holiday Cottages.

description.summary: The Elizabeth Suite is in Ulverston and can sleep four people in two bedrooms.
description.space: This first-floor apartment consists of a kitchen/diner with g. Electric oven, induction hob, combi microwave/oven, fridge/freezer, washer/dryer, dishwasher, coffee maker, wine cooler and dining seating for four. There is also a sitting room with Smart TV. The bedrooms consist of two king-size, along with a bathroom. Outside, there are communal, landscaped garden and off-road parking for two cars. WiFi, fuel, power, bed linen and towels are all included in the price. Apologies, no pets and no smoking. Within 0.2 miles there is a shop and within 0.4 miles, a pub. The Elizabeth Suite makes a stylish getaway to Cumbria. Please note: Check-in is from 4pm and check-out is from 10am.

description.neighborhood: Ulverston is a traditional market town built around a cobbled main street. It boasts a fine selection of independent shops, café’s, and pubs with open fires and real ales. There is an extensive selection of eating places to suit everyone, from fine dining to traditional pub food. Ulverston is also well known as a festival town, with events ranging from flags and walking to art and music festivals throughout the summer months and with the renowned Dickensian Christmas festival in late November. It is the birthplace of Stan Laurel and world record holder of the biggest foam pie fight in the world giving a glimpse into the fun community spirited little town. There are excellent walks around the town and beautiful countryside, with views of the southern Lake District and Morecambe Bay. Home to the deepest, widest and shortest canal, which makes for a lovely afternoon walk with a pub at the end and views over the bay. All of the attractions of the National Park are also easily reached. The Furness Coast boasts sandy beaches and good birdwatching. Nearby family attractions include the South Lakes Wild Animal Park, Lakes Windermere and Coniston and popular Birkrigg Common, with its incredible panoramic views across Morecambe Bay.

Incredible property! Incredible host! Had the best time!

The attention to detail and uniqueness of The Castle make it a great place to stay!  We played golf for 3 days during our stay, and this was a convenient location minutes from Whistling Straits.  The Castle even has it's own golf simulator!  And of course, the outdoor spa and fire pit were a welcoming retreat after 18 holes.  Would definitely repeat!

Tyler was an excellent host. Reached out plenty of times before or stay and during to make sure everything was going well. He was very responsive when we had a minor issue, someone was out with-in the hour to address. 

The Castle Vineyard is beautiful! You feel like you are driving up to a Tuscan Villa. They have everything you need as far as cookware, plates, bowls, cutlery, etc... The grounds are beautiful. The theatre/ game room/ golf simulator room is amazing! We spent a lot of time in there.

My husband and I just had our wedding at the castle on the 20th and we couldn’t possibly say enough good things. My whole family was impressed! We were having a few issues on arrival and Tyler and his team were on it so FAST! Everything went smoothly after. The grounds are massive and gorgeous, coming from downtown Milwaukee, we weren’t prepared for how peaceful this castle was going to be! The movie theater was by far my favorite part, the bass is better than any movie theater I’ve been to, and my husband was in love with the salt water hot tub and outdoor deck. The wine tasting hall was GREAT for serving food and having a nice family dinner too. The piano room, I could go on and on about the piano room. You just have to see this place, don’t think, just book! I will absolutely be back, if not to the castle ANY of their other properties. They clearly have a very high standard and they’re sticking to it!

description.summary:
As seen on the cover of Haven, a luxury home magazine! 

This masterpiece was built over the course of seven years and is officially open to the public in 2022!

For travelers who want an exclusive taste of Tuscany without the hassle of jetting across an ocean, "The Castle Vineyard" is the place to stay. The dramatic, spellbinding stone castle proudly overlooks over twenty acres of idyllic rolling hills and a gorgeous, working vineyard. Once inside, the interior does nothing to dispel the magic.
description.space:
ACCEPTING 2024 EVENTS! Separate event fees apply. Guests must inquire prior to booking. Exceeding capacity without approval prior to booking results in immediate termination of contract. 


Introducing The Castle Vineyard, an exclusive property offered by Wisconsin Getaways, the epitome of premier experiential stays in Wisconsin. With a remarkable portfolio of premier properties and an impeccable rating of 4.99 out of 5.0 from over 400 reviews, Wisconsin Getaways guarantees an unparalleled experience for guests looking for the very best.

Golf cart rental available for $150/per stay. Message us direct for details. 

The castle is a perfect blend of design elements inspired by Tuscan vineyards, castles of Europe, historic Wisconsin barns, mid-century American industry and turn of the century churches. Only the very best material had been chosen with delicate care to create a richly vibrant castle filled with special custom-made pieces. 

Home Entry 

Before you even walk into the castle, you are greeted with the arched beauty of the spectacular mahogany and glass front door. This gorgeous arched door was sourced from a professional, Italian door maker who was moving back to Italy. Once you open the door, you are immediately greeted with a gorgeously lit foyer that features an original Milwaukee gas streetlamp. 

Piano Room 

In true European style, there is a beautiful piano room which features a miniature baby grand piano hanging above as a chandelier. Little known fact… This exquisite instrument was a retirement gift from General MacArthur to his limo driver. And in case you are wondering, no you do not have to take a ladder to play the chandelier piano! There is a lovely grand piano that our musically inclined guests are welcomed to tinkle away on. 

Dining Room 

Brightly lit with its numerous wooden windows that continue to carry out the castle’s rustic appeal, the dining room is yet another room that oozes country elegance. Handcrafted from a 1914 John Deere two bottom plow, the dining room table comfortably seats eight. Hanging above the table hangs a uniquely crafted dining room light created from a hay trolley. 

Kitchen 

The open kitchen plan is a luxury not to be understated. You can find church lights in the kitchen and loft area originating from an 1800's church in Plymouth, Wisconsin. But while the decor may be historic, the kitchen equipment is quite the contrary! The kitchen features state-of-the-art Viking kitchen appliances and a 6' x 11' stainless steel kitchen island. Though this beautiful castle may be rustic in personality, its amenities sure aren’t.

Best of all, with the beautiful windows filling up the kitchen walls, you will be able to get lost in the serenity of the rolling hills and vineyards while you cook! 
Fun Fact: Legend has it, the sailfish that can be seen in the kitchen, was purchased at an Ernest Hemmingway auction in southern Florida. In the process of shipping the sailfish from Florida to Kohler, all the paperwork of authenticity disappeared. The sailfish hung in the Kohler showroom until the store closed in the early 2000's. The builder of this gorgeous estate bought it on the store's closing day so that this legend will continue to live on. 

Office 

While it is a given that you need to relax while on vacation, especially when you are staying in an estate as dreamy as this, this stunning estate offers a wonderful office that is sure to inspire productivity. The lighting in this space is second to none. It not only features an original gas streetlamp from Fort Wayne, Indiana, but the water-pulley light above the desk was specifically sourced from a classic wood sawing mill. If there wasn’t already enough history seeping throughout the room, the combination lock safe was purchased at the estate sale of Clifton Edward Tufte, the founder of Road America. 

Spiral Staircase 

One of our favorite parts of The Castle Vineyard would be the gorgeous, wooden, spiraling open-plan staircase. The unique branching pattern in the wood of the winding staircase and railings was accomplished by fractal burning… a technique that creates patterns in wood resembling branching or fractal patterns. It adds a whole new dimension to classically elegant, Arcadian beauty. 

The Wine Hall

Wine hall? Yes please! 

Asides from the presence of amazing wine, the highlights of the hall would be its gorgeous, award-winning 1902 potato plow chandelier. For a true blue, wine country feels to the place, all the wood used for the tables, benches, and barrel shelves were sourced from an original Johnsonville Brat smokehouse's floor joists and the 32 whiskey barrels lining the walls of the Wine Hall are from Maker’s Mark Whiskey in Loretto, Kentucky. Whilst the entire estate is incredibly dignified and well-polished, the castle remains true to its rustic roots with its original barn metal roof ceiling and most interestingly, the door to the wine cellar was the original gun room door off a WWII Battleship!

Theater Room

This home theater room is a massive highlight for our travelers who are genuine movie lovers. This top-of-the-line movie theater in the tasting room has a twelve seat (three row) setup, an incredibly generous 135” screen and a Dolby 7.2.2 sound system that would be able to make anyone feel like they were truly a part of the movie! Not to mention, with over 600 Blu-ray DVDs you can choose from and a popcorn machine, the film experience in the Castle Vineyard’s theater room is second to none. Think Marcus Cinema, only WAY better!

Bedrooms

Main Bedroom: On the first floor you will be able to find the main bedroom. It offers a generous, queen-sized bed and a full-sized bed (built in the 1800's). Leading off the main bedroom is the piano room featuring another pull-out bed, making it the perfect bedroom for late night music sessions!

Private Master Loft: Overlooking the main floor is the private master loft with a half bathroom. Wake up in a king-sized bed that overlooks the beautiful grounds. No window treatments are added to keep the natural beauty, but sleep masks are provided to ensure a restful night's sleep!

Basement Bedroom: Generously sized Queen bedroom set with wooden sliding barn door.

Basement Bunk: Two bunks, four beds, each with private curtain treatments! Unique ceiling lights made from the old drive gears of a Caterpillar bulldozer. Wooden walls, paneling, and beds… a truly Arcadian experience not to be missed! 

Living Room

With the presence of a gorgeous, stone fireplace, you will be in for warm evenings ahead huddling up on those comfy Baker couches. If you look closely at the stone fireplace, you might be able to see the prehistoric figures secretly embedded in the swirling patterns of the fireplace!

Bathrooms

Offering 2.5 bathrooms - there are two showers, one soaking tub, a walk-in sauna, three toilets and one urinal across both. Depending on the bathroom experience you would like to have, one bathroom offers a luxurious rustic experience with its wide-open space and lightly painted room, while the other bathroom offers a Tuscan castle experience with its European-style décor and red painted walls.

Vineyard

In the spring of 2021, 400 grapevines were planted in an organic mixture of topsoil, sand, and cow/chicken manure. The stone pillar vineyard features the following grape varieties: Edelweiss, Marquette, Kay Gray, Frontenac, Beta, Valiant, Somerset, Reliance, St. Theresa, Vanessa, and Concord. Come back in 2023 for "The Castle Vineyard" wine tastings.

Other

Private chef: Is your group looking for a prepared meal to create the ultimate experience? Message directly for options! Wine tastings, cheese pairings, or mixologist? Message for details!

At The Castle Vineyard, a Wisconsin Getaways property, we are focused on creating ultimate experiences for our guests. The expectation is that we will go above and beyond to leave a lasting memory. So please let us know how we can help! 

Follow us on social media!

Insta: @WisconsinGetaways
FB: Wisconsin Getaways

recent.comments: What a magical place to stay, the castle! We were lucky enough to stay 5 nights. It was peaceful and tranquil. We spent a lot of time reading on the rooftop and in the cozy apartment. Then ventured out for day trips in our rental car to some of the most beautiful places one can imagine. We are from California and greatly appreciated the greenery, chill in the air, and sheep/cows everywhere. We day tripped to the Highlands, St. Andrew’s, and loads of small towns in and around Dollar. The apartment was spotless and had all the amenities one could ask for in this area. It was a trip we will always remember.

We had an amazing stay at the castle.  Paul’s place was even better than the pictures. It was a perfect place for our family holiday in Scotland. The beds were comfortable and the kitchen was well stocked. There are a lot of stairs which was not an issue for us but could be an issue if you have mobility issues. The grounds were stunning as well. You will definitely need a car to get around the area. Highly recommend this unique stay!

Dollarbeg Castle was such an AMAZING place to stay to explore the countryside! Prior to arrival, clear check-in/check-out instructions were provided by Paul. Toni was so nice, flexible, & responsive (& impressive with constantly going up/down the stairs!). The beds were so comfortable; the towels, robes & slippers provided so soft; the thoughtful decor made for a special & unique stay for the entire family. Really luxurious! Main entry is shared but then there is a private entrance to your Tower Apartment up the stairs. As you proceed up the stairs, the Wallace Bedroom is first. Then a few more steps and you have the sitting room (with great Sonos sound system), the pristine & well equipped kitchen, Balmoral room (en suite) and a shared bathroom. Further up the spiral staircase is the cozy cinema room and then still further is the Mary Queen of Scots room and then finally at the top is the spectacular deck - views worth every step! Thank you for a once-in-a-lifetime experience!

This place was incredible!! We rented Stirling castle to get married in and stayed here while in town and the stay was wonderful, the host Toni was very fast on responding back and answered all our questions fast! I absolutely would stay here again! Was the best place I’ve stayed at in ALL of Scotland!

Pictures truly do not do this castle justice. My family and I had the greatest time here and enjoyed the sunset views so much. The rooms are spacious, beautiful dining area and great kitchen. The grounds are amazing and very walkable. Toni the property manager was fantastic too.

description.summary:
DOLLARBEG CASTLE is a unique castle vacation location in Scotland. This luxury apartment has 3 themed bedrooms, a cinema room & tower, with private rooftop terrace and panoramic views of the surrounding countryside & the Ochil Hills.

The Tower apartment at the unique & historic Dollarbeg Castle has been fully refurbished & is presented to a high standard, with luxury furnishings. It retains great character throughout, with turreted corners in several rooms & outstanding views from every window.
description.space:
Situated in a  baronial style castle in Scotland, close to Stirling. The property has modern and luxurious furnishings in all rooms. Four poster beds can be found in every bedroom with luxury bedding.

There is a private cinema room with 75" TV with streaming services such as Netflix and Prime Video.

Stunning views can be had from the private rooftop terrace, where you will find sun loungers and a large outdoor picnic table.
description.access: Free private parking. Car recommended. The Tower apartment is located in the main tower of the castle and has a private rooftop terrace. There are a good number of stairs in the Tower!
description.notes:
Complimentary:
A bottle of Champagne and a complimentary Scottish welcome basket are provided on arrival.

Min 3 night stay (2 nights possible on certain dates). No pets allowed. Adults & children over the age of 13 only. Strictly no smoking. No loud parties or large gatherings permitted.
description.neighborhood:
DOLLARBEG CASTLE lies on the outskirts of Dollar in Clackmannanshire, the smallest county in Scotland.  It is one of the 4 foothill villages of the Ochil Hills which are great for hiking.

In the village you will find a good range of amenities, including shops, a well presented pub and even it's own museum. Castle Campbell, a wonderful place for walking is only 3 miles away with its wonderful scenery as you walk through Dollar Glen and see fantastic views of Dollar below. Just outside the village is the Japanese Garden (Cowden). You will also find ‘Do It Outdoors’ and ‘Lendrick Muir Outdoor Activity Centre’ close by (with loads of fun activities).

Kinross is 12 miles away, where Mary Queen of Scots famously escaped from her prison at Lochleven Castle on 2 May 1568. The castle is situated on a small island in the middle of Loch Leven. Alloa Tower is 8 miles away and is one of the earliest and largest Scottish Tower Houses (run by National Trust for Scotland).

The historic city of Stirling is only 12 miles away, with it’s famous Castle, old prison and Wallace Monument to visit.  If you enjoy castles then why not have a day trip to Blair Castle in Blair Atholl, Scone Castle in Perth (once the crowning palace of Scottish Kings), or Glamis Castle in Angus, the childhood home of the Queen Mother.

For a boat trip with a difference visit the Falkirk Wheel Visitor Centre (40 mins) and be transported from the Forth & Clyde canal to the Union canal over a 100 feet higher!

Alva Glen and Gartmorn Dam Country Park are in close proximity and are great for walking.  Loch Lomond is about an hour, with its visitor and sealife centre.  There are also shops, cafes and boat trips.

Roman history buffs will be interested in the stretch from the Firth of Forth to the Firth of Clyde.  Here are the remains of the Antonine Wall, the northernmost frontier of the Roman Empire ~ the best preserved length of which is at Bonnybridge.

For motorsport enthusiasts the famous Knockhill Motorsport Centre is only 8 miles away, either for watching races or testing out your driving skills in classic/racing/rally cars.

For golfers, visitors are welcome at the local traditional hillside Dollar Golf Club. There are also over 30 golf courses within an hour’s drive including Gleneagles (where there are many other activities such as shooting, falconry, horse riding to name just a few) and St Andrews.

There is also a Tank Drive Challenge Centre and a Dry Ski Slope centre, both within a few miles of the property.

For retail therapy there is of course Glasgow and Edinburgh, but closer to Dollar is Tillicoultry (10 mins), home of Sterling Mills outlet village and Sterling Furniture with its homestore, garden centre and restaurants.

Eating out:

  Fine dining

> The Glenturret Lalique Restaurant - fine dining restaurant with exceptional food, wine and service. Bar lunches, afternoon tea and whisky tasting available. All in the surroundings of The Glenturret Distillery, Scotland's oldest working distillery, producing single malt whisky by hand since 1763. Pre-book to avoid dissappointment at this Michelin Starred Distillery. 45 minute drive.

> Restaurant Andrew Fairlie - fine dining restaurant within The Gleneagles Hotel, serving a high-end Modern Scottish menu by an acclaimed chef Andrew Fairlie. The Gleneagles resort is renowned as one of the world's finest golfing venues. 3o minute drive.

> Rhubarb Restaurant at The Prestonfield - on the outskirts of Edinburgh, the exquisite interior of this 17th-century manor house is the perfect setting for that special occasion. Romantic fine dining using locally-sourced Scottish ingredients. 1 hour drive.

  Award-winning restaurants

> Barley Bree - a hidden gem in a tradtional setting, not to be missed. A highly rated rustic restaurant serving a French inspired menu, using local Scottish ingedients. 35 minute drive.

> Brea Restaurant - small restaurant based in the heart of Stirling, offering impressive bistrot dining. 25 minute drive.

  Local

> The Inn at Dollar - traditional pub menu in modern and comfortable surroundings. 5 minute drive / 25 minute walk.

description.neighborhood: Ulverston is a cobbled-street market town. It has independent shops, cafés, and pubs with open fires and real ales. Fine dining and tavern meals are both available. Ulverston is a festival town, with flags, walking, art, and music festivals in the summer and the Dickensian Christmas festival in late November. Stan Laurel was born there, and it holds the world record for the biggest foam pie battle, revealing a joyful, community-minded town. The town and surrounding area offer stunning views of the southern Lake District and Morecambe Bay. Deepest, widest, and shortest canal makes for a great afternoon walk with a pub and bay views. All National Park attractions are accessible. Furness Coast has sandy beaches and birding. Nearby family attractions include the South Lakes Wild Animal Park, Lakes Windermere and Coniston, and Birkrigg Common.

hosts.about:
After working for a number of years in England, I decided to restore a castle in my home country of Scotland. Being away has given me a fresh appreciation for the beauty and tranquility of the landscape - a million miles away from the increasing urbanisation of the rest of the planet.

I love to host visitors from all over the world and hope they catch some of the magic of Balintore Castle. It goes without saying I enjoy good conversation, good company and if good food is  involved - so much the better. :-)

My top travel destinations are sites of the ancient world and I was recently wowed by Istanbul, staying as an AirBnB guest. I work as a computer programmer, but my interests extend far beyond technology into art, cinema, literature, history, language and yoga!

description.summary: Balintore Castle has been hosting guests since 1860. Located in a remote Highland Glen, it offers direct access to hill walking, mountain biking, bird-watching and shooting. The kitchen wing accommodation has recently been restored in keeping with the high Victorian character of the building. Full self-catering facilities are available.
description.space: The holiday accommodation is located in the kitchen wing of the castle. This is the first area that has been brought to full habitability in the initial phase of a restoration program that started in 2007. Accommodation costs will be entirely directed towards further restoration of the castle.
description.access:
Guests have full and exclusive access to the kitchen wing, but are not allowed in the remainder of the castle which is undergoing restoration and is dangerous. When available,  the owner, housekeeper or builder will be delighted be to show you around the whole building.

Note, there is one other private property in the vicinity of the castle. This is the estate gamekeeper's cottage immediately facing the front of the castle.  Please respect my neighbours' privacy and do not enter their grounds, and do not visit the dogs in their kennels. As a dog lover myself, I can understand the temptation to say hello, but these are working animals and will be upset by any approach.
description.notes:
You are welcome to bring in external catering If you wish e.g. via the "La Belle Assiette" and "Dine Indulge" portal website which allows you to contact local chefs. Professional catering facilities are available, and of course you can also self-cater. 
Chloe is a local chef who is happy to cater by prior arrangement. Please ask for contact information. 

Note that the heating may be off during the summer and periods of warm weather. We appreciate that guests come from all over the world, and may be used to a different climate, so don't hesitate to get in touch if you would like the heating switched on out of season.

Extra beds can be supplied on request.

Spare toilet rolls may be found in the bathroom cabinet.I

The castle can be easily found: just enter the postcode DD8 5JS into a SATNAV. The last few miles of your drive will be on single track road, so please take care and reduce your speed on blind bends.  Do not use the east drive (through the gate lodges) to approach the castle as the track is very rough. Instead, use the west drive which starts by a large barn, and has a "Balintore Castle" sign.

If you are expecting the perfection of an luxury international hotel chain, then Balintore Castle is not for you! However, if you want a more characterful and "crumbly round the edges" experience and to be the house guests of a Highland Laird in a traditional Scottish Castle which once teetered on the brink of dereliction and is still actively being restored, then you will be made very welcome.

Some local recommended eateries:

Airlie Arms, Kirriemuir, 4 St Malcolm's Wynd, Kirriemuir,  DD8 4HB
Armstrong's Bar & Restaurant, Roundyhill, Glamis, Angus, Roundyhill DD8 1QT
Drovers Inn Restaurant, Memus, by Forfar, Angus
Little's Restaurant 1 Riverside Rd, Blairgowrie PH10 7GA
Glenisla Hotel, Kirkton of Glenisla, Blairgowrie PH11 8PH
Glen Clova Hotel, Glenclova, Angus DD8 4QS
Lands of Lloyd Hotel, Alyth

There are private chefs who have done excellent catering
for guests at the castle e.g. Peter who provides "Chef Number 9 
Services", is based nearby in Perth. Please do an online search
or get in touch for more details.

Guests have also used the "La Belle Assiette" and "Dine Indulge"
portals.

Chloe is a local chef that is happy to provide catering at the castle by prior arrangement. Please ask for further details. 


Breakages and damages must be reported and paid for.

name: FAIRY TALE CASTLE ON 2000-ACRE ESTATE BY THE SEA
title: Portpatrick, UK

gallery.caption: Come see Dunskey's life-changing magic. 25  bedrooms,4 grand reception rooms,10 gathering rooms. 2000-acre of woodlands, waterfalls, lochs, beaches, secret gardens, & endless possibilities. These photos, though many, are but a peek into the splendor

hosts.about:
We are a small but mighty team with our hearts set on sharing with you the most glorious hidden gem in this rural corner of Scotland: Dunskey, a 2000-acre estate by the sea, where world-class heritage meets modern splendour, surrounded by secret gardens and endless wonders. 

Everything we do is rooted in our three values: compassion, innovation, and transformation. We strongly believe that the first steps towards spectacular hospitality is taking care of our team and environments. Here, you'll meet the incredible Dunskey stewards who sincerely wish to share with you the joy, beauty, and warmth in all that we do. Most significantly, you will find extraordinary thoughtfulness in every moment of your journey here. 

We are also a feministic company with a laser focus on sustainability. We use re-fillable products wherever possible. Our heating system is nearly at 100% sourced from renewable energy. We compost 100% of our food waste, and our water comes from a fresh spring. We continuously strive to do more and do better.

Our ongoing other projects include policy advocacy in immigration and anti-human trafficking, working on turning out the votes in America and fighting against voter suppression laws. Seeking social and racial justice is a constant, though sometimes painful, anchor in our lives. We would like everyone to read the two novels, The Overstory, by Richard Powers, and, Ministry for the Future by Kim Stanley Robinson. When not heartened by the possibility of collective action to address climate change, we like to cook a ton-load of Vietnamese beef noodle soup and plot the next magic mushroom trail on the Estate.

recent.comments:
Just fabulous!   The house is beautiful, the grounds are amazing and the surroundings are so tranquil you feel in another world.  It is a true escape location where you can unwind.  The children loved walking, rowing boats and exploring the grounds. 
The bedrooms and bathrooms are stunning , constant hot water and lovely touches in every room.  The homemade bread, jams and cakes were lovely.  An absolute gem of a place!

items.comments:
Just fabulous!   The house is beautiful, the grounds are amazing and the surroundings are so tranquil you feel in another world.  It is a true escape location where you can unwind.  The children loved walking, rowing boats and exploring the grounds. 
The bedrooms and bathrooms are stunning , constant hot water and lovely touches in every room.  The homemade bread, jams and cakes were lovely.  An absolute gem of a place!

A wonderful house beautifully furnished and set on a gorgeous estate full of wildlife. Open fire to accompany family snooker games in the Billiards Room, deer, red squirrels, ravens and hare in the lovely grounds were all highlights. Very comfortable bedrooms and lovely bathrooms with lots of storage and living space. We barely used the car instead exploring the estate’s lochs, beaches and woods. Anne was very helpful and quick on communications in the run up to our trip and upgraded us to the wonderful East Wing. On site Simon was a very friendly, helpful and attentive aid. Best equipped self-catering kitchen we’ve ever had in a holiday rental. We were left a lovely selection of welcome produce including home baking. Would highly recommend for a special holiday for families, couples or groups.

This is such a wonderful place to stay and was the perfect family reunion location with enough bedroom space (with luxury bathrooms) and lots of space for eating and socialising. Anne's husband was really helpful and happy to answer any questions. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would strongly recommend it to other families and parties!

Wow struggling to find the words to full convey the experience we have had.

Let’s start with the most amazing thing - out hosts Anne and Ali and their 2 beautiful children.  We had amazing communication up to the week and then their hospitality on site we simply world class.

How often do people open their doors and invite you into a  true working Scottish castle.

The staff on site were amazing and so friendly.

We had 30 people staying in the castle and cottages and it was simply stunning.

Fantastic amenities and access to a working estate and 2k acres of land and seaside.

Couldn’t recommend enough for intimate settings for weddings or group offsite for team building or family holidays.

We had meals cooked for us on site which were delivered to such a high standard they could have been in any top end restaurant. 

It’s amazing............just book it!!

Dunskey House was a fantastic place to stay for a weekend. Everything was fantastic, very spacious & bedrooms were spaced out that no one was on top of each other.
The grounds were fantastic for walks especially the glen walks, walking to beach & into Portpatrick!
There were 14 adults & 3 children & everyone had a fantastic weekend.
Anne even took the time to bake a birthday cake for the celebrations.
The Ruddy family would definitely recommend Dunskey House for a family get together & thank Anne for allowing us to use Dunskey House, it really is a beautiful home & spotless! Definitely 5 star!

Dunskey Estate is a slice of heaven.  Alastair and Anne are the most interesting and incredible hosts (and people): they really want you to feel utterly at home,  and offer wonderful suggestions for exploring the truly magical estate. They are generous in every way.  The interiors are a mix of  old world elegance and contemporary ease - very magical.  All amenities are luxurious.  The gardens, the lochs, the stunning walks to the beach and the sense of space all create a serene and expansive place of relaxation with untold outdoor discoveries.  And the views are nothing short of spectacular. We had one day of snow, one of brilliant sunshine and two rainy days - we loved each for the different moods they brought out of the landscape.  Staff is also top notch and friendly.  Highly recommend and hope to go back.

Anne and her husband are very very nice，we went to borrow some potatos and they even gave us a bottle of Champagne！ Their children are so cute！ 
The Dunskey Castle is just amazing，it‘s way better than the photos. 
The kitchen is really nice，we got all
the equipments we needed. 
Me and my friends had a really really good time in Dusnkey castle. I will definitely be back in the future！
Strongly suggestion to everyone！

description.summary: Bring alive fairytales in this Edwardian castle at the heart of private 2000 acres of glen walks, forests, 3 beaches, 2 lochs, walled and woodland gardens, maze, and 2 waterfalls. Comes with a stately reception rooms, 25 bedrooms and bathrooms, with luxurious amenities and a dedicated team. An award-winning, all-inclusive catering program is available. We host exclusive use and private events for up to 90 guests. March - September, NY & Xmas requires minimum 40 guests, all other times 26 guests.
description.space:
Established by a dapper industry magnate and Member of Parliament Charles Lindsay Orr Ewing, Dunskey Castle infuses intelligent luxury and historical romance into every second of your spectacular stay. The Castle, completed at the turn of the century, showcases unrivaled technology of its heyday and historical architecture of enormous proportions. 

Throughout the Castle, physical features will bring alive the patriarch's globetrotting influences and the rich history of Scottish merchants at the cusp of the Industrial Revolution. From the iconic Delft tiles that grace the mantelpiece in many bedrooms and social areas, to the outrageously intricate Baronial plaster ceiling, which is deemed culturally significant by the Scottish government. Every moment at Dunskey promises true immersion into history, authenticity, and a perfectly bespoke luxury that befits the Castle's historical grandeur.

The Baronial Porch pays homage to the Castle's medieval roots by original stoneworks from the 11th Dunskey Castle ruin that still stands dramatically cliffside a few miles down the coast. Its pared-back austerity sharply juxtaposes the entrance foyer, where rich oak panels immediately cocoon guests in warmth and resplendence. Ornate frames of art works original to Castle are displayed throughout the reception rooms, including an ever-growing collection of ceramics, a tribute to Charles Orr Ewing's travels throughout South and East Asia. Inside the Great Hall, the Jacobean fireplace with its impressive curved countenance, bearing the ancient family crest, commands your attention and invites hours of lazing in front of its cracking embers. Offering views of rolling meadows, through the woodlands and as far as the eyes can see to the coast, the Great Hall embodies a quiet magnificence that can sheathe and soothe outward distractions. 

In contrast to the stateliness of the Great Hall, the Victorian Drawing Room recalls silk gloves and calligraphed letters. Sink into sumptuous wool and velvet upholstered armchairs, most of which have been painstakingly restored. Stretch out on our buttery leather four-seat Chesterfield and be seduced by the handcrafted Grecian and Scottish vines and foliage that adorn the ceiling. Or play the liveliest round of Chinese Whisper on our leather-and-grommet Windsor conversational settee. There are few places better for escaping into a book than next to the roaring fireplace, beneath the spectacular floor-to-ceiling mantelpiece painted in the softest of dove gray. Operatic callings may be on the cards with the presence of the 19th-century mahogany pearl-inlaid piano, or if karaoke is more your jam, consider treating it as a station for whisky tasting. 

Speaking of strong tipples, ensconced yourselves at the United Turkey Red Bar, named after the company founded by the Orr Ewing brothers in 1898, to produce their famously passionate and royal red dye. Entirely bespoke to Dunskey Castle, the bar retains its character from the oak wood paneling salvaged from the attic! While perched on gold and velvet barstools, you'll be charmed by maritime artefacts that came from yachts commissioned and built by Charles Orr Ewing, including gilded prints and photographs. The unusual exposed-brick, multi-tier fireplace will transport you to all the ship's rip-roaring follies on the sea once upon a time. Drink up if the ship's bell from HMS Anson is rung out. Charles' son David was a Naval Captain aboard HMS Anson during World War II.

If it gets too lively at the bar, retreat to the Officer's Corner, a stately homage to the Estate's history and records upon its formation. Here, you'll find an impressive stone-carved fireplace and a fascinating bookcase designed specifically for this quarter. Leather bound and gold embossed volumes of Estate records, crystal ink pots, and mementos from Charles Orr Ewing's globe-circling travels will certainly stir at your own wanderlusts. If that's not quite enough, wool upholstered sofa, throws of sheepskins and velvet armchairs will undoubtedly spur the most intimate parleys. 

Wander past the main carpeted stairs and towards the art-deco double-door into the main dining room, one of the most romantic spaces in the Castle. An enchanting chandelier evoking golden liquid sunlights and dappling raindrops hang from the intricate plaster ceiling. On all four walls, a custom-designed Chinoiserie mural in shimmering lavender and copper takes you back to gilded Victoriana. At each end of the dining room, the signature painting of suave Charles Lindsay Orr Ewing gazes cooly upon his happy guests, while the portrait of Lady Augusta Hunter Blair smiles coyly. Both paintings have been heavily influenced by the John Singer Sargent aesthetics.

After a dizzying feast in the dining room, retire to the library next door. One of the best-kept surprises at Dunskey is the full-size billiard table that is original to the Castle. Lit by four lamps from the 1880s, designed for this specific purpose, the billiard table commands all your attention. Not to be outdone, rows upon rows of antique books, with their embossed spines and leather covers, exude erudition and solemnity. The bespoke design of the book case is truly one of a kind, with its beveled glass doors and elaborate wooden curlicues, echoing art deco influences that were emerging at the turn of the century.

 In need of an even cozier place? Head to the Club Room, where you'll find overstuffed couches, TV, and an original wood-fire range in a heritage room decorated with antique collections of sports and travel paraphernalia. The heart of the castle, of course, is in the farm house kitchen with its soaring skylights and A-frame ceilings. Here, a very large space is dedicated for the loveliest roasts in an incredibly well-equipped kitchen.

Head towards Dutch kitchen with our most treasured heirloom at your feet: the carpets, dyed of course with the Turkey Red. Commanding perhaps the best lights and views in the Castle with its double-story windows, the space is named after the blue-and-white Delft tiles that grace the wrought-iron fireplace. Full disclosure, these Dutch tiles with their delightful depictions of a coastal village are exceptionally dear to our porcelain-obsessed hearts. Here, you'll find an antique spinning wheel, rosebud fainting couch, lioness chairs and, improbably, our upstanding bear Wilson, who is at least 140 years old. That should be all you'll need to create your favourite fairy-tale reenactment. 

On the first floor, the first bedroom you'll find is Ella Baker, named after an African American civil rights activist who worked alongside W.E.B Dubois. Hand painted murals and lacquered Chinoiserie panels adorn the indigo walls, showing off a most spectacular gilded ochre bed. The true wow-factor, however, comes from the other-worldly bathroom suite, with its original ceramic and brass bathtub large enough four full size adults, not that we would encourage that sort of frolicking. Moroccan lanterns are suspended above the bath, lending an exotic air to the suite, and contrast beautifully with the hand-glazed teal tiles. Too much to do to contemplate a leisurely soak? Step into our full-size shower, created with great sympathies to preserve all heritage features of the bathroom. 

Rainbow suite sits across the hall, offering heartstopping views through the fields and to the ocean. Its namesake is the RYS Rainbow, a multi-award-winning schooner that competed in the most exciting international competitions of its days. Keeping true to its seafaring motifs, you'll find lovely coral decor and gold conch lamps throughout the room. We've searched high and low for the mahogany four-poster bed in the suite, and settled on this intricate canopied piece from the early 18th century. Modern comforts won't be compromised though, as a full shower ensuite and a built-in bathtub will ensure you are up to date in luxurious convenience. 

The third bedroom, Orion, often elicit gasps from our guests, particularly those who have always treasured the idea of a gold soaking tub in front of a fireplace. Drawing from the circles in "Orion", also named after one of Charles' yachts, a steel and French linen ring canopy bed sits with spherical gilded lamps flanking its side. Get ready for an evening of fine dining in front of the antique dressing table, featuring, you guess it, a circular gold mirror. One of the best parts of the bedroom, of course, is the velvet emerald chaise, encouraging maximum lazing about. 

Garden bedroom features a unique view of the vast back lawn, glimpses of the Castle's east wing Baronial architecture, and the woodlands. Here you'll find one of the Castle's original brass beds, restored by us, and outfitted with supremely comfortable mattress, downy duvets, and exquisite linens. A tufted vintage velvet green loveseat ensures ample space for snuggles and reading in this retreat. Featuring the only double-door bathroom in the Castle, you'll be greeted with a built-in bathtub by the bay window, and large shower as always. 

At the end of the corridor, straight ahead, is Glen. It was part of the corridor many years ago, we suppose, but has always been a cozy bedroom in living memory. In fact it was the current owner's childhood bedroom. How does that all fit in a corridor you might ask - let's just say our corridors are rather wide. In those days it didn't have a bathroom but it does today, beautifully appointed around a green glazed tile fireplace. Your view is of the forests and you'll dream of the nature abundant in them.

At the end of the corridor on the right is the Oak suite. It seems like you could almost touch the massive sweet chestnut right outside your bedroom window. Look closely for the red squirrels running up and down its gnarled old trunk and sometimes up and down the house itself. The squirrels may be red but the unusual paneled walls are a luxurious grey. Lying in the bathtub is perfect vantage point to take in the forest canopy but if you can't spare the time for the tub the high pressure shower has instant hot water. 

We have finally arrived at the Morroch, the grandest and most awe-inspiring room of all. This expansive suite is guaranteed to take your breath away with its infusive lights streaming from every corner. A brass and velvet four-poster superking bed awaits you. A reclaimed carved pine Colonial sofa in French linen and fringe dove velvet chairs creates a romantic atmosphere. To enhance the grandeur, a statement cream Victorian mirror armoire with full length mirror makes sure you look resplendent from every angle. Not to be outshined, the opposite wall features a splendid two-tier Chateau dressing table, a piece so gorgeous designed we have little difficulty lingering by its side. And of course, one of the most phenomenal bathrooms in the Castle resides here. Truth be told, the bathroom itself is slightly larger than our first studio apartment in Manhattan! We won't tell you everything about it, for a little intrigue goes a long way, and you'll best experience the wow-factor first hand when you arrive.
 
Now don't get lost as you continue down the corridors and pass through a gallery of historical paintings and pictures, proudly showcasing the castle's roots. The first bedroom in the East Wing, Sunset Hill, faces the woodlands that lead to the loch. A handpainted mural of Marrakech and a linen-and-steel canopy bed will transport you to dreamiest destinations. A large en-suite bathroom here features a built-in-tub right by the window, affording the loveliest views of the woods.

Next door is one of the most romantic bedrooms in the Castle, Heartsease, named after one of the superyachts built by the Estate's patriarch. Restored damask chaise lounges right beneath the enormous bay windows, providing exceptional views of the fields and to the ocean, means you have the best seat in the house. The bathroom with its large shower and claw-foot bathtub on an elevated platform will provide stunning views of the matured trees outside.

Blair bedroom is one of the largest in the Castle. It features a super king bed with an upholstered headboard with velvet fabric from the Designers' Guild Collection. Antique furniture are plentiful in this bedroom, and you'll find quite possibly the largest shower here as well.

Adjacent to Blair bedroom is Abdiel, a beautiful paneled bedroom with views to the ocean. It is a smaller room with an ensuite shower, but is grand in its hand-carved bed, artworks original to the Castle, and a beautiful fireplace.  

We can go on to describe every inch of Dunskey to you, and it still would not to do justice. Countless rooms and spaces still await your discovery and exploration, including the movie theatre, magic parlour, yoga and art studio, and so much more.
description.access: The walled garden with its glass house is a romantic and peaceful retreat on the estate. Two lochs nestle into the hills and rhododendron banks. Wander along the glen walk past a rushing waterfall, and a babbling brook, to the two beaches to spot dolphins and seals. Dunskey Golf Course and the picturesque Portpatrick Harbour is two minutes away. Fishing expeditions from the beaches or on our two lochs are available.

hosts.about:
Originally from the south of Japan I left to study abroad (UK & US) when I turned 18, and I have since lived in Australia and Hong Kong, before settling in Scotland where my children have grown up.

We bought Dairsie as a ruin and restoring it has been tough but ultimately very rewarding. It was primarily built as a family home and so despite having its origins set in the 1300s, you can expect all the home comforts of a spacious modern house. I hope you have a lovely time absorbing the historical atmosphere and the beautiful countryside surroundings.

recent.comments:
We had a great family gathering at Dairsie Castle.  Our host was terrific and the castle was a lovely way to reconnect with each other and our Scottish heritage.  All three generations loved it!  The castle was in excellent condition with all things in working order, and we enjoyed being in the countryside but close enough to easily get to Edinburgh, St Andrews and the coast. 
An adventure we will always remember with love and gratitude.

description.summary: Dairsie Castle is a unique self-catered property which sleeps 14. Located close to St. Andrews (15 minutes drive) and Edinburgh (1 hour drive), it is an ideal setting for a holiday to explore the heart of Scotland.
description.space:
First sited in the 12th Century, Dairsie has been the location of secret Scottish parliaments, military sieges, and safe haven for escapee monarchs (James VI and I in 1583). The castle became a ruin in the 19th Century. In 1992 it was bought and rebuilt by the current owner who worked hard to restore the castle to its original medieval character, with all the comforts of a modern family home. 

The Castle

‘The Dungeon' - On the ground floor there is a twin bedroom with a vaulted ceiling and ensuite bathroom. 

'The Family Bedroom' - This huge master bedroom has 3 four-poster beds; 1 king-size, 2 large singles. The en-suite bathroom is complete with a stand-alone bath and window shutters, painted in the style of Hokusai.

‘The Spottiswoode (Upper Tower Room)’ - Named after one of the long-term residents of the castle, John Spottiswoode, the Archbishop of St. Andrews in the 1600s. This bedroom has a double bed and an ensuite bathroom.

‘The Learmonth (Lower Tower Room)’ - Named after the family that owned Dairsie for a 100 years, before they sold it to Archbishop Spottiswoode in 1616. This bedroom has a double bed and an ensuite bathroom.

‘The South Caphouse’ - A twin bedroom on the top floor at the end of the Gallery. It has a shared shower room with the North Caphouse bedroom, with a small compact shower unit.

‘The North Caphouse’ - This double bedroom is at the opposite end of the Gallery, at the top of the spiral staircase. It has a shared shower room with the South Caphouse Bedroom, with a small compact shower unit.

The Great Hall – As the hub of the castle, with a dining table which can seat 12, and is surrounded by beautiful artworks and sculptures.There are two large sofas and a foot stool around the fire place for post-dinner relaxation. A Minstrel’s Gallery which over-looks the Great Hall which can be reached from a staircase behind the room.

The Kitchen – The kitchen has all the usual culinary equipment and has a 2-hub Aga cooker. The room has a table and chairs and is large enough also to be used as a breakfast room. Behind the kitchen is a laundry room with a washing machine and dryer, and adjacent to the kitchen is a washroom.

The Living Room – The living room is on the 2nd floor, situated next to the Family Bedroom. It is carpeted and has a TV and comfortable sofas. Next door to the living room is a small Toy Room which is filled with children’s books, toys and some board games for the evenings.

The Gallery – The Gallery is a spacious area on the top floor of the castle and is where a lot of the castle’s artwork and antiques are displayed. It is a very bright and large space with good views of the surrounding countryside.

Dairsie has 6 acres of grounds including a cop with a woodland walk down to the river Eden, a walled herb garden, an orchard and a large open grass area. There is an open garage, a watch tower and a large drive which can park a maximum of 15 cars. The castle's caretaker lives next door. 

It is a truly unique property seeped in Scottish history, and one which we welcome you to experience and enjoy!
description.neighborhood:
There is so much to see and do in the local area! 

For golf enthusiasts, the famous Old Course in St. Andrews and Kingsbarns are both close by, whilst Carnoustie and Gleneagles courses are less than an hour away. 

For family fun, there is Craigtoun Country Park (Nature & Adventure Play Park), The Deer Centre, the Secret Bunker, and Deep Sea World.

You can spend a day exploring St. Andrews, where you can find the old Cathedral and castle, go on a distillery and tasting tour at the Eden Mill, and walk along the West Sands beach. For some history, Scone Palace in Perth, and Glamis Palace near Forfar are a drive away. You could also spend a day exploring Edinburgh and all it has to offer.

The Michelin-starred Peat Inn is also worth booking for a delicious meal.
description.transit:
The best way to get around is by car. There is enough parking space in front of the castle to park max. 15 cars.
The castle is about 10mins drive from Leuchars and Cupar train stations. There are usually taxis at Leuchars station. 
The castle is 20mins walk to Dairsie village which has a village shop, petrol station and a pub.

There should only ever be a maximum of 14 people on the grounds or in the property at any time. This means that you may not invite extra people for drinks, dinner, to look around the property etc so that it would exceed 14 people.

hosts.about:
John A. Lavender II - owner of Highlands Castle. 
 
Highlands Castle was born from a promise I made to my young son...
“Someday I’ll build a house where we both will live… a place we’ll call home. 
A place where you can bring your friends and create special memories… someday Jason I will build you a castle." 

Looking back to 1978, my 3-year old son would likely have never remembered these words. The promise had more to do with a desire to build a better life, than an actual castle.  

It would be another 5-years before the ideal property presented itself, a mountaintop in Bolton Landing, NY.  

While clearing the land for the foundation, a picture was being painted with a chain saw rather than a brush.  Within a matter of weeks, the most spectacular view in the world was uncovered.  The majesty of Lake George and the Adirondack Mountains seemed as grateful as I was to be unveiled.  How was it, that I would be the one to settle here?  Was it simply luck or something much greater? I believe it was the latter, and that I was led to this specific spot for a reason. 

Once the foundation was completed, the wood framing construction was to the roof in a few months and the structure began to find its outward appearance.  I finally graduated from the living quarters of a tent to a mattress on the floor, which was fine with me… I was quite happy to be sleeping in my own home.

In 1986, I met Yvonne, the woman who 'turned a pile of rocks into a home'.  We were married here in 1992, and my parents who were both Methodist pastors officiated our ceremony.  (In 2008, my son Jason & Mary would be married at Highlands Castle with his grandparents also officiating their wedding). 

"Jason, I promised that I would build you a castle, I didn't say you wouldn't be helping me!"...  So, when Jason was a teenager, he joined in the stonework.  Naturally resourceful, he recruited his football teammates to lend some muscle over the summer months. Their daily mantra was "Let's rock!" and they took great pride in what they accomplished while working together again as a team.  (Jason was not only an impressive stonemason, but he also went on to earn an Architectural Engineering Degree, and achieve anything he put his mind to).

The stonework was a slow, tedious process and the labor of laying up more than 1,000 tons of local granite would take decades. Over the past 40+ years, the property would evolve into what it is today... a series of three castles.

In 2010, my wife Yvonne and I decided to make Highlands Castle available so others could experience what our family has been so fortunate to enjoy.   Since then, families & friends from all over the world have gathered here to create their own special memories.  We hope you'll visit us, too!

Poised on a graceful mountainside overlooking majestic Lake George, a castle awaits you...

description.space: Highlands Castle is a hidden jewel in a private setting, yet only 3-minutes from downtown Bolton Landing with the conveniences of a supermarket, gourmet restaurants, wine store, brewery, unique shops, 2-public parks with picnic areas, 2-public beaches, swimming, fishing, kayaking, tennis, golf, miniature golf, hiking trails, bicycling, boat rentals, scenic boat cruises, and more!
description.access:
Our "2-Suites for 2-Couples" package is a unique getaway for an unforgettable experience! Includes two elegant bedroom suites and access to 'The Great Hall' located in the center or heart of Highlands Castle, plus our outdoor terraces with the most spectacular views in the world! Miles of breathtaking, panoramic vistas of Lake George are yours to enjoy!

Guests will have access to the most impressive spaces of the castle including the main entryway, foyer, vestibule area, the Great Hall, music room/library, and the first-floor half bath (in addition to their 2 bedroom suites). The Great Hall is our grandest room of the castle with 25' high ceilings and 21 windows overlooking beautiful Lake George and the Adirondack Mountains. (Note: The Great Hall is curtained off from a private kitchen & family room where the owners reside).  

*The upstairs lakeview 'ROYAL BEDROOM' sleeps 1 couple. 
*The downstairs 'KING'S SUITE' sleeps 2 guests. 
(The King's Suite can sleep up to 6-guests for an extra fee)
Each suite has a mini-fridge and a coffee maker. 

The 'KING SUITE' features an adjoining screened-in covered terrace, plus another outside lower terrace, and both have spectacular lake views! 

WE HAVE TWO (2) OTHER CASTLES ON THIS SAME PROPERTY:
(Search the Airbnb links to our 2 other castles). 
1.) 'CASTLE COTTAGE'... our adorable mini-castle overlooking Lake George sleeps 4-6 guests and is located just steps away from Highlands Castle.

2.) 'CASTLE GATEHOUSE' sleeps 4-7 guests and is nestled in a wooded setting at the entrance to our property. 

Are you looking for a unique setting for a small family gathering, special occasion, birthday party, anniversary celebration, reunion, etc.? (See below):

HIGHLANDS CASTLE is available to rent for a 'FAMILY RENTAL'.  
Our FAMILY RENTAL option allows you (the guest) to invite up to 28 people to Highlands Castle from 4-8 pm for an extra fee of $198/person.  Note: Book your overnight stay through Airbnb, but inviting 'non-overnight guests' to the property is outside the parameters of Airbnb, so contact us directly to discuss your specific details. (Dates are available starting May-Oct).

Highlands Castle is incomparable to all other places. That is what sets us apart.  You won't find a more magical setting to share time with your loved ones!

The memories of Highlands Castle and the Lake George region will last a lifetime!

description.transit:
Highlands Castle is a hidden jewel in a private setting, yet only a 3-minute drive to downtown Bolton Landing with plenty of public parking to enjoy the conveniences of a supermarket, gourmet restaurants, unique shops, library, public beaches, kayaking, tennis, golf, hiking, boat tours, and more!

Highlands Castle provides free parking for guests.
description.interaction:
The owners, John & Yvonne, live in their section of Highlands Castle (upstairs bedroom, family room & kitchen) which guests do not have access to. 
Your privacy will always be respected, but please know we're available (via phone, text, email, or in person) if there's anything you need during your stay.
description.house_rules:
Younger children are welcome but must be well-supervised by a responsible adult at all times.

HOUSE RULES:
Pets, smoking, vaping, and candles are not allowed on the property.

Guest agrees to our 'No Smoking Policy' and agrees to pay a $500 penalty if our house rule policy is not adhered to.   

Guest agrees to our 'No Pets Policy' because our 2-pets (that are super friendly) make our property unsuitable for a guest's pet to cohabitate with our pups). Our dogs stay with us in a separate section of the home and are not allowed in designated guest areas. Guest agrees to pay a $300/night penalty if our house rule policy is not adhered to.  

Guest agrees to our strict 'No Extra Person' policy and agrees to pay $300/person per night if our house rule is not adhered to.   

AC|Heat Policy: To conserve energy, the guest agrees NOT to run AC or Heat with window(s) or door open.  Guest agrees to pay $500 if this policy is not adhered to. Guest agrees to pay $1000 if AC 'freezes up' due to window(s) or door(s) open with AC running. The recommended AC thermostat setting is 74 degrees Fahrenheit. 

SAFETY RESTRICTIONS:  Standing or sitting on any outside terrace railing or stone wall is NOT permitted on the property of Highlands Castle.  All guests agree to adhere to this rule for their own safety.  

EVENTS: (Parties, small gatherings, etc.) must be pre-approved by the property owner and is categorized as a 'FAMILY RENTAL' that allows the GUESTS to invite family & friends onto the property to enjoy time together from 4-8 pm for an additional fee of $198/person per day.  

Highlands Castle is suitable for elegant, sophisticated, smaller gatherings of family & friends. 

Highlands Castle is NOT permitted for a bachelor party, rowdy, loud, disruptive, or unruly gathering.

Quiet time after 9 pm to be considerate of neighbors and other guests.

Guest agrees to conduct themselves in an orderly, respectful, and responsible manner in full compliance with applicable laws and regulations.  

Guest agrees to pay for damage caused during their stay in order to restore the Highlands Castle property. 

Guest agrees to leave the Highlands Castle property and grounds in a clean and orderly condition.    

Winter Season Bookings: Renter is advised to utilize a 4-wheel drive vehicle with snow tires for safety.

name: Monkton House - 15th Century Castle near Edinburgh
title: Old Craighall, UK

recent.comments: Our family’s week at Monkton House will be forever unique in our memories. We loved the delightful “Kandinsky Bath” and the “Chinese Room” with it’s dragon, and the wall nook beds in the library which reflected the eclectic interests of multiple occupants. We loved the soccer field lawn and the roses. The sloping uneven spiral stairs were dangerous for some of us, especially with no loo on the main floor. The many fire doors made for an isolated feeling and it was hard to keep them closed as requested. Despite the huge dining table, people congregated in the small (modernized) kitchen which could have better seating. Anna was there with tools right away to replace a doorknob and attempt to mend the fancy built in Expresso Maker. The separate 2 bed apt was especially appealing, though less quirky than the main house. Stairs everywhere if that’s a problem.Though there is a mirror, exit to the main road is blind and dangerous.Rail station is a few minutes away; 6 minutes to Edinburgh.

Anna-Luise was a great host and the home is absolutely amazing! We had an incredible weekend with surprisingly good weather. Thanks
Anna-Luise was a great host. Super responsive and had great recommendations. House was interesting ! Our family loved it

An amazing quirky house! Has everything you need for a chilled vibe and a party. 
We hired Monkton House for my wife’s 40th birthday celebration. We had a catering team come and provide dinner one evening which was very cool and worked well in the low lit, moody dining room. 
Loads of space for chill out time, Stoke up the fire and get cosy. 
Our stay was fantastic and I would highly recommend Monkton House for a cool dinner event or just a relaxed break.

Our stay at the beautiful Monkton House was unforgettable. With Anna's help, we had an incredibly fun Stag weekend. Anna got us in touch with a local taxi service that drove us around day and night all weekend (Monkton House is a 20 min drive from the city centre) and with a company that organised amazingly fun Highland games in the gardens of Monkton House. 

Everyone in Scotland is super friendly and always helped us with tips on restaurants and other activities. Monkton House itself is a beautiful old building with beautifully themed rooms, ranging from a cosy bar under a vaulted ceiling, to a Chinese room and a Kandinsky bathroom.

I would recommend a stay at the Monkton House to anyone. Thanks Anna!
Monkton House is a fabulous place for a group gathering. We loved the history of the building and it’s quirks. Anna was so lovely to deal with and super responsive to any requests.

Ein wunderbares Haus mit sehr vielen tollen Details und voller Überraschungen und Geheimnisse..
Wohlfühlen garantiert. Eine wunderbare Erfahrung...
Anna-Luise ist super nett und war für uns immer erreichbar.
Vielen Dank und Alles Gute!

description.summary: Monkton House was built by the monks of Newbattle Abbey to protect themselves from English invaders and stands in 2 acres of private grounds. Three of the sumptuous bedrooms have four poster beds, and there are many unusual features. There are gun loops and arrow slits, one of the living rooms is inspired by the Prince Regent's Brighton Pavilion and hand painted in maximalist chinoiserie, and there is even a secret room. You can imagine yourself in another time when staying here.
description.space:

Nearby there is the historic City of Edinburgh, reachable in only a few minutes by train or bus, the beautiful county of East Lothian with beaches, countryside walks and numerous world famous golf courses.
