hosts.about:
Our love affair with villa holidays first began in 2003 when Co-Founders Oliver and Ravi spent a week at a crumbling chateau in the Dordogne with a group of their closest friends. As fate would have it, that holiday was the start of something special. It was the beginning of Oliver’s Travels.

Today, we have over 6,000 hand-picked villas, chateaux and holiday homes across the top holiday destinations – with new regions launching every year. 

Before deciding on the where, it’s important to consider what you want from your villa holiday. Is it to relax around the pool, dining al-fresco with a spot of sightseeing? Or you are looking for an action-packed trip? Whatever you decide, it’s a good idea to put your requirements at the forefront when discussing with our travel experts who are the best in the business and we have countless awards to match. Trust us, we'll find you the perfect villa holiday to surpass your expectations. 

And the best part? Once you book a villa holiday, the service doesn't stop there. Our Free Concierge Service means you'll be in good hands to arrange catering & fridge stocking, housekeeping, childcare, tours & activities and so much more, to make your stay truly extraordinary

description.summary: Tamar Castle holds a tranquil position on the Cornish bank of the River Tamar, just fifteen minutes away from the town of Saltash, often regarded as the “Gateway to Cornwall”. The Castle makes a completely unique setting for a holiday, special celebration or wedding and the wonderful memories will certainly last a lifetime.
description.space:
Dating back to 1698, Tamar Castle boasts infinite charm and character while still possessing all the modern amenities you could possibly need for a contented and relaxed stay. The living accommodation is ideal for socialising and comprises of the elegant drawing room complete with roaring open fire, a formal dining room with seating for twenty-two, a sunny morning room and a fully-equipped family kitchen. The Castle can comfortably sleep up to twenty-two guests across its eleven beautifully-appointed bedrooms, nine of which boast en-suite facilities. On the ground floor is the first of the bedrooms, specially designed with those who struggle with mobility in mind. Upstairs, on the first floor, are a further eight sumptuous, en-suite bedrooms, a number of which can be set up with twin beds on request. The final two bedrooms are situated in the castellated turrets and share a family bathroom.

The gardens are as equally impressive, with fifty-five acres of woodland grounds to explore, there are plenty of beautiful walks to enjoy. During the Summer months, the solar-heated swimming pool is the place to be and provides hours of fun for the whole family! There are multiple terraces complete with dining facilities, ideal for al fresco dining or simply enjoying a peaceful drink in the magnificent surroundings. 

Features:

Lower Ground Floor
- Games room with small billiard/snooker table

Ground Floor
- Drawing room with log fire
- Dining room
- Family fully-equipped kitchen
- Morning room with terrace access
- Warren Suite with double bed and en-suite wet room (can be set up with twin single beds on request)

First Floor
- Dewhurst Suite with four-poster double bed and en-suite bathroom
- Coryton Suite with super-king bed and en-suite bathroom 
- Tillie Suite with king-size bed and en-suite bathroom
- Spencer Suite with super-king bed and en-suite bathroom (can be set up with twin single beds on request)
- Victor Suite with super-king bed and en-suite bathroom (can be set up with twin single beds on request)
- Howard Suite with twin single beds and en-suite bathroom
- Parker Suite with super-king bed and en-suite bathroom (can be set up with twin single beds on request)
- Kitson Suite with twin single beds and en-suite shower room

Second Floor (Turrets) 
- Bayly Suite with twin single beds
- Wyndham Suite with double bed
- Family bathroom

Exterior Grounds
- Solar-heated swimming pool
- Multiple terraces
- Dining facilities
- Fire pit
- 55 acres of woodland grounds

Additional Facilities
- Wi-Fi
- TV
- Travel cots can be provided on request
- Parking for 20 cars
- Tesla charging point x2
- Universal EV charging point

* The Warren Suite has been designed specifically for disabled use. The en-suite wet room features a height adjustable shower and shower seat. There are call alarms fitted in the bedroom and shower room. All doors and openings on the ground floor are more than 3 feet wide allowing easy wheelchair access.

Location:

Tamar Castle is situated just a 15-minute car journey from the town of Saltash, where a wide variety of helpful amenities, including shops and restaurants, can be found. Saltash is often known as the “Gateway to Cornwall” and therefore Tamar Castle is well located for those wanting to explore both Devon and Cornwall.

There is plenty to do, see and explore in Devon and Cornwall within easy reaching distance of the Castle. In Devon, the popular port city of Plymouth is just 20-minutes away while the rugged Dartmoor National Park is 30-minutes away. A number of excellent Cornish beaches including Whitsand Bay, Downderry and Tregantle Beaches are all less than half an hour away. The Cornish seaside town of Looe and the picturesque fishing village of Polperro are both less than 40-minutes away and well worth a visit. The Eden Project, home to the iconic botanical gardens, is less than 45-minutes drive away. 

Terms & Conditions:

Security deposit?
£1,000 to be paid prior to arrival and to be refunded in full subject to a damage inspection on departure

Arrival time?
5pm

Departure time?
10am

Energy costs included?
Yes, included in the rental price

Linen & towels included?
Yes, included in the rental price

End of stay cleaning included?
Yes, included in the rental price

Internet access?
Yes, Wi-Fi is included in the rental price

Changeover day?
Thursday, Friday, Sunday or Monday only.

Minimum stay?
Please note that there is a 2-night minimum stay, this is increased to 7-nights across peak dates

Pets welcome?
A maximum of 4 well-behaved dogs are allowed on request basis for an additional charge of £15 per dog, per night. The dogs are only permitted to sleep in the Howard, Kitson or Warren bedrooms. They must stay off all furnishings. Please clean up after your dogs and ensure they are on the lead at all times in the grounds.

Smoking Allowed?
No smoking

Other Ts and Cs?
No stag or hen do's.

This second-floor apartment has an open-plan living space with a kitchen containing an electric oven, induction hob, combi microwave/oven, fridge/freezer, washer/dryer, dishwasher, coffee maker, and wine cooler, a dining area for four guests, and a sitting area with a Smart TV. Outside, there are shared grounds, and designated parking for two cars. Within 0.2 miles, there is a shop, and within 0.4, a pub. Please note that pets and smoking are not permitted. WiFi, fuel, power, bed linen and towels are all included in the price. A highchair and cot are available.  Note: Check-in from 4pm, check-out by 10am. description.neighborhood: Ulverston is a cobbled-street market town. It has independent shops, cafés, and pubs with open fires and real ales. There is something for everyone, from fine dining to traditional pub food. Ulverston is a festival town, with flags, walking, art, and music festivals in the summer and the Dickensian Christmas festival in late November. Stan Laurel was born there, and it holds the world record for the biggest foam pie fight, revealing a fun, community-minded town. The town and surrounding countryside offer beautiful views of the southern Lake District and Morecambe Bay. Deepest, widest, and shortest canal makes for a lovely afternoon walk with a pub and bay views. All National Park attractions are accessible. Derwent Beach is a popular beach for families. Nearby family attractions include the South Lakes Wild Animal Park, Lakes Windermere and Coniston, and Birkrigg Common.

name: Rose Castle, Secluded Splendour Near Lake District
title: Dalston, UK

description.summary:
Rose Castle sits on the edge of the Lake District National Park, the heart of Cumbria, just 7 miles from the M6. Up to 28 guests can enjoy our 800-year-old castle as their own.
 
With 15 beautifully furnished bedrooms and 7 acres of landscaped grounds within an estate of 60 acres, your stay promises unparalleled comfort and grandeur.
 
Immerse yourself in the rich history of the castle while enjoying modern amenities and luxurious comforts. You will have an unforgettable stay at Rose Castle.
description.space:
Sympathetically renovated over 3 years with careful attention to detail, historic Rose Castle has recently opened its doors for guests to gather family and friends for special events and celebrations. This home of the Bishops of Carlisle since 1230 can now be your home in Cumbria. Homely and comfortable with superfast broadband throughout, experience heritage and high-tech combining in style.
 
Your Castle
 
“Wander lonely as a cloud” around our beautifully landscaped, fragrant grounds, sip cocktails on Pettinger’s Lawn, and dance the night away to the strains of your favourite music. Engage in a spot of croquet on the lawn or petanque on the shingle. Or catch up with a whisky around one of four open log fires set in the large ornamental stone fireplaces of the State Drawing Room, Lumley Room and Entrance Hall.
 
If you’re feeling competitive, enjoy a game of backgammon or draughts on our ornate fold-out board games table. Browse paintings and books that date back to the 16th century in the Bishops Library. Marvel at the mystique of our 13th century Strickland Tower with its circular stone staircase and dungeon set against magnificent views across the Caldew Valley below and the Lake District fells just to the south.
 
Our luxurious State Drawing Room with its hand-painted chinoiserie wallpaper is the perfect space to relax as a large group of family and friends, especially at the end of an active day exploring the fells and lakes of the UNESCO World Heritage Lake District close by, visiting William Wordsworth's house, or further north, Hadrian's Wall is just 24 miles away.
 
This is your castle in Cumbria, a place to gather, celebrate and make memories together.
  
Attention to detail
 
Each room has been designed around a unique colour palette, furnished with carefully curated antique pieces and hand-crafted upholstery in luxurious fabrics. The attention to detail is simply breath-taking.
 
6 reception rooms
 
There are 6 reception rooms for you to enjoy. Gather in comfort on the plush pink velvet couches in the State Drawing Room to chat, play boardgames, or simply admire the view across the valley. Seamless SONOS room-to-room music. Our atmospheric historic chapel offers space for reflection or making music on the grand piano. Cosy up for a movie night and project your favourite film onto its large white walls!
 
15 bedrooms
 
Each of our 15 individually themed bedrooms have been lovingly restored to the highest standards with original fireplaces, stone windows, folding wooden shutters and exquisite cornicing.
 
Our deluxe bathrooms, with their premium toiletries, underfloor heating and modern fixtures, make the castle a haven for those seeking an indulgent pampering retreat. Of the 15 rooms, 13 are ensuite, with two adjoining single rooms just perfect for families or carers. 12 of the 15 bedrooms can be easily set up with either a super king bed or twin beds. The Castle comfortably sleeps up to 28 guests.
 
Bakelite rotary dial telephones feature in every bedroom, and there are no distracting TVs, just fast broadband.
 
Boardroom meeting space
 
A large modern 65” TV, “Owl” 360 conferencing for Zoom on fast internet connections and VOIP telephone systems can be found in the Peace Study, our connected boardroom meeting space.
 
Rose Castle has the ideal space to blend business and pleasure.
 
Reception Office
 
This is your castle complete with a dedicated office. The grand green leather desk used by the previous Bishops who lived here is complemented by a hand-made bureau stacked with the state-of-the-art technology you’d expect. Use this private office to get work done.
 
Your Kitchen
 
Our fully kitted Boost Kitchen is your homely and practical space to use for the duration of your stay, whether you want to whip up a batch of sangria, cook a full English breakfast, or pop in for a fancy coffee made using the multi-choice bean coffee machine. The Boost Kitchen looks out over Pettinger’s Garden, across the Apothecary Garden, and beyond to the Lake District fells.
 
We have a chef within our professional team you can optionally call upon to cater a magnificent feast using the full facilities of our commercial kitchen, which itself is not available for guest cooking.
 
Baby Changing and Accessibility
 
Baby changing facilities, cots and high-chairs are available. There is disabled access to all ground floor and first floor main rooms of the castle, including the Chapel and State Drawing Room. Three bedrooms and the reception rooms on the first floor are all wheelchair accessible via a lift. One large bedroom on the first floor has a deluxe accessible bathroom designed to the latest building regulations, with an adjoining single bedroom which can be used by a carer or family member.
 
We also cater for other disabilities throughout the building, including visual fire alarms for any guests who are hard of hearing.
 
Secluded, but just 7 miles from the M6
 
Despite enjoying splendid seclusion, Rose Castle is just 7 miles from the M6, making it accessible from the Scottish Borders and anyone driving up north from London.
 
Lake District National Park and Hadrian’s Wall
 
There is plenty to see and do in and around Rose Castle. The Lake District National Park offers an impressive range of outdoor activities for walking, hiking, kayaking and mountain biking. Outdoor enthusiasts are in for a treat with no end of exhilarating hikes and picturesque trails to enjoy, including England’s highest peak, Scafell Pike.
 
And there are plenty of museums, galleries, shops and eateries in nearby Keswick (22 miles), Cockermouth (23 miles) and Penrith (16 miles).
 
If you’re a cultural aficionado, explore Cumbria’s rich heritage at the Wordsworth Museum and Dove Cottage, and immerse yourself in the life and works of our famous poet William Wordsworth, who himself visited Rose Castle in August 1803, alongside Dorothy Wordsworth, his wife, and Samuel Coleridge, who recorded their visit starting with the phrase, “We are delighted with Rose Castle”.
 
Carlisle, with its famed mediaeval castle and popular Tullie House Museum, is a mere 8 miles away. If you fancy a spot of retail therapy, you’ll be spoiled for choice with plenty of high-street stores and quirky local shops to potter in.
 
Rose Castle was fortified to keep the Scots out following an attack by Robert the Bruce in 1323. The towers and crenellations embedded in our walls aren’t just decoration! Hadrian’s Wall is 24 miles away and Scotland is even closer. Rose Castle is your gateway to the Scottish Borders, not just the Lake District.
description.access:
As guests, Rose Castle will be yours to explore on a self-catering basis for the duration of your stay. Gather in our elegant State Drawing Room for after-dinner drinks, party all night in the grand State Dining Room, peruse the ancient books in the Bishop’s Library and literature in the Peace Study.
 
Please note that the nearby Chauffeur’s Cottage and the Gardener’s Cottage are not accessible to guests. Likewise, the Farm Cottage is also unavailable, however the adjoining Farm House, with 5 simply furnished bedrooms, can be booked as additional accommodation upon request.
 
At the request of our onsite Head Gardener, furry animals and pets must be kept under control in the 7 acres of formal gardens and outdoor spaces, as there are free-roaming guinea fowl and other exotic animals already living in the grounds!
 
Across the Castle’s 60-acre estate are plenty of tracks and fields to explore with your pets, as well as the Caldew River below for a delightful valley walk. Rose Castle sits right on the Cumbria Way, the award-winning 76-mile walk which crosses the Lake District from north to south.
description.notes:
- Available onsite parking for up to 40 vehicles.
- 1 gigabit fibre installation with fast internet throughout.
- SONOS sound system allows you to enjoy music moving seamlessly between rooms
- We have two pet-specific bedrooms.
- All dogs must remain on a lead while in the formal gardens (7 acres). The wider estate is 60 acres.
- Options for a part or fully catered stay are available on request.
- Note that our commercial kitchen and cellar are not accessible to guests due to environmental health regulations, however guests have their own dedicated private Boost Kitchen with full facilities to cook, bake and entertain to their hearts’ desire.
description.neighborhood: Rose Castle is nestled in the picturesque Caldew Valley on the borders of the Lake District. The pretty village of Dalston, with its charming selection of independently owned shops, pubs, and restaurants, is 2 miles away. For a larger selection of shops and amenities, the city of Carlisle is 8 miles away. Keswick, the adventurous heart of the Lake District, is 22 miles away. Penrith, on the London to Glasgow trainline, is just 16 miles away. The M6 is 7 miles away.
description.interaction:
A member of the Rose Castle team will welcome you on arrival. You can expect to enjoy complete privacy during your stay. However, please be assured that someone will be contactable by phone should any issues arise.
 
Bedrooms can be made up and bed linen changed during your stay as an additional service. Please get in touch for more information if this is important to you.

Villa Idalina no es un hotel, es un espacio en el tiempo que nos gusta compartir con ustedes, donde se puede disfrutar de arte e historia, puestas de sol, paseos por el rio, playa, música, fiestas, gastronomía, mercados...
Estamos bien comunicados por carretera, tren y embarcaderos. La población de Caminha de gran interés arquitectónico y comercial se encuentra a 3 km. Las ciudades y aeropuertos de Porto y Vigo se encuentran a menos de una hora en coche y tren. El Ferry Boat Caminha-A Guarda une Portugal y Galicia (España) en 7minutos.
Respetaremos su descanso y les recomendaremos lugares y actividades de interés para que su estancia entre nosotros sea agradable y quieran volver. 
Les esperamos

recent.comments: The castle made us feel that we were stepping into a small piece of history. The castle is referenced a lot in other places in town due to its historical relevance. Primarily the Kerr family influence on the town. I do wish there was more information on the history there when you stay there. That way you can understand the history of the property and know when the house was built and see what/ when sections were added on to the original tower.

items.comments: The castle made us feel that we were stepping into a small piece of history. The castle is referenced a lot in other places in town due to its historical relevance. Primarily the Kerr family influence on the town. I do wish there was more information on the history there when you stay there. That way you can understand the history of the property and know when the house was built and see what/ when sections were added on to the original tower.
We had such a lovely time at the castle. It is truly a special place and we really enjoyed exploring the local area.

Staying at Ferniehirst Castle while we visited the border region was a dream come true! The area is so peaceful and the castle felt comfortable and luxurious as we took in the history of the area.There are so many great books in Leslie’s place and Ian was even kind enough to show us some of the castle! I miss it already!

The location was breathtaking, the walks by the stream were wonderful and the help and attention we received magnificent.  Ian was so helpful and sweet. It was hard to leave and I would recommend this to everyone.  There is so much to do within a few minutes drive that you could spend weeks here.
absolutely lovely!
Beautiful and serene. Sharing the castle lodge was an awesome experience.  The team on property were a delight as well as extremely helpful. Charming!

For a member of the Kerr family, being able to stay on site was really a dream come true. I booked a visit with Bob Lawson, the historian and curator…it was a fantastic afternoon!!! I will be working to bring my brothers and father over for a trip in the next 6-12 months!

description.summary:
The Lothian Wing wing was built on the original foundation stones of the 17th century Ferniehirst Castle kitchens, to serve as the private apartment of the late Lord and Lady Lothian. The addition initially had a thatched roof until recent years when replaced by tiles.

Take in the fresh, country air in this magnificent setting. Boasting exquisite decor and walls draped in history, visit The Lothian Wing to explore what Ferniehirst has to offer.
description.space:
Master bedroom: A light and airy double bedroom with copious wardrobe space. Views to the landscaped grounds. A private bathroom that can be shared with the Twin Bedroom.

Twin room: This twin bedroom also has views of the landscaped grounds. Shares bathroom with the Master Bedroom.

Upper bedroom and bathroom: Self-contained upstairs unit of a double bedroom with adjacent private bathroom.

Sitting room: Enjoy the log fire and piano in winter. On warmer days, the French doors open onto the landscaped grounds and patio with a picnic table and chairs.

Kitchen: A well equipped, spacious kitchen with modern facilities and a seated eating area. From here discover the early 16th century left-handed stone staircase that leads up into the castle itself.

Dining room: Cosy room for kitchen suppers with an Aga and piano. The round dining table seats 6.
description.neighborhood:
Our private riverside walk is a stone’s throw from the Castle and the perfect place to get a taste of our beautiful Borders countryside. Stroll in woodlands by the meandering Jed Water, before taking the steps up to our viewing point to take in the vista.

Two miles north of Ferniehirst is the colourful and historical town of Jedburgh. The town is dominated by the red sandstone ruins of Jedburgh Abbey (pictured above), founded in 1138 by David I. Other attractions are Mary Queen of Scots’ House, a museum that tells the story of her tragic life.
description.transit: Whether you explore by car, on bike or on foot, you’ll discover friendly towns and picturesque villages, as well as the castles, abbeys, stately homes and museums that illustrate the exciting and often bloody history of the area. It’s that history which is commemorated in the Common Ridings and other local festivals, creating a colourful pageant much enjoyed by visitors and native Borderers alike.
description.interaction: We will not intrude on your holiday and will communicate entirely through AirBnB. The Wing is run by a business and therefore response times may vary over the weekend and UK public holiday hours. Communication is typically between office hours of 08:45 and 17:00. We will do our best to respond outwith these hours.

gallery.caption: East tower dining room christmas party

description.summary: Springfield Castle & East Tower is an exclusive property on a 200 acres.The Castle & the East tower sleep up to 25 guests. When you rent the property it is exclusively yours as we only rent to groups and not by the room.  Base nightly & weekend price set to reflect a 2 night stay low season. If you stay for 2 nights,3rd night is free in low season & the weekly rate in low season is just €8000. Mid & high season week prices differ.May-Sept 7 night minimum stay & bookings run Saturday to Saturday.
description.space: The castle is situated in the heart of County Limerick on a magical 200 acre wooded estate and is approached along a magnificent three quarter mile long avenue, lined with ancient lime trees. An ideal vacation place for you, your family and friends. A place to unwind and relax whilst on your luxury Irish castle stay. Springfield is a family owned business run by Jonathan and Betty. Betty's brother Robert and his wife Rita, Lord and Lady Muskerry live in South Africa but visit at least once a year as Robert has a keen interest in his family home and its restoration. The estate includes beautiful woodlands and an organic working deer farm and Jonathan will be more than happy to take you to meet the deer. It is also a historic castle where many battles were fought and for those who are interested Betty will share her wealth of knowledge and give you a tour of the 15th Century Tower house adjacent to the East Tower .There are wonderful woodland walks, barbeque areas, and lots of lovely outdoor spaces. The East tower has open plan shared spaces with a lovely long sitting room and a very quaint pub. The castle has lovely open fires where you can sit with a drink and relax. While you can cater for yourself while staying in the Castle we can arrange a chef to come in and cater for breakfasts, lunches and dinners if required.We produce a lot of fruit and vegetables in our chemical free walled garden and this produce is available for guests to buy.If you decide to enjoy a meal while staying the chef will use as much of the fresh produce from the garden as possible. We do hold weddings and celebrations for up to 80 people at the castle and east tower but these incur an extra fee on top of the rental price.
description.access: When you rent Springfield it is exclusively yours. There are forest walks, bicycles, a tennis court, a pool table, table tennis, fuzball, darts,  a pub which we can stock with barrels of Heineken and Guinness for you.There are 2 courtyards a soccer pitch , a tennis court, archery, BBQ areas, a bonfire pit and much more.
description.neighborhood: If you are looking for exclusivity this is the place to be. There are no other properties in the vicinity, however there are 2 villages within 4 km with shops and pubs. There is lots to do in the near vicinity such as horse riding, walking, paintballing, hawk walks,  water activities. The Castle is also well based for touring all of the south west and we can help you to plan day trips and suggest places to go.
description.transit: There is a bus stop in Newcastlewest which is 15 minutes away. Buses from Dublin, Cork, Kerry and Limerick arrive to this stop. There is a train station in Charleville which is 20 minutes away and there are trains from Dublin, Cork and Limerick to this station. We can organise a taxi from either of these location to the Castle. It is recommended to hire a car but taxi, mini bus and touring buses can be arranged for those who dont want to drive.
description.interaction: We live on the property and are always available to answer questions.
description.house_rules:
- There is a venue charge for events and all suppliers for events must be those agreed by us
- There is a maximum number of guests allowed for a party

description.summary: Dating back to 1698, this extraordinary castle provides an escape like no other. Enjoy 55 acres of surrounding gardens, an outdoor swimming pool and a living space that is fit for royalty.
description.space:
Incredible riverside location on the Devon and Cornwall border
An impressive living space with grand décor, historic antiques, and elegant interiors
An outdoor, solar-heated swimming pool and 55 acres of woodland gardens to explore


About the property

Oozing luxury, Cornish Castle is set in an idyllic location beside the River Tamar. You will be impressed by the grandeur yet feel completely at home, with two cosy living spaces, 11 individually styled bedrooms and a private garden featuring your very own solar-heated pool. Should you wish to venture beyond the castle, the city of Plymouth is just 20 minutes away or you can delve further into Cornwall to experience its many attractions and beautiful coastline.

Your journey begins with the picturesque driveway, paving the way to this magnificent abode. Sir James Tillie’s statue will greet you in the Courtyard, before stepping inside to be impressed by the castle’s grandeur and many years of family history.

The elegant dining room sits in the heart of the castle and is a fabulous place to wine, dine, entertain, and socialise. Seating up to 22 guests, you can gather here for a delicious banquet, admire the gold-framed portraits and clink champagne glasses until nightfall. Once replenished, retire to the drawing room in front of the open log fire, sink into the cosy sofas and reminisce good memories under the glistening chandelier.

Next door you will find the morning room, a comfortable space to relax and unwind. Nestle into the sofas, sip a warming cup of tea, and admire the far-reaching views from the patio doors. As the sun starts to set, wiggle your toes in front of the open fire or snuggle up to watch a film on the TV.

The large kitchen provides everything you should need to self-cater with ease, including an AGA, a large gas oven and hob, two dishwashers, a microwave, and an American-style fridge/freezer. Congregate around the eight-seater dining table to discuss your next adventure or natter over a cup of coffee to start the morning right. Rearing off the kitchen is a handy boot room, where you will find a selection of Le Chameau’s to wear for your walks.

Head down the steps to the cellar/games room where you will find an abundance of activities to keep the whole group entertained. There is a pool table, table football, a dartboard, and a Smart TV, enabling you to watch the latest sports match or big game.

There are eleven bedrooms, all of which have been beautifully decorated with soft linen sheets, original antiques, and chic interiors throughout. There is one accessible bedroom on the ground floor, featuring a wet room and all the luxuries the first floor rooms provide. The impressive staircase will lead you to eight first-floor bedrooms, all of which boast incredible views of the river or gardens and are equipped with a king-size bed as standard and en-suites (all bar one with a shower and bath). The final two bedrooms are additional rooms in the attic, sharing a shower room with views across the gardens. The option to have rooms twinned (two single beds) is available in all rooms except the Dewhurst Suite, Coryton and Wyndham. Bayly is twinned as standard.

The outside space is complete with 55 acres of private woodland to explore, a solar-heated outdoor swimming pool and three large terraces with riverside views. Play a game of croquet on the lawn, toast marshmallows on the fire pit under a blanket of stars and absorb the exceptional surroundings that will take your breath away time and time again.
description.access: The owners will greet you on arrival and show you into the property.
description.notes:
Check-in: from 17:00
Check-out: by 10:00

Deposit: Bookings are subject to a non-refundable deposit of 30% of the booking value plus applicable booking fees, with the balance payable 60 days before the date of travel.

Accidental Damage Deposit: To maintain the highest standards in our properties, guests will need to pay a refundable Accidental Damage Deposit of £1000 prior to their stay.

Book with confidence: If your booking is affected by new Government travel restrictions which were not known at the time of booking and you are legally unable to travel, we will arrange with the property owner to refund 100% of your holiday cost.

Sustainability

If you would like to offset the carbon emissions from your trip, get in touch and we can arrange this for a small fee.

Children of all ages are welcome

Up to 4 dogs are permitted, at an additional fee of £30 per dog

No smoking/vaping indoors

Please keep noise to a minimum

Parties and events are charged separately
description.neighborhood:
Cornish Castle is located a short drive from Saltash, also known as the ‘Gateway to Cornwall’ and neighbours the famous St Mellion Golf Course. Whilst there is so much to do nearby, the estate itself provides an abundance of activities to enjoy, including walking the woodland gardens, stand up paddleboarding on the River Tamar, gin tasting, clay pigeon shooting (available between April and June), 4x4 driving and so much more.

Just 10 minutes away, ‘The Who’d Have Thought It Inn’ serves delicious home-cooked meals and provides a hearty Cornish pub atmosphere. The local town of Saltash features all the amenities you will need for your self-catering stay and the many close-by villages and towns allow you to browse boutiques, grab a coffee and a slice of cake or enjoy a locally sourced meal in a restaurant beside the sea.

There are several beautiful beaches located across the coastline. Whitsand Bay is a short 30-minute drive, with the popular surfing spots of Newquay and Polzeath reachable within an hour. Enjoy a scenic stroll, a spot of paddleboarding or coasteering if you are feeling adventurous.
If the weather is not on your side, fear not. Visit the world-renowned Eden Project in St Austell and discover its two huge domes of tropical and Mediterranean plant life, or venture into nearby Plymouth to explore The National Marine Aquarium.
description.transit: With a mile long driveway, a car is essential for travelling to the property and for ease of getting around. There is ample space for parking and charging points for those with electric vehicles.

Een heel fijn verblijf gehad op deze sprookjesachtige locatie.

We felt right at home, exactly how it was advertised and everyone we encountered was extremely helpful and we got the feeling they were genuinely interested in us have a good time, not just presenting smiling faces.  Such a peaceful and beautiful area, if you are looking to relax and leave stress behind, this is the place.

Fabulous stay at Ardrhu house, we’re very sad to leave!! We’ll definitely stay 2 nights next time, cause we’re coming back for sure! The location is just stunning and the place feels magical, the views are fantastic, staff is lovely and every detail is arranged to perfection. It was a shame that the restaurant was closed, we’d love to enjoy a dinner in the beautiful outdoor bubbles. Our dog Lupa absolutely loved the place, she had lots of fun and cuddles from the staff :)
Incredible location and building. We loved our stay even more than we had expected. Fantastic staff and facilities.
Wonderful place, the service was perfect ! It is a high standing hostel and a homestay in the same time.

An amazingly stylish home in an incredible position on the loch. Hospitality was wonderful and it was idyllic to sit and drink tea in the beautiful living room looking out onto the views of the mountains and the water. We brought our dog Ellie who was also made very welcome, and it was ideal to be able to walk straight out onto the beach from the house.
Food was excellent - dessert of a chocolate brownie with a salted caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream was without doubt one of the best we’d ever had! 
We had the floral suite which was beautiful, the only downside was that it would be nice to have a shower rather than just a bath, but the fact that the sauna area was just down the corridor from the room meant that this wasn’t a big issue.
This would be a great house to rent out for a birthday or celebration weekend. Many thanks for such a wonderful end to our trip to Scotland!

From the moment we stepped on the porch and Ela greeted us, she went over the hygiene rules. It was so reassuring to know that this lovely place has hygiene as it’s priority. This was clear throughout the whole property. 

As we stepped through and got the wee tour, we saw how magical this place is. Staying originally only one day in the floral suite we felt like we were living in a fairytale. We loved it so much we booked another night in the Emperor Suite. The rolls were big and had everything you could ever want. 

Ela and her staff were simply so lovely and genuine. Caring and attention to detail was incredible. I was shocked at how attentive they were. They genuinely cared about your happiness while you’re there. 

From sitting out watching the sea waves splash against the outer wall during the day and seeing the beautiful mountains as a backdrop to late at night relaxing into the furniture outside under the stars and watching the moon. This places is just such a romantic retreat and I hope and pray it is not the last time I’m in the area.

You will come away from this place sad, sad you couldn’t stay longer but my goodness will you have memories and stories to tell.

Thanks again Ela and team. It’s not good bye 👋🏻

description.summary: Luxury room in a magical setting with panoramic views of Glencoe, Mull and Loch Linnhe
description.space:
An impeccably restored Scottish Baronial Manor nestled between the great Ben Nevis and Loch Linnhe affording sweeping views from Glencoe all the way to Isle of Mull and across to Ardnamurchan peninsula.
This unique residence has a special place in the local history so I hope you'll enjoy your time at this  19th century baronial retreat built in the same architectural style as Her Majesty The Queen's favourite retreat at Balmoral Castle.
Redesigned now to accommodate a large family group with all the amenities of a luxury hotel and the comfort of a grand country residence most of the original features have been preserved and stunning new ones have been installed to create lavish marble ensuites with heated floors and new bedrooms out of thin air. Stone cast bathtubs, bronze sinks and sculpted marble pedestals complement exquisite art deco Imperial sanitary and custom made bathroom fittings. The Floral Suite has a spectacular marble ensuite with bathtub  and sweeping view towards the loch and Glencoe. The property enjoys a great deal of privacy from its commanding position on the tip of the headland sat amidst 3 acres of landscaped grounds with its own sunny beach and accessed via private road. You will have privacy as the house is flanked by the sea and by its woodland and with very few neighbours around it truly is a retreat into nature.
The room is fitted with USB sockets, sound speakers, electric blankets and luxurious bedding and towels. You will have a large down filled duvets and different types of pillows to choose from (down & feather, hollow fibre or water pillows).
description.access:
During your stay you will have access to the entire ground floor (morning room, dining area, conservatory).
The lounge area in the morning room is the perfect spot to relax or snooze. Large wood-burning fireplaces, make the house truly magical in the wintertime when a giant Christmas tree takes residence. And as much as the Highlands are famous for the magnificent outdoors there is also a time to cosy up in front of a log fire in the TV room.
The house is dog friendly and there is a midweek housekeeping service included free of charge for longer stays. 
Continental Breakfast consists of a selection of local produce and homemade treats and preserves to enjoy. Leisure activities can be arranged on site at affordable costs (yoga, fitness, bootcamp, mountain hikes, massages or hairdressing services). Be prepared to be pampered and looked after in our spa or blissfully left to your own devices to enjoy your stay without any interference. But whichever it is, lace up those boots and get walking at least once whilst you’re here! Be it for an epic hike to the summit of Ben Nevis (the highest mountain in the British Isles) or just a stroll into the wilderness nearby (you can walk to the Corran ferry from the house or cross by car and within minutes Ardnamurchan opens up a whole box of surprises for the keen or casual walker). There’s something for everyone and rest assure there’s nothing better than a long soak in the bathtub afterwards or a steaming hot powershower followed by stiff drink in the conservatory. Here you can unwind before dinner watching the sun set on Glencoe and Mull and as serene sunsets compete with thundering storms for your full attention you can probably point by then the peaks you’ve claimed on Ardnamurchan!.

A good steady internet connection throughout the house and nearby so you can be as connected as you wish to be. The house has CCTV in some public areas connected to the security system with Police response.
description.notes: Fort William is a very short drive away (15 min) for all major supermarkets Marks &Spencer, Morrissons, Aldi & Lidl or 7 min to Co-op in the village towards Glencoe where you can also find a Post Office where you can exchange currency or use the ATM machine.
description.transit: there is a bus stop at the end of the road with frequent service to Fort William.

description.summary: Located on the second floor in the North West aspect of the Palace and overlooking the Parks, the Balvaird Wing has been newly refurbished offering guests 5 star, luxury accommodation. The Wing sleeps up to six guests in 3 beautifully decorated, en-suite bedrooms and is accessed via external and internal stairs.
description.space:
Scone Palace has an exciting and colourful history as one of Scotland's most important stately homes. Fifteen hundred years ago it was the capital of the Picts.  In the intervening centuries, it has been the seat of parliaments and the crowning place of the Kings of Scots, including Macbeth and Robert the Bruce. The Palace houses an outstanding collection of antiques, paintings and rare artifacts and the grounds are renowned throughout the world, making the stateley home one of the most popular tourist attractions in both Perth and Scotland. 

Poised above the River Tay in Perthshire, Scone Palace overlooks the routes north to the Highlands and east through Strathmore to the coast. The Grampian mountains form a distant backdrop, and across the river stands the city of Perth.

If you fancy dining out, it is only a short 10-minute taxi ride to the centre of Perth where you will find a variety of award
winning restaurants.  

Guest facilities include: Comfortable sitting room with magnificent views over the Parks to the river Tay;  Fully equipped and spacious dining kitchen suitable for entertaining; TV, DVDs, board games and Wi-Fi facilities; A cook and maid service can also be arranged on request.

Not only is the exterior stunning for our guests at Scone Palace, but the grounds and gardens are also an experience and retreat in themselves.  Residents have their own private gardens at Scone seen below along with the entire Estate when the gates are closed to visitors.  A relaxing outdoor space to enjoy breakfast, your own afternoon tea or a drink before dinner.

Guests staying at the Balvaird Wing have complimentary tour tickets for Scone Palace during April to October when the Palace is open to the public.  Out with those months we can arrange a private tour subject to availability.
description.access: Guests will have access to the beautiful grounds of Scone Palace and their stay will include a tour of the Palace during the open season.
description.neighborhood:
Poised above the River Tay in Perthshire, Scone Palace overlooks the routes north to the Highlands and east through Strathmore to the coast. The Grampian mountains form a distant backdrop, and across the river stands the city of Perth.

Scone Palace and the Balvaird Wing is set in 100 acres of Park and Grounds by the River Tay only 2 miles from the City of Perth. 

A gateway to the Scottish Highlands this is a wonderful central location in which to easily access many stunning parts of Scotland.
description.transit: Guest would be advised to have their own car.

hosts.about:
Our love affair with villa holidays first began in 2003 when Co-Founders Oliver and Ravi spent a week at a crumbling chateau in the Dordogne with a group of their closest friends. As fate would have it, that holiday was the start of something special. It was the beginning of Oliver’s Travels.

Today, we have over 6,000 hand-picked villas, chateaux and holiday homes across the top holiday destinations – with new regions launching every year. 

Before deciding on the where, it’s important to consider what you want from your villa holiday. Is it to relax around the pool, dining al-fresco with a spot of sightseeing? Or you are looking for an action-packed trip? Whatever you decide, it’s a good idea to put your requirements at the forefront when discussing with our travel experts who are the best in the business and we have countless awards to match. Trust us, we'll find you the perfect villa holiday to surpass your expectations. 

And the best part? Once you book a villa holiday, the service doesn't stop there. Our Free Concierge Service means you'll be in good hands to arrange catering & fridge stocking, housekeeping, childcare, tours & activities and so much more, to make your stay truly extraordinary

description.summary: Tarbert Country Manor holds a magnificent position on the shores of West Loch Tarbert, with stunning views over the loch to Kintyre and the hills of Arran, the Manor is the perfect retreat for those looking for a luxurious and tranquil escape. While guests will enjoy being away from the hustle and bustle, the village of Tarbert with its shops, restaurants and pubs, is just a fifteen-minute drive away.
description.space:
The turreted 19th century baronial mansion has been lovingly modernised and combines its original charm and character with updated interiors and all the modern amenities guests could possibly need, including pool table, cinema room, and wifi throughout. Tarbert Country Manor can comfortably accommodate up to seventeen guests across its nine well-appointed bedrooms, making it a fantastic setting for a special celebration or family reunion. On the ground floor is the main living accommodation which offers multiple spaces for relaxing and socialising, including a sitting room, dining room, library, study and a large, fully-equipped kitchen with separate dining area. Upstairs are the nine bedrooms, one Emperor, three king-size rooms, one double, a triple and a twin as well as two single rooms. Three of the bedrooms boast en-suite facilities, while the final bedrooms share the use of two large family bathrooms.

Outside, guests can explore the estate, with its spacious well-tended gardens, oak woods and walled garden, as well as the private pebble beach and foreshore.

*Please note that no concierge services are available at Tarbert Country Manor

Features:

Ground Floor
- Fully-equipped kitchen with dining facilities
- Living room with working fireplace
- Dining room
- Games room with pool table
- Cinema room with DVD player and projector 
- Map room 
- Study
- Cloakroom

First Floor (split-level)
- "Medlar Suite" with Emporor bed, private sitting area and en-suite bathroom
- "North Bedroom" with king-size bed
- Family bathroom
- "Blue Room" with king-size bed
- "Mod Room" with double bed
- "Monk's Room" with single bed
- "Molly's Room" with twin beds
- Family bathroom

Second Floor (accessed via two separate staircases)
- Tower Bedroom with king-size bed with en-suite bathroom
* Please note there is a low ceiling height on the corridor accessing this bedroom. 
- Bedroom 8 with three single beds 
- Bedroom 9 with single bed
- Family bathroom

Exterior Grounds
- You will fnid folding outdoor chairs in the Boot Room
- Large gardens
- Access to pebble beach

Additional Facilities
- Wi-Fi (please note that this is a rural connection!)
- TV 
- One travel cot & highchair available on request
- Washing machine & dryer
- Iron & board
- Parking for 10 cars
- Charcoal BBQ (owners willl provide charcoal for one BBQ)

* Please note that the maximum number of guests is 17, extra beds cannot be provided under any circumstances. Furniture in the home should not be moved.


Location:

Tarbert Country Manor is situated on the shores of West Loch Tarbert, on the Kintyre Peninsula on the west coast of Scotland. The pretty village of Tarbert is just a 15-minute drive from the Manor, here a variety of amenities, including shops and restaurants can be found.

Tarbert, known as the gateway to Kintyre, gives you superb access to all the ferry points across Kintyre, that travel to Gigha, Arran, Islay and Portavadie and excellent access to all the locations of interest from Kilberry, the islands such as Jura, Islay, Gigha and Arran, the main road to the Mull of Kintyre and the main road in the other direction to Oban, and further on to Fort William. Therefore, Tarbert Country Manor makes an ideal choice for those looking to fully explore this wonderful part of Scotland and all that it has to offer. For those travelling in from further afield, Glasgow Airport is just 2 and a half hours away.

*Please be aware of seasonal opening times*

Terms & Conditions:

Security deposit?
£1000 charged to the client's credit card as a pre-authorisation at least 2 weeks prior to arrival and refunded two weeks after departure, subject to a full inspection

Arrival time?
4pm. There is no access to the estate before 4pm and we are grateful for guest's co-operation and understanding

Departure time?
10am. Later check-outs are not possible under any circumstances

Energy costs included?
Yes, included in the rental price

Heating costs included?
Yes, included in the rental price

Linen & towels included?
Yes, included in the rental price

Changeover day?
Friday

Minimum stay?
3 nights

End of stay cleaning included?
Yes. However, guests are required to leave the accommodation clean, tidy and in the same

condition as on their arrival. Any extra cleaning, laundry, maintenance and/or rubbish disposal required will be charged against the security deposit

Smoking Allowed?
Smoking & Vaping are not permitted

Pets welcome?
On request prior to booking ONLY with the owner. If accepted, a pet supplement of £100 will apply. Please state the breed of dog at the time of booking. Strictly only 1 dog allowed at the property

Stag & Hen Do's Allowed ?
Weddings, stag/hen parties and any special events are not allowed

Other Ts and Cs?
The lead booker must be at least 30 years old.

Please state the purpose of visit on your booking form



Other 3?
The house is presented in an immaculate condition and if any damages occur it would be at the discretion of the owner to retain the necessary sum from the damages deposit for repair purposes. The holidaymaker is hereby invited to inspect the property on arrival and if any damages are noted before occupancy has begun to bring them to the notice of the owner immediately- thus avoiding any possibility of dispute

description.neighborhood: Ulverston has a cobblestone main street. It has independent shops, cafés, and pubs with open fires and real ales. There is something for everyone, from upscale dining to classic pub grub. There are festivals throughout the year, from flags and walks to the famous Dickensian Christmas Festival in late November. It is the birthplace of Stan Laurel and the world record holder for the greatest foam pie battle in the world. A picturesque village with views of the southern Lake District and Morecambe Bay. Deepest, widest, and shortest canal makes for a great afternoon walk with a pub and bay views. All National Park attractions are accessible. Furness Coast has sandy beaches and birding. Nearby family attractions include the South Lakes Wild Animal Park, Lakes Windermere and Coniston, and Birkrigg Common.

hosts.about: Born in Scotland, but spent most of my life in other countries now. Keen to share this stunning castle with like-minded people.

recent.comments:
The Penthouse is in a stunning location and the apartment itself is first class. Spacious, stylish, really great for families with older kids or a group of friends. Parking is right outside the front door, although bear in mind when packing that there’s a few flights of stairs to get in! The views from the apartment are it’s very best feature, directly across the Loch. 

Perhaps the only downside is there’s a venue close by that plays loud music until late; possibly wedding venue or similar? Might be annoying for some, although for us was just a mild distraction despite having windows open. 

Everything else is great, and Graham the host is very helpful and quickly responds to questions. We would definitely visit again.

items.comments:
The Penthouse is in a stunning location and the apartment itself is first class. Spacious, stylish, really great for families with older kids or a group of friends. Parking is right outside the front door, although bear in mind when packing that there’s a few flights of stairs to get in! The views from the apartment are it’s very best feature, directly across the Loch. 

Perhaps the only downside is there’s a venue close by that plays loud music until late; possibly wedding venue or similar? Might be annoying for some, although for us was just a mild distraction despite having windows open. 

Everything else is great, and Graham the host is very helpful and quickly responds to questions. We would definitely visit again.
What a great experience!!
Great place to stay!! Beautiful! Thanks!
Super endroit ! Je recommande sans hésiter ce Penthouse.

We stayed at the Penthouse for one night on our trip and wished we had booked longer. The setting is beautiful and the unit is very comfortable for three couples traveling together. it’s on the third floor but there are no lifts. Pack lightly and avoid if you can’t climb stairs. Otherwise the views from the living area and bedrooms are amazing. Grahams guide book was also very helpful.
Really lovely and serene place

The views alone are worth the stay.  Be aware that there are a lot of stairs so pack light but the views and quiet are well worth the climb.  The penthouse is indeed a penthouse with lovely furnishings, comfortable beds and nice linens. The kitchen is very functional and clean.  The “master” bedroom is huge and all the bedrooms are comfortable.  The grounds are lovely and great for children to run and play; the bunnies were an added plus.  There are many things to do in the area and activities are within minutes driving.  Graham was quick to respond and provided excellent, clear directions.

description.summary:
Amazing Penthouse apartment in Lomond Castle with uninterrupted views of Loch Lomond and Ben Lomond. 

All three bedrooms are ensuite with modern showers, luxury beds, mattresses, top end Egyptian cotton sheets and amazing views. The Livingroom and dining area are perfectly appointed to ensure plenty of room for social gatherings. 

Distance to local attractions:
Private Beach - on site

The Penthouse has been fully modernized and is equipped with modern furnishing and kitchen amenities. The televisions are SMART TV's with Netflix.

description.neighborhood: Ulverston is a quaint, historic market town with a cobblestone main street. It has a wide variety of locally owned stores, cafes, and pubs serving up hearty fare and cold ones alike. There is a wide variety of restaurants serving everything from gourmet cuisine to classic pub fare. Throughout the summer, Ulverston hosts a variety of festivals, from a flag-raising and walking festival to an art and music festival, and in late November, the town hosts the world-famous Dickensian Christmas festival. In addition to being the place where Stan Laurel was born, it also holds the record for the largest foam pie fight in the world. There are wonderful walks in the countryside around the town, with sights such as Morecambe Bay and the southern Lake District. The deepest, widest, and shortest canal in the world can be found here, and it makes for a lovely afternoon stroll with a pub and bay views at its conclusion. Access to the park's many sights is a breeze. The sandy beaches and excellent birdwatching along the Furness Coast are a major draw. Popular Birkrigg Common, with its breath-taking vistas of Morecambe Bay, is also close by, as is the South Lakes Wild Animal Park and Lakes Windermere and Coniston.

Entre sus sufridos muros de piedras y sin ornamentación se respira un ambiente de paz y serenidad repletos de historia.
description.neighborhood: En Castellar podrás encontrar un espacio rural incomparable y la tranquilidad de los pueblos andaluces; blancas callejuelas empedradas adornadas con flores, impresionantes vistas panorámicas de toda la comarca desde la terraza de nuestro hotel, gastronomía tradicional y gran número de espacios históricos y naturales para visitar.

Love to co-host my friends place and get to know a little about each guest. 
As a guest I love to travel around with my wife, my little girl and my little boy.
It's my pleasure to welcome travellers from near and far!

recent.comments: The most INCREDIBLE Air B&B! We loved views and listening to the River and the sheep each morning & evening. It was the perfect location for the day trips we had planned. Our daughters wanted to stay at Mirian’s instead of continuing on to the rest of our 3 week Roadtrip they loved it so much!

items.comments: The most INCREDIBLE Air B&B! We loved views and listening to the River and the sheep each morning & evening. It was the perfect location for the day trips we had planned. Our daughters wanted to stay at Mirian’s instead of continuing on to the rest of our 3 week Roadtrip they loved it so much!

Loved our stay at The Bridge House- such a unique location! Comfortable and homely. Private and peaceful. Mirian/ Mimi was super friendly, attentive and gave us plenty of recommendations. Loved the sauna, large outdoor terrace and hearing the river flowing directly below. Seeing the white stag was pretty special too!

This is one incredible place to stay! So special and unique, a little creaky and rustic inside befitting  of the castle atmosphere :)  and Mimi has made it such a comfortable space with her decor and plush bedding. The views from the balconies are spectacular, we took so many pictures here. I'll be recommending this to anyone going to this area.
We had a magical stay in your beautiful miniature castle. It was a dream. We even spotted a white stag nearby! Can’t wait to come back.

We had an incredible stay here! My hubby didn’t want to leave and neither did I! So peaceful and enchanting. 💖 Marion was very helpful and made some great recommendations. I wanted to take Tino (the cat I met outside) home with me. Thank you so much!

The Bridge House was as magical as we hoped it would be. We absolutely loved the apartment and the beautiful surrounding area. We were thrilled to have the opportunity to stay there and would absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for a unique experience for a weekend. The host seemed very on top of everything. Keep in mind that she is a more hands on Airbnb host than we are used to. We typically prefer to be left alone to enjoy a space, while she seemed to prefer to give instructions in person and throughout our stay, even to the point of telling us how to care for our children and entering the apartment without warning during our stay. As airbnb guests we are used to following clear written instructions and responsibly caring for a space as requested. She easily could have posted instructions for the various things she asked of us throughout our stay and then let us be, and that would have felt much less stressful.

What an incredible place to stay! As soon as I saw it I knew I had to book it! It's like a fairy tale! A unique and beautiful place to stay! The beds were wonderful with memory foam mattresses and down pillows and comforter. I slept just like I was at home!

description.summary:
If your looking for something a little different then The Bridge House might be just for you! 

My unusual 2 bedroom home is actually build on a bridge spanning the River Ardle in 1881.

Charming original features including stone spiral stairs, traditional Scottish timber clad walls, stone/pine flooring and even a privy directly over the river below!

Recently renovated.

Quiet, peaceful and rural location.

Pretty views from every angle.

Sauna.

Category A listed.
description.space:
The adventure begins as you enter my front door with a winding stone spiral staircase leading upto The Bridge House.

The top of the stairs opens into the conservatory dining room.

From here you can access the little bedroom and kitchen/sittingroom.

The little bedroom has a small double bed, great views upriver and a quirky privy from olden days!

The kitchen sitting room is surrounded by traditional scottish timber clad walls and floor. It has a cosy log burning stove and pretty views downriver. The kitchen is fully fitted with everything you need.

From the kitchen sittingroom you access the romantic master bedroom with kingsize 4 poster, smart TV, ornamental fireplace and fitted mini wardrobes. I hope you'll sleep as well as I do with the peaceful sound of the river below.

The bathroom has a choice of shower or bath. 

There are stone walkways all around The  Bridge House with magical views down to the river below. They connect with the veranda seating area nestled in the castellations and a small sauna in a mini stone 'outbuilding'.
description.access: Garden up river is shared with the stable apartment.
description.notes:
There is another completely separate 2 bedroom apartment in the stables just over the bridge. It is completely detached apart from a stone walkway which is only used if the two units are rented as one (4 bedroom).

Due to the upper walkway walls being only 1 meter high in places we do recommend bringing children unless the are kept an eye on at all times.

The little bedroom has a small double bed (120cm wide). Comfy and cosy but can be tight for two.

There is a charge per pet per booking (not always pets accepted or any pets accepted)
description.neighborhood:

. Tourist hotspots of Braemar, Pitlochry, Dunkeld and Perth all within an hours drive.
. Glenshee skiing 35 minutes.

name: Live like a King in my Castle
title: Galway, Ireland

gallery.caption: Our beautiful castle, and perhaps yours for a night or two?
Lovely mosaic tile floor on the bathroom (home made)
This is our home made limestone carved toilet.
sunlight in the evening streaming in.
View of the turret, from the top of the castle. We hand carved every stone.
This is a stone carving I did of my partner, Eva.

hosts.about: I am an eccentric  stonemason, father, and proud castle owner. I used to be a clothing designer, but turned from designing cloth to cutting stone. I now work on castles all over Ireland and live with my French girlfriend in the castle.

recent.comments: Pete was super friendly & very casual. Castle was more than we expected!  So very interesting and quirky!  Felt very special. Wish we had more time there!!  Highly recommend!

items.comments: Pete was super friendly & very casual. Castle was more than we expected!  So very interesting and quirky!  Felt very special. Wish we had more time there!!  Highly recommend!
Great place, very unique. Pete keeps the magic alive. If anyone is looking for an experience out side of the square….. this is it!
Had a great stay at Pete's Castle. He has created something very special! Would definately recommend to our friends and family.
Peter's Castle is an amazing place for a stay.  He gives a wonderful tour and history of the castle.  It's an amazing project and the kids love it.  Very cozy and fun place to stay.

It's understandable why this airbnb has become one of the most popular in all of Europe.  Make no mistake, this place is not a comfortable accommodation, it is an experience, so you need to show up with this expectation.  We came after visiting Ashford Castle, which is a 5-star luxury resort, so it was a bit of a shock initially.  But it was awesome, and our family of 5 (3 boys) had a blast over a 2 night stay.  You have to walk up 50 stairs up a very cool narrow spiral staircase to the living quarters and then another 15 or so to get to the bedrooms.   The restroom is in the living quarters so something to think about if you tend to get up in the middle of the night to use the restroom.  While the castle is awesome in itself, having Pete onsite made the experience equally unique.  Forget the Dos Equis guy, Pete is "the most interesting man in the world." His passion for the property and story-telling certainly rounded out the experience.

Quirky place. Pete is a delightful enthusiastic host. Stairs could be a challenge for some. Don’t expect to cart your cases up. Leave down stairs. Bathroom and toilet could be a challenge for some. We found it interesting but one night is enough mainly due to the stairs. If you want to live in a castle this is your chance. Embrace the challenge.

we needed more time to learn more about his work on this unique accommodation.

description.summary:
Cahercastle has been standing since the late 1400s One needs to be somewhat crazy to be owned by a castle , itsowned me now for 20 years, anyway it is our home its not perfect, so don't expect perfection ,we do have cobwebs and a little dust (so asthma sufferers take note)We endeavour to make your stay as comfortable as possible 
Please note when making a request to stay please take time to write an introductory message or have an informative profile We look forward to welcoming you 
Peter / Eva
description.space:
A beautiful, original medieval castle experience can be yours for a weekend, a week, or even longer. You'll be staying in the master bedroom, the highest room in the castle.

This castle has been restored to its original state by using traditional materials, and also by using cutting edge technology. We used traditional local stone, limestone, as well as oak beams, to make the castle as traditional as possible, but it also has modern conveniences, such as solar water heating. The castle was built sometime in the 1400's but was refurbished in the last decade. It is comprised of a master bedroom upstairs, with access to the turret, a living room and dining room, two guest bedrooms, and some storage rooms. I'm Peter, your host, and I spent the last ten years refining and refurbishing the castle - the pictures can attest to how well that has worked out. Two room in the castle are still under construction - the storage room downstairs.

Remember, this is a castle that is over 600 years old. That means it's not perfect. Castles were never designed with bathrooms and showers, so we've improvised. You'll have to come downstairs to have a bath which is located in the living room - this is the quirkiest part of the castle. You have full private access to the living room,kitchen , bath and  your master bedroom  

Castles are built with solid stone,  so there is a huge fireplace with a cooker to keep the place warm and of course underfloor heating complements of our pet Dragon that lives in the dungeon 

The castle has lots of quirks, its a great and fun place to stay the night.

Galway City is a 25 minute drive from the castle which is a very beautiful city. The castle is around a 20 minute drive from Galway Airport, a 45 minute drive from Shannon Airport and Dublin is two hours away.

What to expect: lots of winding staircases, a castle that has been lovingly restored, but there are some cobwebs, and it gives you the real Irish castle experience. It's not pristine, its not perfect, but it's a real castle. There are lots of sheep and cows in the nearby fields - but lots of peace and quiet.

This is a very unique place to stay. There's nothing like it around, where you can say that you stayed in an actual castle. It's not a tourist attraction (like Blarney Castle) and it's not pristine like a hotel, but you'll have a great time visiting. 

You'll need a car. The castle is about two miles from the nearest public transport. (Craughwell has both train and buses running regular schedules)

I can help with anything like lighting a fire or answering any of your questions.
P.S. as this is our home we like to get an idea of who's coming to stay so please write a message of introduction or have a written profile as we do sometimes decline if we just see a one liner and nothing on a profile 
so to avoid disappointment fill out your profile

description.summary: Spedlins Castle is the perfect place to rent for family/friends to meet for a holiday or celebration. The Great Hall, with its roaring fire, provides an amazing entertaining space. There's a large kitchen, a dining room with seating for 14. On the floor above are 4 bedrooms - 3 doubles, 1 twin and a bathroom. On the 4th floor is another double bedroom, plus a dormitory room with 4 single beds and a 3rd bathroom. The grounds extend to 4 acres and include beautiful gardens and a lake.
description.space:
Entering Spedlins Castle through the original oak front door, the mediaeval quirks of the architecture are immediately apparent as you ascend the spiral stone staircase. 

A magical tower, rising some 48ft above the Dumfries and Galloway countryside, this unique home is just as incredible inside as it looks. Its 9ft thick stone walls have stood the test of time since 1450. Packed with history and centuries of stories, this home is an absolute gem by the banks of the River Annan. Exploring the castle for the first time is a wonderful experience, with a wealth of turrets, nooks and staircases to discover. The showstopper here is the Great Hall, with a high, arching ceiling and a Renaissance fireplace so huge you can walk inside it. Like the rest of the castle, it's dressed with antique furniture and eclectic art collected over many years by the owners. Two long sofas make for a fabulous space to relax with family and friends and, in the evening, you can light the fire and play music. Elsewhere there's a fine library, a basement playroom with Sky TV and a large kitchen with its own casual dining space and a fireplace. Formal dinners can be held in the dining room – and perhaps if you don't feel like cooking, you could ask the host to arrange a private chef. On the top floors, bedrooms are romantic and impressive. There's a beautiful four-poster in one room, a large antique French bed in the room next door, and a bed built into a cosy alcove in another. Outside there are four acres to explore, including a lake, a medieval-style topiary garden and a terrace for sipping drinks together on a summer evening. Perfect for a large group celebrating something special, this is an enchanting and memorable place to stay, just a short drive from the town of Lockerbie. And did we mention there's a famous ghost story here? Old ‘Dunty’ Porteous hasn't bothered visitors for decades but it makes for a fun tale.

Spedlins is situated right next to the River Annan where you can sit and picnic on the river bank in the summer months, and where wild swimming is possible. The Annan is filled with trout and salmon and it's a great spot for fishing. There are some beautiful walks directly from the front door.

The nearest town is Lockerbie, which has a supermarket, an incredible butcher, and a selection of trains that go directly to London Euston (3 hours 40 mins). You can also get the train from Lockerbie to Glasgow, which has the nearest airport. If you're driving, Glasgow airport is about a 1 hour 10 min drive or Edinburgh airport is a 1 hour 30 min drive. Tesco and Morrison’s both deliver online shops directly to the front door. 

It’s a very tranquil spot, full of history. There are plenty of things to do nearby - whether it's whisky tasting,  fishing, clay pigeon shooting or golf that you're into. 

Our housekeeper and gardener are always on hand in case you need them. We have a private chef who can cook you a celebratory meal or organise your food for the weekend. As well as this, we have a fantastic masseuse who lives locally. She's very happy to come to the castle to give massages. We can also arrange a guided history tour of the castle. Just let us know if you're interested in any of these services when you book so we can get things organised in advance.
description.access: The whole of the space is available for use by guests. on a self catering basis. We provide all your bed linen and towels. We can also offer you a private chef during your stay if required. There are two large car parks with plenty of parking space.
description.notes: The tower rises to 48 feet and is four stories high. You reach the top floors by a spiral stone flight of stairs so it is not suitable for the very elderly, and for safety, children and adults need to be directed to hold onto the rope which runs all along the stone spiral staircase.
description.neighborhood:
Spedlins Castle is the perfect escape from the stresses of modern life.
Few can remain unmoved by the unspoilt beauty of this corner of Scotland. There is so much nature to watch in the gardens, there are bird tables everywhere, attracting robins, chaffinches and swallows, and even the occasional red squirrel. There are plenty of walks directly from the front door - including along the Annandale Way which is a 5 minute walk from the castle entrance. There's whisky tasting at the nearby Annandale Distillery, several golf courses nearby, a clay pigeon shoot on the doorstep, fishing on the River Annan, or you can simply snuggle up in front of a huge open fire in the Great Hall and enjoy the utter relaxation that being away from it all brings.
description.transit: There is plenty of space for car parking. The nearest station is Lockerbie (5 miles/ten minute drive). Glasgow airport is a 1 hour 10 minute drive. Edinburgh airport is a 1 hour 25 minute drive.
description.interaction: We are are available to answer any questions by phone, text or email 24 hours a day.
description.house_rules:
Please be aware this is a 15th century castle and there is a stone spiral staircase case that leads up to the upper floors. For safety we ask all our guests to make sure they take the stairs carefully and hold on to the rope bannister at all times.

There is a giant fire place in the Great Hall. Please be careful when using the fire and put the fire guard in front of it before going to bed.

Please note the heating is on a timer. If you would like a fire, we have fire wood available for you to use in the turret on your left as you look out of the castle entrance.

description.space:
Get ready to feel that instant sense of grandeur from this luxurious second floor apartment.. Second Floor: 
Steps to entrance.
Living room: With Freeview TV and DVD player.
Dining room.
Kitchen: With electric oven, electric hob, microwave, fridge/freezer and dishwasher.
Utility room: With washer/dryer.
Bedroom 1: With four poster kingsize bed and en-suite with roll-top bath, shower cubicle and toilet.
Bedroom 2: With twin beds and en-suite with roll-top bath, shower attachment and toilet.. Biomass central heating, electricity, bed linen, towels and Wi-Fi included. Travel cot, highchair and stairgate available on request. Welcome pack.. Fishing by arrangment with the owner. Private parking for 2 cars. No smoking. Please note: The property has a natural water supply from a spring. There is a unfenced lake in the grounds. This property has a security deposit of £300.. Within the stately Kinnaird Castle, these three luxuriously appointed apartments, offer the discerning guest an opportunity for gracious living and can be enjoyed in every season. Ideal for couples or groups who enjoy outdoor pursuits such as fly fishing, golf and walking, or indeed those just wanting a relaxing break. The three properties can be combined as they can be linked with one another and as such are perfect for a special occasion.
Lying between the Montrose Basin and Brechin, adjoining the River Southesk, Kinnaird Estate has been in the owners’ family since 1400 and covers some 7,000 acres of low lying land. There is a huge variety of wildlife to be seen, including red squirrels, woodpeckers, owls and ospreys, whilst the River Southesk is home to salmon and even freshwater pearls. Within the immediate grounds of the castle there are many paths laid out for guests, leading to follies and fine views on the way to the river and estate lake. Enjoy a barbecue or a game of tennis on the private court, or take a leisurely cycle on one of the many quiet roads which cross through the estate.
The owner can provide catering packs for the first evening and first morning on request, including a breakfast pack (£10) or a dinner pack (£15). The owner will leave coffees, teas, cereals, farmhouse bread, butter, marmalade and jams, together with fruit and yogurt in the kitchen, along with bacon and eggs. They can also leave a homemade supper (main course and pudding) for heating up in the apartment.
Macduff Tower is perfect for a couple or a family, this impressive apartment commands wide panoramic views over the park. Situated on the 2nd floor and incorporating some of the principal bedrooms, there is a real sense of grandeur with a 4-poster bed in the main bedroom and an elegant drawing room. Outside, there is a garden, with a barbecue and table and chairs, ideal for spending quality time outdoors. Beach 7 miles, shop, pub and restaurant 3 miles.
Macduff Tower (UK30766) can be booked with Lauderdale Apartment (UK30765) and Glen Apartment (UK43813) to accommodate up to 14 guests.
Free WiFi
