description.summary:
If your looking for something a little different then the stable wing of The Bridge House may be just for you! 

My unusual holiday home is part of the unique Bridge House built over the River Ardle in k1881. 

It has recently been renovated to a warm and cosy standard!

Charming original features including stone spiral stairs, traditional Scottish timber clad walls, brick and pine flooring.

All mod cons including wifi & smart TV.

Quiet, peaceful and rural location.

Pretty views.
description.space:
The adventure begins as you enter the front door with a winding stone spiral staircase on your left and kitchen on the right.

My large kitchen salon has original brick flooring with timber and stone walls.  The kitchen is fully fitted and has everything you need.  There is a cosy wood fired oven that is not only pretty but practical too.  I love breakfast here looking at the river and bridge, especially in the morning sun.  There is also a large comfortable sofa and smart TV.

The spiral staircase leads up to the bedrooms and bathroom. 

The master bedroom is large and bright with views of the river on one side and beautiful Strathardle on the other. King size double bed and smart TV. 

There is a small second bedroom with a cosy double bed (tight for two). There is freeview TV, ornamental fireplace and traditional gas lamp lighting!

I hope you'll sleep as well as I do with the peaceful sound of the river and comfortable beds...

The bathroom has a choice of shower or bath. 

If you're lucky with the weather you can enjoy the garden and river.

Pets welcome in the house but strictly not in bedrooms or sofa in any circumstances and in case dog hair found in bedroom or sofa a deep clean will be requested at a and  cost that will deducted from deposit.
description.access: Sauna on top of the bridge by arrangement and depending in availability.
description.notes:
This is the stable part of the Bridge House. 

I occasionally stay in a studio apartment located with a private entrance at the parking area. (Normally on changeover days.)

There is another 2 bedroom holiday cottage on top of the bridge. It is completely detached with its own entrance on the other side of the river.

There is a charge for accepting pets (not all pets accepted) when accepted £25 per pet per booking

items.comments: Mark and Eva are wonderful and very responsive. They let us checkin early as soon as the house was ready.  There are so many things to do. It’s like having our own private resort and no worries of disturbing the neighbors.  The kids enjoyed playing outdoors around the fire pit and in the hot tub. Our fisherman caught more fish here than at Ocean City.  The house was very clean and beautifully decorated throughout with the medieval theme.  Everyone agreed that this was one of the best family reunions.

We enjoyed our stay at Pocono Castle. Everything was exactly as stated on website.  House is clean and decorated in the most fun detail!  Great place for kids and adults!  Endless things to do and many things to do and places to visit within 30 minutes driving.  We highly recommend this house to all!

The only thing better than the castle was Mark and Eva. Cannot say enough about them. Wonderful people. Wonderful stay. We celebrated birthdays, graduations, new jobs and family. Memories were definitely made. Already looking forward to our next trip! WORTH EVERY PENNY!! BOOK IT!!
Best trip ever ❤️

The following will be a review of this place based on a bachelor party:
Everyone was shocked that they would be staying at a castle and was entranced by the scenery and interior of the place. Throughout the initial tour, we were laughing and enjoying the small and subtle details and small surprises that awaited us here. The game room offered a variety of games that we could use and enjoy. We were tailored to a variety of things we could do here both inside and out, which after several days we did accomplish to do all of them! The attention to detail was wonderful, with the fairy tale book of knowledge to the assortment of things we can do here. The serenity of the pond was probably the best part of the trip as we definitely made use of both the boats and fishing gear here... we hit double digits in fish caught! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would welcome a chance to come back here again for another bachelor party if the situation arises to the occasion. 
Thank you for everything!
Incredibly unique experience…

Look no further! 

The house and property was absolutely stunning. So much character and detail put into this home it was incredible, it was also very clean! The property was so beautiful and peaceful, it was perfect for a family getaway. There were so many things to do wish we could have stayed longer! 

Thank you for sharing your home with us and for being an excellent host. We hope to be back again!
What a great place, my kids and I had a great time!!

description.summary: No need to go to England to enjoy Castle life. We invite you to come and relax in this 2300 square-foot Castle home. It features four bedrooms, two full  baths in a lovely Pocono setting.Enjoy the wildlife while relaxing in the outdoor hot tub or rejuvenate in Cedar Sauna. Indoor and outdoor games for all ages. Everyone will enjoy role-playing King & Queen, when dressing up in the costumes we provide. There is a 1 acre private pond if you would like to try your hand at catching your Golden Fish!
description.space:
Want the best Poconos vacation? 

★Things to do in WINTER★ We are located between 4 ski resorts...

!!!SHAWNEE Mountain Ski/Snowtubing Area its not even 2 MILES away!!! CAMELBACK/CAMELBEACH Water Park & SKI/SNOWTUBING RESORT 17 miles 
BLUE MOUNTAIN SKI RESORT  33 miles & 
JACK  FROST SKI RESORT/JFBB about 33 miles

Camelback Ski Resort has open year round water park where you can play on many water slides or grab inner-tube and float around the lazy river. 

★Thing to do in SUMMER/FALL★

BEST hiking trails are couple minutes away from our "Castle" 

 We are 2 miles away from APPALACHIAN TRAIL/McDADE RECREATIONAL TRAIL
We have SMITHFIELD BEACH that is about 7 miles drive, plus much more access roads to Delaware river within minutes away... 
Also well known and local favorite is MILFORD BEACH which you can access from McDade trail that 25 miles away.

Please check out our GUIDEBOOK for much more fun activities, hikes and nice walks.

★BACKYARD★

BASKETBALL HOOP, BADMINTON, MINI GOLF COURSE, 1 ACRE POND, LARGE CHESS GAME, HOT TUB & CEDAR SAUNA everything at your own backyard :) Fish off in our 1 acre private pond without any worry getting your fishing license. Whether you are here for hiking trails, shopping, casinos or just a family getaway, this place is for you! 

★HOUSE★

Our 2300 square foot newly renovated castle has 4 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and each bedroom is furnished with queen size bed, we provide fresh clean linens, please dont worry about bringing your own unless you really want to or feel like to. 3 of 4 bedrooms has their own smart TV's, they come with free smart TV channels and access to Netflix (there is no cable).

The kitchen also includes 30" TV is fully equipped and hopefully has all the items you need while your stay... pots, pans, plates, flatware, utensils, cups, mugs, wine, shot glasses...whistling kettle, Keurig coffee maker, french coffee press, microwave, cooking items, toaster, blender, waffler maker and spectacular panoramic views of the pond while you eat your meal! We do provide few spice jars, tea, coffee, sugar and coffee creamer.

Game room is on lower level and includes 3 couches, casino bar table which you can convert into black jack table with the dealer and 6 players, craps and french roulette plus pool table, air hockey table, foosball table and karaoke, 4-5 board games, chess table, play cards, guitar and indoor darts...for adults and little ones. Game room also includes a washer and dryer with some basic detergent, which of course you all have access to.

  


***********

description.interaction:
There is ample parking for up to five or six cars (garage is not available for parking) No parking inside the garage and there is no access to the garage. Snow plowing service is set for any flakes that fall. The house is key-code secured so there's no keys to mess with, and features two Nest thermostats so you don't have to worry about leaving the heat at a certain level when you depart because we can do it from our phones. 

Please no pets! No exceptions! 

Always wear a life jacket once you get on boat. Life jackets save lives! No lifeguard is on duty! 

THIS IS WATERFRONT PROPERTY. Children must be accompanied by an adult at all times! 

Please be respectful of our neighbors and community especially between the hours 10pm to 9am.

NO LIABILITY/INDEMNIFICATION/HOLD HARMLESS: 

The owners of the property do not assume liability for the loss, theft, damage or injury (or death) to persons or their personal property.   Guests agree to indemnify and hold the owners harmless for any liabilities, theft, damage, cost or expense whatsoever arising from or related to any claim or litigation which may arise out of or in connection with Guests’ use and occupancy of the rental property, including but not limited to claims for personal injury or property damage/loss.

This shall include, but is not limited to: boating, kayaking, swimming, using sauna,hot tub, playing games walking on the property, using stairs inside or outside the house, approaching or viewing wildlife, etc.

By booking this property Primary Guest and/or anyone you invite to use the Vacation Rental as your guest acknowledges and agrees to comply with this agreement 

HOT TUB RULES:

By booking this place you HEREBY acknowledge that upon entering the hot tub area, I will continuously thereafter, thoroughly inspect such area. My continued presence constitutes an acknowledgment that I have inspected this area and find and accept such areas as being safe and reasonably suited for the purposes of the Activity. I further agree and warrant that if, at any time, I feel or think anything to be unsafe, I and all guests will immediately leave the area and advise Aysha and Ren.
You are voluntarily participating in the Activity and I am participating entirely at my own risk. I am aware of the associated HOT TUB RISKS which may include but are not limited to drowning, heat exhaustion, heat stroke, skin/ear/bladder/lung or other infections, chemical burns or irritations, physical/psychological injury, pain, suffering, illness, disfigurement, disability, economic or emotional loss, paralysis or death.  I understand that these injuries or outcomes may arise from my own or others’ negligence, including that of Eva and Maros, or from the conditions at the Activity location.  Nonetheless, I assume all related risks, both known and unknown to me, of my participation in this activity. Some of the known risks and precautions are noted below and I have read and understand these:                                                     
	•	Pregnant women, children and those with heart disease ARE NOT ALLOWED IN THIS HOT TUB.
	•	If you are taking medication of any kind, or being treated for diabetes, low or high blood pressure, strokes, epilepsy, weakened immune system or other conditions, or are a frail elderly person, consult your physician prior to use of the hot tub. 
	•	It is advised to limit your soak in the hot tub to no more than 15 minutes at a time. If you overheat and faint, you can drown. 
	•	Shower when you get out to rinse off the hot tub chemicals.                     
	•	Keep your head, arms and upper chest out of the water to avoid overheating. Get out if you feel dizzy, overheated, nauseous, or unwell.
	•	Stay hydrated before getting into the hot tub.                                              
	•	Check the chemical strip yourself before getting in to be sure the pH and chlorine levels are at the recommended levels. If not, or if the water looks murky or slimy, don’t get in. Alert us. 
	•	Check the temperature. Do not get in if over 104˚. 
	•	DO NOT DRINK ALCOHOL or USE DRUGS before or during hot tub use. 
	•	Please KEEP the hot tub CLEAN and CLEAR: Shower before you get in to get off most particles, oils, cosmetics and hair and skin products. No shoes, street clothes, pets or glass containers in or around the hot tub. Do not eat, or drink, or use soap and shampoo while INSIDE the hot tub. Do not urinate or spit into tub. And please, no “adult activity” while inside the hot tub. 
	•	Don’t get in tub if you have open sores or wounds, or cuts, or diarrhea. 
	•	Close the lid when you are finished. 
	•	Do Not sit, lay or stand on the hot tub cover – it will collapse into the hot tub. 
	•	Be careful when getting out so you don’t slip and fall.

hosts.about: I'm an Irish doctor interested in discovering new places, cultures and cuisines. I've been lucky enough to work and travel through inspiring parts of Europe, East Africa and the United States. Now I'm looking forward to sharing the beauty and history of my native Kilkenny by hosting at my family's medieval Irish tower house.

recent.comments: The castle is so beautifully restored and brings you back to the 15th century but with modern amenities. The kitchen has really tall ceilings that makes it feel really large. The steps will give you a good work out with beautiful views at the top.

items.comments: The castle is so beautifully restored and brings you back to the 15th century but with modern amenities. The kitchen has really tall ceilings that makes it feel really large. The steps will give you a good work out with beautiful views at the top.
Great castle for your private group. Glad we came.

This castle is incredible!  The exterior is spectacular as you drive up the entrance. The ambiance is just what we had hoped for. We felt very comfortable with the high-end modern amenities, yet we also felt as though we were living in history at the same time. The views are breathtaking. Imagine a professional photography book with beautiful rolling  Irish countryside images. THAT is what you see from the property. We spent quite a bit of time sitting outside gazing at the gorgeous landscape. Star gazing at midnight was better than anywhere we have seen. The host, John, was extremely responsive to all of my inquiries. He was very helpful and friendly. We highly recommend staying at this amazing castle!

Perfectly described. Authentic tower house/castle. Don't expect a five-star hotel, as this is a real castle. Beautiful views. Off the main road, a few km with lots of cows to see and hear! Beautifully restored with new amenities like updated appliances and internet.
Amazing location. All amenities and accruements needed were in place. I would highly recommend this locale.

WOW!! What an amazing stay! This was truly a once in a lifetime experience that we’ll remember forever!!!
The castle is beautifully restored…everything was luxurious and pristine. We feel so blessed to have been able to stay here!!
A nice blend of modern comfort and history. We enjoyed the personal touches. Beautiful place!

description.summary: Tubbrid Castle is a unique 15th-century tower house, uninhabited for the last century and now restored to its former glory. We've highlighted original features to let you step back in time and added luxury touches so you can indulge your inner prince or princess.
description.space:
Heritage
In 942 AD, Muircheartach, King of modern-day Ulster, marched his army of 1000 Leather Cloaks south to avenge his allies, who had been attacked by Callaghan, King of Cashel. Muircheartach’s bard, Colmanach, recorded the journey in an epic poem, Circuit of Ireland, in which he praised the beauty of Osraí (now Kilkenny), and the hospitality of its people. At the edge of enemy territory and on the cusp of battle, Muircheartach’s army set up camp in Tubbrid, on a plain that a millennium later is still called Bán an Champa (the Field of the Encampment). The King himself is thought to have slept at the fort where Tubbrid Castle now stands. A thousand years later, the people of Kilkenny still pride ourselves on our warm hospitality and from the top floor bedroom of Tubbrid Castle you can survey Bán an Champa and enjoy lodgings befitting a king.


Luxury 
Staying in our authentic Irish tower house doesn’t mean foregoing the finer things in life. Start your day under a powerful rainforest shower or in a deep, bubbly bath. Sip your morning coffee while taking in vistas of forest and field from bespoke velvet cushions in the large original window seats. In the evening you can dine at the grand oak banqueting table before curling up with a book or a board game in front of a roaring log fire. However you choose to spend your day, you can look forward to coming home to spend the night under a goose down duvet in a superking four-poster bed.


Location
Situated just 20 minutes from Kilkenny City and deep in the heart of Ireland's Ancient East, it’s the perfect location from which to explore the most beautiful parts of our vibrant country. Picturesque rural Kilkenny is home to hiking trails of all levels. In Kilkenny City, just a twenty-minute drive away, you can while away a leisurely day exploring its secret cobblestone laneways, impressive cathedrals and magnificent castle, before treating yourself to a pint of the local brew, Smithwicks, or to Michelin-starred cuisine. In an afternoon you can cycle along the banks of the Nore as it meanders through South Kilkenny, to quaint and scenic villages like Inistioge, or visit the workshops of Ireland's foremost craftspeople. If you want to visit a wide array of Ireland’s attractions without the hassle of packing and unpacking your suitcase every second night, Tubbrid Castle is the ideal base. Whichever direction you face, the rich diversity of Irish history and nature is on your doorstep. Dublin is just a ninety-minute drive away. You can take in the Rock of Cashel (30 mins), Kinsale and Cork City (90 mins) in one day, Limerick (90 mins), the Burren and the Cliffs of Moher (2h15) another, and Galway (2h15) and Connemara another.
description.access:
We only take one booking at a time, so you will have the castle to yourselves.

Each bedroom is named for a different important character in the castle's history.

Seomra Sheáin, on the ground floor, is named for my late father, John, who began the restoration work in 2004.

Rí Ailig, on the second floor, is named after Muirchertach, King of Ulster, whose army camped in Tubbrid in 942 AD on their Circuit of Ireland.

Leapa Mhaighread is named for Margaret Butler, 8th Countess of Ormonde. She is said to have erected the tower house and legend holds that she slept at its highest point when she was in residence, to keep her safe from invading enemies. As this bedroom is on a closed timber mezzanine above Rí Ailig, the two rooms are not acoustically private from each other.
description.notes: Tubbrid Castle is a living, 600-year-old piece of Irish heritage, but it is not a five-star hotel. Central heating was recently turned on in the tower house for the first time in its long life. Over coming years, as the walls cure, they are expected to undergo changes in moisture, which will create alterations in colour and a little dust and condensation.
description.neighborhood: The castle shares an entrance laneway with another house, which is not shown in the photos, to protect our neighbours' privacy.
description.transit: The nearest train station is Kilkenny City and it is possible to get a taxi from there to Tubbrid Castle.
description.interaction: A member of my family or I will be contactable should you need anything during your stay.
description.house_rules: The castle is unsuitable for parties, including hen and stag parties.

hosts.about: Hello! My name is Tanner. Me and my wife Nicole are Superhosts from Salt Lake City Utah. We love to travel and spend time in the outdoors. We have had many amazing experiences with Airbnb and hope to create some of those for the guests who stay with us.

Hello and welcome! I am excited to be apart of this community and to be able to make people feel right at home. My husband Tanner and I love to see the world- some of our favorite places being Nicaragua, Switzerland and Croatia. We both grew up in Utah and absolutely love it here for the beautiful mountains, deserts and people.  I have worked in hospitality for 10+ years and absolutely love what I do.  We look forward to making wonderful new friendships around the globe. :)

recent.comments: Excellent stay in a beautiful place! Highly recommend.

items.comments: Excellent stay in a beautiful place! Highly recommend.

I moved into the Chalet apartment when the rest of my family arrived and stayed for 4 nights (after staying in the other smaller unit earlier).  I loved both apartments!  They both have the same ambiance and character of a European winery - lovely and spacious! Great central location to the mountains, SLC and Provo while being very private.

Tanner and Nicole were such accommodating hosts!  I appreciated the way they helped me move from one unit to the other.  We all appreciated the time Tanner took to give us a tour around the grounds and buildings that are used for weddings and events. So much family history and we enjoyed hearing of all the reclaimed wood, ironwork, etc that were used!

The rooms were all decorated simply and elegantly. The dining room was sunny, cheerful and bright with a balcony overlooking the orchard. The kitchen had everything needed. The pictures online are exactly what you see in person.   

Loved my home away from home!
What a beautiful experience. We just adored the chance to be at Wadley Farms.!
We had a wonderful time at the farm, it was peaceful and serene, the accommodation was great and we thoroughly enjoyed our time. We are certainly planning to come back!

The property is even more beautiful than pictured. Apartment is very spacious, perfect for our family of five. Kitchen has a great flow and equipped well. We enjoyed dining in the generous sized dinning room with a beautiful farm and Mountain View, with sunset. Nicole and Tanner gave us some great local recommendations. We had the pleasure meeting the owner and his sister who told us the history of the farm and gave us a tour of the castle and the grounds. We would love to return in a season other than winter to appreciate the orchards and gardens. This place is wonderful and there is not enough words to describe. Most of all, as a family, we made great memories spending time together in this fabulous place. Thanks!!

Magical! 
Teleports you to a whole different country! Breathtaking views. Beautiful architect. Heartwarming history! Family run! It was a true wow factor at every corner. Easy check in. Secluded from the public but not from nature ! Nature is all around you. And the windows and balcony’s allowed you to really immerse in the views! Mountain View’s and sunsets. And the babydoll sheep’s were adorable. The orchards, even covered in snow were picture perfect. Everything was a short drive away! I celebrated my one year anniversary and was happy to hear many weddings happen at Wadley farm. Alan Wadley gave us a personal tour of the grounds and told us about the history and future of the Farm! Thoroughly enjoyed his excitement. Highly recommend this is a hidden gem! By far one of my favorite air bnb! Will be returning in fall<3
Me encanto el lugar, el paisaje es lindo y la casa muy acogedora, un lugar excelente para compartir en familia

description.summary: Château apartment on the beautiful grounds of Wadley Farms. With spectacular views of our fruit orchards, gardens, vineyard, Mount Timpanogos and Castle, there really is no other place like it. Whether you are attending an event on-site, or are here for work or vacation, this is the place for you. Located at the base of the Wasatch mountains there is a lifetime of outdoor recreation only minutes away.
description.space:
3 bedroom, 2 bath and fully equipped kitchen. We offer a king bed, two queens, a full and a small twin pull out couch. 

 Located in our fruit orchards with spectacular views of  the vineyard, gardens  castle and red barn from 2 private balconies.  Located on second floor up one fight of stairs. Mostly quiet during the day. Events take place most evenings between the hours of 6-9pm (hours may vary). Parking is private and reserved during an event. Access to the grounds is closed each night by a large gate. You are welcome to come and go during these closed hours, however will need to  simply un-latch the chain, open the gate, and close the gate behind you. 

Includes fully equipped kitchen for on site meal preparation - dishes, pots, pans, mixing bowls, utensils, cookware, bakeware, etc. washer and dryer included. Large closets with extra bedding.  Strong Wifi with desk and workspace area. TV with streaming services. Pack n' play offered by request.

Guests will have access to the apartment only.  Feel free to admire the grounds, but because this is a full-time wedding and corporate event center, we ask that you only use the space provided.  You are welcome to walk around when no events are taking place.  Feel free to walk around the fruit orchards and barn area to see our baby doll sheep at any time.   Thank you in advance!
description.notes:
This is a brand new building so the outside grounds of the building are still under construction.  You may hear a little noise during the day. The landscaping of the property is not yet complete.  You will still be able to enjoy the beautiful grounds of Wadley Farms and the Orchards right outside the door.

PLEASE READ BEFORE BOOKING!
If you are booking for your wedding or attending an event on-site PLEASE
DO NOT BOOK our apartment if you plan on having any before or after parties.  We are located in a residential area and have strict rules on noise after 11pm.

***We do not allow guests who use the apartment to use the grounds for any private events/weddings or ceremonies.  If you are interested in using the grounds, you will need to reach out directly to Wadley Farms to book the event space/gardens. ***
description.neighborhood: Only 5 minutes from hiking, biking and running trails near Battle Creek Canyon. 10 minutes to scenic Provo Canyon and American Fork Canyon and just minutes from I-15, Sundance Mountain Resort, BYU and UVU. Only 15 minutes to Provo, 45 minutes from historic Park City and 40 minutes from downtown Salt Lake City and Salt Lake City International Airport.
description.transit: We have a large gate at the entrance of our property that will be self locked with a large chain between the hours of 10pm-7am.  If we have no scheduled events, you may notice the gate being closed early. We keep the gate closed all day on Sundays.  We ask that if you must enter or leave during these closed hours, that you close and latch the gate behind you.  This offers you privacy and safety in the evening and early morning to enjoy.
description.house_rules:
As a host, we aim to make your stay as comfortable as it can possibly be! Our mission is to help our guests have an authentic, memorable experience in our cozy Chateau apartment here at Wadley Farms. For us to do so, we would truly appreciate it if you can follow these house rules. If for any reason the House Rules cannot be followed, you will have the option of cancelling the booking penalty free within 48 hours of booking as we have a Strict Cancellation policy. Thank you in advance and we truly appreciate your cooperation!

- Keep noise to a minimum after 10pm.
-No extra guests may stay overnight unless pre- approved by the host. 
-Because this is a full-time reception and event center, we ask that you DO NOT use the outside grounds or gardens. Please feel free to walk around and admire the venue during business hours, when there are no events taking place.  
- No smoking or vaping inside or outside of the apartment. Extra cleaning fees to remove odor and stains may be applied. 
-Please no shoes in the apartment 
-If anything in the house is lost or broken, the guest may be charged for those items
- Please do not rearrange our furniture.
- No large gatherings or events for groups on property without pre-approval from the hosts.
 - If guests are found to have had a party without host permission which results in extra cleaning, guests will be responsible for extra cleaning charges and in the unfortunate event of the disruptions alerting neighbors, GUESTS WILL BE ASKED TO VACATE THE PROPERTY IMMEDIATELY.
- If guests are suspected of carrying and/or using illegal drugs of any kind, the authorities will be engaged, and GUESTS WILL BE ASKED TO VACATE THE PROPERTY IMMEDIATELY.
-Return all keys or additional fees may be applied.
- Please be respectful of the property and our things. 

By booking with us you agree to follow these rules.  Thank you! We are looking forward to you staying with us.

hosts.about:
My name is Brandon Bonfiglio! 
I live in NY and invest in out of state properties like the ones you see on my profile! I purchased my first rental when I was 19 and have been in the rental industry for 5 years now! I have a ton of experience when it comes to traveling as I am in a different location every week! If you need a place to stay and an awesome itinerary full of adventure… well you found your guy!
The reviews don’t lie!

recent.comments: Brandon’s castle is absolutely incredible! The pictures don’t do it justice. All the little details really set this place apart from the many other places I’ve stayed. Brandon was also great at communicating instructions and expectations, was always quick to respond and very friendly. The road to get to the castle was a little intimidating but it was well worth the drive and once you drive it a few times you get the hang of it. I will definitely rent this place again the next time I’m in the area. Overall, I can’t say enough good stuff about this place!

items.comments: Brandon’s castle is absolutely incredible! The pictures don’t do it justice. All the little details really set this place apart from the many other places I’ve stayed. Brandon was also great at communicating instructions and expectations, was always quick to respond and very friendly. The road to get to the castle was a little intimidating but it was well worth the drive and once you drive it a few times you get the hang of it. I will definitely rent this place again the next time I’m in the area. Overall, I can’t say enough good stuff about this place!

We rented this AirBnB for our Wedding Anniversary weekend. I must say, pulling up to the property was breathtaking. The Host went above and beyond to have this place ready for us when we arrived in the night. The turrets were lit up and it seemed as if we really were walking into a Castle. The interior of the residence, gave us the log cabin, midevil experience. Decor was superb. The location of the property was spectactular as we have stayed in this area several times over the years. No harsh Mountain Roads to drive up and down. Which was a major plus in the safety category for us!!! The enviroment around the AirBnB was peaceful and calming. No noise from neighbors or traffic. Which allowed us to spend the perfect weekend to celebrate our Anniversary. The Residence itself was super clean, plenty of towels, linens and toiletries. The beds were cozy and comfortable. The host had plenty of cooking supplies, utensils and anything else we needed to make our stay, One to Remember.
Truly Impressive location that was able to easily accommodate our large group in style. The castle is BEAUTIFUL and  Larger than what the photos show. We Loved our time here! :)
Brandon was an amazing host, and very responsive with any and all questions we had about the place. The castle was exactly what we were looking for and took the trip to the next level!
Great host! Everything was as described and pictured and communication was great. Beautiful property with plenty of space and amenities. Our family had a wonderful stay!

We had a great time at the castle! We’re a dungeons and dragons group, so needless to say we LOVED the details put into this space — swords, shields, and beautiful stone spiral staircases. It felt like our own magical fortress. The area is pretty remote so the wifi wasn’t always reliable, but Brandon gave us a heads up beforehand and people were able to hotspot with their phones to get work done. We appreciated the list of nearby attractions (split rail is a hidden GEM), and had some wonderful dinners on the gorgeous porch. Thank you Brandon!

It was a beautiful place with lots of space in an area with lots to do. There were recommendations of places to go in the kitchen and outdoor section out back had an amazing view. Everything about the trip was amazing and the castle was a perfect place to stay if you have kids and want to go to the smokies.

description.summary: Let your imagination run wild at ‘Braxdon’s Castle,’ a regal 3-bed, 3.5-bath vacation rental set in the majestic Smoky Mountains. A breathtaking view of Mt. Le Conte paints the backdrop of this kingdom, set on .65 acres. Soak in the vistas from the hot tub or venture down to Gatlinburg to get a closer look inside the National Park. Also nearby are the abundant attractions of Pigeon Forge. After a full day of adventures, this sprawling castle calls you home for a game of pool, darts or Pac-Man!
description.space:
ENTIRE PRIVATE CASTLE On ⅔-Acre Lot | Private Hot Tub | 3,130 Sq Ft | Family Friendly

Suitable for both the young and the young at heart, this sweet Seviervelle spot feels like a dream! From the sprawling great room marked by a towering river rock fireplace to the beautiful brick archways that highlight each bedroom - ‘Braxdon’s Castle’ treats your crew to a truly unique retreat.
description.access: ENTIRE CASTLE || Bedroom 1: King Bed, Futon | Bedroom 2: King Bed, Futon | Bedroom 3: Queen Bunk Bed, Full Bunk Bed, Sleeper Sofa | Living Room: Sleeper Sofa| Additional Sleeping: 2 Rollaway Beds
description.notes:
OUTDOOR LIVING: Covered deck, outdoor furniture, gas grill, hot tub, mountain views
INDOOR LIVING: Open living area, lofted game room, Multicade machine, dart board, pool table, foosball table, gas fireplace, 4 flat-screen satellite TVs, surround sound system
EAT-IN KITCHEN: Fully equipped, drip coffee maker, microwave, dining table
BEDROOMS: Flat-screen satellite TVs, full en-suite bathrooms w/ jetted tubs and rain head showers
GENERAL: Free WiFi, washer/dryer, linens/towels, complimentary toiletries, Pack ‘n Play
PARKING: Driveway (10 vehicles)
description.house_rules:
-ANY PARTIES OR EVENTS MUST BE DISCLOSED AND DISCUSSED PRIOR TO BOOKING
-Must be 24+ years old to book
                              - No more guests then 16 unless communicated with host prior
-No smoking in the cabin. You may smoke on the porch. (butts are to be properly disposed of and not thrown in the yard.  Trash in the yard will incur an excess cleaning fee at services hourly rate.) 	•	Pets are not allowed.   	•	Beds may be left unmade •	Make sure all door opening outside are locked. 5 excluding main) •	You will be assigned an access number for the keypad upon completion of your reservation.  To enter, press those numbers and unlock door.  When you exit, press lock (inside) button and pull door to close. (Ensure that door is locked by trying to reopen it without inputting your code) 	•	No house parties or illegal substances are permitted on the premises and are grounds for immediate eviction from the property with NO REFUND being due to the tenant. 	•	Cabin was checked for damage prior to your arrival and will be checked again after your departure. 	•	NO loud music or parties will be tolerated.   	•	Tenant/Tenants and their guest agree to release owners of the property from all liabilities incurred by loss or damage to any person/persons or their property on or about the property including personal injury through no direct fault of the owners of the said property, weather it be caused by any form of omission, neglect or default by the owner/owners and agent acting on behalf of the said party. 	•	No RV campers or tents are allowed on the premises. 	•	The cabin has a maximum occupancy of  8 people.  No more people shall be allowed to occupy the premises without the express written consent of the owners of the property. Failure to comply with the provision may result in eviction from the property with no refund of any amount including the tenant’s security deposit being due to the tenant/Tenants. 	•	The tenant may not sublet or otherwise substitute occupancy of the cabin.  Rental is strictly to the tenant and his/her party. Anyone found in violation of this policy is subject eviction from the property with no refund of any amount including the tenant’s security deposit being due to the tenant/Tenants. It is regrettable that we have to spell all of this out but we have to do so to protect ourselves in this heavily litigious society in which we live.  It is our wish that you have the time of your lives in our home and that you return again and again to enjoy its peacefulness and beauty. We supply games and activities for our guest enjoyment however; some games have small pieces or parts that are not suitable for children of all ages particularly young children , toddlers, and infants who may put things in their mouths. It is your responsibility to supervise your children around the games and around the property. I have read and understood the conditions of use and assume all responsibility and liability for its correct use.  I in no way hold the owner/owners of this property liable for any occurrence during our stay.

Fantastic stay at Cats Castle. It has everything you need and it’s in a great location. The gardens are beautiful too with amazing views. The hosts are extremely helpful and ensured we had the best stay. Would come back again!
Lovely stay in historic house. Beautiful grounds and scenery.

Very happy to have stayed at Cat’s Castle. The space inside is quite expansive with many rooms to spread out in and enjoy. 

Our group of 9 had an absolutely outstanding stay and would love to come back here again soon. 

For being 130 years old you might expect the space to have issues but everything was in wonderful condition, and we thoroughly enjoyed our time here.
Excellent séjour dans ce château ! Très agréable, propre et spacieux ! Nous conseillons ce lieux pour un séjour en famille

Great place for a big families holiday.
The views are spectacular!
Plenty of cutlery and crockery , which made a nice change.

Brilliant place. Very spectacular amenities. Paul & Gemma had thought through everything eg: Kitchen had basic food and condiments, chair for a toddler etc 
TV was easy to operate.
Perfect amalgamation of Traditional Castle with Modern amenities!!

Only hitch was: We requested 2 hours delay in checkout because of a little child with us but they did not budge. Left a sour taste in the end but I won't take away anything from the place overall.

description.summary:
Built in 1888, Cats Castle sits in two acres on the seaward side of the A814, just beyond the western edge of Dumbarton. The property has wonderful views down the Firth of Clyde. 

Cats Castle is close to Glasgow, Helensburgh, Loch Lomond and the Trossachs.

The castle comprises three reception rooms, all with working fireplaces, a family kitchen, pantry, and five bedrooms, including the turret bedroom on the top floor. 

Suitable for family holidays or special occasions.
description.notes: For smaller parties, we also offer the Cats Whiskers cottage at Cats Castle. This has two bedroom and three beds. This can be booked separately on Airbnb.
description.neighborhood:
Cats Castle sits in grounds of about two acres on the seaward side of the A814, just beyond the western edge of Dumbarton. It
is close to the conservation village of Cardross and about 6 miles from Helensburgh, one of western Scotland’s most desirable
towns. Cardross is a quiet village with a respected primary school, tennis club, bowling club and one of the finest golf courses in west
central Scotland. There is also a village store, post office and country pub.
Helensburgh is a larger town offering more extensive services. The birthplace of John Logie Baird, the inventor of television, the
town now offers an excellent range of local and specialist shops and supermarkets including Waitrose. On the Firth of Clyde, nearby Rhu Marina (8 miles) is one of Scotland’s most popular marinas with excellent facilities and easy access to some of the worlds most testing sailing waters. Loch Lomond is within 7 miles and offers spectacular scenery, pleasant walks, water sports and Loch Lomond Golf Club. Nearby Cameron House Hotel and Spa provides private leisure facilities including
a swimming pool, gymnasium and marina.
description.transit:
The castle offers good access to Glasgow, with the A814, A82 and the M8.
Glasgow Airport is within 20 miles. To the north, the A811 leads to Stirling to join the M9 south to Edinburgh and the A9 north to Perth.The castle is also only a 5 minute drive from the train station at Dalreoch. From Dalreoch, you can catch direct trains to Glasgow (around 30 minutes) and Edinburgh (around 90 minutes). There is also a host of local taxi services.

recent.comments: Amazing unique experience!  I have already told all my friends about our stay.

items.comments: Amazing unique experience!  I have already told all my friends about our stay.

We absolutely loved our stay at Smithstown Castle!  To experience a 15th century castle at the start of our Ireland vacation was incredible. With 4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms and a fully stocked kitchen it was perfect for a large family or multiple couples. Close to attractions such as Cliffs of Moher, Galway, Shannon, The Burren and Doolin (for ferry to Aran Islands).  Need to be extra careful on the stone spiral stairs and the long climb to top bedroom and bathroom. But if you take it slow you will be fine!  I can’t recommend the castle enough to anyone visiting this part of Ireland.

This castle is incredible! The spiral stone staircase was a favorite feature of ours and makes you feel as though you are living in history. The ambiance is just what we had hoped for. We felt comfortable with the modern amenities, yet also felt like we were back in time. The giant fireplace in the Great room was extraordinary. The exterior is spectacular as you drive up the entrance. Rebekka was very helpful, responsive, and generous. We highly recommend staying at this amazing castle!

The opportunity to stay in your own 15th century Irish castle cannot be missed. On our two week trip across Ireland, we stayed at beautiful hotels and castle resorts, but the two nights in this authentic castle will be the lasting memory. A perfect mix of authenticity with modern amenities. Our kids will never forget this once in a lifetime experience! While here, reach out to Ollie's Tours to experience Doolin and the Aran Islands! Your own castle with a day trip to bike the islands is a perfect combo!

It’s not too often you get to say that you  stayed in a castle! Truthfully, it was an absolute blast. The Irish countryside is so beautiful in its own way and to be able to stay in such a fun place made the trip that much better. I will highly recommend that you ensure anyone in your party can climb sketchy stairs. Worst part was lugging the luggage up to the rooms, my favorite part was finding 4 leaf clovers right outside the door! Since it is in the countryside and inside a block wall the cell/internet service doesn’t work great, but that made for a nice getaway as well. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone interested. Come on, it’s a castle and you get to be king and/or queen for as long as your stay! Make sure to have a fire and enjoy!
Stay at the castle!  Book it early!  This is quite an experience. There are 58 stairs to the top bedroom.

what a spectacular find. The  building was so wonderful and it was so truly amazing to stay in a castle. the modern amenities available made it extremely livable. The host was friendly and though we never actually met with the groundskeeper, they were still very responsive by email. Everything went perfectly. The castle was as clean as it could possibly be for such an historic building. Our family had such a great time and the kids loved it. It was well worth the 3 nights stay!

description.summary:
Located only 10 minutes from the West coast of Ireland in the beautiful County Clare, Smithstown Castle is the perfect place to start your Irish adventure. Experience a true 15th Century Irish Castle, authentic in style yet with all the comfort of the 21st Century.
Set rurally on almost 5 acres of mature grounds overlooking a river valley, the Castle offers tranquility and privacy - and yet Clare is at your doorstep, with all its bountiful attractions, epic landscapes and stunning history.
description.space:
The Castle is an original 15th Century building. This means it has the following features which must be taken into consideration before booking:

- thick walls (up to a meter thick), so reception is limited to a few corners!
- the spiral staircase means the Castle is unfortunately unsuitable for wheelchair users. Please be extremely careful using the stairs! Avoid drinking too much alcohol for your own safety, always supervise infants/children, and always hold on to the handrails/rope. Especially if the stones get wet, they can become slippy and very dangerous!
- Due to the nature of the stone walls, if the weather is very wet and rainy over a prolonged period, it can occur that water pushes through the walls and emerges from some alcoves/window-niches in small amounts. This shouldn't affect your stay, but it is something we'd like you to be aware of so there are no strange surprises. 
- Please bring your slippers! :)
description.access:
Sufficient space for parking in the direct proximity of the Castle. 

Our caretakers will be there to welcome you in, show you around, and hand over the keys. They can also give you some great tips on nearby shopping facilities, live music and dance, where to eat and drink and all sorts of things to do, see and experience in the area.You can also contact them if you have any questions or problems during your stay.
description.notes:
We also offer 1-night stays, the booking procedure can only proceed with us privately, however (not over the AirBnB platform due to certain restrictions). Please get in touch with us via email (email-address can be found on our website) for a quote and more infos. 

If you want to dive a little deeper into Smithstown Castle's fascinating history, or discover what's to do and see in the area, please visit our website: smithstowncastle(dot)com. 

Some of the most important attractions nearby include:

The famous Cliffs of Moher (15min drive): Rising 509 feet (155m) and extending over 9 miles (15km) along the West Atlantic coast. The breathtaking scenery here was even featured in the movie 'Harry Potter'. 
Our caretaker offers discounted hiking tours at the cliffs!

Doolin (10min drive): this coastal town is the mecca for Irish music and dance, pubs and celtic craft. At Doolin's pier you will find ferries heading to the Aran Islands. 

Aran Islands: Horse-drawn carriages, minibus tours and bicycles for hire await you at the bustling pier of Inish Mor, the largest of the 3 Islands. The nearby Heritage Centre will tell of a rugged traditional way of life that is fast disappearing. 

Kilfenora (5min drive): The smallest diocesan of Ireland with it's ancient cathedral and famous high-crosses. Learn about the stunning Burren in the 'Burren Exhibition Centre'. Visit Vaughan's for food, drink and regular live Irish music and dance!

The Burren: This limestone plateau is a spectacular landscape carved by glaciers, wind and rain. Home to pre-historic dolmens, ringforts, early christian churches, an underground network of caves and many other ancient monuments; there are countless things to do and see here! 

And if this isn't enough, you can also go hiking, fishing and deep-sea angling, cruising along the Atlantic Highway, cave-exploring, diving, surfing, pony trekking, climbing, cycling, golfing, treat yourself to a wellness spa, and so much more!

recent.comments:
Caraigin Castle is really something special.  The location is unbelievable and the grounds are immaculate. We stayed 3 nights and very much wish we had more time there. We paid the extra for use of the boat and that was well worth the minor extra cost. We spent evening in the bay on the boat fishing and just enjoying the view of the castle, the wildlife, and beautiful LATE evening sunsets after dinner.  

The castle itself is fantastic. It could use some bathroom updates, but honesty the rest of it is so unbelievable, even with that it's well worth the price - even under=priced honestly! The story of the refurbishment is well worth the read to understand the history of the area, and what the owners took on in rebuilding and restoring this gem.  We stayed there with only 4 people, but it can easily sleep a large family or two.  

We hope to go back in the future, with our kids and friends. It was EXCELLENT and a BARGAIN for what you get!

This is such a special place and a unique experience. The grounds and the castle are spectacular. We were greeted upon arrival, and given the full tour/instructions. We had a group of six and there was plenty of room for a larger group. We would definitely stay again. As an aside, there are lots of stairs, for those with mobility issues.

The castle was fantastic for our family trip. There were plenty of beds and it was very comfortable. Geraldine was such a great host and we hired Tina, the local caterer, to prepare the dinners. Definitely book the catering if you can!

Had an absolutely wonderful stay in the castle. The only single small negative about the place is that checkin is quite late in the day and checkout quite early, but other than that it was all brilliant. The surroundings were amazing, our kids will have treasured memories forever. Contact with the hosts and the checkin process was seamless and very clear, they were so helpful for us. The castle was so much fun for us and our kids. Can't recommend this Castle enough.
A great place for a family get together in beautiful surroundings.

Very good bedroom accomodation for 4 couples. Very nice to meet Christopher (the builder) and Anne Marie (the host) when we arrived, for some extra notes and history.
We made use of Tina's expertise for arrival meals and enough food for several days. House was very clean and well maintained, quirky but good interior. We also made use of the boat just down on the loch, and Dave was really helpful.

Our stay at the castle was remarkable. Situated on a gentle slope leading down to the waters of Lough Corrib, Carraigan Castle sparks the imagination and evokes the mystical feelings of days gone by, of Christmas, of magic, of gold at the end of a rainbow. It impressed the most stoic of our group. Young and old, we all felt the specialness of this amazing home and grounds.
We rented the boat- so much fun! It’s a small outboard so it’s not for the faint of heart but going out on this beautiful lake was a life changing experience.
We highly recommend having beautiful Tina make you a feast for dinner- seemed to be a little expensive at first but was worth every penny and we had wholesome food that lasted are entire stay, 3 nights. 
We had tea at Ashford Castle while we were there, reservations needed and expensive but worth it, another remarkable place just 20 minutes from Carraigan. I highly recommend a visit there during your stay or at least to the little town of Cong that it’s in.

description.summary:
13th Century Lakeside Castle, 6 Bedrooms, 2 Baths, (Sleeps 10-12)

Surrounded by seven acres of lawns, park and woodland, Carraigin Castle is an idyllic holiday home in a beautiful setting on the shores of Lough Corrib. From the Castle one can enjoy boating and fishing, walking, riding and sightseeing, or just relax by the open hearth and contemplate the simple grandeur of this ancient dwelling, a rare and beautiful example of a fortified, medieval “hall house”.
description.space:
You will love the relaxed atmosphere of this authentic 13th-century manor house, which has been restored by the present owner after more than two centuries as a roofless ruin.  Carraigin's church-like structure sits on a rise reached by an avenue across the tree-lined Pleasure Ground.  The ancient-looking, nail-studded front door on the ground floor, often mistaken for an authentic antiquity, was actually made by the owner during the building's restoration in the 1970s.  Round the corner, an imposing stone staircase leads to another grand entrance, into the lofty, oak-beamed Great Hall featuring a wide, stone-arched fireplace that provides a comforting aroma of turf and wood-smoke.
The Great Hall is the central living and dining area of the castle. It features a mix of old oak and comfortable modern furniture surrounding the welcoming hearth. Its white walls are extensively decorated with tapestries, brass rubbing portraits of ancient kings and knights and a magnificent triptych featuring a Galway galleon. There is a tiny but well-equipped kitchen next door. 
On the same level as the Hall is an oak-beamed double bedroom with a king-size bed and bathroom.  A stone staircase winds upwards over this master bedroom to a gallery room overlooking the Great Hall. Another winding stairs leads up to a little single bedroom in the corner tower (available only in the summer).  From both of these second-floor rooms you can stroll out onto the castle parapets with fabulous views of Lough Corrib and the hills of Connemara and Mayo.
The rest of you sleep in the four cosy 'Vaults' on the ground floor below The Vaults have much picturesque charm with their oak-timbered partitions, arches and vaulted ceilings, and they work if you know each other well as the rooms lead one into the other. Vault I, the largest of the four, sleeps two in bunk-beds and features a fair-sized work table and chairs for busy teenagers and a mini-sofa for one or two in the window embrasure. Vault II (off No. 1) has a double bed and a similar window seat. Vault III (also off No.1) has one double and one single bed and a window seat. Vault III in turn gives access to Vault IV, a small single room with a three-light gothic window looking out onto the lawn.
description.access: For an extra fee of E160 for 3 days (or E300 for 7 days) a fishing boat is available between 1st March and 31st October. This includes outboard, life jackets, 2 fishing rods and an introduction to Lough Corrib by a local fisherman.
description.notes:
You will have the whole property and 7 acres to yourselves. Carraigin Castle is ideal for a family reunion.
Carraigin is very much a place of communal living which works well for people who know each other, as some of the rooms lead from one into the  other in ancient fashion. We generally recommend the place for 8 people to  be comfortable. Please also keep in mind that there are only 2 bathrooms. 
Tower bedroom only available in the summer.
There is central heating, electric heaters and an open fire in the Great Hall.
description.transit: A car is necessary. The nearest town with shops, bank, post office, chemist etc is about 5 miles away.

The average winter charge for three days has been around the Euro80 mark, the spring charge around the E35 mark. recent.comments: We had such a wonderful stay at Ravensby Hall.  The house is massive!  So many bedrooms and sitting rooms to choose from!  I think we enjoyed the kitchen the most - hub of the visit for dine-in breakfast and dinners.  Highly recommended for a quiet stay or jumping off point for exploring the countryside.

items.comments: We had such a wonderful stay at Ravensby Hall.  The house is massive!  So many bedrooms and sitting rooms to choose from!  I think we enjoyed the kitchen the most - hub of the visit for dine-in breakfast and dinners.  Highly recommended for a quiet stay or jumping off point for exploring the countryside.

Ravensby Hall is a tranquil getaway filled with charm. The rolling green spaces surrounding the home and the amenities are a delight. Overall I strongly recommend the space! 

One note, for business travelers, the wifi is quite slow, so you will need to use cellular.

Great for large parties and with the games room, sauna, steam room and hot tub kept everyone occupied.  Highland cows in the adjacent field especially the calves were a great source of entertainment for the children and adults.  Apart from one door knob that kept falling off and one shower that leaked badly everything else worked.  Such a spacious property that you never felt that it was crowded.  Might be worth the hosts leaving cleaning chemicals for the hot tub with instructions as after 2 days of lots of use this would have helped keep the water cleaner. Just a short stroll from Barry Mill which is worth a visit. Would definitely go back.  Big thumbs up from all 17 of us that were there.

It's rare for an Airbnb to be even nicer than its pictures, but this was the case with Ravensby hall. 

Great place + great hosts. Will return!

Stayed with a group of fifteen ladies for a long weekend, this house had just what we needed for a nice relaxing weekend with friends with loads of extra benefits 
Let’s just say we couldn’t wait to book again, even booked another stay on our second day 
Just fantastic *****

We spent a lovely family weekend at Ravensby Hall. It was everything we expected and more. Will definitely go back. 
Thanks so much to Richard and Laura.

Laura and Richard were terrific hosts, and Ravensby Hall was gorgeous! Like some other reviewers said, the pictures don't do it justice. The scale of the house is huge, and windows everywhere. Wonderful showers, beds, and so much room we were getting lost just exploring it upon arrival.

We were a group of 8 golfers playing mostly in the Carnoustie area, and would definitely stay there again. The setting is rural and tranquil, and the touches like the hot tub and sauna were wonderful. We would not hesitate to recommend Ravensby Hall for large groups of friends or families!

hosts.about:
John A. Lavender II - owner of Highlands Castle. 
 
Highlands Castle was born from a promise I made to my young son...
“Someday I’ll build a house where we both will live… a place we’ll call home. 
A place where you can bring your friends and create special memories… someday Jason I will build you a castle." 

Looking back to 1978, my 3-year old son would likely have never remembered these words. The promise had more to do with a desire to build a better life, than an actual castle.  

It would be another 5-years before the ideal property presented itself, a mountaintop in Bolton Landing, NY.  

While clearing the land for the foundation, a picture was being painted with a chain saw rather than a brush.  Within a matter of weeks, the most spectacular view in the world was uncovered.  The majesty of Lake George and the Adirondack Mountains seemed as grateful as I was to be unveiled.  How was it, that I would be the one to settle here?  Was it simply luck or something much greater? I believe it was the latter, and that I was led to this specific spot for a reason. 

Once the foundation was completed, the wood framing construction was to the roof in a few months and the structure began to find its outward appearance.  I finally graduated from the living quarters of a tent to a mattress on the floor, which was fine with me… I was quite happy to be sleeping in my own home.

In 1986, I met Yvonne, the woman who 'turned a pile of rocks into a home'.  We were married here in 1992, and my parents who were both Methodist pastors officiated our ceremony.  (In 2008, my son Jason & Mary would be married at Highlands Castle with his grandparents also officiating their wedding). 

"Jason, I promised that I would build you a castle, I didn't say you wouldn't be helping me!"...  So, when Jason was a teenager, he joined in the stonework.  Naturally resourceful, he recruited his football teammates to lend some muscle over the summer months. Their daily mantra was "Let's rock!" and they took great pride in what they accomplished while working together again as a team.  (Jason was not only an impressive stonemason, but he also went on to earn an Architectural Engineering Degree, and achieve anything he put his mind to).

The stonework was a slow, tedious process and the labor of laying up more than 1,000 tons of local granite would take decades. Over the past 40+ years, the property would evolve into what it is today... a series of three castles.

In 2010, my wife Yvonne and I decided to make Highlands Castle available so others could experience what our family has been so fortunate to enjoy.   Since then, families & friends from all over the world have gathered here to create their own special memories.  We hope you'll visit us, too!

Poised on a graceful mountainside overlooking majestic Lake George, a castle awaits you...

recent.comments: Staying at the castle cottage was amazing! The location, the views, and experience were all great. We visited Lake George for an open water swim race and this made the whole visit magical. John and Yvonne (and Major and Bella) are so delightful and such welcoming hosts. Such an amazing visit!

items.comments: Staying at the castle cottage was amazing! The location, the views, and experience were all great. We visited Lake George for an open water swim race and this made the whole visit magical. John and Yvonne (and Major and Bella) are so delightful and such welcoming hosts. Such an amazing visit!

Our stay at Highland Castle  Cottage was absolutely amazing! The hosts, John and Yvonne are the most accommodating, kind, and warm people we have ever met! Communication was great and anything we needed was right there.  The details put into the property is astonishing!  The views and the beauty of the entire property is hard to put into words and like no other we have ever seen. It truly is a magical place and we can’t wait to visit again!!
We had a wonderful stay, incredible views and John & Yvonne were so kind. We loved all the little details and watching the sunrise over the lake and mountains. Would definitely recommend!

This property is just amazing! The views, the way it makes you feel, the ambience, everything about it. Even though it didn't snow much when I was there, the snow it has was enough to transform it into a winter wonderland. Bolton landing is a beautiful town, and the people are very friendly too. 

Definitely recommend staying here

What an amazing piece of property with buildings I've never seen before!!! Highlands Castle was the true "cherry on top" for myself and my family this Thanksgiving. John was beyond accommodating,  and very caring and thoughtful to my entire family.  
Whether you are local,  or traveling,  if your looking for a place like no other with views and an experience to match,  check out Highlands Castle!!! You will not be disappointed!!!

There are not enough words to explain how wonderful our stay was at this hidden gem. John and his wife Yvonne are two of the most wonderful people we have ever met. Their home is absolutely incredible and the story behind it is even more incredible. The views are some of which we will never forget. It was an amazing getaway from the hectic city life. We look forward to going back again to this magical place.

Imagine yourself on the patio of your private castle. The view of Lake George is breathtaking. The sunset is spectacular. John was an amazing host . The home is beautiful inside and out. We will surely be back.

You provide the Fairy Tale and we'll provide the Castle... 
Whether it’s time with family & friends, honeymoon, royal vacation retreat, birthday or anniversary celebration, proposal location, girls weekend getaway, or any "experience" you can envision!

Poised on a graceful mountaintop, a castle awaits you...
From the moment you arrive, you'll sense the tranquility that surrounds this enchanting property and you’ll be captivated by the most spectacular view in the world! The intrigue of the castle is matched only by its glorious vistas of Lake George & the Adirondack Mountains. 

Cherished family memories at Highlands Castle... 
Highlands Castle is incomparable to all other places. That is what sets us apart.  You won't find a more magical setting to share time with your loved ones. 

The Castle Cottage is a hidden jewel in a private setting, yet only 3 minutes from downtown Bolton Landing with the conveniences of a supermarket, gourmet restaurants, unique shops, public beaches, swimming, kayaking, canoeing, tennis, golf, miniature golf, water tubing, whitewater rafting, hiking trails, biking trails, boat rentals, scenic boat tours, and more!

Invite your family & friends!

description.neighborhood:
'The Castle Cottage' overlooking beautiful Lake George is a hidden jewel in a private setting, yet only 3-minutes from downtown Bolton Landing with conveniences of a supermarket, gourmet restaurants, unique shops, public beaches, swimming, kayaking, canoeing, tennis, golf, miniature golf, water tubing, whitewater rafting, hiking trails, biking trails, boat rentals, scenic boat tours, and more!

Bolton Landing offers a variety of great restaurants, shopping & more!
There's a grocery store down the street for all your cooking needs. 
Or enjoy an array of family-owned restaurants from pizza, to Italian, to great Steak Houses and more... all just 3-minutes away! 
Stop in and enjoy all the amenities that Bolton Landing has to offer. 
From fine gift stores, novelty and antique shops, clothing stores, hair salons, canoe, kayaking, canoeing, jet-ski rentals, boat rentals, scenic boat cruise tours, camping apparel stores, ice cream parlors and so much more!  There’s plenty to do and see while you’re here, plus 2-public beaches with picnic areas just off Main Street.

Experience the natural wonders of Lake George and our Adirondack paradise! The memories of 'The Castle Cottage' and our Lake George region will last a lifetime!

HIGHLANDS CASTLE is also available to rent for a memorable gathering with family & friends up to 28-people.  Contact us for more details regarding a 'FAMILY RENTAL' at Highlands Castle.

description.house_rules:
Children are welcome but must be well-supervised by a responsible adult at all times.

HOUSE RULES:
Pets, smoking, vaping, and candles are not allowed on the property.

Guest agrees to our 'No Smoking Policy' and agrees to pay a $500 penalty if our house rule policy is not adhered to.

Guest agrees to our 'No Pets Policy' because our 2 pets live on the property (which makes it unsuitable for a guest's pet to cohabitate with our pups). Guest agrees to pay a $300/night penalty if our house rule policy is not adhered to.

Guest agrees to our strict 'No Extra Person' policy and agrees to pay $300/person per night if our house rule is not adhered to.

AC|Heat Policy: To conserve energy, the guest agrees NOT to run AC or Heat with window(s) or door open. Guest agrees to pay $500 if this policy is not adhered to. Guest agrees to pay $1000 if AC 'freezes up' due to window(s) or door(s) open with AC running. The recommended AC thermostat setting is 74 degrees Fahrenheit.

SAFETY RESTRICTIONS: Standing or sitting on any outside terrace railing or stone wall is NOT permitted on the property of Highlands Castle. All guests agree to adhere to this rule for their own safety.

EVENTS: (Parties, small gatherings, etc.) must be pre-approved by the property owner and is categorized as a 'FAMILY RENTAL' that allows the GUESTS to invite family & friends onto the property to enjoy time together from 4-8 pm for an additional fee of $198/person per day.

Highlands Castle is suitable for elegant, sophisticated, smaller gatherings of family & friends.

Highlands Castle is NOT permitted for a bachelor party, rowdy, loud, disruptive, or unruly gathering.

Quiet time after 9 pm to be considerate of neighbors and other guests.

Guest agrees to conduct themselves in an orderly, respectful, and responsible manner in full compliance with applicable laws and regulations.

Guest agrees to pay for damage caused during their stay in order to restore the Highlands Castle property.

Guest agrees to leave the Highlands Castle property and grounds in a clean and orderly condition.

Winter Season Bookings: Renter is advised to utilize a 4-wheel drive vehicle with snow tires for safety.
