gallery.caption: Dunskey Estate: an enchanted 2000-acre wonderland full of secret gardens, secluded beaches, serene lochs, and endless possibilities.
Aerial view of the walled garden. During 2021, sections of it will be undergoing tender and thoughtful regeneration. If you do not mind it looking not-at-its-best we'd love to show you parts of it.

Dunskey’s magic can be felt by all. Yet each guest possesses a unique key to unlock his or her own enchantment. Here, we urge you to jettison conventional holiday-making and immerse in this hidden gem.

The maze, walled garden, and matured woodlands are a short leisurely stroll from your door. Throughout the year, deers, rabbits, pheasants, squirrels, and so many woodland animals are about that it's practically living in a Disney movie.
More than anything, we love sharing with you all the astonishing glories and quiet sublimity of Dunskey Estate. It is our greatest wish to for you to be as besotted with Dunskey as we are.
We have a boat ready for you to use on the lower loch. Take with you a picnic lunch and a bottle of bubbly for a ridiculously fanciful lunch.

PHYTONCIDES should be our household word. Referring to airborne scents and oils released by trees, these chemicals are known to be a powerful antioxidant that can decrease cancer proteins in the human body. Tree-hugging: let's make it an activity.
In summer, the Estate is blanketed with riotous rhododendron, from pale yellow and fuchsia to the darkest violet. It certainly transform a countryside frolic into a sensual and immersive journey.

It's hard to fully capture Dunskey's magic. From Jurassic - era plants to untamed landscapes, you'll discover joy and wonder everywhere on the Estate. This babbling brook, for example, gushes down to the waterfall, and is lined with ancient ferns.

Dunskey’s magic can be felt by all. Yet each guest possesses a unique key to unlock his or her own enchantment. Here, we urge you to jettison conventional holiday-making and immerse in this hidden gem.

The site of Dunskey's origin: the 11th century castle that stands on the cliff's edge. The family eventually moved from this abode and built anew after an unspeakable tragedy. Our guided walk can provide you with all the colourful history.
Just as Killantringan Lighthouse once guided ships safely home, the lodestar of Dunskey magic will be your compass on this blissful rural escape.

This is one of the three waterfalls on the Estate, but this view is afforded to those who are brave enough to enter the cave. Endless adventures await you, no matter your age or level of courage (ours is close to zero).
Dunskey Estate: an enchanted 2000-acre wonderland full of secret gardens, secluded beaches, serene lochs, and endless possibilities.
More than anything, we love sharing with you all the astonishing glories and quiet sublimity of Dunskey Estate. It is our greatest wish to for you to be as besotted with Dunskey as we are.
Aerial view of the walled garden. During 2021, sections of it will be undergoing tender and thoughtful regeneration. If you do not mind it looking not-at-its-best we'd love to show you parts of it.

The maze, walled garden, and matured woodlands are a short leisurely stroll from your door. Throughout the year, deers, rabbits, pheasants, squirrels, and so many woodland animals are about that it's practically living in a Disney movie.

Autumn is one of the most picturesque time on the Estate. The lights seem to diffuse into the changing colours of the leaves, and the crunching underfoot makes for an all-sensory experience when you walk in these woods.

There is an enchanting walk from the Estate to the Lighthouse, then circle back along the most dramatic coastline of the Southern Upland Way. Here you'll find untouched wild beauty, a ship wreck, and overwhelming beauty.
Upon this 2000-acre Dunskey Estate, miles of uninterrupted high skies, with sheep dotting the meadow, will be enough to temporary stop the wayward feet of the greatest wanderlust.

Golden lights cascade over the lowland coast to highlight surreal beauty, so rarely unspoiled by human activities. We encourage the most compassionate and immersive kind of staycation: one where nature is at the heart of it all.

As Mufasa says, "Everything the light touches is
our kingdom." Well, at least for the entire duration of your holiday at Dunskey anyway. Feel free to reign over your kingdom and run about like a wayward royal.
Spelunking off Turtle's Back Landing is one of many popular activities at Dunskey. At low tide, you'll discover many swimming holes, though you may have to share it with some of the local octopuses.

Dunskey: the Ibiza of Scotland? The Maldives of Wigtown? Anything is possible with a good wetsuit on! Turquoise clear water, white sands, and sea-glass stillness. Who knew this kind of hidden paradise exists on this Estate?

The most dazzling memories will be made here on Laird's Bay, in our little corner of the world. Allow yourselves to be spirited away to endless coastal walks and evening tipples of hot toddies as you watch the sun slip into the ocean.

Dunskey is the ultimate manifestation of your wild imagination. Come to us with your ideas, and we will find a way to deliver. From mind blowing off-site meals to the most spectacular photoshoot in untouched wild beauty, you'll find it all here.
Geometric intersection of beauty and grace traverse through all parts of Dunskey Estate. Where will these paths lead you on your journey away from the bustle, and into the calm?
The Southern Upland Way courses through Dunskey Estate, and along this path, you'll encounter friendly "coos" and all the lovely wee sheep.
At Dunskey, rural bliss meets soul-melting sunsets on the beach: it is the perfect life for any aspiring mermaids wishing to escape the urban grid.

No matter the season or weather, you are guaranteed to have a magical time at Dunskey. We believe that somehow, even the lights here take on a different quality to the rest of the planet. Come and explore this wonderland yourself.
The grand pillars of Dunskey Main Gates, standing guard for over a century.

You'll find historical relics throughout Dunskey Estate, including these ancient pillars that guarded the old pathway leading to Dunskey House from the 12th century. Imagine--these gates were wide enough for a double-horse carriage!

The national animal of Scotland is a unicorn, and it is the only nation with a mythical beast as its emblem. We can't think of an animal more fitting for our magical grounds and the compassionate experience we provide for all our guests.

This stretch of road is near one of our lochs. It's where you'll witness incredible sunsets. In the spring, the cows play in this field. They absolutely love music, so bring a portable speaker and watch them gather round for a listen.
Dunskey Estate: an enchanted 2000-acre wonderland full of secret gardens, secluded beaches, serene lochs, and endless possibilities.

The maze, walled garden, and matured woodlands are a short leisurely stroll from your door. Throughout the year, deers, rabbits, pheasants, squirrels, and so many woodland animals are about that it's practically living in a Disney movie.
Run along the brook to the sea, linger on the Upper Loch at dusk to listen to the birds and observe the swans groom one another. Note how your shoulders relax throughout this rural arcadia.
View of the Upper Loch. Surrounded by matured trees, ferns, and the home of our two resident swans.
In the spring, the loch banks are covered in daffodils and snowdrops. A parade of ombre color rhododendrons turn the lochs into a lovely magical painting.
This breathtaking loch, often an amazing viewing spot for migrating geese, is but a short walk from your front door.

Was William Wordsworth standing in this very spot when he wrote, "And then my heart with pleasure fills / And dances with the daffodils."
This is one of the most incredible spots at Dunskey, where it is entirely carpeted by daffodils in springtime.
Dunskey's Upper Loch, located about fifteen minutes from the main house. This is where our resident swans call home. In the spring, they will be fluttering about with their cygnets.

The Director of Photography for "Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves," told us that had he known about the Dunskey woodlands ahead of time, he would have brought the production here. It's true, these botanical cathedrals are a balm for these times.
We have a boat ready for you to use on the lower loch. Take with you a picnic lunch and a bottle of bubbly for a ridiculously fanciful lunch.

The Director of Photography for "Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves," told us that had he known about the Dunskey woodlands ahead of time, he would have brought the production here. It's true, these botanical cathedrals are a balm for these times.
In the spring, the loch banks are covered in daffodils and snowdrops. A parade of ombre color rhododendrons turn the lochs into a lovely magical painting.

Quite often, our lodges are covered in flowers or are surrounded by trees. Come nightfall, these matured woodlands ensure that you'll hear not a sound murmuring beneath the window other than foraging hedgehogs and scurrying hares.

Wild bluebells underfoot will enchant and transform every single second of your walk at Dunskey. These incredible tiny flowers, when crushed, bloom exquisite and slightly musky scent of iris, vanilla, and green moss.
The beguiling grounds at Dunskey have inspired many elopements and celebrations. We always know just the perfect spot to make your vision comes alive, and trust us, the possibilities are endless.

Down into the woods we go. This fairy glen leads you along a babbling brook on a path that's covered with wild flowers and fern. The path ends at the stone bridge that crosses the waterfall, and finally crescendos at the beach.

No matter the season or weather, you are guaranteed to have a magical time at Dunskey. We believe that somehow, even the lights here take on a different quality to the rest of the planet. Come and explore this wonderland yourself.
Ever feel the need to simply run away from it all? Look no further, Dunskey Estate is quite possibly the most enchanting get-away to soothe the spirit and invigorate the soul.

In the winter at Dunskey, for the truly lucky, the mythical Scottish mist can linger for a visit. Whispers of air trail through the trees, enveloping it all in a kind of awe-inspiring peace you didn't know can exist alongside the cold.
Come and rediscover childlike delights, such as kite-flying and wriggling your toes deep into the sand, all at secluded beaches on this splendorous estate.

The Water Nest at the lower loch is a spacious and stunning place to admire wildlife on the water. It is also the perfect spot for yoga. In the summer, the ease of access into the water will encourage many swimmers!

At low tide, adventurous foodies may wish to forage for winkles clinging on the cragged shoreline. Steam them with lemongrass, and dip in a mix of garlic, fish sauce, brown sugar, and chili for the most detectable treat.

Whether it's a foggy morning or an afternoon bathed in golden light, discover the rocky Scottish coastline at one of our three beaches. Maybe you'll get lucky and run into one of our resident seals sunning in the late afternoon warmth.

The Dunskey headland marks the natural border with charming Portpatrick Village. The Southern Upland Way continues along this part of the coast, lined with wild heather and gorse, scenting your steps with hints of vanilla and musk.

John Muir said, "In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks." It's no secret that wild rambling walks are at the heart of all Dunskey stays, and we wonder if Muir himself came up with this insight from within our grounds.

Dunskey Estate built this incredible 16-hole golf course with commanding view of the Irish Sea, and donated to Portpatrick Village. A charming walk along the coastline takes you from your door to your buggy.
In summer, the Estate is blanketed with riotous rhododendron, from pale yellow and fuchsia to the darkest violet. It certainly transform a countryside frolic into a sensual and immersive journey.

PHYTONCIDES should be our household word. Referring to airborne scents and oils released by trees, these chemicals are known to be a powerful antioxidant that can decrease cancer proteins in the human body. Tree-hugging: let's make it an activity.

hosts.about:
We are a small but mighty team with our hearts set on sharing with you the most glorious hidden gem in this rural corner of Scotland: Dunskey, a 2000-acre estate by the sea, where world-class heritage meets modern splendour, surrounded by secret gardens and endless wonders. 

Everything we do is rooted in our three values: compassion, innovation, and transformation. We strongly believe that the first steps towards spectacular hospitality is taking care of our team and environments. Here, you'll meet the incredible Dunskey stewards who sincerely wish to share with you the joy, beauty, and warmth in all that we do. Most significantly, you will find extraordinary thoughtfulness in every moment of your journey here. 

We are also a feministic company with a laser focus on sustainability. We use re-fillable products wherever possible. Our heating system is nearly at 100% sourced from renewable energy. We compost 100% of our food waste, and our water comes from a fresh spring. We continuously strive to do more and do better.

Our ongoing other projects include policy advocacy in immigration and anti-human trafficking, working on turning out the votes in America and fighting against voter suppression laws. Seeking social and racial justice is a constant, though sometimes painful, anchor in our lives. We would like everyone to read the two novels, The Overstory, by Richard Powers, and, Ministry for the Future by Kim Stanley Robinson. When not heartened by the possibility of collective action to address climate change, we like to cook a ton-load of Vietnamese beef noodle soup and plot the next magic mushroom trail on the Estate.

recent.comments: A really friendly team which made us feel comfortable all the time (thank you Ali and Andrea!). The place is spacious and perfect for group/family outing.  We enjoyed two of the arranged activities Archery and Fishing a lot. Jim (instructor) helped us caught 2 fishes which was really our trip highlight ;) The location is quite tuck away so driving there is highly recommended.

items.comments: A really friendly team which made us feel comfortable all the time (thank you Ali and Andrea!). The place is spacious and perfect for group/family outing.  We enjoyed two of the arranged activities Archery and Fishing a lot. Jim (instructor) helped us caught 2 fishes which was really our trip highlight ;) The location is quite tuck away so driving there is highly recommended.

该如何描述这段入住经历呢？我们实在太喜欢它了！在旅程中，比起奢华酒店，我们常常更喜欢Airbnb，因为更有家的感觉。但在Dunskey Estate，一切完全超出了对于Airbnb的预期。无与伦比的宅邸被森林环境衬托，种类丰富的植被、美丽的湖泊、瀑布和海滩，一切都令人惊叹，同时又如此自然的发生。提供的冷冻菜品加热后完全是意料之外的美餐，让对异国食物很挑剔的中国食客也感到满意。认识植物的散步之旅来自森林真正的护林员Davy，Sarah提供的瑞典spa让来自服务行业超级发达的中国上海的我们也感到很满意，海边的篝火让我们完全沉醉，这一切很像是Aman Hotel之流想要缔造却无法实现的，那些地方只有钱的味道，而在这里一切美好都是如此朴实而自然。我非常欣赏团队介绍中的一句话：“We strongly believe that the first steps towards spectacular hospitality is taking care of our team and environments.” 小型的运营团队非常强大，孩子们学到了很多，我也收获满满。真的是个难忘之地！下一次，我想尝试更加独立的整栋房屋。期待再见！

Saltwater is a beautiful place to get away from it all.  Lovely, comfortable accommodation with a really well-equipped kitchen, great bathrooms ensuite in every room, spacious with a sea view and own beach 2 minutes away.  Furnishings and decor all to a high spec. Best kitchen knives I have experienced! Access to nature, the beach, woodlands on your doorstep.  Peaceful, calm lochs not far.  We had a great guided Ranger Walk over 3 hours and learnt lots about the local environment and what the estate is doing with it.  Loved it - highly recommended. Hope to return! Thank you.

We absolutely love the staying at the Roy apartment at the Dunskey‘s house. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Just a couple steps away from your door and you are in the magical woods of Scotland. The kids loved the maze, exploring the ponds and the beach campfire. I would highly recommend this place for anyone who is looking to escape the every day business of life.
A beautiful secluded estate in the Scottish countryside. My group of friends and I went with a few of the activities that the host was offering and it was very fun and worthwhile.

Worth every penny! We stayed at the Royal Apartment on Dunskey Estate and the accommodation was very spacious, clean and had everything needed for a relaxing getaway. The hosts and locals were very friendly and helpful which made everything go smoothly. Would definitely recommend!

A great place to stay.  Accommodation was spacious and  plentiful for eight adults without being cramped in any way.  Beautiful walks around the large estate and further afield as well, with Portpatrick with its pubs and restaurants close enough to walk or taxi in the evening.  Would definitely recommend for a peaceful break away.

description.summary: This is a private and self-contained apartment inside an Edwardian historic castle. Lovingly restored to the highest specs, but with all the charming original details: the art deco spiral staircase, blond wood floor, and classic windowpanes. Flooded with lights, full of modern comforts (speedy wifi, Smart TV, biomass heating) 2000 acres of glen walks, forests, beaches, lochs, gardens & waterfalls to explore. Vast lawn for games & courtyard for BBQ. 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, sleeps 8 comfortably.
description.space:
A fascinating fusion unfurls inside an Edwardian Castle in form of the apartment. There's an unusual architectural interplays within this unique Castle apartment, hidden down a private drive in deep Scottish countryside. At first glance, the Apartment is grandly presented inside a 19th-century castle, but a closer inspection reveals contemporary features dovetailed into the original design, cleverly expanding the space and light, to create a luxury self-catering homestay that's bespoke down to the last detail.

Traditional vintage charm combines with boutique flair inside, with many secret spots to sit and absorb the tranquil grounds. Every effort has been made to preserve original features of the Castle, including the stripped-back blond hardwood floor, and the art deco spiral stairs case from a Glaswegian company at the height of its industrial heyday. History buffs will particularly delight at the original furniture, art works and artifacts dotted throughout the space.

With its double-floor loft style, the apartment will appeal to those with passion for architecture and history. Persian rugs cover the gorgeous reclaimed wood floor, original to the Castle. An arcadia mural stands prominently in the living room and family space. Mid-century leather sofa and gold coffee table, alongside leather rocking chairs and an upcycled wood burning stove will make sure you lounge in true Mad-Men style. A modern kitchen with muted jade colours and breakfast bar will encourage lengthy lingerings alongside poached eggs. With a nod to mid-century inspiration, ghost chairs around the dining area opens up the space to connect the kitchen and the lounge. 

Four bedrooms make slumberous havens. Plush wall-to-wall carpets are throughout the top floor, alongside three very spacious full bathrooms. The collection of beds in the apartment is definitely something to write home about: Italianate canopy bed, 18th-century antique mahogany single beds, linen-upholstered and brass-studded rococo bed, and the grand colonial style reclaimed wood bed will ensure the sweetest sleeps.
description.access:
The 2000-acre Dunskey Estate is your private pleasure ground. You'll roam freely and will typically encounter no one during your stay in this truly hidden and magnificent gem in Scotland.

We make bedrooms available based on the number of guests in the group.

Please note: the Estate's walled garden is undergoing extensive renovation during late 2020 to 2021. It is only accessible to our team members during this time.
description.neighborhood: You're not simply staying in a Castle: you are staying on one of the most beautiful spots on the planet. Dunskey Estate boasts two waterfalls, two lochs, and three beaches, with the most magnificent walks along the craggy Scottish coastline. This pleasure ground will be completely yours to explored, including a private walled garden and a maze. You will have the time of your life, I promise.
description.interaction: We will be available to assist you during your stay.
description.house_rules: No smoking is allowed inside the house. A house tour is possible to arrange, but please respect our privacy and use rooms we have prepared for your access. We allow one dog at 60gbp per stay.

recent.comments: A fantastic experience staying in an extremely interesting castle!

items.comments: A fantastic experience staying in an extremely interesting castle!
Would stay again. My kids said it was their favorite place to stay during our time in Scotland!

Staying at Thornton Castle was a great experience. We enjoyed walking in the gardens and grounds, being greeted by our host who took the time to show us round and give us the history of the castle and the options for breakfast in the morning. We had a lovely and peaceful night in the beautiful and historic tower. It was a very memorable stay. Thank you!

Griselda had us for two nights and the stay was magical. 

Griselda made sure we were as comfortable as we could be and was very welcoming and friendly and made the best breakfast and absolutely THE best coffee I have ever had in my life. 

We sure do recommend for anyone wanting a new experience in Scotland. 

Thank you Griselda for having us and looking for it again!
Amazing place, lot’s of activities available, wonderful host. Griselda let’s you feel as you had a castle. Fantastic experience.

Griselda is a warm and brilliant host and her home is fascinating and full of character. The bed was very comfy and the views from the top of the tower are fantastic. Breakfast is delicious and fully fledged - can strongly recommend.

This was a gem to find! Friends from Canada  wanted to stay in a castle and we found a fantastic castle with beautiful grounds!
An amazing host. Promptly responsive, providing extremely helpful suggestions re how to get there (accurate directions), what to bring re luggage (stairs to climb) & where to go for great food (excellent supper recommendations). 
Met all expectations and more. The drawing room provided lots to entertain... billiards for the boys and a challenging jigsaw for the girls (even if a piece was missing!) Breakfast was to order... delicious 
Thank you for providing an awesome experience, Griselda!! We will return!

description.summary: Traditional & relaxed B&B in the 16th century Scottish tower wing of our family home. 2 bedrooms for 4 people over two floors in a private wing of the house with large bathroom and small sitting room with tv.  Full breakfast included.
description.space:
The castle dates from the 13th century and is full of original features but has been extensively improved for modern living! It is an excellent location for exploring the area or for business in Aberdeen or even a wedding at one of the excellent local venues.
The property is about 45 minutes’ drive south of Aberdeen off the main A90.  Edinburgh is 2 hours to the south.  Royal Deeside is about 20 minutes away, across the Cairn O’Mount pass.  
Our main guest room is a bright room, overlooking parkland, on the second floor of the L-shaped tower built in 1531.  It has a superking sized bed and there is plenty of storage with a wardrobe & chest of drawers. A cosy sitting room with TV is adjacent.
Up a further flight of the impressive stone spiral stair is the bathroom and a further guest room, with twin beds.  The bathroom, for exclusive use by guests, has a power shower and bath. 
All linen, towels and basic toiletries will be provided.  Duvets and pillows are feather/down, but synthetic may be available. A hairdryer is available, as well as an iron & ironing board. There are tea and coffee making facilities and a fridge with ice box.  White waffle weave robes can be used for the short walk between the bedrooms and bathroom. 
On the ground floor is a Billiard room with full sized billiard / snooker table and selection of board games which guests are welcome to use by separate arrangement.  On inclement days or chilly evenings we would be happy to light a fire.
A full breakfast is provided in our dining room, depending on requirements. A selection of cereals, fruit juices and yoghurt are all available, with home made bread and preserves.  A simple cooked breakfast can be provided. 
For larger parties there are other rooms available by arrangement.
Reasonable Wi-Fi is available throughout the house limited in places by the thickness of the walls!
description.access:
The space is not suited to the infirm or very young because of the spiral stair between floors.
Guests will be free to use the large garden, croquet lawn and all weather tennis court by arrangement. 
The family use a separate wing of the house.
description.notes: We have two dogs which live outside, and a cat in our wing of the house. We also have chickens and ducks in the garden – there may well be fresh eggs for breakfast
description.neighborhood:
The house is located in a tranquil and quiet rural setting midway between the villages of Fettercairn and Laurencekirk in the fertile farming area of the Howe of the Mearns. River and woodland walks are on the door step
Fettercairn has an award winning distillery with visitor centre. Slightly further afield over the Cairn O'Mount road, is Royal Deeside with Balmoral Castle and other attractions.
The property is not far from the coastal towns of Stonehaven, Catterline, Johnshaven and Montrose.  There are superb beaches at St Cyrus.
The nearest golf courses are in Edzell, Auchenblae, Montrose and Stonehaven.  Carnoustie and St Andrews are within an hour’s drive. 
There is an abundance of walks and cycling for all abilities and interests on our doorstep. The coast to coast walk from Fort William passes through Glen Esk en route to Montrose. 
The area has a number of excellent hotels, restaurants and coffee shops for eating out.
description.transit:
Given the rural location a car is fairly essential, particularly as there are no places to eat within walking distance.  There is plenty of room to park. 
As mentioned, the area is ideal for cycling and we can store bikes and any other sporting equipment under cover.
description.interaction: We will be around to answer any questions. We are very happy to chat and share our local knowledge but the large spaces in our property afford the guests their own privacy.
description.house_rules: We have a strict no smoking or vaping policy and no pets are allowed in the space. We request that our guests respect both our privacy and our property as we will do theirs.

Whether it’s a family-friendly holiday, a pet-friendly holiday or an activity and adventure-filled holiday, find your ideal UK break with Sykes Holiday Cottages.

description.summary: The William Suite rests in Ulverston and can sleep four people in two bedrooms.
description.space: The living areas in this second-floor, triplex apartment include a kitchen/diner with an electric oven electric oven, induction hob, combi microwave/oven, fridge/freezer, washer/dryer, dishwasher, coffee maker and wine cooler, and a table for four, along with a third-floor sitting room with a Smart TV. Second-floor, triplex apartment. Two second-floor bedrooms: 1 x super king-size with en-suite walk-in shower, basin, heated towel rail and WC, 2 x 2ft 6 twin (request to be King on booking). Second-floor bathroom with bath, shower over, basin, heated towel rail and WC. Second-floor kitchen/diner. Third-floor sitting room. Guests have access to a private rooftop terrace with furniture, the shared grounds, and two designated parking spaces.  Within 0.2 miles, there is a shop, and within 0.4, a pub. Please note that pets and smoking are not permitted. WiFi, fuel, power, bed linen and towels are all included in the price. A highchair and cot are available. Note: Check-in from 4pm, check-out by 10am. Note: There is lift or stair access to the apartment, but only stair access inside the apartment. Note: Children must be supervised on the rooftop terrace. Choose The William Suite for a luxury holiday in Cumbria.

description.neighborhood: Ulverston is a cobbled-street market town. It has independent shops, cafés, and pubs with open fires and real ales. Fine dining and tavern meals are both available. Ulverston is a festival town, with flags, walking, art, and music festivals in the summer and the Dickensian Christmas festival in late November. Stan Laurel was born there, and it holds the world record for the biggest foam pie battle, revealing a joyful, community-minded town. A picturesque village with views of the southern Lake District and Morecambe Bay. The deepest, widest, and shortest canal in the world, with a tavern at the end and views over the bay. All National Park attractions are accessible. Furness Coast has sandy beaches and birding. Visit the South Lakes Wild Animal Park, the Lakes Windermere and Coniston, and the famed Birkrigg Common, with its spectacular views across Morecambe Bay.

Fantastic stay and we would love to come back. We got married here several years ago and great to come back for a stay. Such a beautiful place

A very beautiful and unique experience.
It was a special stay and we felt a bit like royalty
I had a wonderful experience at Neidpath Castle. Highly recommend!

We loved our stay! It was the perfect ending for our Scotland road-trip. 
Everything was better than expected, you are really renting a whole castle to explore with the castle grounds 
We would love to come back someday!
Literally you’re given the keys to the castle! From the excellent dining to the cosy decor we had a relaxing experience.
Experience of a lifetime!!

description.summary: Mary Queen of Scot's chamber at Neidpath Castle is perhaps the most romantic place to stay in the Scottish Borders. Explore privately the whole castle and then retire to enjoy your suite rooms. The antique four poster bed, deep roll top bath and open fire evoke earlier times, but are truly comfortable and luxurious. An elegant table is set for breakfast. Peebles is 10 minutes walk away, with a host of shops and restaurants, as well as a museum and award winning chocolatier.
description.space: There is a small kitchenette with fridge, kettle and delicious provisions for a continental breakfast. Dinner can be served by prior arrangement and is subject to availability of the private chef. Please message for details.
description.access: Guests can explore the whole castle at their leisure. There is only the one bedroom suite.
description.notes:
The chamber is on the 2nd floor of the castle, with no lift access.

Pets are welcome at a cost of £35 per pet, per stay. 

While we welcome pets, Neidpath Castle is a Grade A listed building and as such we would appreciate it if pets are kept under close supervision and any dog waste in the grounds is cleaned up and disposed of properly.
description.neighborhood: The glorious River Tweed, races past the castle below and you can follow it's banks into the heart of Peebles, where there are plenty of charming shops, cafes, pubs and restaurants.
description.transit: Peebles is a 2 minute drive from Neidpath. Edinburgh airport and train station  are 45 minutes away by car. There are lots of local taxi companies.
description.interaction: You will be met and shown to the apartment, and someone will be available at the end of a phone during your stay.

recent.comments: Great castle style house. Great lawn space on the back. Great location. Hosted an unforgettable proposing event here. Thank you for helping us make the memory!

items.comments: Great castle style house. Great lawn space on the back. Great location. Hosted an unforgettable proposing event here. Thank you for helping us make the memory!

Maria was an amazing hostess. Very responsive,  willing to work with us. Grounds beautiful,  beds comfortable. Pictures make the space look larger, but there was PLENTY of room. There were a few minor things,  but nothing that detracted from our stay. Heads up, even with wifi, cell service was spotty, but that is no fault of the hostess. Loved the theme and decor. Maria made plenty of recommendations of things to do in the area. Kids took full advantage of the game room, (sometimes at 3am!😁) which had a pool table, air hockey, and Foosball.
Maria was a tremendous host and staying at the castle felt like we were in Europe. She was very responsive and informative.

My family and I had a COMPLETE BLAST!!  The castle is so spacious and well decorated it literally makes you feel like you have traveled back in time.  My children enjoyed the game run for hours on end and my wife and I were able to just relax in the yard and take in the surrounds of the beautiful grounds.  The host was very professional and accessible from the beginning to the end of our stay.   They answered any and all questions and made sure our stay was perfect.  Highly recommended location for sure!  Thanks for allowing us to make joyful memories in this lovely estate!

Maria was a very nice host and we all had a wonderful time staying at their home. The place was beautiful and we thought the architecture was amazing. The only thing to note is that there were a couple instances where strangers entered the premises but we understood because it is known to be a tourist attraction for this area.

I rented the castle to host my family for the weekend and to have my 40th costume birthday party. I could not have picked a better venue! The castle was whimsical and the decor/theme Carrie’s throughout the home. Amazing space, luxurious bedrooms and the game room were perfect! Location is close to Bellport Village which is such a charming town. I would definitely rent from Maria again!

People should take advantage of this one of kind experience. I wish this was available when my family was younger because kids will absolutely love the castle.  There is plenty of space for big families and the game room keeps everyone busy.  Maria is a wonderful host willing to be available for any questions and very accommodating to your needs.

description.summary:
Live out your Walt Disney dreams in this castle by the Great South Bay.

Brookhaven Castle in Brookhaven, NY is an impressive, gated, castle-like property, just 15 min from the Hamptons, offering luxury & privacy. 

Great outdoor, private space perfect for intimate gatherings and small-scale celebrations.  Close to Smith Point Park beach and Mastic Beach.  

Please introduce yourself.  I enjoy learning about all my guests :)

**No parties or events allowed.  Please read further below.
description.space:
Although my home is a spacious place for family and friend gatherings, I must still respect my neighborhood and neighbors.  I welcome small-scale celebrations for family and friends.  Out of respect for my neighbors, I kindly ask that any loud outdoor music end by 8 pm.  

Each room can accommodate two people.  The maximum amount of overnight guests is 10.

You may notice that rooms look different.  This is because I'm constantly renovating and improving the castle, and sharing updates as I go.  

All cars must be parked inside the property.

No pets.
description.house_rules: In respect of Airbnb's policy, I do not allow any gatherings of over 16 people or any events or parties.

hosts.about: I love to host people from anywhere in the world and enjoy meeting people.

recent.comments: Wonderful stay here in the Borders for a friend’s wedding. Hosts communication excellent throughout and kindly set up a travel cot on our request.

items.comments: Wonderful stay here in the Borders for a friend’s wedding. Hosts communication excellent throughout and kindly set up a travel cot on our request.
Beautiful and quirky tower. Great area for cycling and walking.

Barns Tower is a unique and fun place to stay in the Scottish Borders --  it's historical, rustic, and cozy.  The four story peel tower is situated amongst the sheep pastures in the rolling hills, with the scenic River Tweed running nearby.  Extensive walking trails allow you to explore the beautiful countryside.  Within short driving distances, it is easy to visit the towns of Peebles, Selkirk, Melrose, and, a bit further away, the city of Edinburgh.
Our host Lulu, or I should say, Lady Elizabeth Benson has done a marvelous job of restoring this old tower, preserving the historical nature while making it comfortable and cozy with all the amenities you need.  Be prepared to do a lot of climbing up and down the narrow, spiral stairs !  And watch your head upon entering through the original iron yett (gate) at the front door.  We really enjoyed "soaking up" the ambience of this tower -- it's like being in the show Outlander  : )
Overall, Barns Tower is a remarkable experience.

I can’t say enough about Barns Tower… I was absolutely blow away. The tower itself is clean, cozy, and comfortable while still being so historic and timeless. The renovations were obviously so lovingly and knowledgeably carried out and the result is a phenomenal treasure of a place. The tower was beautifully clean and all amenities were provided. They even left us essentials like bread, eggs, and milk. The fireplaces were also fantastic and our host left detailed instructions for use. 
The grounds around the tower are breathtaking as well. There are beautiful idyllic walks around the property and a lovely path by the Tweed into Peebles. I have never wanted to not leave an Airbnb so much! Thank you to our hosts for sharing such a special place! 11/10 stars!!

What a fantastic place this was!! This was a birthday present for my boyfriend, we’ve stayed all over Scotland over the years, and he said this was his favourite place of them all! 
Spotlessly clean, fantastically stocked kitchen with all the utensils you would need, and although it’s obviously an old building, it has all the modern touches you would need. 
Bed is so comfy, the bath is so perfect and deep , all in all a fantastic place to stay - you will not be disappointed in any way. 
Thanks for having us, we hope to come back one day for sure!

Me and the wife, Enjoyed our stay.
To think that building is over 500 year's old. They did a great job, Making it your own wee Castle, With all the mod con's.
Great location, not far from Peebles, Which had plenty of restaurant's to choose from. Highly recommended.

When looking for somewhere to stay, I wanted a holiday not just of place - but of time; somewhere that the mindset and chaos of modern life really couldn’t reach. And I found that unique combination when I found Barns Tower. Consider the snuggly box-bed where I’d read late into the night, the open fires, the nascent, ghostly hoots of owls coming out to play with the stars, or the luxurious deep bath that amply takes two, it ticked everything off my list, and a few more things beside. There’s a wood and a walled garden within feet of the front door, and a multitude of walks just a little further on. Lulu and her team, including the formidably efficient Katarina, give a genuine welcome and are justifiably passionate about the area. Peebles itself is a brisk and friendly little market town, with its fair share of notable attractions, while day trips to Edinburgh and Glasgow make for a lively contrast. The area is sublime, the people wonderful, and if you go, you will never forget it.

description.summary: Authentic medieval mini castle with roaring log fires and all modern comforts. In beautiful countryside on the River Tweed.  Ideal for exploring the Scottish Borders. Biking at Glentress 5 minutes; Edinburgh 45 minutes; Peebles nearby. Heavenly walks. If Barns Tower happens to be booked when you want to stay, we do have two other luxurious properties right next door at Barns Cottage and Barns Bothy, both available through Airbnb.
description.space: Enjoy staying in a cosy, romantic miniature castle with all the luxuries of the 21st century. There is a luxurious double bed on the top floor and a possible 2 extra single beds in the Sitting Room.
description.access: Linen, towels, heating and firewood are included, as well as wifi and a selection of toiletries. It is possible to arrange a private visit to Neidpath Castle if you should wish.
description.notes:
The Tower is ancient with open fires and fairly steep stairs, so not very convenient for small children or those unable to walk.

We welcome pets at a cost of £35 per pet, per stay. Please keep your dog on a lead around all farm animals and clean up and dispose of dog waste appropriately.
description.neighborhood: The rolling hills and romantic valleys of Peebleshire  are some of the loveliest in the land. World class Glentress is nearby for keen mountain bikers and Peebles is full of charm, with an award winning chocolatier and plenty of interesting shops.
description.transit: It is essential to have your own transport, be it car or bike. Edinburgh airport and train station are about 50 minutes drive. Peebles is 4 miles away.
description.interaction: There is a housekeeper nearby if you should have any queries, but otherwise you have complete privacy.
description.house_rules:
When booking, please specify the number of guests. 

Up to 2 dogs are welcome, for a fee of £30 each. Please ask if you would like to bring one, and we will send you a 'payment link' for the payment via airbnb. 

For visits of a week or more, a complimentary tour of Neidpath Castle is offered. For shorter visits, a reduced price of £30 is charged for a tour, which can be arranged.

We are happy to provide free internet and broadband, however if we are notified by our provider that you have used illegal software to access films etc, during your stay, we reserve the right to prosecute. 

There is firewood provided for a fire each day of your stay, but if you require more we can arrange it for a small extra charge of £10 per bag.

description.neighborhood: Ulverston's central street is paved with cobblestones, and the town itself has a historic feel. It has many unique stores, cafes, and pubs serving up real fires and a variety of brews. From five-star restaurants to neighbourhood pubs, there is truly something for every palate. Ulverston is also well-known as a festival town, hosting a variety of events throughout the summer (including flag and walking festivals, as well as art and music festivals, and the world-famous Dickensian Christmas festival in late November). Stan Laurel was born there, and the town holds the record for the largest foam pie fight in the world, so you can imagine it's a pretty fun place to visit. It is possible to take pleasant strolls in the scenic countryside around Morecambe Bay and the southern Lake District. Featuring the world's deepest, widest, and shortest canal, this area is perfect for a leisurely stroll in the afternoon, thanks to the nearby pub and beautiful views of the bay. It's also easy to get to any of the National Park's sights. Beaches and excellent birdwatching can both be found along the Furness Coast. Popular Birkrigg Common, which offers breathtaking views of Morecambe Bay, is also close by, as is the South Lakes Wild Animal Park and Lakes Windermere and Coniston.

hosts.about: Husband, father, stepfather. Love my family, travel and new experiences.

recent.comments: It was a great experience all around!

items.comments: It was a great experience all around!

From the moment we arrived, Eric and his family welcomed us in to their stunning and well equipped home, provided us with everything we needed and gave us great recommendations for local sights, trails and food spots

The place itself is spectacular, steeped in history and is impeccably clean. You can lounge by the pool, grill, relax with a drink at night or dine in the lavish dining room - all of which we did and would absolutely do again. FYI considering this place has been in many movies the pictures really do not do it the justice it deserves !!!!

Couldn’t have asked for more welcoming, genuine, down to earth hosts or a better location to get away with during unprecedented times - it’s really somewhere where you can balance relaxation with hiking, visiting breweries / cideries, antiquing and even visiting Baltimore in ~20 mins

I would 100% recommend the property, the location and our gracious hosts to anyone in future and would hope to go back again some day
A unique, historic site with lovely hosts and great outdoor spaces!

Eric and Patricia's home is every bit as stunning and unique as its pictures--loads of character and charm. I rented the house for my bride-to-be to get ready in and for our wedding night. It was an exciting and hectic time for us, but our hosts were incredibly generous with their time and communication to make sure my wife and I had a wonderful experience. And we did! We can't thank them enough for their hospitality and friendliness.
Great stay! Great location! Thanks for everything!
Beautiful home, hosted a 12 person party here and the hosts were reasonable and accomodating.

Amazing mansion in the lovely town of ellicott city. The decor is really something to marvel at, and the grounds are really beautiful. Eric was prompt to respond to all inquiries and mar my colleagues and I feel right at home. Definitely recommend this home if you need to be near Baltimore / D.C. but want something more unique than just your average hotel!

description.summary: Welcome to Lilburn Mansion, also known as the Castle! We appreciate your interest in this beautiful 160-year-old historic mansion that we call home.
description.space:
COVID note.  Absolutely NO POOL PARTIES 
Welcome to Lilburn Mansion, also known as the Castle! We appreciate your interest in this beautiful 160-year-old historic mansion that we call home. The Castle is our primary residence and our pride and joy. We welcome anybody that would like a chance to relax and enjoy the peace and serenity of our historic home. Our home has been host to productions that have appeared on Discovery Channel, Discovery Science, A&E, and full-length feature films.  The Castle is a tranquil setting in the woods but walking distance to beautiful, historic downtown old Ellicott City.  

The Castle is close enough to Baltimore, DC, and BWI to make it an excellent base for the National Capital Region. 

If you are looking for a perfect romantic getaway or an opportunity for peace and solitude, we would love to be your hosts.  

To save a bit of time for you and us, we want to be precise. The Castle is not a party pad or location for obscene photoshoots or productions.  We do NOT rent our property for pool parties of any kind, so please do not ask.  

Price listed is based on up to 4 people and is not negotiable. Each additional person/child is $100 per night.

We do host weddings, tv/movie productions, professional photo shoots, and tasteful events.
Contact us for separate and additional pricing.
description.access: Kitchen, pool, grounds, outdoor spaces, library, ball room, basement for an extra charge. Beyond 4 guests will be at an extra charge.
description.notes:
If the main house is rented the  owner some times stays in the basement with a separate entrance and locks from the main house inside. The owner may be at the pool or at another area outside. The owners will do their best to avoid guests outdoors so you will have a private visit. 

The ballroom and library  is off limits for drinks and food unless contracted for an event. Food and drink are limited to the kitchen, dining room, and outdoors. Drink coasters and placemats  are provided to protect the surfaces of the dining room table. Please do not place drinks or other hot, cold or wet items  on other wood furniture or marble surfaces. Guests will be charged for damage to surfaces, rugs, and furniture. 

The pool is for guests staying at the house only or as a decoration for an event. Absolutely no pool parties. Swimming is at your own risk and guests are liable for any incident that occurs in the pool. All safety rules must be abided by without fail. 

Children must be supervised at all times in and around the home and pool.

All items in cabinets and shelves must remain in place. Please do not attempt to open locked or closed closets, cabinets, or drawers. Please don’t attempt to go above the second floor, attic, or basement.

WiFi is provided on a limited basis and is spotty at best. We don’t guarantee a good connection so we specifically do not have WiFi listed as an amenity. The house is solid stone and has serious challenges with WiFi. 

There is a county noise ordinance that must be obeyed at midnight. 

Please don’t block the driveway of the neighbor, drive on our grass or park in the neighbors driveway.
description.neighborhood: Quaint historic Main Street! Great place to shop and eat. The property is quiet and cozy!  Walking distance to Patapsco River.
description.transit: MARC/BWI
description.interaction: As often as they like
description.house_rules: No parties unless contracted out for parties separately with the owner. TV productions, photo shoots, or events are different pricing please contact the owner.  We have hosted many TV productions and wedding here. Please respect the antiques and wood and don't place wet drinks or items that scratch or destroy antiques. Any wet ring damage to furniture, rugs, or surfaces will be charged to the guests staying. No food or drink  is allowed in the ballroom or library. All closets and cabinets  that are locked or closed throughout the house (minus the kitchen cooking supplies and dishes) must remain closed. Do not enter the attic, upper floors, or basement under any circumstances.

description.summary: It's rare to find a place that's both historic and one of a kind. Tan-yr-Ogo Lodge is a castle conceived as one of a series of lodges to serve Gwrych Castle and was originally the principal and ceremonial entrance to the estate. Tan-yr-Ogo or more correctly, Tan yr Ogof, translates to 'beneath the cave', and is nestled below Lady Emily's Tower and the great cave of Cefn Yr Ogof, all part of the Gwrych Castle Estate.
description.space:
Tan-yr-Ogo Lodge is a monumental gate lodge built as the ceremonial entrance to Gwrych Castle, forming courtyards and an elaborate complex of structures. 

The rooms are in a recently refurbished elevated section of the complex providing a mini castle experience. The battlements contain four recessed sandstone inscription tablets. These commemorate various historical events which have taken place on this important strategic site over the past thousand years: 

1) the battle between Harold II and Griffith ap Llewelyn
2) the routing of Hugh Lupus on his way to invade Anglesey
3) the repulsion of Henry II by Owain Gwynedd
4) the betrayal of Richard II by Henry Percy, Earl of Northumberland, as imortalised in Shakespeare's history play. 

Passing under a huge stone Tudor-arched entrance gateway, into an inner courtyard, the drive turns ninety degrees and rises past more towers and walls to reveal the lodge itself. There are least eleven towers set within the curtain walls and the accommodation is set within two of the largest towers which are linked by a long gallery. 

ACCOMMODATION:
The heavy oak door leads into a single storey barbican Entrance Hall which contains the Kitchen and Dining Room, leading to the Drawing Room with two sofa beds and a feature fireplace with a wood burning stove. A ground floor twin room is located in the West Tower and an adjacent oak staircase that is built over the exposed bedrock takes you to the first floor. There is also a recently refurbished downstairs cloakroom with sink and toilet. 

The light and airy landing leads to the second bedroom which has bunk beds, along with the Art Deco bathroom with the benefit of an architect designed freestanding bath and walk-in shower. The long gallery leads to the Master Bedroom in the first floor of the East Tower, and provides breathtaking sea and countryside views. The master bedroom has an antique double four poster mahogany bed and the same spectacular views.

To the front of the lodge are extensive and private gardens for the whole family to enjoy, consisting of a seating area, lawn and access to Gwrych Castle’s 9 miles of permissive woodland walks.

PLEASE NOTE:
We have The Gothic Bedroom which is a self-contained suite available within the complex, please see the last photo. This is available to let separately and has its own patio and parking space.

GWRYCH CASTLE TICKETS:
If you would like to visit Gwrych Castle, we’re able to offer 25% off admission tickets. Once full payment has been made for your booking, please contact us to book your timeslot. Please check Gwrych Castle’s website for latest opening dates/times. Please ensure that you show proof of booking on arrival.
description.access: Guests are welcome to drop off and pick up from outside the front door into the lodge but we ask that they park in the designated parking spaces marked out.
description.notes: We are very low key and suit private minded guests. We won't bother you but our team will be available if you need anything. Please feel free to message us with any queries before or during your stay.
description.neighborhood: We are based in Llanddulas, on the Gwrych Castle Estate, in an exceptionally beautiful part of the North Wales coast. The locality is peppered with monuments, fine walks, castles, lovely tourist towns like Llandudno and Conwy, Snowdonia National Park and beautiful scenery in all directions. All this within an hour and a half's journey to Liverpool and Manchester by car or by train.
description.transit: The lodge is less than five minutes drive to Junction 23 of the A55 and is situated on the A547.  There are two bus stops outside the main gates which are on the principal routes. The closest railways stations are at Colwyn Bay (10 minutes drive) and Abergele-Pensarn (10 minutes drive).  No commercial vehicles or motor homes/caravans may be parked on the property.
description.house_rules:
Please take great care when entering and exiting the lodge from the A547. It can be a very fast road and due to the large towers, blind spots exist. 

Please keep all dogs under control in the grounds of the lodge as there may be gaps in fences to the surrounding land. 

Please be respectful of other guests staying at the lodge.

description.neighborhood: Ulverston is an old-fashioned market town with a cobblestone central street. There are many unique stores, cafes, and pubs to explore, all of which serve up delicious food and cold pints of beer. A wide variety of restaurants, from upscale eateries to neighbourhood pubs, are available to satisfy any appetite. Ulverston is well-known as a festival town, hosting events like the Flag and Walking Festival, the Art and Music Festival, and the World-Famous Dickensian Christmas Festival, all throughout the summer and into late November. Stan Laurel was born in this town, and the annual foam pie fight held there holds the record for largest in the world. Great walks in scenic countryside with views of Morecambe Bay and the southern Lake District can be found all around the town. The deepest, widest, and shortest canal in the world can be found here, and it makes for a great afternoon stroll with a pub and bay views at its conclusion. The National Park's various points of interest can also be quickly and conveniently reached. Sand beaches and excellent birdwatching can be found along the Furness Coast. The South Lakes Wild Animal Park, Lakes Windermere and Coniston, and the breathtaking views of Morecambe Bay from Birkrigg Common are all within easy driving distance and are great for families.

description.summary: Elegant and imposing, Wilton castle is a 19th century castellated residence set on the banks of the Boro River specializing in luxury accommodation in the sunny south-east of Ireland. Wilton Castle is surrounded by open parkland and quiet wooded countryside. A part of the local landscape since 1247, when the first fortified tower was built on the land.

items.comments: Art was a fantastic host and his place was a dream.  Our family had a fantastic time and the church/house was laid out so well so that everyone in the group had a place to relax.  The game room and the lower level dining area were our favourite places to get together and we will definitely be returning to this place in the future.  Thank you Art once again for hosting us!

We spent a weekend at Art’s place and had a lovely time. The “castle” was a little hidden gem. It was comfortable, clean, stocked well and was really just the perfect spot for a little get away. Our university aged kids loved the chapel. The art work was eclectic and fit the space perfectly. The local attraction cards were a great touch. We would absolutely  recommend and revisit!

We booked for our staff doing an event at Berlin Klassik.  It slept 12 people comfortably and could sleep more if you want to include all the couches!   We love the kitchen, it is spacious and was perfect for our food truck staff to prepare for the event.  2 of us were DJs booked for the event and the wifi was important for us.  Super fast internet, I did not need to use my Starlink.  I was also able to charge my Tesla with my regular 120V connector under the deck/beside the stairs which was easy to get to.

Art has pretty much everything thought-out for the entire venue.  Although it is a church converted to a residential living quarters, it's got an interesting twist of unique art throughout the place.  

Art's place will definitely be on the list for Berlin Klassik staff!

Thank-you again Art!
The place was as to expectation, lots of space and things to do. Art was very good at communicating when it came to questions and concerns.
We had a great time! Would book again.

Just finished my second stay at Art's absolutely incredible property.

Art is extremely responsive, check-in and check-out were very simple and Art left us great instructions at both ends.

11/10 will certainly stay again!
Fantastic space to collect with loved ones!

description.summary:
Don't be a bird. Stay in a large 100-year old church conversion like a peacock. Short drive to the beach. Lots of amenities. Lots of space to spread your wings. Perfect for family reunions who like to play together. 

PLEASE READ
I was really hoping I wouldn't have to write this but unfortunately I do. Please do not book this place if you are planning to have a party or bring a lot more people than you indicate on the request. It will be a waste of time as I will simply ask you to leave.

description.summary:
Rowallan New Castle is a large mansion within a beautiful private estate, complete with a 19 hole championship golf course. 

We have a further accommodation on the estate with four large bedrooms, all en-suite, and may be rented at the same time for larger groups.
description.space:
There are eleven bedrooms on two floors, with a lift to both floors. All our bedrooms have televisions and are ensuite with beautiful cast iron baths. Our super king beds are made up with 500tc Egyptian cotton and luxurious  bathrobes and Arran Aromatics toiletries are provided for the use of guests. Nine of the spacious bedrooms can be changed to twins, whilst one bedroom is a single. Two also have a sofa bed in a separate area, and can be made up at an additional cost. 


On the ground floor there is a large comfortable lounge with plenty of seating for all, and an adjacent bar which can be fully stocked on request. The breakfast room, seating up to thirty, is located on this floor, and can also be used for lunch or evening meals. Breakfast is additional and can be served at a time of your choosing. All catering in the Castle is provided by us.

There will be a full time member of staff to help make your stay memorable, which is included in the overall price.  We provide full or partial catering, and our award winning team of chefs can create bespoke menus for any occasions, be it a relaxed barbecue or a five course fine dining experience. If preferred, the popular Glasshouse Restaurant  is a mere two minute walk away,  where Castle guests will receive a 10% discount. The golf club is also located here, and preferential rates are offered to guests who may wish to test their golfing ability on our 19 hole Colin Montgomerie course!
description.transit: Car or taxi is best for leaving the estate on excursions. 5 mins away to nearest train station (Kilmaurs) which takes you directly in to Glasgow
description.interaction: Available to contact via phone, email or text for the duration of guests stay.

We had the best time here! The surroundings were peaceful and beautiful. Close enough to Belfast for day trips, and lots of fun outdoor activities in the surrounding areas. Would love to stay here again!
Very enjoyable and comfortable stay

Travelling with a party of 4 adults I have to say it was better than I imagined. The apartment was beautifully designed spotless and the location could not have been better. If I have one fault to make there is no sign outside on the road for the castle. We spent ages going around trying to find it. Please put up a sign on the road to highlight the entrance. I would definately go back. 5 star.
Un grand logement au calme dans un cadre magnifique. Jardin gigantesque magnifiquement bien entretenue. On recommande
We enjoyed our stay very much!  The apartment was beyond what we expected and the tour of the castle by Marcus was a bonus.  Highly recommend!
Enjoyed staying at Narrow Water Castle.  Only wish could have a private tour inside the castle but totally understand it is a private residence.

description.summary:
This newly renovated, luxury apartment is situated at the majestic Narrow Water Castle. The original building dates back to the 1680s.

This 2 bedroom luxury apartment is the perfect place to escape and unwind. Both bedrooms are en-suite. There is a grand open plan living /dining area with feature skylight and exposed beams. The living area has also got a quality sofa bed, allowing the apartment to accommodate up to 6 people. The kitchen is fully equipped.
description.space: he apartment looks out across the estate farmland, as far as Warrenpoint and Carlingford Bay. The landscaped gardens provide unrivalled idyllic castle views in this truly unique setting.
description.access:
Guests can enjoy the beautiful landscaped gardens, walks across the estate farmland and forest and even book to go horseriding at the equestrian centre.
The main castle building is a private family home and is generally not open to the public. Occasionally the castle is hired for private events.

hosts.about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.
