It was the most fantastic, incredible, enchanting place I've ever been.  Dragon cake, fresh flowers, view, hot tub, antiques that were amazing. The history there and the way the host went over and above is beyond what you can imagine. You will never regret going to the Castle.
Great place!  Looks like pictures. Enjoyed our stay. Recommended

We had a fabulous 3 day stay at the Schweitzer Castle! You could easily stay in the castle the entire time or ski into the resort. The castle was full of treasures and antiques! There was additional touches that made the castle memorable, like the indoor hot tub overlooking the outdoors, fresh flowers, a dragon cake and the huge fireplace! We loved everything about this Airbnb. We can’t wait to return!

One of the coolest places I've stayed! We loved the castle and its decor. The kitchen is well-stocked and the large dining table was perfect for our group. We enjoyed the hot tub after skiing, and the quick cat track to ski down to the resort was a huge perk. And the dragon cake from the host was a delicious surprise. We hope to be back!!
Trip of a lifetime

description.space:
The Castle - Chateau De Melusine Once upon a time, there stood an enchanted castle on a hill... Perched on Schweitzer Mountain, one mile above the Schweitzer Mountain Resort, with a private, enclosed hot tub overlooking the slopes, and exquisitely themed decor from floor to tower, The Castle - Chateau De Melusine, offers guests an experience unlike any other! This true living stone castle presents three levels of otherworldly comforts with a blend of modern amenities and old-world features like hand-laid stones, statues, and curved staircases. The dramatic great hall boasts a vaulted ceiling, hydronic-heat floors of Idaho Quartzite, a cozy living area with a 50' wood-burning fireplace, a well-equipped, kitchenette with colorful stained glass windows, and a grand dining table ready for hearty banquets or memorable game nights. This home also includes a private hot tub room with breathtaking mountain views. Whether you're here for the ultimate ski-cation, a newlywed getaway, or a family adventure, let The Castle - Chateau De Melusine transport you and your guests into your world of fantasy. Hotel rooms are soon forgotten, and memories last a lifetime! Sandpoint and the surrounding area are brimming with fun activities no matter the season! Ski the slopes of Schweitzer Mountain Resort in winter, or hike and mountain bike on the trails in summer. Just a mile north, grab a slice at Powder Hound Pizza or head down the hill into Sandpoint where you'll find Lake Pend Oreille access at City Beach Park, restaurants, brewpubs, museums, and great local shopping, all just 13 miles from your door. THINGS TO KNOW A seasonal gas grill and picnic area are available for guest use. An electric vehicle charger is included. This is a ski-in/ski-out home, but for experts only. Please note that the owner lives on-site in a secondary structure on the property. Please note that a four-wheel drive vehicle is required from October 31st to April 30th. 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.
Parking notes: There is free parking for 3 vehicles.
Damage waiver: The total cost of your reservation for this Property includes a damage waiver fee which covers you for up to $3,000 of accidental damage to the Property or its contents (such as furniture, fixtures, and appliances) as long as you report the incident to the host prior to checking out. More information can be found from the "Additional rules" on the checkout page. Due to local laws or HOA requirements, guests must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation.
description.transit: 4WD/Traction May Be Required In Winter
description.house_rules:
By booking this reservation, you agree to the additional policies, terms, and conditions below.

UNIT SPECIFIC TERMS

- Due to local laws or HOA requirements, guests must be at least 25 years of age to book. Guests under 25 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian for the duration of the reservation.
- 2 dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.
- The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation.
- All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m.
- If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee.
- No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises.
- No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures may not be erected.
- Renter is liable for any damage to the property and agrees to accept charges to the card on file should damage occur during occupancy.
- Due to local laws, regulations, or Homeowner Association rules, guests may be required to agree to additional terms of service. A signed paper contract is required to be completed and returned to Vacasa.
 - Property Specific terms: 

DAMAGE WAIVER

The total cost of your reservation for this Property includes a damage waiver fee (USD) with the following costs, plus tax if applicable:
0 bedrooms: $60 for stays 1-3 nights, $15 per night for stays 4+ nights.
1 bedrooms: $60 for stays 1-3 nights, $15 per night for stays 4+ nights.
2 bedrooms: $80 for stays 1-3 nights, $20 per night for stays 4+ nights.
3 bedrooms: $100 for stays 1-3 nights, $25 per night for stays 4+ nights.
4 bedrooms: $100 for stays 1-3 nights, $25 per night for stays 4+ nights.
5 bedrooms: $120 for stays 1-3 nights, $30 per night for stays 4+ nights.
6 bedrooms: $120 for stays 1-3 nights, $30 per night for stays 4+ nights.
7 bedrooms: $140 for stays 1-3 nights, $35 per night for stays 4+ nights.
8 bedrooms: $140 for stays 1-3 nights, $35 per night for stays 4+ nights.

The Damage Waiver covers you for up to $3,000 of accidental damage to the Property or its contents (such as furniture, fixtures, and appliances) as long as you report the incident to Vacasa prior to checking out. The Damage Waiver fee eliminates the need for a traditional security deposit.

How to Report Damage
Please report accidental damage as soon as it occurs so we can assess and minimize the extent of the damages. 

Damage Waiver Additional Terms and Conditions
The Damage Waiver only covers damage that occurs during the authorized rental period and that Renter or an authorized guest reports PRIOR TO CHECK OUT.
The Damage Waiver does not cover intentional damage or damage caused by smoking, pets or other animals brought onto the Property, or criminal activity.
The Damage Waiver does not cover damage to any structure other than the Property covered by your confirmed, non-fraudulent reservation.
Renter is responsible for any accidental damage that exceeds $3,000. Damages for covered claims in excess of $3,000 or for uncovered claims will be charged to the Renters credit card.
The Damage Waiver program is provided and administered by Vacasa and is not an insurance policy. The Damage Waiver does not provide liability coverage and does not cover vehicles or guest personal items.




ADDITIONAL TERMS FOR VACASA ACCOMMODATIONS

These Additional Terms for Vacasa Accommodations, including any applicable Unit-Specific Terms (as defined below) (collectively, the “Vacasa Terms”), apply to your Airbnb booking of the vacation rental property specified in a confirmed reservation (the “Property”). In case of any conflict between the Vacasa Terms and the Airbnb Terms of Service (“Airbnb Terms”) that apply to your reservation, the Airbnb Terms will control.

These Vacasa Terms are between: (1) Vacasa (“Vacasa,” “we,” or “us”), acting for itself and for the owner of the Property (“Owner”), and (2) the person who is the responsible renter of the Property (collectively “Renter” or “you”). You acknowledge that you have read and understand, and agree to be bound by, all terms, conditions, and policies in these Vacasa Terms.

Certain jurisdictions, resorts, and specific homes require renters to agree to additional terms and conditions (“Unit-Specific Terms”). If any provision of the Unit-Specific Terms differs from the general provisions of the Vacasa Terms, the provision of the Unit-Specific Terms will control.

Vacasa operates using different legal entities in different geographical regions. As used in these Vacasa Terms, the term “Vacasa” means the entity specified in the Unit-Specific Terms, if any. If no entity is specified in the Unit-Specific Terms, then:
·   If the Property is located in the United States or Mexico, Vacasa means Vacasa LLC.
·   If Property is located in Europe (meaning one of the countries of the European Union or Switzerland), Vacasa means Vacasa Europe AG.
·   If the Property is located in Canada, Vacasa means Vacasa Canada ULC.
·   If the Property is located in South Africa, Vacasa means Vacasa South Africa (PTY) Ltd.
·   If the Property is located in one of the following countries in Latin America or the Caribbean, then Vacasa means:
            o   In Belize: Vacasa Belize Ltd.
            o   In Chile: Vacation Rental SpA
            o   In Colombia: Vacasa Colombia S.A.S.
            o   In Costa Rica: Vacasa del Pacífico Central de Costa Rica Ltda
            o   In the Dominican Republic: Vacasa, S.A.S.
            o   In Honduras: Vacasa Honduras S. DE R.L.
            o   In Nicaragua: Vacasa Nicaragua S.R.L y CÍA LTDA
            o   In Uruguay: Vacasa Uruguay, S.R.L.


POLICIES AND ADDITIONAL TERMS

A. Minimum Age. The “Minimum Age” to rent the Property is the age specified in any Unit-Specific Terms. If no age is specified in the Unit-Specific Terms, the Minimum Age is 21 years of age (or the minimum age required by law in the jurisdiction where the Property is located, if different). You agree to provide us with proof of age upon request. A parent or legal guardian must accompany all guests who are under the Minimum Age for the entire duration of the rental.

B. Maximum Occupancy.  The number of people present at the Property may not exceed the maximum posted occupancy.

C. Good Neighbor Policy.  Because the Property is a privately owned home, all Occupants must comply with this good neighbor policy:
-   Please treat the Property with the same care you would use with your own residence and leave it in the same condition it was in when you arrived.
-   To prevent theft of or damage to furnishings or your personal property, you agree to close and lock doors and windows when you are not present at the Property and upon check-out.
-   You and other Occupants agree to conduct yourselves throughout your stay in a manner that is respectful of and not disruptive to neighbors, traffic flow, or the community and that will not prompt complaints to Vacasa from police, neighbors, or neighborhood or homeowner associations.
-   Noise audible outside the Property is prohibited between 10 p.m. and 8 a.m.
-   You and other Occupants agree to abide by all applicable parking restrictions and limitations.

D. No Smoking.  No smoking is permitted at the Property (including porches, decks or outdoor areas) at any time.

E. No Permanent Residence. You agree that your use of the Property is on a temporary and transient basis only; that you may not use the Property as a permanent residence; and that your permanent residence is and will remain elsewhere than at the Property.

F. Animals.  We accept assistance animals in line with Airbnb's Nondiscrimination Policy. No other animals or pets of any kind are permitted at the Property except as specifically authorized in your reservation. You also agree that we cannot and do not guarantee that no animals have been in the Property prior to your use or that the Property is free of animal or pet allergens, even if the Property listing states that pets are prohibited or includes a similar description.

G. Events; Commercial Photography; Structures; Charcoal Grills. Parties and other events are prohibited at the Property. Commercial photography and filming are also prohibited at the Property without our express written permission. (If approved, applicable occupancy limits and other rules under Airbnb's Party and Events Policy will apply, and additional conditions and fees may apply.) No tents or other structures may be erected on the property. The use of charcoal grills is prohibited.

H. Criminal Activity Prohibited. Use of the Property for any criminal activity is prohibited and may result in fines, prosecution, and/or your immediate removal from the Property. This prohibition extends to use of the Property’s internet service, if any, for criminal activity, including but not limited to unlawful downloads of copyrighted material, including movies, music, software, or other material. We may cooperate with any investigation of alleged criminal activity that occurred at the Property during your stay.

I. Consequences of Breach; Charges for Damage. Any failure by you or any other Occupants to comply with any of the terms, conditions, or policies above is a breach of these Vacasa Terms and may result in a forfeiture of your rights to rent the Property, up to and including immediate removal from the Property without refund and with or without the assistance of law enforcement. Vacasa may terminate your occupancy of the Property for breach, and if you are notified of such termination you agree to leave the Property immediately. In addition, subject to Airbnb’s damage claim policies, you are responsible for (1) any damage or loss that occurs at the Property during your stay; (2) a charge of up to $1,000 for violations of the pet policy, including for bringing more pets or different types of pets than specifically authorized; (3) an additional cleaning fee of up to $500 (or the actual cost of cleaning services, if greater) for violations of any of the guest policies above (other than the pet policy) or for excessive cleaning required by the acts or omissions of any Occupant during your stay; and (4) any fines issued by police, other government officials or agencies, utility providers, and/or homeowner associations for violation of any law, ordinance, or rule during your stay, and any damages (which may exceed the amount of fines) that result from the violation. If any unauthorized download of copyrighted material via the Property’s Internet service occurs during the period of your stay, you agree that we may obtain and share your contact information with the internet service provider or any other party we believe, for any reason, has enforcement rights.

J. Early Check-In/Late Check-Out.  Early check-in or late check-out may be available; additional charges may apply. If you do not vacate by check-out time (or late check-out time as agreed by Vacasa), you authorize us to charge a late departure fee of up to one night’s rental and we may remove all Occupants and their personal property from the Property.

K. Maintenance or Housekeeping Issues; Property Conditions. The Property is provided as is, and we are not responsible for the inoperability or unavailability of any amenities. You agree to contact Vacasa, using the contact information provided in your confirmation email, as soon as you notice any maintenance or housekeeping problem, or any potentially hazardous condition, at the Property, or if any incident occurs at the Property that is related to such a problem or condition. You further agree to give Vacasa a reasonable amount of time to respond to your report and to cooperate with Vacasa’s efforts to address the concern or provide a remedy. We will take reasonable and appropriate steps to remedy any reported problem as soon as practicable. We may enter the Property at your invitation to remedy any problem you report, at reasonable times and with reasonable notice to inspect, maintain, or repair the Property, and to address any situation that we reasonably deem an emergency that threatens persons or property. You acknowledge that if the Property has access to amenities that are shared with other properties, such as a shared pool, hot tub, parking lot, or fitness center, that the availability and condition of those amenities is outside Vacasa’s control.

L. Choice of Law; Jurisdiction and Venue; Dispute Resolution.

L.1. Choice of Law. Unless otherwise specified in any Unit-Specific Terms or if a different choice of law is required by the law of the jurisdiction in which the Property is located: If the Property is outside Europe, these Vacasa Terms shall be governed by laws of the State of Oregon, U.S.A, without regard to its conflict-of-law provisions. If the Property is in Europe, these Vacasa Terms shall be governed by the laws of Switzerland, without regard to its conflict-of-law provisions.

L.2. Dispute Resolution and Arbitration Agreement: United States. If (a) your claim against Vacasa relates in any way to a reservation for or stay at a Property located in the United States, or (b) you bring any other claim against Vacasa in the United States (to the extent permitted by these Vacasa Terms or the Airbnb Terms) (any such dispute, claim, or controversy under either (a) or (b) a “US Claim”), then you agree to resolve the US Claim as follows:

a. Agreement to Arbitrate. You and Vacasa mutually agree that any US Claim will be settled by binding arbitration rather than in court, such arbitration to be conducted by the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”) under its Consumer Arbitration Rules, or such other AAA arbitration rules that the AAA decides to be applicable to a specific dispute, that are in effect as of the time of service of an arbitration demand. Payment of filing, administration and arbitrator fees will be governed by the AAA's rules. To begin an arbitration, a party must send a letter to the other party requesting arbitration and describing the claim. If Vacasa requests arbitration, it will send the letter to your most recent email or physical address in Vacasa’s records. If you request arbitration, you must send the letter to Vacasa’s registered agent in the state in which the Property you reserved or stayed at is located, or if the dispute does not involve a reservation for or stay at a specific property, to Vacasa’s registered agent in the state of Oregon.

b. Place of Arbitration. The arbitration shall take place in the county in which the Property is located, or in Portland, Oregon, if the dispute does not involve a reservation for or stay at a specific property, or in such other location as you and Vacasa may mutually agree.

c. Exceptions to Arbitration Requirement. As the only exceptions to the agreement to submit all US Claims to binding arbitration as provided herein, Vacasa and Renter both retain the right to pursue: (1) in small claims court in the county in which the Property is located (or if the dispute does not involve a reservation for a specific property, the small claims court for Multnomah County, Oregon), any claim that is within that court’s jurisdiction, and the parties consent to the personal jurisdiction and venue of such court; and (2) a suit in any court with jurisdiction to enjoin (whether by temporary, preliminary, or permanent injunctive relief) infringement or other misuse of intellectual property rights.

L.3. Dispute Resolution: Outside the United States.
Europe: If you are a resident of Europe and your claim relates in any way to a reservation for or stay at a Property located in Europe, you and Vacasa consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the courts in Zurich or Zug, Switzerland. If applicable law prohibits exclusive jurisdiction over your claim in Switzerland, then you and Vacasa agree to the non-exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the courts in Zurich or Zug, Switzerland, or your jurisdiction of residence.
Outside Europe: If your claim relates in any way to a reservation for or stay at a Property located outside of Europe or the United States, you and Vacasa agree to bring any action in the courts of the country in which the Property is located, or in such other location and forum as you and Vacasa may mutually agree.

L.4. Class Action and Jury Trial Waiver. You and Vacasa agree that any dispute resolution proceedings will be conducted only on an individual basis and not in a class, consolidated or representative action. If for any reason a claim proceeds in court rather than in arbitration, you and Vacasa waive any right to a jury trial.

M. Limitation of Liability. TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, IN NO CASE SHALL THE OWNER OF THE PROPERTY OR VACASA, NOR THEIR AFFILIATES, NOR THEIR RESPECTIVE OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, OR OWNERS, BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, OR FOR ANY DAMAGES FOR PERSONAL OR BODILY INJURY, EMOTIONAL DISTRESS, OR DAMAGE TO PROPERTY, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH YOUR STAY AT THE PROPERTY. THIS LIMITATION APPLIES TO ALL CLAIMS FOR DAMAGES WHETHER BASED ON A THEORY OF WARRANTY, CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING ORDINARY NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF VACASA HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE AND EVEN IF THE  LIMITED REMEDY SET FORTH HEREIN IS FOUND TO HAVE FAILED OF ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE.

N. Indemnity. You agree to hold harmless and indemnify Vacasa and Owner, and their respective affiliates, for and from all claims for property damage, personal injury, or monetary loss resulting from your actions or omissions, and the actions or omissions of other Occupants, during or relating to your stay.

O. Substitution of Property. On rare occasions, due to ownership changes, properties being removed from rental use, or a need for extensive repairs or maintenance, the Property may not be available for rental on the dates of your reservation and Vacasa may have to cancel your booking. In this unlikely event, rebooking shall be subject to the Airbnb Terms for booking modifications.

P. Assignment. Vacasa may assign these Terms or any of its rights, or delegate any of its duties under these Terms, at any time without your consent.

gallery.caption: If you are interested in treating someone you love, please ask about our Kilmartin Castle gift cards.

Kilmartin Castle as it looked for 200yrs before restoration in the 1980's. We feel lucky it remained as a ruin through the Victorian period because at that time they usually made the windows bigger and extended. This castle remains original.
Kilmartin churchyard rolls down the hill and into the glen. It is the first thing you see when driving into the village.
Climb any hill and be rewarded with stunning views.
This is the lady's seat. If you look very closely you may be able to see the castle in the distance.
These standing stones have been here longer than Stonehenge.
Some of these standing stones are huge.
We recently climbed to an old hill fort in the next village of Ford. There is always something new to discover in this part of the world.
Island hopping is easy from the castle and so much fun
Carnasserie Castle was John Carswell's second home after Kilmartin Castle. Walking distance from us, it's worth a visit.
Oban, the gateway to the islands, is a 45 minute drive from the castle
Crinan basin has the world's cutest lighthouse and makes a great picnic spot
This is The Boathouse on Gigha. They do a fish curry to die for!

hosts.about:
We both fell head over heels in love with Scotland whilst on a road trip in 2014. Kilmartin was, by far, our favourite Scottish village! So, when Kilmartin Castle went up for sale, a few weeks after our holiday ended, we couldn't resist starting a new adventure. We sold all our worldly possessions and bought it. Simon was a Creative Director and I was a Travel Journalist & Radio Broadcaster. We spent 6 months renovating Kilmartin Castle in 2019 and now we are very excited to share it with you! 

We live at the castle with our super friendly cat, King Frank, whilst offering bed and breakfast and when the castle is booked for exclusive use all three of us head off travelling in our campervan. 

Well behaved dogs, and cats are welcome at Kilmartin Castle.

recent.comments: Everybody thought the highlight of the trip was here, and we stayed at 4 amazing other castles. It's so much better in person.

items.comments: Everybody thought the highlight of the trip was here, and we stayed at 4 amazing other castles. It's so much better in person.

Absolutely fabulous place. Everything on the website and other positive reviews are right on target. Simon's guide on what to do in the area was extremely helpful and informative. I would give the entire experience 10 stars if I could!

Fantastic.  Certainly one of the nicest places we've stayed in.  An ancient castle, eclectic hip decorations, and luxury accommodations.  A very short drive to trailheads leading to castles, cairns, standing stones and rock art.  We hired two of the chefs that Stef and Simon recommended for cooking dinners in the castle, and can't recommend that highly enough.  Less than an hour drive up to Oban for a nice day outing and Whisky tasting.  Of course, is a castle... lots of precarious stair climbing and no air conditioning.  As you would expect.

What a stunning place and wonderful hosts
We couldn’t have asked for more from our short break- we even loved the cold pond for a quick dip!
Special stay, very well equipped, beautiful village & great walks. Perfect location for friends & family.

I wish I could keep this sweet and perfect castle as our secret garden, it is that special. Our general rule as a family is to keep moving,  discovering.   So when we want to come back, that says a lot. Such a magical place. Also not in pictures, is the beautiful scent of the place. A blend of stone, beeswax, crisp linen and wood. Divine. Do go, no need to venture too far except in long walks and come back to a warm floor fully equipped kitchen where you can cook just about anything you’d like or soak in a deep bath. Or both.
Amazing. Hope to be able to return again some time in the future. It’s out of this world !

description.summary: Restoration of 16th Century Kilmartin Castle was completed in 2019. Located within the ancient landscape of Kilmartin Glen surrounded by 8,000 years of history. Standing stones, ancient hill forts, stone circles, burial tombs, & ancient rock carvings make this Glen one of Europe's most important areas, archeologically. Kilmartin Castle was Named #4 Best Places to Go in the World in  2023 by The New York Times
description.space:
When we travelled around Scotland, as tourists, we were disappointed that we couldn't find a castle to stay in that 'felt like a castle' once inside. We found a castle that had dodged the Victorian home improvement brigade, quit our sensible jobs, and set about creating the experience for visitors that we had hoped for. Plasterboard and down lighters became the modern day enemy of Kilmartin Castle! 

An authentic castle retreat, welcoming and warm, rustic and honest. The castle walls and floors have been deliberately left with their original aged patina. Interiors are a mix of antique furniture and original artworks and objects that we have lovingly collected over time. The kitchen is well equipped with two Bosch ovens, Neff induction hob, fridge freezer and a dishwasher so no-one has to draw the short straw there. The dining room sits 8-10 guests and the grand hall is a fabulous place to gather around the fire. A HD projector and retractable movie screen  transforms the grand hall into your own personal theatre room for movie nights together. The whisky snug is an excellent place to sneak off to with a good read. All five en suite bedrooms have been individually designed to retain the rustic magic of a 16th century castle while spoiling you with the comforts of modern living including wood burning stoves, extravagant walk in showers, roll top copper baths and of course, luxury bedding.

Our gardens have been landsacped by the award winning Chelsea Flower show garden designer Amber Crowley to include a bio diverse wild swimming pool, outdoor kitchen, orchard, sunken fire-pit, dining table and outdoor living space with a wood buring stove. The outdoor kitchen is full equipped with crockery, cutlery and hot running water sink. There is a large Kamado Joe, a BBQ and a pizza oven. 

We grow our own organic veggies, fruits, and herbs at the castle which you are welcome to enjoy. A stone shed has become outside toilets, complete with wood burner. This new addition is convenient for events, small weddings or anyone in need of a visit whilst enjoying the gardens. In early 2023 we will be building a glasshouse which will become a dining room in the garden providing shelter whould there be a Scottish rain shower whilst you are barbecueing. 

WiFi: We have a fast fibre optic broadband connection at the castle and 6 routers placed throughout, which automatically reconnect as you walk through the building. We understand that a lot of people like to be disconnected whilst travelling but at the same time it's nice to have the option and to be able to watch Netflix on an iPad if you choose to do so. 

Kilmartin Castle is the perfect place for a small wedding or elopements of up to 10 guests. Let us know if you have a few extras and we may be able to help.  The great thing about Scotland being that you can say 'I do' anywhere you like, as we did in the castle garden back in 2016.

There is a wedding surcharge of £1000 on the price of holiday accommodation should you wish to hold your wedding whilst staying at Kilmartin Castle. This includes a list of extra benefits including introduction to our personally selected group of wedding suppliers; private chef, celebrant, bagpiper, photography, floral designer, hair and makeup artists.
description.access:
Kilmartin Castle is yours to rule throughout your stay. Enjoy! As it takes a while to make the place lovely and clean for you, we do have to strictly stick to our check in and out times. We will welcome you with open arms from 4pm on the day of your arrival and be waving goodbye no later than 10am on the day of your departure. 

If you do arrive earlier than 4pm the good folk at the Kilmartin pub, are always happy to see you.
description.notes: We’ll happily introduce you to our private chef who can prepare an amazing locally sourced 3-5 course dinner for you in the castle dining room. We'll put you directly in touch to talk menus and prices once the booking is confirmed. She also makes a mean breakfast/brunch.
description.neighborhood: Kilmartin Glen has the largest number of historical finds within a six mile radius in all of Scotland. You can set off on amazing walks from the front door. We often describe it as an outdoor museum. Kilmartin Village has a great community vibe, an award winning museum / café and gift shop and a local pub serving real ales, Scottish single malts and great dinner, only a 3 minute walk away.
description.transit: In the village everything is within walking distance. We recommend you hire a car though so you can make the most of the surrounding areas. In the summer island hopping is a lot of fun and there are some incredible, off the beaten track restaurants to discover.
description.interaction: We are only a phone call away. Since its renovation, the castle is very good at looking after itself, so you shouldn't have any issues during your stay.
description.house_rules:
The castle is in a small village in the countryside. We ask that all of our guests respect the village by driving at a snails pace through it (children and cats roam free) and also do not make a noise nuisance. 

Fireworks are a strict NO as we are surrounded by farmland.

description.summary:
Reign in style in this majestic 17th-century castle in stunning Somerset countryside.

Steeped in history, Walton Castle has been renovated for modern living and offers a stunning location. With the woods of North Somerset on one side, and Wales across the Bristol Channel on the other, our Grade II listed hilltop castle enjoys 360-degree-views of some of the most beautiful landscape in Britain.
description.space:
The main part of the accommodation is housed across four levels in an octagonal keep, which sits in the centre of a beautifully maintained lawn and cobblestone courtyard.

On arriving through the main entrance hallway, steps take you up to the impressively large kitchen with beautiful circular granite dining table. There is a spiral staircase down to the lower ground floor where there are two double bedrooms which share a 'Jack and Jill' style en suite bathroom. On the first floor there is a grand sitting room with large stone fireplace and a 50” plasma TV. There is also a library and reading room through an archway. On the second floor, there is a magnificent master bedroom with en suite bathroom boasting a roll-top bath as well as a private terrace which is the perfect place from which to enjoy a drink while admiring the gorgeous views.

Surrounding the keep are eight turrets, each located 30 yards across the courtyard from the main building.

Superbly presented communal turrets include the 'entertainment turret', ideal for enjoying an aperitif over a game of pool, and the two largest turrets, equipped for larger groups, dining and dancing. We can recommend fabulous local caterers who can prepare and serve a feast with fresh local ingredients.

Five turrets are self-contained double bedroom suites, with soft furnishings and en suite showers. So you can enjoy the luxury of having space to be together or spaces to be apart.

Other social spots include the sunken patio with a stunning wooden hot tub, the indoor heated swimming pool and second patio area, perfect for barbecues. There are sitting spaces in the courtyard and during the summer months, the attractive lawns are ideal for larger groups. The gardens are secure so children and dogs can play and run free.

You can tailor your visit with a whole host of experiences and activities - including Castle Cluedo, medieval dinners, archery, wine tasting, outdoor pursuits and more.

THE LAYOUT
The Keep Ground Floor: 
Main entrance through to hallway. Steps up to kitchen with granite work surfaces and marble floor. The kitchen has a large circular granite and glass table that seats eight, with a banquette to the side where an additional 8 people may dine.
Spiral staircase to:
The Keep Lower Ground Floor:
Hall.
Two double bedrooms with king size beds which share a ‘Jack and Jill’ style en suite bathroom with large Jacuzzi bath and twin basins. Both have room for a cot or a small spare bed. One of the bedrooms has access to the indoor pool via the sunken patio area.
The Keep External Lower Ground Floor:
Indoor swimming pool via separate entrance down steps.
Access to outdoor sunken patio with wooden hot tub
The Keep First Floor:
Sitting room - a grand octagonal space with panoramic views over the surrounding countryside and Bristol Channel. Bar area, gas coal-effect fire in a large stone fireplace and a 50" smart TV, DVD player and PlayStation. Adjoining the living room is the library, a quiet snug to read peacefully with a view over the entrance cobbled courtyard.
The Keep Second Floor:
Master bedroom with 5’ bed and en suite bathroom with roll-top bath. Private terrace with panoramic views of the surrounding countryside, the Bristol Channel and across into Wales.

Turret 2 –Utility Turret
This turret contains a utility room with washing machine, dryer and wc.
Turret 3 – Pine Bedroom
This turret bedroom is one of the largest with a king size bed, sofa, soft furnishings and exposed stonework. It has an en suite shower room.
Turret 4 - Queen Ann Bedroom
The Queen Ann Turret has a king size bed, sofa, furniture, wardrobe and an en suite shower room. Beautifully decorated with chandelier lighting.
Turret 5 – Mahogany Bedroom
This is one of the larger turrets with a king size bed, soft furnishings, exposed stonework and plenty of seating. It has an en suite shower room.
Turret 6: Entertainment two-level apartment
This is the largest turret at the castle, as it extends under the castle walls either side of the turret. It has a double bedroom, a sofa and table football. In the sitting room, it has two large sofas and a games area with a darts board and lawn games (croquet, kubb, giant jenga, quoits and badminton). It features a fully fitted kitchen and dining space for 3, and a shower room.
In the basement it has a pool table, table tennis and a comfy sofa, perfect for relaxed evenings with friends.
Turret 7 - The Alcove
This is a charming room with exposed stone work, a French Antique double bed and en suite shower room.
Turret 8 - The Bar Turret
This is the second largest turret which has been used as a cinema room and has floor to ceiling glass doors to let in plenty of natural light. It features large exposed beams and stone work. The room also has special air conditioning system to heat, cool and dehumidify.

IN A NUTSHELL
16 Guests
Two additional single beds and one sofa bed available (*extra fee)
Eight double bedrooms, all of which are en suite

Covid-19 measures* (see Visitors' Notes)

EQUIPMENT
The Keep: Central heating, gas coal-effect fire in living room
The Turrets: Electric heating

description.neighborhood:
Beyond the grounds, explore the beautiful surroundings with your hounds at your heels (dogs are welcome at Walton Castle). Clevedon Seafront and the beautiful Victorian Pier, the UK’s only Grade 1 listed Pier, now complete with its new Heritage Centre and Museum, are half an hour’s stroll. Great coastal walks both north and south are also accessible.

Or wander up Hill Road (one of many parts of Clevedon featured in Broadchurch TV series) which has many independent shops, cafes, pubs and restaurants, such as Il Giardino (possibly the best Italian restaurant for 100 miles), Junior Poon, The Limehouse and Scoozi. There’s a Sainsbury's local for essential supplies and major supermarkets within a ten minute drive of the castle (Asda, Aldi, Lidl, and a large Tesco supermarket with petrol station).

Nearby Bristol, with its fantastic attractions include the ‘Floating Harbour’ with its iconic ferries, Isambard Brunel’s 'SS Great Britain', the Bristol Science Museum and Aquarium.

Access to M5 Motorway (Junction 20) is just 2 miles (9 minutes' drive) away. This offers fast access to North Somerset’s many attractions: the lovely Mendip Hills, the World Heritage City of Bath, and Cheddar Gorge within an hour. Day Cruises from the Pier are often available from May to September on the historic MV Balmoral.

Nearby attractions include Clevedon Golf Course which surrounds the castle grounds. The River Wye and Blagdon Lake are conveniently placed for fishing. Horse racing is available in Chepstow and Wincanton, as is sailing on the Bristol Channel and Chew Valley Lake.
description.transit: We do advise guests to have a car and there is ample parking. Bristol International Airport, with international and domestic services, is 11 miles and Yatton train station is 5.5 miles – with regular train services to London Paddington, taking 90 minutes.
description.interaction: Our local housekeeper is available if needed and an information folder is provided at the house. We are happy to answer any questions at all before you book and send you information about the area to help you plan your trip.
description.house_rules:
Parties or events are not allowed
Smoking is not allowed inside any of our properties.
* Well-behaved dogs welcome by request (additional £25/dog/stay). Dog bed & bowl available on request. Please do not allow your pet/s on the furniture and restrict to the ground floor.
Please note that a damage deposit of £1000.00 is payable through bank transfer. This is paid prior to arrival and will be refunded in full after departure subject to damage.
Minimum stay is 1 night during midweek or 2 nights at weekends.

gallery.caption: A perfect day at Smithmore Castle

Over 100 acres of private property, next to over 400 acres of natural preservation land, and behind the Castle is thousands of acres of forrest, woods, mountains and wild life leading all the way to Tennessee.

hosts.about: Smithmore Castle is a private mountain estate with over 100 acres located on top of English Knob in Spruce Pine, North Carolina. It's the perfect getaway as you can unwind and retreat in the most beautiful part of the state. Come and nestle up in one of many of our dreamlike bedrooms and experience the endless amount of amenities available that will have you leaving all of your troubles behind. Experience an intimate and exciting Chef Class by learning how to prepare Gourmet Dishes with our 5 star rated Gourmet Chef. Our in-house Chef specializes in Gourmet Food Dining which includes a variety of exotic dishes that are French, Italian, and Japanese inspired. After dinner, relax in our one of a kind theater room while you're drinking a glass of your favorite domestic or imported wine. Smithmore, a grand estate that you must tour. Including a vintage 'starlight' bar, a Tuscan themed lounge, and the main dining room that accommodates your private dinner party. Victorian 'esque fireplace and remarkable ceiling frescos completes the vibe. Visit our exquisite wine room that offers a variety list of wines and no wine session is complete without a tasty charcuterie board to go with it. The most breathtaking area of the Castle is the 'Great Room,' incorporating a three story stone fireplace, marble floors, fine paintings, and an extravagant Swarovski crystal chandelier. If you're wanting to get some fresh air then you must experience our courtyard, displaying a grand fountain as well as our huge open deck over the portico. The views are so captivating that you will lose yourself over and over again. If you're looking for some outdoor activities, explore our hiking trails allow for a special experience as you take in all of the surrounding beauty, serene natural settings and even coming across some stunning caves. It doesn't end there, another beautiful building known as Crown Hall is nestled in the woods below the Castle. Crown Hall boasts a commercial kitchen, banquet hall, bride's room, separate mens and ladies restrooms and was specifically designed for hosting weddings and other receptions.

recent.comments: Wonderful experience! The team accommodated each guest and left us speechless. Appreciate each of you immensely for making the birthday celebration special - from the tailored dinning options, custom menus, custom cake, impromptu lunch on the balcony & amazing hospitality. Thank you!

items.comments: Wonderful experience! The team accommodated each guest and left us speechless. Appreciate each of you immensely for making the birthday celebration special - from the tailored dinning options, custom menus, custom cake, impromptu lunch on the balcony & amazing hospitality. Thank you!
If you’re thinking about staying here, do it! The castle is beautiful, the rooms are wonderful, and the food is some of the best we’ve had anywhere. Can’t wait to stay again!

My family of 6 booked a last minute weekend trip to Smithmore. Chef Benjamin was truly on top of things. Within the same afternoon we booked (just a few hours before we planned to arrive) he had a full itinerary for our stay, along with accommodating food preferences. He is truly an asset to the castle. Food was excellent, and we really appreciated the kind mannerisms and attention to detail from the staff. We would recommend this to anyone! 100/10 experience.

What an amazing and unique experience! The pictures on the web are great but in person all I can say is WOW!  We loved learning about  the history of the castle and cave Bruce. Chef Benjamin and Jesse were exquisite hosts. Food was delicious and beautiful. The decor in all the rooms were unique and beautiful. We loved all the antique furniture. Benjamin also had so many great ideas of what the future holds for Smithmore Castle. Can't wait to visit again.

The castle itself is stunning and the views are incredible. It is beautifully decorated and the beds were very comfortable. Chef Ben  and Jessie are delightful and made the stay more enjoyable as well as made incredible food. Everything was amazing and we would definitely come back.

We rented the entire castle with concierge service for a long weekend.  This was a 60th birthday celebration for a number of us and from the moment we arrived until the moment we left we felt like royalty.  The food was amazing!  Chef Ben was flexible with our schedule and accommodated the one member of our party with a seafood aversion.  We did a self guided hike to the caves and made only one wrong turn along the way - but that just meant more time in the woods!  The last section down to the caves was a little too steep for some of the group with bad knees.  We spent a lot of our time on the patio over the front entrance way.  The view from there is unreal from sun up to sun down.  We brought our own "beverages" and set up in the bar area when we first arrived, this worked out real well.    Thanks Chef Ben and your team for an unbelievable weekend.

BRAVO!!! WOW!! If I died and gone to heaven this is where I would want to end up. In the clouds to a view of the world at my finger tips. The house was breathtaking, accommodations of the rooms were thoughtful and comfortable. We had a great night sleep and slept with our balcony doors open. Just to wake up to the birds chirping a melody to us. I can see why so many couples love it here, the fireplaces, 360 view and architectural charm is more than along ambiance. It just transports you.  I love all the Castle Decor and unique touches throughout the house. I never sat at a dining room and sat on a 150 year old table and chair for breakfast and dinner by candlelight. But the true gem of this already scenic storybook stay is Chef Benjamin. I honestly need an hour or so to just write a review on him. To sum it up, absolutely PHENOMENAL. Hands down one of the best Chef Pairings and combinations of dishes to shock your palate. I consider myself a great cook and appreciate distinguished service and talent. The attention to detail of presentation and the burst of flavors and combos to each meal was truly exceptional.  Chef took the time to carefully think of everything to have the full experience. Wine Pairings we’re superb. For example, I absolutely loved his Bison Lasagna and Lemon Pepper Vinaigrette Dressing with Dragon Fruit over arugula salad was my favorite. It sounds simple but has a complexity of depth in the flavors that you really have to have on your bucket list. BRAVO to such talent and passion to the dishes you prepare. We appreciated the two lady staff serving us. THANK YOU Clara and Rebecca. Always smiling and so attentive and sweet. Thank you Smithmoore Castle for hosting us. We look forward to visiting again.

description.summary: Smithmore Castle is unlike anywhere in the world. This real life Castle offers exclusive stays curated specifically for your booking. Upon arrival, you will immediately be taken by the magical views of this "Castle in the Sky."  Once you've checked in & relaxed in one of our outstanding rooms, a 3 course Gourmet dinner by renowned Chef Benjamin will be served at 6pm in the Royal Dining room. That's not all, your stay will also include a Royal Breakfast served at 8am at our majestic balcony.
description.space:
Smithmore Castle gives guests an experience they will truly cherish. Unlike other experiences, Smithmore Castle offers an in house 5 star rated Gourmet Chef as well as concierge services. Each stay is uniquely designed for your specific booking. Whether you are celebrating an anniversary, birthday, graduation or just wanting a luxurious get away, Smithmore Castle delivers. 

Smithmore Castle is a private mountain estate with over 100 acres located on top of English Knob in Spruce Pine, North Carolina. It's the perfect getaway as you can unwind and retreat in the most beautiful part of the state. Come and nestle up in one of many of our dreamlike bedrooms and experience the endless amount of amenities available that will have you leaving all of your troubles behind. Experience an intimate and exciting Chef Class by learning how to prepare Gourmet Dishes with our 5 star rated Gourmet Chef. Our in-house Chef specializes in Gourmet Food Dining which includes a variety of exotic dishes that are French, Italian, and Japanese inspired. After dinner, relax near our giant three story stone Victorian'esque fire place, while you're drinking a glass of our paired favorite domestic or imported wine. Smithmore, a grand estate, receives hundreds of guests annually from around the world. Guests can tour things including the vintage 'starlight' bar, the Tuscan themed lounge, and the main dining room which accommodates your private dinner party. Remarkable ceiling frescos completes the vibe of the Castle. Visit our exquisite wine room that offers a variety list of wines and no wine session is complete without a tasty charcuterie board to go with it. The most breathtaking area of the Castle is the 'Great Room, featuring marble floors, fine paintings, and an extravagant Swarovski crystal chandelier. If you're wanting to get some fresh air then you must experience our courtyard, displaying a grand fountain as well as our huge open deck over the portico. The views are so captivating that you will lose yourself over and over again.
description.access:
Guests will be able to walk Castle common areas. Take photos and enjoy this magnificent real life Castle.

* For Special Discount Rates Please See Our Website *
description.notes:
********Notice for Winter months********** 
The Castle is large and is located at the top of a mountain. It is concrete, stone and steel and can be chilly in a few common areas during the winter. The weather can be unpredictable. Beautiful one day and then a blizzard the next. Snow plowing may not be able to keep up with a storm. If you are resilient then the Castle is perfect for you!
description.neighborhood: Smithmore Castle is located only 4 miles from the city of Spruce Pine. 4 miles from our private airplane hanger at Avery County airport. 10 minutes from the Blue Ridge parkway. 50 miles from Asheville and 61 miles from Asheville Regional Airport, supermarkets, and other amenities and scenic attractions.
description.transit: Smithmore Castle offers exclusive ride services to accommodate small or large groups. (Additional fees will apply, please contact concierge for booking as this is on a first come first serve basis)
description.interaction:
Guests will be served by server 
Guests will meet & interact with renowned Chef
Guests will interact with activity specialist (If activity was selected)
description.house_rules: Pets are an additional cost per night. Please contact us for pricing.

recent.comments: Absolutely amazing experience & place! This was one of the most magical things that we have every done! We will definitely be back! Thank you so much Daphne!

items.comments: Absolutely amazing experience & place! This was one of the most magical things that we have every done! We will definitely be back! Thank you so much Daphne!

Un castillo para nosotras solas!! 
Que maravilla de sitio, espectacular! Mejor incluso que en las fotos, nos quedamos en la queens room, y fantástica. 
Daphne nos preparó el desayuno, con croissants, napolitanas y pan artesano. La llegamos a conocer justo al irnos y fue un encanto! Estuvimos jugando con sus perritos que eran un auténtico amor. 
De verdad que el sitio es espectacular.

We stayed in the Queen’s room at Tybroughney Castle for the first two nights we were in Ireland while on our honeymoon. The accommodation was indeed remarkable. What a treat to stay in a castle in Ireland. 

The breakfast was amazing. 

If you are on the fence about booking here, go ahead with it. You will not be disappointed.

The Queen’s Room was more than I could have asked for after 2 days of hectic travel. It was beautifully decorated, comfortable and had everything we needed for our 2 day stay. The location is amazingly beautiful looking out over the green hills. We loved watching the cows come out from the barn in the morning. A very special place.

We had such a lovely stay! Tybroughney Castle has a wonderful energy about it, full of so many beautiful and thoughtful details. We enjoyed deep and restful sleep in the fluffy beds at night and delightfully charming breakfasts in the dining room. The panoramic view from the tower of the Irish countryside was breathtaking and peaceful. I hope we can return again someday.
We loved everything about this place.   It was amazing and I wish we had stayed more than one night.

We spent 8 days traveling Ireland and this castle was by far the best place we stayed. The Queen’s suite was perfect for 2 adults and 1 child. Hosts were responsive and everything was exactly as-advertised. It was a truly remarkable experience. Highly recommend!

description.summary:
Step back in time and stay in our delightful medieval tower house located in Piltown, County Kilkenny in south-east Ireland.                                         Tybroughney Castle is over 500 years old and is steeped in history and combines old-world-charm with modern comfort.
It is located on a working dairy farm and with its proximetly to the mountains, coastline, historical sites and towns, it is in a perfect location from which to explore our beautiful country.
description.space:
Tybroughney Castle was built in 1462 and is situated on the banks of the River Suir, approximately 1 km from Piltown, Co. Kilkenny. 
The tower house has its own private driveway, courtyard and entrance door. The courtyard is complete with beautiful outdoor furniture, a charcoal bbq, a fire pit and outdoor lighting. There is a shared kitchen just off the courtyard with cooking facilities, fridge etc. 
On the ground floor of the castle, there is a banquet hall with a large dining table. A complimentary self-service breakfast will be available in this room.
From here the winding staircase will lead you to the bedrooms. Your bedroom (The Queen's Suite)  is located on the first floor. This is a  large ensuite bedroom (6’ bed) with an adjoining smaller bedroom (4’ 6’’bed). It sleeps maximum 4 people. 
It has its own seating area, coffee station and mini fridge. 
All guests can access the parapet by a short narrow stairs. From here you can enjoy the spectacular views of the River Suir, Slievenamon and The Comeragh Mountains. 

We aim to provide a unique and exceptional holiday experience for our guests creating beautiful moments and lasting memories. 

Check-in is after 4pm unless by prior arrangement.
description.access:
A car is neccessary while staying at this property as it is located in the countryside.
There is private parking on site.
description.notes: Due to the nature of the castle, its spiral stairwell and some narrow doors, it is not wheelchair friendly or suitable for those with mobility issues.
description.neighborhood:
There are an abundance of local attractions within a short drive. 
These include:
Historical sites : Ormond Castle, Kilkenny Castle, Rock of Cashel, Reginald's Tower.

Award winning golf courses: Mount Juliet, Waterford Castle, Carrick-on-Suir.

Walking and Hiking: River Suir Blueway, Kildalton College, Castle Morris Woods, Slievenamon, Comeragh Mountains, Mahon Falls, The Waterford Greenway and long sandy beaches.

Cycling:The River Suir Blueway and The Waterford Greenway

River Kayaking:River Barrow

Surfing: Tramore

Swimming: Endless beaches
 
Traditional Irish music sessions

Beautiful Drives


We will be very happy to help plan and organise any of the above.
description.transit:
By car, Tybroughney Castle is:
5 min drive to Carrick-on-Suir.
20 mins to the Viking city of Waterford
20 mins to the mountains (The Comeragh Mountains and Slievenamon)
30 mins to Mount Juliet golf club
30 mins to the picturesque fishing village of Dunmore East
30 mins to the Copper Coastline 
40 mins to the Medieval city of Kilkenny
1 hour 45 mins to Dublin airport
1 hour 40 mins to Shannon airport
1 hour 30 mins to Cork airport
description.interaction: We will be available to offer help and advice throughout your stay as we live next to the castle.

hosts.about:
As an Airbnb host with a background in real estate, I pride myself on providing only the best in hospitality. I've personally selected exceptional properties for you to experience a luxurious stay, with exquisite furnishings and top-of-the-line amenities. 
My goal is to offer a seamless and unforgettable experience that exceeds your expectations. Let me show you the true meaning of high-end Airbnb hospitality.

recent.comments: Thank you Diana and Joe for hosting us. We had a really special time at Strawberry Castle and were able to enjoy everything the space had to offer, from the historic decor to the funky details, to the pool (that was a really fun feature), and luxurious the primary bedroom and bathroom. Our nephews had A LOT of fun exploring the secret play room. Everything was perfect and we were grateful that you were willing and able to accommodate us at the last second. We made great memories, and we are grateful to you for being such gracious hosts.

items.comments: Thank you Diana and Joe for hosting us. We had a really special time at Strawberry Castle and were able to enjoy everything the space had to offer, from the historic decor to the funky details, to the pool (that was a really fun feature), and luxurious the primary bedroom and bathroom. Our nephews had A LOT of fun exploring the secret play room. Everything was perfect and we were grateful that you were willing and able to accommodate us at the last second. We made great memories, and we are grateful to you for being such gracious hosts.
Beautiful historic home, responsive hosts, lovely outdoor space.  We would definitely recommend to others.

Once in a while you come across a few places, where you'd want to extend your vacay just so that you can wind down a bit more and Strawberry Castle is one such place. 

One can't get enough of the lush green view outside the window with the sound of birds chirping. If you are planning your visit here, make sure you mark a day or two just to relax here among other plans to explore the surrounding.

We stayed here for my child's graduation from RIT. It was wonderful to have a big house for the whole family to stay in, and to have a big outdoor area to host guests for an outdoor lunch. We may have been one of the first guests to stay at the Strawberry Castle, so there was a bit of stuff that was not quite ready-for-prime-time, but everything got handled and the hosts were very quick to respond to questions and requests. Beds were EXCELLENT -- so comfortable, and each bedroom upstairs has its own bathroom, which was a great convenience.  It is an old house (1883), so it's got its fair share of quirks, but that's 100% to be expected. The kitchen is all brand-new and sparkling, with easy access to the (sun-heated) pool and yard.

Great stay - very unique, and large home and property.  Quick communication made it a breeze. 

Being able to bring our dogs was an added bonus!

We loved our time at the beautifully restored strawberry castle. The kitchen, mud room, bathroom had just been redone. The appliances in the kitchen were extremely nice. We hosted thanksgiving for our family at the house, so we did a lot of cooking and their dining table holds 10👍🏼.There were 3 bedrooms, believe the beds were tempurpedic, they were very comfortable. Beautiful, well maintained property on 3 acres. Lovely patio and pool area. They were sweet enough to allow dogs, and my yellow lab enjoyed walking on the 3 acres! I’ll definitely do it again in the summer when the pool is open.

My family (and our four-legged friend) loved our stay at Joseph's property! It was the perfect location for going on some awesome fall day trips in the finger lakes area and the historic house definitely fit the fall vibe. The newly renovated kitchen was perfect for cooking family meals and the huge TVs were amazing for curling up and watching some Halloween movies as we sipped apple cider. Definitely made some great fall memories here!

description.summary:
Calling all Princes and Princesses!  Your Strawberry Castle awaits!
Come and be greeted by the glorious sight of beautifully manicured lawns. This historical castle has all you need for your magical vacation.

Live like the rich and famous for as long as you desire.  The Strawberry Castle is perfect for both history buffs and luxury lovers.
description.space:
Each room is a jewel, waiting to be explored and admired. Italian grandeur is evident throughout the estate. Take special notice of the custom oven and antique fireplace.  

Head out to the patio and fire up the Green Egg grill.  Savor a swim in the gorgeous pool. 
You'll forget your daily stresses as you amble about the property.

 This castle was built in 1875 and still has original flooring and hand-plastered ceilings. 
It's the perfect blend of old-time glory, history, and modern amenities all for your ultimate enjoyment
description.access: The entire historical rental home is exclusively yours without interruption for the duration of your stay, so just relax, unwind, and indulge in luring luxury! Take note, we have neighboring homes so please be respectful of the neighbors and their property and kindly keep the outdoor noise down between the hours of 10 PM and 8 AM.
description.notes: The Property is off the main road. The pool is closed for the winter season
description.house_rules:
No parties are allowed on the premises under any circumstances.
We kindly ask that you respect the neighbors and behave in a courteous manner while staying in our space.
Quiet hours are enforced after 10 pm to maintain a peaceful atmosphere.
To avoid disturbing the neighbors, playing music outdoors after 10 pm is prohibited.
Smoking is strictly prohibited indoors to maintain a clean and fresh environment. For any smoking odor-related issues, a $150 cleaning fee will be applied to cover deep cleaning expenses.
We take great pride in our carefully selected furnishings, and we kindly ask that you handle them with care and respect.
Guests will be held responsible for any damages incurred to the furniture or property during their stay.
 An additional charge of $70 will be applied for each guest who is not included on the reservation.
Check-out time is strictly enforced. Guests who exceed the allotted time will be charged a fee of $50 for every half-hour late.
Any guests who stay two hours past the check-out time will be charged for another full day.
To ensure the safety of our property and guests, please refrain from using open flames such as candles or incense.
For security purposes, please keep all doors locked at all times to ensure the safety of your belongings as well as our property.
Please note that mail/package deliveries are not permitted on the premises, and we cannot be held responsible for any missing items.
Our home is pest-free, and with your help we intend to keep it that way! Guests are asked to properly dispose of any food waste that may attract unwanted pests.
We cannot be held responsible or liable for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur during your stay.
We cannot be held responsible for any loss or damage to personal belongings or valuables during your stay.
Any lost TV remote will result in an additional charge of $150 to cover the cost of replacement.

Bride in Great Hall at Lickleyhead
The Leith Gallery. Our family suite.
The trees in the grounds covered with snow

Shower on 1st floor. There is another on the top floor, great for those in a rush or not keen on baths.
Library nook. Just off the great hall

recent.comments: If you are looking at this venue for a large group…don’t hesitate.  I’ve stayed in 30-40 AirBnbs, and this would be in the top three of all time.  It is a gorgeous place…a true castle that is a complete joy to stay in.  Our group of eleven was sad to leave our stay and we will always remember the time we spent at Lickleyhead Castle.

items.comments: If you are looking at this venue for a large group…don’t hesitate.  I’ve stayed in 30-40 AirBnbs, and this would be in the top three of all time.  It is a gorgeous place…a true castle that is a complete joy to stay in.  Our group of eleven was sad to leave our stay and we will always remember the time we spent at Lickleyhead Castle.

Magical and beautiful.  This castle provides the perfect venue for a private party.  Each bedroom is beautifully decorated and themed and the different staircases added mystic.  We loved the private chapel , props and the big fire in the sitting room.

Just exceptional - could not fault it and - highly highly recommend to anyone.  
Plus a big shout out to James, who answered my many worries and quieries and sorted things out for me. 

This place was a game changer, thank you so much.

I cannot tell you how amazing this castle is with its beautiful decor, winding turret staircases and a series of individually decorated and designed bedrooms. We and our children loved it. Everything from the woods and gardens to the fire pit area to the gorgeous dining and formal rooms with the biggest fire we could make!  This is a properly hidden gem….

We had a brilliant time at Lickelyhead Castle celebrating a 70th Birthday over the weekend. Excellent rooms - bed very comfortable and great kitchen and dining space. Would highly recommend for a big family gathering - we had a brilliant time playing a murder mystery in the castle! Thanks to James for hosting and restoring the castle.
We were meeting as a family for internment of my fathers ashes nearby and the place was ideal , allowing us to eat together in a place with some presence .

An unforgettable experience!  When else do you have a chance to have a whole CASTLE to yourselves?  We had a group of 11 folks traveling to Scotland from the USA to participate in the Dramathon - a trail marathon along the Speyside.   Large group accommodations aren't easy to come by in the area, but when we found Lickleyhead Castle on Airbnb, it seemed like a once in a lifetime opportunity.  It was even better than we thought!  Every room has a unique character tied to the history of the castle, the grounds are amazing, James and his family are gracious hosts.  The castle is a OLD building, but it has been updated to bring modern comforts while still maintaining the historic character.  

James also arranged a falconry demonstration for us - that was truly an epic experience as well.  Thank you for being a key unforgettable part of an awesome trip!

We were a group of seven and had the use of the whole castle. We had a wonderful time. The facilities were great for self-catering and relaxing. There are some great trail walks from the castle around Bennachie and plenty to see in the area. The host communication was excellent. Would love to visit again. Many thanks.

description.summary: Lickleyhead Castle is a Grade A listed historic building from the 16th century. It can accommodate up to 16 adults, 4 children and 3 dogs. Despite it's grandeur  the castle feels very much like a home with the 5 working fireplaces and the overwhelming smell of woodsmoke which greets you as you climb the stone staircase. Outside, the sound of running water and abundant birdlife combine to provide an atmosphere of peace and calm. We also host weddings.
description.space: Each of the bedrooms have been styled to reflect the period of former owner's of note. This includes our 16th century box bedroom which has proven to be a great favourite with our guests and the Victorian nursery on the very top floor. The castle grounds which are exciting to explore, extend to 11 acres, with 2 burns (streams), rope swings to discover, not to mention a ruined archway and a bird hide. We are also situated on the lower slopes of Bennachie which of course means plenty of wonderful walks from the doorstep.
description.access: The whole building will be yours!
description.notes:
Weddings
We are now hosting weddings of up to 30 people at Lickleyhead Castle! We specialise in destination weddings, elopements and vow renewals, though any wedding type will be accommodated. 

Golf
Guests at Lickleyhead Castle can play complimentary golf at Insch Golf Club!  Offer ends in June 2023. Up to six people at a time can play. The seventh guest wanting to play and up will pay only £15 per round. This is unlimited, meaning you could play golf every day during your stay at no extra cost. For guests with us there is also 50% off a round at clubs affiliated with Insch in Aberdeenshire. Please let us know if this is of interest to you so we can arrange it.
description.neighborhood: The village of Auchleven nearby is also a sleepy backwater with a primary school, pub and village hall. The nearby town of Insch ( 2 miles) has 2 supermarkets, restaurants and cafes.
description.transit: Ample parking is available for up to 12 cars.
description.interaction: As hosts we will be available all day as we reside on the estate in a cottage so any problems will be addressed immediately.

recent.comments:
Staying at Old Rowallan Castle was a dream come true. Rachel and I loved every minute of it, we just wished we could have stayed longer and brought the rest of our family (next time!). The history is just amazing and the building has been well preserved and enhanced with all the mod cons. We truly felt like the Laird and Lady of the house and George was such a great host.

And, as a Campbell descendent myself, it was a pleasure meeting Niall and Louise. What the family have created at Rowallan is pretty special. And we have definiltely found a spectacular venue for weddings, special milestone birthdays, etc in the new castle. Simply breathtaking.

The golf course is also exceptional, a true rare find and I had a wonderful round with two very entertaining local members who were more than happy to have an Aussie hacker crash their two ball!

Thank you once again. 
Tony (and Rachel) Bradford
Sydney, Australia

Wonderful place for a family visit
Our stay at the castle was magical! I only wish we could have stayed longer.

A great stay and loved the castle. Very comfortable and filled with history. Everyone was so friendly and accommodating. The private dinner at the castle was delightful. Restaurant food, service, and prices were all great!
A WONDERFUL experience!  We loved it!
房东很很nice，我们旅途延误，一直等我们一个下午，到了热情带我们参观，并介绍各个房间和使用。第二天准时为我们退房，孩子们都很开心，非常难忘的一晚。

description.summary:
Old Rowallan Castle dates from the 12th Century and has been lovingly restored.
Nestled in the centre of Rowallan Estate, it is the ancestral home of the Mures & Campbells. It is a highly unique space and acknowledged as the finest specimen of Renaissance Castle Architecture - still boasting original features. 
With a 19 hole Championship Golf Course designed by Ryder Cup winning Captain Colin Montgomerie on its door step and the much acclaimed Glasshouse Restaurant only a short walk away.
description.space:
This is an unique opportunity to be King or Queen of your own castle!  We have four large bedrooms, three with superking beds and one double bed,  with the two superkings able to be changed to twins if required. All the beds are made up with 500tc  Egyptian cotton. Luxurious bathrobes and Arran Aromatic toiletries are provided for the use of guests. Two of the bedrooms are ensuite, whilst two share a spacious bathroom. There is also the option to add two single sofa beds, which can be set up in the Castle Gallery within the turrets! 
There is a well equipped kitchen with a large table and chairs and a small dishwasher. Space does not permit a washer/dryer, but we can provide a laundry service for a small fee, please enquire on check-in.  We also have  a grand dining room for more formal occasions, and if wished our chefs can cater for you, with advance warning! Our top gallery provides the perfect setting to relax after a day either exploring the surrounding area or out on the course. Equipped with a 55 inch TV, luxurious sofas, 6 foot pool table, card table with numerous games & several musical instruments; there is plenty available for an evenings entertainment. As it is a 12th Century listed building, the stairs may be uneven in places and some door frames are lower, so beware of bumping your head!
description.access: The castle is entirely private so all rooms can be used exclusively by guests. Unfortunately, the Castle is not suitable for wheelchair access.
description.notes:
For golf enthusiasts, we have a 19 hole Championship golf course and the 9 hole Castle Course, with the Clubhouse being a short walk from the castle - tee times can be arranged prior to check-in with two complimentary four balls included in your stay, thereafter special “Castle Rates” are available. The award winning Glasshouse Restaurant is located here and is open every day with guests receiving a 10% discount on their bill! There is also the option to arrange for catering to be provided in the castle  by our renowned team of chefs.
We can also arrange Whisky & Wine Tastings, a days Falconry and Clay Pigeon Shooting on the Estate.
description.neighborhood: There are many places to visit within a half hour drive of the estate, including the famous Scottish Bard, Rabbie Burns' birthplace, the world renowned Glasgow Galleries, Kelvingrove and The Burrell Collection and Dumfries House is well worth a visit. With Royal Troon and Prestwick Golf Clubs a mere 15 minutes away, and Turnberrry 45 minutes, golfers are spoilt for choice..........there are great beach walks too, for the non golfers! Other interesting Castles to visit in the vicinity are Dean Castle in Kilmarnock and Culzean Castle on the Ayrshire coast.
description.transit: The castle is situated a short drive from the A77, and is 20 minutes from both Glasgow and Prestwick airports, with Edinburgh airport an hour away. Kilmarnock train station is 10 minutes from the Estate with a direct service to and from Glasgow Central.
description.interaction: On arrival at our Castle you will be warmly welcomed  and shown around. Our family work on the estate, so can be of assistance at any time if required!

I cannot say enough about how lovely this place was and how relaxing of a time we had. The views were amazing and I loved the little touches here and there. The lighting was wonderful inside the home as you can choose an evening setting to set the mood. We appreciated the access to Netflix and the cable tv. The washer and dryer in the closet was an awesome surprise and allowed us to do a small load of laundry before we set back off home. The bed was comfortable and the couches were comfy. Thank you for a lovely stay!

Best airbnb I’ve ever been to! Incredible experience. Step outside and you’re on the hiking trails. See all of Draper from the living room. Bath like a king in the stunning bathroom. 10/10 would stay again.

We loved everything about our stay!  Amazing, magical space in a beautiful castle tucked into the mountain with hiking trails from the property.  The views and sunsets are fabulous. This was a great home base for us as we explored Utah. We highly recommend Draper Castle. It's a very special place that exceeds all expectations.

This is such a fantastic unique stay! Lindsey’s castle apartment was an unforgettable part of our first trip to Utah. The home is super comfortable, and we especially loved making the most of the trail access.
Loved it!
Beautiful home in a great setting up on the mountainside.  Lindsey was easy to communicate with and quick to respond!

description.summary: Also known as the Hogwarts Castle, this Draper home follows a traditional luxury style. Stay in our Luxury Guest house apartment that is attached to a modern-day 24k sq ft Castle. No expense was spared on this guest house. Enjoy the beautiful sunsets looking over the Draper Temple and Salt Lake Valley. Take a hike or mountain bike ride on one of the many trails directly behind the home. Within 45 minutes from Ski Resorts in the Park City and Sundance area. Central to 3 valleys.
