hosts.about:
Greetings!

Welcome to Knoxville - I will be the host of your stay at Williamswood Castle - I am a native Knoxvillian -- a lawyer, a beer-maker, and an air-cooled Volkswagen mechanic. I love meeting new people wherever I go, and have traveled all over the world in search of the most interesting people, the best adventures, and the tastiest food.

Even though I have traveled and lived everywhere from Japan to South Africa, I still call Knoxville home, and want to show you the best time possible so that you see Knoxville as I do -- a quirky, fun, diverse, and sometimes ludicrously epic city.

recent.comments: This was perfect place to stay for us - loved the castle which was ALOT of fun even for adults....thank you for the swords, masks, and perfect castle of play.   It is a midevil castle, we loved; there are folks that not like what that means.  WE LOVED IT.  And, a path to ijams nature (0.6 miles) with river "right there"

items.comments: This was perfect place to stay for us - loved the castle which was ALOT of fun even for adults....thank you for the swords, masks, and perfect castle of play.   It is a midevil castle, we loved; there are folks that not like what that means.  WE LOVED IT.  And, a path to ijams nature (0.6 miles) with river "right there"
We had the absolute best time here. We could not believe how magical it was. Spent several hours just exploring the castle. We want to come back as soon as we can!
Such a unique experience! We loved the sense of adventure and fun! Great for all-ages.

One of my family members described the visit as an “experience “ 
My husband and I spent our 55th anniversary at the castle.  We hosted a small dinner for immediate family. Quiet and informal . A memorable and fun evening .  We highly recommend staying there .  We will always remember our brief journey back in time .

The GOOD: this place decorated extremely well. It had a great overall feel, and a TON of small details that made it really feel like a castle! The pictures honestly don't do it justice! It's amazing, and would be perfect for a team-building location, or themed event. 

The NOT-SO-GOOD: this place was basically like glamping. Not the amenities (the bed was fine, running hot water, etc). But there were bugs in every corner. I counted at least 3 large spiders in the master bathroom (i had to kill one, since it was hanging out near the toilet...).  Cobwebs at every turn. Then the master bathroom itself was just, 'old dirty' (the kinda dirty that only exists in like, hoarder houses), specifically the sink and shower. A simple replacement would rectify this. It'll be fine if you plan on using the other restrooms, but it was just the two of us, and i didn't wanna dirty up another restroom.

The Wow factor is immeasurable. Definitely a place I will always remember. Our family had the best time. A great walking trail nearby. Close to downtown, but very secluded and private. I’m so thankful for the experience. The hosts were very responsive and have thought of everything you would want.

Gorgeous Castle! It’s a great experience to stay here. I stayed for a few days and always found something new to admire :) loving Scottish heritage! We wore the crowns and pranced around the second floor library lol.
Played their table tennis, drank at the pub style bar, found secret room, fenced, took endless pics and walked to a beautiful quarry named Ijams. Ijams also has a swimming hole that’s pretty fun. It had a great hiking trail! 
Slept 4 nicely. Both kids had their own room, as well as us. Was 10 min drive to downtown for dinners.  Gated driveway was nice. Only thing that stumped us a little was the spiderwebs. Outside mostly but you’ll get over it. We wanted to open a few windows to get fresh air but the screens were too full of the spiderwebs. 
So aside from that it was fantastical and so much fun!!
We found some clues too and ended up on a hunt! If you love Scottish heritage and castles this is a must experience! It’d be best if you had 1girl & 1boy for fitting room Decor.

description.summary: Step back in time and become royalty by staying at Knoxville's most unique estate - your very own castle only ten minutes from downtown. Surrounded by 300 acres of Ijams Nature Center. Secret passage, towers, swords, armor, and magic abound!
description.access:
The entire premises, with the exception of the chapel that is disconnected from the castle and the garage. The roof off the second floor of the master bedroom is not accessible to guests. Absolutely no use of fireplaces.

No children or impaired adults are allowed on the balcony outside the master bedroom, as it is more than 100 feet above the river.
description.notes:
Unless you have booked with us and are checking in, please be respectful of our neighbors privacy and do not attempt to visit Williamswood. It is a private residence and is gated. There is no turn around as it is a dead end. 

Check-in is from 3:00 pm until 6:00 pm. Check-out is no later than 11:00 am.

*No events or weddings allowed*
*No use of fireplaces allowed*
*No alcohol is provided*

We have a minimum of two night stays for holidays and weekends. 

Per city permit regulations, no more than 8 guests allowed. 

Smoking inside or use of fireplaces will result in a $1,000 cleaning fee. 

Please wait for confirmation from us once you book. Thank you!
description.neighborhood:
Williamswood Castle is quite secluded in the forest, as it is a property surrounded by Ijams Nature Center. With 300 acres of beautiful forests, Ijams has trails, a ropes course, a mountain biking path, and programming for children.

Williamswood is located directly across from Island Home Airport, where visitors can land and store their private planes.
description.transit: You will need to either take a taxi or drive to and from Willliamswood Castle.
description.interaction:
*Currently not meeting guests in person due to COVID-19*
Generally you will receive a tour of the castle, as well as instruction on how to operate the castle. You will have my personal cell phone number just in case you need me for anything.
description.house_rules:
Please enjoy the estate, but there are a few rules that you must strictly adhere to.
*No more than 8 overnight guests allowed at Williamswood. This is a legal requirement with the city- if you show with more guests than allowed, you will not be able to stay with us as this is outside of city regulations*
1. No smoking in the Castle.
2. No weddings, professional photo shoots, or large parties. If you want to schedule a photography shoot, please let us know and we will be happy to accommodate you. 
3. If you have guests over, absolutely no parking outside of the gate. The neighbors WILL tow your's and your guests' cars without warning.
4. If you want to bring additional guests over that are not staying the night, please let us know and we may be able to accommodate you. 
5. Williamswood is full of antiques and art. If any of your guests steal, deface, or otherwise damage any part of the property, you will be held personally responsible.
6. No entering the garage. That is our staging area.
7. Absolutely no pets allowed indoors.

name: Enchanted Glenbeg Castle on a secluded Estate
title: Glenbeg, Ireland

recent.comments:
unbelievable castle home and beautiful landscape.  
Billy was very very helpful!!

items.comments:
unbelievable castle home and beautiful landscape.  
Billy was very very helpful!!

Er stayed at Glenbeg for our wedding in ireland with our family and it was just a gorgeous an enchanting stay. Would have loved to stay longer or come back with the family in the future. Gerard was also a very polite, great and helpful host. Can only recommend.

To start with, you enter via a beautiful gate with roses planted in front, only to be greeted by the most curious and adorable cows one has ever seen. Not enough? Keep reading!  There is so much living space, that even with 9 people I could still hear my thoughts. The kitchen truly is the heart of the home, only to be made more cozy if we had made some stew.  The bedrooms were all spacious and beautifully decorated, the beds cozy, the water pressure great. Outdoors there are more places to have a fire or sit and enjoy the soft moos in the distance and castle ambience than we knew what to do with.  My only complaint about the outdoor seating is that the weather didn’t cooperate very well for us to enjoy the water and cow overlook, though we spent every evening by a fire. I would stay here again, and I would live here if I could!

We spent a wonderful 5 nights at Glenbeg. The house and surroundings are beautiful with horses in the nearby fields and very pretty views over the Blackwater Valley. Gerard was an excellent host and has been extremely helpful following our stay by forwarding items that were mistakenly left behind. We would definitely recommend the house and also the excellent private chef that Gerard put us in contact with. A truly memorable trip.

description.summary:
Tranquil historic estate accommodating guests in luxury

Glenbeg, a historic castle which has been sensitively restored, preserving its historic past, whilst catering to the needs and comforts of modern living. 

Glenbeg Estate is the maternal home of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, who visited during his life time and wrote some of his early work while visiting with his family here.
You and your party will have exclusive use of the property during your stay.

description.summary:
The Clonmellon Lodge is an 18th c. gothic mini castle recently restored,  newly refurbished bathrooms and kitchen, all in one floor, with easy access to  the grounds of Killua Castle. 
The Lodge can fit 5 people comfortably. 
There are 2 bedrooms  with ensuite bathrooms. The first one with an ( American) Queen size bed, and the second with a double size bed. There is an office with a daybed that can sleep an adult comfortably, and it has a full bathroom next to it.

location.address: Perth and Kinross, Scotland, United Kingdom

description.summary: A beautiful Baronial style castle sitting within 200 acres of glorious countryside in Glenshee (known as the 'Fairy Glen'). The Dalnaglar Castle has spacious bedrooms, living and entertaining space and comes equipped with everything you need to self cater or bring in your own private chef. Dalnar Castle is an ideal base for walking, fishing, sight seeing and making memories with family and friends. Set on the southern fringe of the Cairngorms National Park it's easy to understand why this incred
description.space: Enter the estate via the formal driveway which leads up to the castle where there is ample parking. Walk through the imposing front entrance and arrive in the spacious reception area with welcoming and comfortable seating. From the main corridor which runs the entire length of the ground floor, you can access the traditional library, housing a selection of classic books; the formal dining room which seats 20 and provides spectacular views, as well as access to the terrace; the informal breakfast room which leads into the well-equipped, newly refurbished kitchen with two dishwashers, a glasswasher, two electric cookers, microwave, coffee maker and larder. At the end of the corridor is the bright and comfortable drawing room with focal fireplace.
description.access:
The main staircase leads up to a large landing which offers access to seven spacious and uniquely styled bedrooms, with five having their own private bathroom and three offering spectacular views over the Southern Cairngorms. A small flight of stairs leads to three further bedrooms all with private bathroom, providing views of the surrounding countryside.

Access the terrace from the patio doors and venture out into the expansive grassed garden, where you can enjoy playing with family or just sitting and taking in the breathtaking, rustic views over a pond and the surrounding natural beauty and wildlife, including roe deer.

Two double en suite bedrooms
Two twin bedrooms with shared bathroom
One four-poster double en suite bedroom
One en suite bedroom can be set up as a twin bedroom or zip-and-linked to make a super king-size bed
Four twin en suite bedrooms
description.neighborhood:
Skiers and snowboarders will benefit from the proximity to the popular Glenshee Snowsports Centre, just ten miles away.
Walkers will love the Cateran Trail, with the second of the five stages of the 64-mile Trail passing through the estate. This stage takes you along a beautiful moorland route to the Trail's highest point between Strathardle and Glenshee, offering spectacular views of glens and rugged peaks.
The Estate also offers an ideal base for exploring the Cairngorms National Park. With a choice of 55 Munros (four of which are the highest mountains in the UK) for beginner and experienced hill walker to conquer. Kayakers and Canoeists will enjoy exploring the challenging network of rivers (instructor led beginner sessions can be arranged).
If you prefer to enjoy the wild highland scenery from the comfort of your car, you’ll love the breath taking 90-mile Snowroads stretch. The route, starting in the nearby market town of Blairgowrie, takes you past the Dalnaglar Estate and up through the East Cairngorms to the Highland town of Grantown-on-Spey.
description.interaction: The castle is available as a self-catering hire> However, we can put you in touch with our preferred chef services, cleaning and activity organisers during your stay as we have various preferred suppliers we use.
description.house_rules: There is a £500 security deposit which will be required to be paid prior to your arrival. There is no smoking inside the castle and we would like to agree any pets that you wish to bring during your stay.

Wir hatten eine wunderbare Zeit auf Queblen. Die Gastgeber haben das Haus mit viel Liebe zum Detail saniert. Das Haus war sehr gut ausgestattet, wir haben das gemeinsame Kochen in der Küche sehr genossen. Wir danken Elsa und James, dass wir eine so erholsame Zeit in ihrem Zuhause verbringen durften!

We had a very nice Christmas week with our families in Queblen. Everything went perfect and we particularly enjoyed cooking together in the spacious and well equipped kitchen which became the main room for us to come together. The salon and the petit salon were more used for reading or playing piano. As it was wintertime it was a bit chilly and wet outside, so we could not use the garden. Nevertheless we had an unforgettable week in Queblen and would definitely recommend Jame's and Elsa's family chateau for someone who is looking for something special.

Dear James and Elsa, thank you for opening your beautiful home to us, we had a wonderful relaxing time and enjoyed this spectacular part of France.  We wish you both all the best and much success with the next phase of renovations of Chateau de Québlen.
We had such a peaceful week - no sound apart from birdsong. The chateau was beautiful and comfortable. The setting is stunning. Plenty to explore nearby and a great selection of patisseries in town!

Château de Québlen is a truly remarkable home! The beautifully renovated interior offers modern comforts and conveniences seamlessly integrated with the chateau’s vintage style. Elsa and James were exceptional hosts, answering questions and providing helpful recommendations regarding activities in the area, both prior to and during our stay. I would definitely recommend Château de Québlen to anyone contemplating a visit to Southern Brittany.
Château / manoir de charme: idéal pour des retrouvailles en famille été comme hiver. La grande cuisine est un lieu de vie et de réunion très sympathique.

description.summary:
Château de Québlen has five renovated bedrooms ready for you to stay (sleeping 10 people). We hope to have the whole house ready someday, but for now you will be staying in the west part (Côté  Métairie) while the east side (Côté Terrace) waits its turn. 
Nestled in 50 acres of ancient forest, it is a short drive (15 mins) from the beautiful beaches of Le Pouldu. The charming town of Quimperlé is a 5 minute drive away.
description.space:
Ground Floor:
Entrance Hall – a medieval entrance with stone floor and walls, and original wooden beams running across the ceiling.
Salon – an elegant sitting room with a marble fireplace and windows over-looking the garden.
Petit Salon - a cosy television room.
Kitchen – Light, spacious and well-equipped. A large dining table seats twelve people.
Cellar - a gravelled room off the kitchen with pantry shelves, which also serves as boiler room and store room.
Downstairs loo – located in the back hall, near the staircase.

First Floor:
Petite Chambre - a lovely twin bedroom overlooking the front lawn.
Chambre d’Olive - A double bedroom overlooking the front lawn.
Bathroom - A large Jack and Jill bathroom shared by chambre d’Olive and La Petite Ferme with freestanding bath and double sink unit.
La Petite Ferme - A double bedroom overlooking the front lawn.
Upstairs loo - located along the main corridor
Shower Room - A comfortable shower room for your convenience.
La Lingerie - a twin bedroom, which also serves as the utility room with linen press, washing machine and tumble dryer.
Bathroom - A Jack and Jill bathroom between the lingerie and chambre de l’évêque, with bath and loo.
Chambre de L'Évêque - A large medieval double bedroom, accessible via the main spiral staircase.

Outside:
Queblen is set in 40 acres of private land. The house is surrounded by a garden of lawns, mature trees and shrubs, and framed by an old 16th century farmhouse (la métairie) and dovecote (le pigeonnier). A croquet set, table tennis table, and BBQ are available for your enjoyment. A outside dining table with umbrella seats 10 people. 

Over the hedge (separate from the main house) lives our friendly cousin.

Restoration:
Although the house has been in our family for hundreds of years, it has not been continuously lived in for the past 50 years. Almost all the rooms were in need of work, but we have had to focus on the western end (côté métairie) for now. You will be staying in this part of the house, and won’t have access to the eastern end (côté terrace). To learn more about the work we have completed, please visit our website.
description.notes:
Babes in arms and children over 6 years old are very welcome. However, Québlen is an old home with some uneven floors and numerous small and large stairways. There is also an unfenced terrace in the garden. Therefore, we do not routinely accept children below this age. 

All children should be supervised. For your safety, all guests should remain in the renovated part of the house.
description.neighborhood:
Things to do :
Beaches - We are spoilt for choice when it comes to beaches. The beaches of Le Pouldu are 15 minutes drive from the house. Our favourites are Plage du Kerou and la Roche Percée.
Sailing, windsurfing and kite surfing - Water sports schools are all under half an hour from Québlen.
Surfing - The KLOAR surf school is 15 minutes from the house, paddle boarding also available.
Walking - For the walking enthusiasts, the famous GR34 trail travels 2000km along the Breton Coast. It was once a path that allowed customs officers to travel along the coast to prevent smuggling; today it is a peaceful hiking trail celebrated for its beauty.  These routes begin a short walk away from the house in neighbouring Lothea.

Cycling - This is excellent cycling country, reasonably flat and, with the “Espace VTT Cornouaille” circuits, the surrounding countryside can be easily explored. Bicycles can be hired and delivered directly to Québlen.
Kayaking - The canoe/kayak club of Quimperlé is just a 5 minute drive from Québlen. Paddle to the coast down the Laïta river and they will pick you up and drive you back to the club !
Golf - The stunning golf courses of Golf de Cornouaille and Golf de Ploemeur Ocean are within easy reach of the house (both are 35 mins drive away).
Horse Riding - The best way to explore the Forêt de Carnoët which surrounds Québlen is perhaps on horse back. 5 minutes drive from Québlen, at the Centre d’Équestre de Lothéa, you will be able to do just that.
Fishing - Trout streams are plentiful near Québlen and guided fly-fishing trips can be organised to help you make the best from your day on the river.
description.transit:
Situated on the south coast of Brittany, 2.5km from the charming town of Quimperlé, Québlen enjoys a peaceful rural location a short drive from the Atlantic Coast.
There are excellent shopping facilities in Quimperlé, with large supermarkets, multiple boulangeries, specialist charcuteries and weekly markets.
By car, Québlen is 1 hr 45 minutes from Rennes Airport, 2 hrs from Nantes International Airport, 1hr 20 minutes from Brest aiport, 40 minutes from Quimper airport, and 30 minutes from Lorient airport. 
You can travel via train (TGV) directly from Paris Montparnasse to Quimperlé (3hrs 10mins) or Lorient (2hrs 50mins). Quimperlé is a 5 minute drive and Lorient is a 30 minute drive from Québlen.
Alternatively, the ferry ports of Roscoff (less than 2 hours drive) and St Malo (2.5 hours drive) are served by Brittany Ferries with regular departures from both Portsmouth, Plymouth and Cork.
description.interaction: Our Housekeeper will greet you on arrival. If you need anything,  she can be contacted.
description.house_rules:
After 11pm, we request noise is kept to a minimum if seated outside.
Québlen is a very old home, please treat it and its contents with respect. Thank you.

hosts.about:
There is nothing I look forward to more than my next international adventure. Sadly as a mother of young twins, such trips are not as frequent as they once were! 

Airbnb gives us the opportunity to not just visit a new land, but to really experience it from a more interesting perspective, living amongst locals. We are interested in the unusual and unconventional. In return, we offer our unique vacation home in the last wilderness of Europe - the Highlands of Scotland. Housed within an ancient Fort, our stunning abode sits right on the banks of Loch Ness

recent.comments: Nous avons passé un excellent séjour. logement vraiment très agréable qui donne envie d'y rester. Nous recommandons vivement. Un grand merci à Baljit.

items.comments: Nous avons passé un excellent séjour. logement vraiment très agréable qui donne envie d'y rester. Nous recommandons vivement. Un grand merci à Baljit.
Awesome stay! We enjoyed exploring the castle and the surrounding countryside. Beautiful

Oh my goodness, if you are looking for an amazing place to stay, walkable distance to restaurants, beautiful views, and a peaceful getaway, then this is the place to stay! Also, if you’re a Harry Potter fan and jsut want to feel like you’re at Hogwarts, then stop reading this and go ahead and book this place. My family of four and my parents stayed very comfortably in this flat, and we had a magical time. Between taking in the Loch Ness cruise and the history of the area, as well as our kids pretending to be Hogwarts wizards in training, this stay truly made the whole vacation!

The abbey location and grounds are nice. Keep in mind, there is significant amount of bugs during the summer being located near a lake. 

The housing is terrible. The common areas are all musky and stagnant. The rugs and flooring show signs and smell of mold. 

The living space is as pictured. The cutlery, linens, bedding, mattresses, and sofa are fitting of a Premiere Inn. The owner’s must have gone to the local Poundland to outfit the space. Poorest quality flatware and insufficient number of glasses. The heating was barely adequate for a cool summer night. The radiator in the master bedroom doesn’t work. I can’t imagine spending a winter holiday there. The rugs in the apartment are old, dingy, and flea infested. All of us received several flea bites during our dreadful stay. 

For the luxury mark up this place is charging, it is a Terrible Value. I paid over £550 per night to stay in an unkept, poorly maintained AirBnB. 

Review left by a Marriott Platinum & Hilton Diamond member.
Great location!
Beautiful apartment and surroundings, we had a wonderful time and warmly recommend it!

description.summary: The Highland Club is set within 20 acres of beautifully landscaped grounds on the shores of Loch Ness. It occupies the Grade A gothic buildings of the original 1729 English fortification, Fort Augustus. 5 Star luxury in a traditional Highland town!
description.space:
Luxury three bedroom, two bathroom second floor apartment in a landmark grade A listed Benedictine Monastery (The Highland Club) set in 20 acres of private grounds on the shores of Loch Ness. In the heart of the Highlands, this sympathetic conversion is an ideal base for exploring all that Scotland has to offer. Whether you are searching for outdoor adventure, or simply just want to unwind, this is the place to do it.

This spacious mezzanine apartment has been fitted to the highest specification. Tastefully decorated by Scottish interior design team ANTA coupled with stylish funishings and high specification fittings promise to make your stay both memorable and relaxing. There are a plethora of original features such as the majestic cathedral window in the open plan living area. This beautiful window floods the room with light with wonderful views over the cloisters. As a guest you will have access to all The Highland Club has to offer.

There is highspeed internet and wifi within the apartment. Two TVs - 50 inch in lounge, and 32 inch in master bedroom.

PLEASE NOTE: 
1. Access is via stairs (52 steps) and there is no elevator. Our property is not suitable for people with limited mobility.

2. The mezzanine bedroom with cannonball bed overlooks the main living area. It is not protected from sound or light. It has a half wall and is not suitable for young children

3. The on site amenities are subject to availability and reserved through a booking system which our agents will guide you to. The pool is limited to 10 people at any one time. During peak periods it does get booked up very quickly.

4. All rooms have UK regulation fire doors by law. They are heavy and make a noise when closing. They are also more difficult for very young children to open. But they have been installed for the safety of all guests.
description.access:
Facilities included are The Boathouse Restaurant providing an idyllic setting on the shores of Loch Ness in which you can enjoy delicious, locally sourced food. The Highland Club swimming pool, sauna and steam room. Within the stunning grounds outdoor picnic tables and BBQ'S are provided for guest use; tennis court, outdoor table tennis, croquet lawn, giant chess and children’s adventure play area promise to keep everyone amused. The Monks refectory has been transformed into a Club Lounge with its oak panelled walls and stained glass windows, providing a sumptuous area to relax with friends or enjoy a game of Snooker (WIFI access available).

The on site amenities are subject to availability and reserved through a booking system which our agents will guide you to. The pool is limited to 10 people at any one time. During peak periods it does get booked up very quickly.
description.notes:
There are a couple of local grocery stores in the village. If you are arriving from Inverness it is worth stopping at the Tesco Extra Superstore to stock up on provisions. It is open 24 four hours a day, 7 days a week

CLEANING CHARGE: We are often asked about the amount of this charge. It is exactly what we pay our local managing agent and simply pass it on. It covers a full clean, linen changeover and meet and greet of all guests (plus Sales tax!)
description.neighborhood:
The Highland Club is situated in the picturesque village of Fort Augustus which lies south-west of Loch Ness near the Caledonian Canal. Like any good village, there are a full selection of local amenities, including pubs, shops and restaurants.

Whether you’re into water sports, boating or spotting Nessie herself, the world famous Loch Ness will not disappoint. At 23 miles long, it is one of the longest and deepest lochs in Scotland. The character of the loch is undoubtedly awe-inspiring and varied given its size; so the view from the shifting banks changes dramatically as you travel through. With Inverness at the top, and Drumnadrochit to the west, the loch is connected by the surrounding A28 main road, allowing you to visit all of the key spots along the way.

For the active amongst you, in good weather, the loch is the perfect platform to take to boating activities. If youre a novice, the Highland Club will steer you in the right direction for the appropriate guidance.
description.transit:
Fort Augustus is equidistant to Inverness (to the north) and Fort William (to the south), and an hour's drive from either. The Caledonian Sleeper train from London stops at both stations. The nearest airport is Inverness. 

It is highly recommended that you hire a car for your stay to truly enjoy the Highlands. Hire cars are easily booked at Fort William or Inverness
description.house_rules: Strictly no smoking and no pets

recent.comments:
Wow… And I really do mean ‘WOW’ in every sense of the word. 
This is one of the most spectacular AirBnB venues that we have stayed in. Very design chic, beautifully maintained, peaceful & welcoming atmosphere. It truly was a grand mansion that had been lovingly restored, with its original oil paintings. 

You can tell this house is family owned as there are abundant thoughtful touches throughout. Our children loved the constant supply of complimentary lemon sherbets in a big bowl on the way in/ out of the building. They loved the full sized pool table too under the stairwell.

Every apartment seems to offer a different feel. We’ve already booked again for next year after leaving today. 

The location is superb, an easy 5 min walk into Ulverston. 

We were greeted by quirky live street music on Saturday morning in the village. Such a pretty little place with wonderful eateries & pubs. Ulverston is not as overrun as the other well known villages like Bowness, Ambleside etc.

description.summary: The Mary Maude Suite in Ulverston can sleep five people in three bedrooms.
description.space: This first-floor apartment has an open-plan living space with a kitchen equipped with electric oven, induction hob, combi microwave/oven, fridge/freezer, washer/dryer, dishwasher, coffee maker and wine cooler, a dining table, and a sitting area with Smart TV. The bedrooms consist of a king-size with en-suite shower room, a king-size with balcony, and a single, along with a bathroom. Outside, there are shared grounds, and designated parking space for two cars. Within 0.2 miles, there is a shop, and within 0.4, a pub. Please note that pets and smoking are not permitted. WiFi, fuel, power, bed linen and towels are all included in the price. A highchair and cot are available. Note: Check-in from 4pm, check-out by 10am. Note: There is lift or stair access to the apartment. Choose The Mary Maude Suite for a luxury setting on your next holiday in the Lake District.

description.neighborhood: Ulverston has a cobblestone main street. It has independent shops, cafés, and pubs with open fires and real ales. Fine dining and tavern meals are both available. Ulverston is a festival town, with flags, walking, art, and music festivals in the summer and the Dickensian Christmas festival in late November. It is the birthplace of Stan Laurel and the world record holder for the greatest foam pie battle in the world. The town and surrounding area offer stunning views of the southern Lake District and Morecambe Bay. Deepest, widest, and shortest canal makes for a great afternoon walk with a pub and bay views. All National Park attractions are accessible. Furness Coast has sandy beaches and birding. Nearby family attractions include the South Lakes Wild Animal Park, Lakes Windermere and Coniston, and Birkrigg Common.

hosts.about: I am both a host and a traveller

recent.comments: Beautiful location. Quiet with spectacular gardens. Dollar is a small town. Friendly people and history surrounding the castle.  Karen’s place is exactly as described but better!  Very clean and well stocked.

items.comments: Beautiful location. Quiet with spectacular gardens. Dollar is a small town. Friendly people and history surrounding the castle.  Karen’s place is exactly as described but better!  Very clean and well stocked.

Stunning inside and out! The photos don’t do it justice. It is an old castle on the outside and a totally redone, modern apartment inside with lots of charm. Beds were very comfortable. The kitchen was massive with everything you would need to cook a feast and the space to serve it. We were sad to leave.

This is indeed a once-in-a-lifetime place to stay in terms of the history and setting. Everything about the flat was spacious and luxurious, and we loved the extra touches like bubble bath, coffee, and some breakfast essentials. The beds are just fantastic, and those deserve a mention of their own 😁! This is a such a beautiful and culturally significant area of Scotland, so we enjoyed walking, hiking, and driving to explore all of it. In particular, Karen’s website/portal was deeply appreciated and super helpful - a true gem at helping us to lay out an itinerary. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a relaxing and beautiful stay in the Scottish countryside - it really delivers!

Dollar is a cute town with local shops and nice nearby hikes. Karen’s place is in a peaceful and beautiful location. The accommodation is big but remains cosy and is decorated with taste (modern with glimpses of history). The garden is gorgeous. The kitchen is equipped with everything you would need. Karen provided lots of recommendations for our stay and even some treats that were greatly appreciated upon our arrival. Don’t hesitate to book the great hall!
Karen’s castle was a fantastic place to stay! Absolutely gorgeous, brilliantly clean. It was an amazing home base for us to explore this part of Scotland.

This place is IMPRESSIVE, to say the least. VERY spacious, 3 full bathrooms. We wanted to spend more time in/at the castle property. It feels pretty private, but the castle has 8 or so other apartments. The town of Dollar is only 5min drive, so it was easy to get dinner or groceries.

We book The Great Hall for a few days to celebrate my 60th birthday and I am so glad we did.  Karen's place is fabulous inside and out.  The attention to details was noticeable everywhere.  The place is spotlessly clean and is very well stocked with more than just the normal essentials.  I highly recommend The Great Hall and Karen.  We will most definitely return!

Thank you, Karen!

description.summary:
This 2 bedroom apartment is the beautifully converted former Great Hall of Dollarbeg Castle.

Built in 1890, Dollarbeg Castle was the last gothic baronial style building of its type ever built. 

Beautifully restored in 2007 to the very highest standards, it was converted into 10 luxury properties, one of which is a conversion of the original "Great Hall" with its vaulted ceiling and majestic views across the formal grounds towards the Ochil Hills in the distance.
description.space: This is a truly rare opportunity to explore Scotland while staying in a historic building...ideal for short romantic getaways or for longer breaks exploring all that Scotland has to offer
description.access: This apartment has it's own entrance and is totally  private
description.notes: Guests should be aware that the open plan lounge/kitchen area of the apartment is directly above the living space  of one of our neighbours and we are very keen to minimise the risk of noise transfer through the wooden floor, so this apartment may not be suitable for families with very active children.
description.neighborhood: The apartment is set within 3 acres of formal grounds and private woodlands, all of which are available to roam and enjoy at your leisure during your stay

hosts.about:
Hi,

My name is Teva. I’m an artist, a father to a golden retriever and a lover of nature. 

I’ll treat your home with respect, care and love! 

Teva

I am a native Southern Californian, writer, artist, designer, communicator, mother and partner who left for Oregon for ten years and happily returned home. I love beautiful old properties, majestic oak trees, historic architecture, music, fresh food, chocolate, art, people and places.

recent.comments: Beautiful location inside and out.  Super clean and private.  Well equipped kitchen and yard areas.  Felt very safe and cozy at the same time.

items.comments: Beautiful location inside and out.  Super clean and private.  Well equipped kitchen and yard areas.  Felt very safe and cozy at the same time.

Absolutely lovely! This home was the perfect escape from everyday life. Tucked up in the hills, Debra’s charming home was the perfect place to stay for a weekend in Los Angeles. Close enough to the city, but enclosed in the hills and surrounded by nature, this was the perfect destination to recharge. Extremely clean, luxurious amenities, and a gracious host, we hope to come again!
Simply amazing. Unique, beautiful, peaceful!

place was great and so was Debra.  would have been 5 stars but the AC didn't work the first night and it stayed over 80 degrees all night.  these things happen and she offered to have it fixed the next day but thankfully the temps fell quite a bit over the weekend so not needed.  

would highly recommend and she was a great communicator.

This is a Five Star Home! Look no further for your Los Angeles BNB rental. I am extremely grateful that Debra allowed me and my wife to create such beautiful memories and reconnect in her home. 
The sheer presence of the castle in person is jaw dropping. The courtyard and the design of the home give off such tranquil vibes . The setting of the home takes you to a different time period where the things that matter aren't electronic devices but the people you are there with. 

The heated spa was absolutely amazing and exactly what was needed while we were on our retreat. There home's Soundsystem ( the sound system is exquisite! A+ for the sound system ) has a speaker  spa/poolside which adds to the ambiance and allure to that setting.  Just imagine the heated spa, your favorite tunes and the warm vibes of a fire pit all at the same time...😁

The inside of the home is just as exquisite  as the out. There is so much detail in the home and you can really tell that gave careful thought to it's design and layout. 
The oversized shower also can double as a steam room!! It's unreal how beautiful this home is.

Prior to reserving, Debra communicated that she would be onsite was onsite  however in a completely separate section/location of the home . She advised that we would only share a carport and a common walkway from the carport.  Her transparency about her being onsite allowed me  to make a decision on whether or not I wanted to book. I really appreciated that. (To add , we had complete privacy . We saw Debra for the initial home tour and that was it ) 
The communication was excellent. The personality was very welcoming. When I had questions regarding places to eat, she not only   provided me with a listing of suggested restaurants,  she pulled some strings to get us the best seats in the house @firefly.  
The wine and snacks were a pleasant welcoming gift too ☺️
Debra is the kind of host that I would most definitely love to do business with in the future. Me and my wife will forever share fond memories of our first time to California.
Thank you Debra for sharing your home with us.

We absolutely loved our stay! Private, Tranquil, beautiful down to every little detail with so many things to enjoy. Truly magical. Debra was helpful, attentive, quick and easy to communicate with and really made sure our stay was as comfortable as can be. One of the most beautiful Airbnb experiences, you won’t regret booking!
What an amazing place! We loved everything! Debra was great and we loved every detail of the house and stay!

description.summary: Entire upstairs in this historic, iconic 1931 castle includes kitchen, living room, exclusive gardens, courtyards, pool & spa. Tucked high up in the legendary Laurel Canyon, this just restored 2 bed/1 bath private suite embodies Hollywood's golden age with 21st Century comforts. Quiet and serene, surrounded by ancient oaks and flowering bougainvillea, yet minutes from bustling Sunset Strip, West Hollywood and Studio City, this property is a rare example of 1920s filmic storybook architecture.
description.space:
*** Please note: 4-day maximum booking from May 26-September 4.
*** Additional guests not noted in the reservation will be charged an additional $150/night.

The upstairs suite in this magical newly restored gated home includes full kitchen, living room, master and guest bedroom, marble bathroom and steam shower for two, claw foot bath tub, two fireplaces, private courtyard off one side of the master, and deck overlooking pool on the other. Very private, quiet, safe and exclusive! 

With its long history, every inch of the suite oozes character, patina and detail rarely seen in modern homes. The master bedroom is a stroke of romantic genius reminiscent of a far away outpost from ancient times. Think gothic doorways and leaded glass windows in a circular room with an enormous rotunda ceiling (and yes, a smart tv).

From the master, step into the private stone courtyard and imagine you are in a Spanish castle built by Gaudi. 

Adjacent to the master is the guest bedroom, which can accommodate twin, full, queen or a king sized bed. 

Both bedrooms open to the vestibule with its groin vault ceiling and round gold leaf skylight, which leads to the sumptuous bathroom as well as the deck overlooking the pool for outdoor lounging and dining. 

Serving both the master and guest bedroom, the bathroom is for highly discriminating clientele desiring an experience reminiscent of a Turkish spa. Unwind in this architecturally elaborate Morroccan-inspired chamber powered by two steam jets and equipped with his-and-her shower heads, chromotherapy lighting, marble slab for reposing, rain head and built-in audio speaker. 

Flowing seamlessly from the vestibule through the interior gothic rock archway is the kitchen and banquette…and then onto the living room,  where you surrender yourself to the royal surroundings of a fantastic gothic room modeled after sets of European castles featured in films in the 1920s and early 30s (specifically, Boris Karloff's castle in the original black and white "Frankenstein" film).

The back living room door leads past a wishing well to the tunnel, through which you walk to a moat over the swimming pool. From here, you can slip into the gated pool area and play a game of ping pong, forget it all in the spa or chill in the hammock by the fire pit. 

Lighting details throughout the suite are exquisite, with chandeliers, hand-blown glass pendants, crystal sconces, natural fiber shades, up lighting, pin spots and swing arm lamps, all setting the mood for warm, glowing ambience. No stark overhead airport landing strips of recessed led lights in this house.

This historic residence, at once luxurious and unique, is one of the oldest homes in the Lookout Mountain section of Laurel Canyon. It is ideally situated to provide a peaceful respite from the sprawling city below yet fantastically well situated in the Hollywood Hills. You won't be able to find such a unique, high-end accommodation like this in Los Angeles (or the world), and certainly not for less than the cost of a one-bedroom pool suite in a comparable old Hollywood hotel. It is truly one of a kind. 

Calling all writers, artists and romantics seeking a space in which to work and relax, this filmic castle in the canyon is a storybook set waiting for someone to inspire.

Walk 3 minutes to the best ocean-to-city view in town or drive 3 minutes to one of the best networks of hiking trails the city has to offer.

Minutes by car from either Studio City, Universal City, The Sunset Strip, West Hollywood, Hollywood and Beverly Hills. If headed to the beach, Sunset Plaza Drive connects to Sunset Blvd, which winds through posh neighborhoods and ends directly at Pacific Coast Highway. Very centrally located. Many fine restaurants and cultural points of interest in areas easily reachable by rental car or Uber.

Weekly maid, garden and pool service provided. 

Communications:  Flat screen tv (Netflix, local channels and HBO…more cable channels available upon demand) in master bedroom, plus turbo wifi, and built-in Sonos sound system. Wireless booster for the pool area, and several inside/outside areas can serve as work stations. 

We keep a completely separate and private downstairs studio for use by either one of our family members unless you are renting the entire property, which includes both the upstairs and the downstairs suite.

Spa heats up in 15-20 minutes and costs $15 per use. Pool heat requires at least two days advance notice and costs an extra $60 per day.
description.access:
This is a gated property. When you book, you will be provided specific property directions and access instructions. 

Off-street tandem parking for two cars is available inside the carport and driveway. 

From the carport, walk up the first and second flight of stairs. The doors will be left unlocked for you to enter and enjoy. Basic amenities are provided, including starter supply of soap and shampoo, paper products, and hotel-quality linens and towels.

Access the private pool, spa and fire pit area through the gothic gate at the end of the wide stone pathway. Enjoy the garden. Pick the fruit in season.
description.notes:
Our 20-year-old son, a college student, is helping manage our property. Don't be surprised if he answers your calls or email.

The entire house is on filtered water, so drinking and showering is free of chlorine and other impurities. The kitchen comes equipped with a Miele combination steam-convection oven rather than a microwave.

Even though we're in the middle of the city, cellular service is sketchy in the hills. However, we have excellent wifi throughout the house for Wifi assisted cellular calls and a TMobile booster. If all else fails, we have  a back-up landline for domestic calls.

Remodeled guest bedroom not shown in photos.
description.neighborhood:
Charming homes surrounded by ancient oak trees are tucked into soaring canyon walls of green, providing a sense of privacy, quiet and seclusion in the city's coastal green belt known as the Santa Monica Mountain range. And yet, within a 3-minute walk from the house is a vast view of twinkling lights from the amazing city at night and the endless blue ribbon of the Pacific Ocean on the horizon during the day. Also minutes from one of the best network of hiking trails in the city, and located in the esteemed Wonderland school district.

For those who seek to glimpse the way Laurel Canyon used to be in its early days, this is the neighborhood. It is still quaint and reflective of its original character.
description.transit:
Even though Laurel Canyon is ideally close to Hollywood, West Hollywood, Studio City and the major studios, the property is located in the hills above the city. A car or Uber (please tip the driver) is recommended for quick and easy city access. 

The Saturday Night Live skit, "The Californians," is no joke. Angelinos get in heated debates about the best ways to circumnavigate the city's notorious traffic to get to desired locations. For those unfamiliar with the city (or even if you think you know it like the back side of your hand), we'll do our best to provide you with what we consider the most desirable routes. 

To access areas impacted by major traffic and expensive parking (such as Downtown Los Angeles), you can easily drive to the Universal City/Studio City Metro station (where there is generally free parking to be found before 7:30 weekdays) and from there explore the city using public transit. Alternatively, if you are in good shape you can walk  to the intersection of Lookout Mountain and Laurel Canyon, where a bus stops hourly.

If you don't feel like messing with the city and its traffic, just put on a pair of sneakers and explore the neighborhood on foot. Some of the most breathtaking views in all of Los Angeles are here, and also fun little narrow roads and plenty of hills for a vigorous workout.

The closest coffee joint and market is our beloved Canyon Country Store (a genuine throw-back to the rock and roll era of the '60s and '70s for which Laurel Canyon is world renown) on the corner of Laurel Canyon Blvd and Kirkwood. This is a great place to soak up the vibe of the hood. Of equal impressive Laurel Canyon vibey-ness is the most excellent Pace restaurant, located downstairs from the market. (If you don't want to motor or Uber down to Pace's, they deliver in the canyon!)
description.interaction: 24/7, we are available to help.
description.house_rules:
IMPORTANT: Please send an Inquiry or Contact the host BEFORE submitting a Request. Scroll past the reviews to find the Contact Host button.

MINIMUM NOTICE: 48-hour minimum notice required. 

ADDITIONAL RULES:

1) NO PHOTO SHOOTS (INCLUDING SOCIAL MEDIA) on property without prior authorization of owner or co-host. Photo shoots are charged separately from guest stays. Starting price is $900 for half-day exterior still photo shoot and $2000 for exterior video. 
2) NO THIRD-PARTY BOOKINGS without prior permission of owner or co-host.
3) NO UNBOOKED VISITORS OR ADDITIONAL GUESTS are allowed on the premises without prior permission of owner or co-host. Doing so will be grounds for immediate cancellation of the booking.
4) Hushed voices after 10 on work nights, 11 weekends. No pool/jacuzzi after 10 work nights and 11 weekends. No loud music at the pool.
5) This is not a party house. No excessive drinking.
6) Please lift up your luggage inside the house to avoid scuffing floors.
7) No smoking/no candles on the property -- inside or out. 
8) Carport gate to be kept closed at all times
9) Front gate to be kept closed AND LOCKED at all times
10) $130 charge for the first day of pool heating; $65/day thereafter. Spa heating is $5/day.
11) Check-in at 4, check-out at 11, no exceptions without approval
12) Please take shoes off while in the house.
13) Keep the kitchen nice for the next guests.  *** No roasting of meats in the Miele oven! ***Clean the inside of the big oven if you dirty it. ***Do not put the Nutribullet container in the dishwasher (the dishwasher clouds the plastic). ***If you burn a pan, clean the pan. A pumice stone is next to and Barkeeper's Friend is under the sink. (The dishwasher does not clean pans that need to be scoured by hand.) 
14) LIVE WOOD kitchen peninsula and banquette table are in mint condition. Please keep off foods that stain (think blueberries) and hot pans!!!
15) Reduce or turn off AC/heating and lights when you leave to reduce energy usage.
16) If you move furniture, put it back where you found it unless you get owner's permission. Replacement fee of $90 will be charged otherwise.
17) Additional $50 charge for Saturday check-outs and Sunday check-ins. (We lose Saturday night guest stays because our housekeepers take off Saturday afternoons and Sundays.)  

AND MORE...

An additional fee of $150/person/night will be charged for the sixth guest if you are guests in the Entire Castle. If you are guests in the Luxe Suite, a $150/person/night will be charged for the fourth guest.

This is a peaceful residential neighborhood, and we expect our guests to behave like respectful, quiet neighbors. 

Please be conscientious about water use (this is SoCal).

No pets without prior written authorization. Children are warmly welcomed with responsible parental supervision, and 100% supervision in pool area. No jumping or diving off the bridge or planters into the pool. No climbing in planters. Gates to the pool must be closed when this area is not in use. 

No fires in the wood-burning fireplace hearth except November-February. Also, no fires on "no-burn days." Determine if it is a no-burn day at the AQMD's "Check Before You Burn Map."

For your own safety, stay off all ladders on the property.

Your deposit will be fully refunded provided you leave the house and its contents in the same condition as they were in when you arrived, including clean dishes and garbage in the bins by the driveway. In addition, if any of our neighbors complain about noise, illegal parking or garbage cans being left on the street, we will deduct $200 from your security deposit.  

Outdoor maintenance crews (gardeners & pool cleaner) will be on the property sporadically throughout the week.

If your stay is 28 days or more, a separate contract with the owner must be signed.

Luxury Suite is not available 12/23-12/26 or 11/23-27.

HOLIDAY MINIMUMS:
July 4 -- 4 days
Thanksgiving -- 4 days
Christmas -- 10 days

recent.comments:
BOOK THIS CASTLE ASAP! 

Our family of 7 had the best time here at Springfield Castle. The hosts, Jonathan and Karen, greeted us when we arrived and they were so accommodating throughout our whole stay. We enjoyed every part of the castle from the beautiful decor, rooms, outdoor hangout areas, forest walk, deer farm, and more! We spent a couple days there, but we made sure to make time for one full day at the castle to enjoy everything from the incredible Irish breakfast with fresh ingredients from their farm (this was an add-on to our stay and I highly recommend this), walks in the forest trail, playing games on their lawn, enjoying their hot tub and fire pits under the stars, enjoying some drinks in the pub, and more! It was truly such a MAGICAL experience and we are so grateful for the hospitality, kindness, and incredible castle. Everything exceeded our expectations and we will always cherish the memories made from our wonderful stay at Springfield Castle! Thank you so much to the hosts again!

The grounds are steeped in history, the rooms are immaculately well put together, the amenities are incredible (bar in the basement, hot tub...) and overall, the castle is simply stunning. With beautiful furniture throughout and lots of space, it's the perfect place for a large group getaway. Jonathan was also a fantastic host - always helpful and quick to respond. description.summary: The East Tower is a beautifully renovated luxurious building. It has a beautiful courtyard & outdoor areas. When you rent the East Tower it is exclusively yours as it is only rented to groups not by the room. Base nightly & weekend  price set to reflect a 2 night stay low season. However if you stay for 2 nights,3rd night is free in low season & the weekly rate in low season is just €3500.  Mid & high season week prices differ.May-Sept 7 night minimum stay & bookings run  Saturday to Saturday.
description.space: The East Tower is situated in the heart of County Limerick on a magical 200 acre wooded estate and is approached along a magnificent three quarter mile long avenue, lined with ancient lime trees. Springfield is a family owned business run by Jonathan and Betty. Betty's brother Robert and his wife Rita, Lord and Lady Muskerry live in South Africa but visit at least once a year as Robert has a keen interest in his family home and its restoration. The estate includes beautiful woodlands and an organic working deer farm and Jonathan will be more than happy to take you to meet the deer. It is a historic castle where many battles were fought and for those who are interested Betty will share her wealth of knowledge and give you a tour of the 15th Century Tower house adjacent to the East Tower .There are also woodland walks, with barbeque areas, and lots of lovely outdoor spaces. The East tower has open plan shared spaces with a lovely long sitting room and a very quaint pub,which we can stock with barrels of Heineken and Guinness for you. While you can cater for yourself while staying in the Castle we can arrange a chef to come in and cater for breakfasts, lunches and dinners if required. We produce a lot of fruit and vegetables in our chemical free walled garden and this produce is available for guests to buy. If you decide to enjoy a meal while staying the chef will use as much of the fresh produce from the garden as possible.
description.access: When you rent Springfield's East Tower it is exclusively yours. There are forest walks, a tennis court, a pool table, table tennis, table football ,darts, croquet, boules, badminton and   a pub which we can stock with barrels of Heineken and Guinness for you.There is a courtyard with a fountain,  a soccer pitch, archery, BBQ areas, a bonfire pit and much more.
description.neighborhood: If you are looking for exclusivity this is the place to be. There are no other properties in the vicinity, however there are 2 villages within 4 km with shops and pubs. There is lots to do in the near vicinity such as horse riding, walking, paintballing, hawk walks,  water activities. The Tower is also well based for touring all of the south west and we can help you to plan day trips.
description.transit: There is a bus stop in Newcastlewest which is 15 minutes away. There is now a local link that runs a few times a day from Dromcollogher to Newcastlewest. Buses from Dublin, Cork, Kerry and Limerick arrive to this stop. There is a train station in Charleville which is 20 minutes away and there are trains from Dublin, Cork and Limerick to this station. We can organise a taxi from either of these location to the Tower.  It is recommended to hire a car but taxi, mini bus and touring buses can be arranged for those who dont want to drive.

description.summary:
If your looking for something a little different then The Bridge House might be for you! 

My unusual 4 bedroom home is actually part build on a bridge spanning the River Ardle!

It was completed in 1881 and is category A listed.

It has recently been renovated to a warm & cosy standard!

Charming original features including stone spiral stairs, traditional Scottish timber clad walls, brick & pine flooring.

All mod cons including wifi & smart TV.

Quiet, peaceful, rural location, pretty views.
description.space:
The adventure begins as you enter the front door with a winding stone spiral staircase on your left and kitchen on the right.

My large kitchen sitting room has original brick flooring with timber and stone walls.  The kitchen is fully fitted and has everything you need.  There is a cosy Esse wood fired oven, not only pretty but practical too.  I love breakfast here looking at the river and bridge, especially in the morning sun.  There is also a large comfortable sofa and smart TV.

The spiral staircase leads up to the stable bedrooms and bathroom. 

The stable master bedroom is large and bright with views of the river on one side and beautiful Strathardle on the other. It has a king size double bed, smart TV and mini fitted wardrobe.

The second little bedroom is cosy with a small double bed (tight for two). There is also freeview TV, ornamental fireplace and traditional gas lamp lighting!

The top of the spiral staircase opens onto a walkway connecting the stable building to the upper bridge house. The is a veranda seating area on one side and a small sauna in a quirky stone out-building on the other.

The upper bridge house has a romantic  master bedroom with kingsize four poster bed and great views downriver.

The second little bedroom also has a small double bed, pretty views up river views and 'en-suite' privy direct into the river below (no longer in service!)

Both bedrooms share a bathroom with bath/shower.

There is also a connecting sitting room / mini second kitchen with log stove. 
(The bridge house can also be rented as two separate 2 bedroom self contained units - see other listings.)

If you're lucky with the weather you can enjoy the garden and river. Here there is a barbecue and seating area.
description.notes: I occasionally stay in a studio apartment located with a private entrance at the parking area. (Normally only on changeover days.)
description.neighborhood:

Sounds of river below.

. Please note, the SMALL DOUBLE BEDS are tight for two! (120cm wide.) 

. Please no dirty dishes in kitchen sink, take all rubbish to the door outside every day neatly if no time to take to the dumpster at the end of the road.

Airconditioning was on when we entered the place (which was nice) from 109 degrees outside. When we parked up the driveway, it was a bit confusing of where we were to enter into the building. We finally found it along a sidewalk towards the front area of the property, arrows to guide probably would be needed. 

Every morning we were woken up by construction hammering/banging upstairs. We loved the antiques all around the entire place. We had NO TV access!! No remote for the main room and remote in the bedroom batteries were dead. Someone did drop off some batteries but it was too late. Owners were out of town so the response time was off. However we made it work by watching our cell phones. 

It was a Very Beautiful place however, spending that kind of money for what we got (on this special trip), we probably will not book here again.

I travel for work to LA monthly, this is my favorite place I have stayed.
I don’t think we left the front porch the entire time, it was such a beautiful view. The bed was also fantastic. Will definitely book again if it is open.

description.notes:

Table set up in your suite, candles, relaxation music, spa water, aromatherapy essential oils etc.

The Castle Urrea is perfect for those searching for a special and unique get away.

Your accommodations are very spacious and private. Your Host is nearby in a separate home if you have questions or would like a walk through on our lush grounds. The views are endless from your ground level private airbnb suite and patio. It is beautifully staged for your stay. 
Fresh orchids, art and unique furnishings set the ambience for our elegant decor. Provided in the hallway nook is a mini refrigerator/freezer, micro wave, coffee maker, coffee & tea selection and toaster. Adjacent is an antique wood buffet cabinet equipped with silver tray, ice bucket, tongs, wine cork remover, glasses, cutlery, plates, creamer, tea cups, placemat settings and coasters. This is a fully functioning serving nook. NOT A KITCHEN.
description.house_rules:
IMPORTANT PLEASE READ

* Due to COVID-19 we are only allowing registered guest at the castle. No visitors please unless pre-approved by host on Airbnb thread.
We are practicing safe social distancing. 

* NOTIFY your host PRIOR TO ARRIVAL if you plan to have guest visit. 

* Airbnb designated PARKING SPACE is along the cement flowered wall only. Please DO NOT park in front of garage doors.
Instructions & Pictures are available on Airbnb website. Please review.

* PLEASE NO SMOKING INSIDE THE CASTLE. 
This includes cigarettes, marijuana, cigars or hookah’s. Smoking is only permitted outside on the patio. Please be respectful of this Rule. 
NOTE: A $350 fine will be enforced if smoking inside.

* PLEASE USE COASTERS Provided on all wood surfaces.

* DO NOT light or use the Fireplace. It is for décor only. 

* Do not light candles. 

* OWNERS private gated back-yard is off limits.

* PLACE ALL your trash in the trash cans.

* NO PARTIES or Loud Music or Events.

*Suitable for Infants if you bring your own gear. NOTE: No cribs, play pens, children's bedding or high chairs are provided.

* No Pets 
If you have a well mannered Pet. (You can send us a pet request and we may consider.) 
Note: If pre-approved, there will be a Pet Fee of $35 per night per dog up to 2 dogs)

* ALL UNREGISTERED GUEST Must leave Castle by 10:00pm or additional guest fees will be charged.

* PLEASE LEAVE ALL REMOTE CONTROLS inside the airbnb. There is one remote control for each television and one remote control for the air conditioning/heating system. If these remotes are missing at time of your departure you will be charged $150 per remote to replace. 

*NOTE: If we discover you have not disclosed all registered guest on your confirmation there will be a fine of $75 per person per night, strictly enforced. Our per day rate is based on 2 people aka double occupancy. 
 
* We have a 4 Guest Maximum: Master bedroom sleeps 2 and a Queen size sleeper sofa located in your private living room sleeps an additional 1-2 people. 
Upon request we have an additional twin deluxe air mattress.

* WE OFFER SEPARATE EVENT RATES FOR PHOTOSHOOTS & FILMING 

**** BRIDAL/ BRIDESMAID PHOTOGRAPHY ****
Rates vary depending upon Castle usage required and size of your bridal group:
(Please include in your group number....the photographer, assistant, hair, make up, stylist, and or whoever is an additional part of your team.)
Rates start at $600

THANK YOU.....And most importantly enjoy your stay!

hosts.about:
Our love affair with villa holidays first began in 2003 when Co-Founders Oliver and Ravi spent a week at a crumbling chateau in the Dordogne with a group of their closest friends. As fate would have it, that holiday was the start of something special. It was the beginning of Oliver’s Travels.

Today, we have over 6,000 hand-picked villas, chateaux and holiday homes across the top holiday destinations – with new regions launching every year. 

Before deciding on the where, it’s important to consider what you want from your villa holiday. Is it to relax around the pool, dining al-fresco with a spot of sightseeing? Or you are looking for an action-packed trip? Whatever you decide, it’s a good idea to put your requirements at the forefront when discussing with our travel experts who are the best in the business and we have countless awards to match. Trust us, we'll find you the perfect villa holiday to surpass your expectations. 

And the best part? Once you book a villa holiday, the service doesn't stop there. Our Free Concierge Service means you'll be in good hands to arrange catering & fridge stocking, housekeeping, childcare, tours & activities and so much more, to make your stay truly extraordinary

description.summary: Sitting proudly in a one hundred acre private estate, Jacobean Manor is an impressive Grade I listed Jacobean manor house that offers groups of family and friends a fabulous stay. The manor house is located in Flintshire in north east Wales with Cheshire to the east, Denbighshire to the West and Chester within easy reach.
description.space:
The area is rich in history and culture with King Edward I ordering work to begin on Flint Castle in 1276, a site of fierce battles between the Celts and Romans, British and Saxons, and Welsh and Normans. Hawarden enjoys two castles, one the home of William Gladstone, four times British Prime Minister. Other notable attractions in this wonderfully scenic area are Ewloe Castle, Bailey Hill in Mold and Point of Ayr lighthouse. Mold is a bustling market town famous for its theatre, markets and June carnival and surrounded by an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The highest peak in the Clwydian Range boasts stunning views of six counties. The nearby Snowdonia National Park offers sensational, rugged scenery, waterfalls and hiking trails to the top of Mount Snowdon. Guests staying at Jacobean Manor enjoy an endless list of castles and stately homes to visit and the young are spoilt with fabulous family friendly attractions. 

Jacobean Manor is imposing, spacious and very comfortable. This private country house is situated at the end of a long, tree lined drive. It is the perfect countryside getway offering total privacy and many entertainment options. Guests can totally self-cater or can opt for various dining packages. The house is ideal for special celebrations. Jacobean Manor dates back to 1540 and offers atmospheric rooms and a fabulously warm and lived in ambience. The house can sleep up to fourteen guests. Three acres of beautiful gardens lay within the surrounding stone wall together with a south facing Victorian walled garden and central lawn. The land surrounding the house leads to the River Alyn. Within the estate, another property, Argall House which Oliver’s Travels also features, sleeps a further eight guests should you want to invite more guests to share your holiday. 

Guests enjoy superb entertainment spaces at Jacobean Manor, including a fabulous drawing room, an oak-panelled central hall, a stately dining room and a second floor television room brimming with atmospheric original beams and vintage sofas and chairs. The main entertainment spaces with fantastic carvings and walls covered with oil paintings. The house boasts seven bedrooms, four of which are on the first floor alongside four bathrooms and three on the second floor with two bathrooms. You will feel as though you have gone back in time at this remarkable house. Though you are welcome to use the large fully-equipped kitchen, you might be tempted to opt for some catering. The live-in housekeeper, can prepare delicious feasts for breakfast and special menus are available from fine caterers to be served by waitresses in the dining room. Breakfast includes cereals, fruit, organic yoghurt, sour dough toast, jams, marmalade and Welsh honey, full cooked breakfasts, juice, tea, coffee and newspapers so it is very tempting. Afternoon teas are available and the evening menus are extensive, including canapes, starters, mains and desserts. 

The bedrooms are beautifully finished and presented. They offer Italian Frette linen, duck feather pillows and duvets and wonderful art collections. The master bedroom was originally the drawing room in the eighteenth century. It boasts a beautiful, upholstered bed, intricate cornicing and stunning panelling, a comfy sofa and chairs and stunning garden views. Guests have use of a spacious adjoining bathroom. The second bedroom enjoys an antique four poster bed and remarkable wall murals. Its bathroom sits at the end of the adjoining passage. The next bedroom boasts an intricately carved bed with exquisite soft furnishings, a desk and sofa. The bathroom is adjoining. The last double bedroom on the first floor offers a beautifully dressed, kingsize brass bed and a bathroom next door. The second floor is home to the remaining three bedrooms and the enormous entertainment area with its large screen with Sky channels, DVD player and movie collection. Family board games are also provided for your entertainment. On the front of the house is a huge bedroom with a super kingsize bed that can be converted to twins. With its sky blue walls, vintage rug and adjoining bathroom, it is a light drenched gem. The final two bedrooms share a bathroom, one with a queensize bed and the other with flexible sleeping arrangements. The bed can be set up as a double or twins. You will certainly notice the attention to detail in every room. 

The gardens are a delight, full of colour, lush lawns and outdoor furniture. A barbecue is provided for alfresco dining and much entertainment is available. Guests can enjoy clay pigeon shooting with training given, falconry displays, archery, strolls through the estate and much more. There is a recommended therapist available for in-room massage and holistic treatments. 

Jacobean Manor enjoys a fascinating history. It is still owned by direct descendants of the original owners, the Lloyd family. The present house was built by Edward Lloyd in 1625 on the site of the previous house. The Lloyds are descended from Hywel ap Edwin who was Prince of Wales in 1096. 

Features:

Interior
- Entrance hall
- Drawing room
- Fully-equipped kitchen with Aga and Rangemaster electric cooker
- Dining room with seating for up to 20 guests
- Cloakroom
- Bedroom with double bed and en-suite bathroom
- Bedroom with four poster double bed and en-suite bathroom
- Bedroom with double bed
- Bedroom with king-size bed
- Bedroom with super-king bed (can be set up with twin beds on request)
- Bedroom with queen size bed
- Bedroom with zip & link double bed and 2 additional single beds
- Four family bathrooms

Exterior Grounds
- 100 acres of gardens and parkland
- A walled garden
- Croquet set 
- Tree-lined driveway

Additional Facilities
- Wi-Fi
- TV
- Plenty of parking

Location:

Jacobean Manor enjoys a fabulous countryside location in the county of Flintshire, an area rich in so many ways. With a distinctive heritage, it offers incredible landmarks and the most breathtaking scenery. Flint market can be dated back to 1278 and remains a popular attraction of this pretty market town. The ruins of Flint Castle built by Edward I are still worth visiting. The well of St Winefride’s in Holywell has been visited by pilgrims since the seventh century. It gained a reputation as the ‘Lourdes of Wales’. In Hawarden, St Deiniol’s Library is recognised as Britain’s finest library, having been founded by William Gladstone. Mold is another delight with its street markets on Wednesdays and Saturdays and its Theatre Clywd. The famous theatre was opened by Her Majesty the Queen in 1976 and remains Wales’ major drama producing operation. 

Angelsey is an hour and a quarter’s drive from Jacobean Manor via the North Wales Expressway. Here you will find spectacular landscapes, unspoilt coastline and picturesque villages and towns. There are scenic walks along the coastal path, fantastic water based activities and excellent cycle paths. Rhyl, Prestatyn and Colwyn Bay are all brilliant for days by the sea. The Wales Coast path from Prestatyn to Colwyn is stunning. Children love the SeaQuarium and Welsh Mountain Zoo at Rhyl as well as the town’s miniature railway. The Victorian seaside resort of Llandudno at the foot of the Great Orme, is known for its beautiful North Shore Beach and its iconic pier. 

Within the Snowdonia National Park, is the mighty Mount Snowdon, Wales’ highest mountain. There are six recommended paths up the mountain, all of which are pretty tough and can take between six and eight hours to get to the top and back. Alternatively, visitors can take a train up to enjoy breathtaking views of the lakes, waterfalls and peaks. 

The Roman town of Chester is within easy reach with its magnificent gardens constructed in 1949 just outside the city walls near the Newgate and Roman Amphitheatre. The garden project formed part of Chester’s contribution to the 1951 Festival of Britain. To provide access to the gorgeous River Dee, the gardens were remodelled in 2000. Chester Cathedral was founded as a Benedictine abbey in 1092. It was rebuilt from around 1250 in Gothic style, a process that took roughly 275 years. Chester Racecourse is known as the Roodee, the oldest racecourse still in use in England. With racing at Chester dating back to the sixteenth century, visitors enjoy many fixtures including the Boodles May Festival. Chester’s Roman Ampitheatre is the largest Roman ampitheatre in the UK. 

The National Trust’s Erdigg Hall is a popular visit, fourteen miles from the house. It is a fabulous stately home originally designed in 1683. Its walled garden is stunning with rare fruit trees, a canal, a pond and its collection of ivy. Another of the National Trust’s properties, Bodnant Gardens, is also worth a visit. The gardens span eighty acres with Italianate terraces, colourful shrub borders from around the world, a gorgeous waterfall, the Winter Garden, Old Park Meadow, a riverside garden and the Dell. 

Golfers and horse racing enthusiasts are delighted by the courses and Aintree being close by. Aintree is the home of the Grand National, one of the most difficult courses to complete with sixteen steeplechase fences. In addition to the Grand National, Aintree also hosts the Topham Chase, the Fox Hunters’ Chase, the Grand Sefton Handicap Chase and Becher Chase. Aintree is also used for motor racing and music events. There is a 9-hole golf course and driving range there too plus other fantastic golf courses nearby. 

Terms & Conditions:

Security deposit?
£1000 due one week prior to arrival. It will be refunded one week after departure subject to damage inspection. 

Arrival time?
4pm

Departure time?
10am

Energy costs included?
Yes, included in the rental price

Linen & towels included?
Yes, included in the rental price

End of stay cleaning included?
Yes. However, guests are required to leave the accommodation clean, tidy and in the same condition as on their arrival. 

Internet access?
Yes, included in the rental price

Changeover day?
Flexible

Minimum stay?
Please note that there is a 2-night minimum stay, this may be increased to 5 or 7-nights across peak dates

Pets welcome?
No pets

Smoking Allowed?
No smoking

Insurance?
Guests are required to be in possession of a valid insurance policy, which covers them for cancellations, personal belongings and any accidental damage caused during their stay.

Other Ts and Cs?
Please note that for insurance reasons, the fireplaces within the house cannot be used.

description.summary: Welcome to The Verdilla Castle located in the rural area of Selinsgrove, Pennsylvania. This stunning property is a modern masterpiece that seamlessly blends medieval inspiration with contemporary luxury. Built by a single man from the ground up in 2003, every detail of this castle is a true work of art. Don’t worry, you won't be living in the past - the tower is equipped with all the modern amenities you may need.
description.space:
The three story tower is ideal for one or two people, as it is NOT very spacious.
 
The first floor is the living room with authentic renaissance couches, refurbished and imported from France coated with 24 carat gold leaf and Italian velour, a smart TV that you can sign into your favorite streaming services and a fully stocked kitchen including salt, pepper, seasonings, oils, utensils, cookware, bakeware, etc…

The second floor is the bathroom fully stocked with toiletries. 

The third floor is the bedroom with ONE queen bed and a smart TV.
 (We do offer an air mattress per request as well for an extra guest, that you can set up in the living room.) 

You also have access to the pavilion with a fireplace, grill and outdoor furniture all year round! We provide wood and grilling utensils. Please make sure to bring a lighter and fire starting materials if you plan to use the fireplace.

The roof top access is currently closed until further notice!
description.access:
•Pavilion access is welcomed all year round, along with the fireplace, grill and outdoor furniture.
 
•Tower roof top access is closed at this time.
description.notes:
•The property is three separate units, we live in one of the units with two dogs, please do not book if that is a problem to you! Our third unit is unoccupied at the moment as the exterior/ interior is being renovated for airbnb.

•Located in the RURAL AREA of Selinsgrove PA, roughly 14 minutes from the “borough” of Selinsgrove PA. We are also roughly 10 minutes from Mt Pleasant Mills, PA where the closest grocery store and gas station is to the castle for most of your needs. 

•Depending on your cell phone service, you may or may not get service. ( We have Verizon, it’s spotty but usually works.)

•Tower roof top access is closed. 

•We only offer satellite internet because that’s all that’s available in our area, please work with the slower speeds.

•Outdoor restroom is open late spring, summer, and early fall. It does not have power or a sink,  just a toilet.
