The description doesn't really tell you much, but the photos are spot on. The bedroom and attached bath are gorgeous. The common areas are amazing. There's a player piano that I had to figure out how to use, but it was so awesome! I love history and historical places, so instead of dragging my partner to German Village and historic places to tour, we stayed here! It's remodeled, obviously, but it's still so charming. It has all of the modern features you need and all of the history and beauty you'd expect. There's an arcade system with old games in the basement, which we spent so much time playing! 

If you're wanting to stay in German Village, this is the place. There are so many great restaurants, bakeries/coffee shops, shops, etc around this place. The Book Loft is a five minute walk, and if you need to drive to another area, the location is really convenient for getting on the interstate.

I wouldn't hesitate to book again! Thank you so much for the experience!

description.summary:
Once home to Frederick Schwartz, a young apothecary shop owner who built the house for his young bride-to-be before she would immigrate from Germany in the 1800's. His fiancé dreamed of marrying in a castle, so young Fredrick got to work!

Unfortunately, long distance struck again and after his fiancé called off the wedding, via letter no less, Fredrick was said to have been driven mad with grief.  He stopped shaving and grew a big beard, stopped eating meat and started drinking only rainwater.

The Baronet - 1 bed
Located at the foot of the Ochil Hills in the small village of Menstrie, Scotland.  Just 10 mins to Stirling, 50 mins to Glasgow, Edinburgh & St Andrews makes Menstrie Castle Stay the perfect location to explore the central belt.
Menstrie castle sits proudly below the Ochil hills in the beautiful village of Menstrie.
The Baronet apartment is situated on the ground floor.

Tea & coffee supplies for your arrival at the Baronet
Beautiful large shower bathroom with a walk in shower.
Your stay will give you a warm glow at Menstrie Castle.
Hang your coats and kick off your shoes after your day out!

Floor plan - 

One bedroom Apartment

The Baronet, Menstrie Castle Stay
Menstrie castle sits proudly below the Ochil hills in the beautiful village of Menstrie.
The archway welcomes you to Menstrie Castle Stay.

Menstrie castle forms part of Clackmannanshire Tower Trail.

The castle was built in 1560 by the Alexander family. The museum is situated within the castle.

Entrance door to the Baronet Apartment.

Menstrie Castle Stay

Nova Scotia Gardens - 2 minute walk from the castle at the foot of the Ochil hills.

Meet the famous Foxboy!

Wallace Monument - Only ten minutes drive from Menstrie Castle.

Alva Glen is a dramatic and scenic walk up a steep sided gorge nestled in the Ochil Hills. With a forest floor carpeted with wild flowers and five waterfalls to see, the walk is full of natural beauty. Just over two miles from Menstrie Castle.

hosts.about: My name is Tracey and along with my husband and two boys, We run Menstrie Castle Stay, two self-catering holiday apartments in a Scottish Castle. Located in Menstrie at the foot of the Ochil Hills, we are just ten minutes from Stirling and within an hour's drive of Edinburgh, Glasgow and St. Andrews, the apartments are perfect as a base for exploring the central belt, visiting friends and family in the village or Stirling University, or exploring the many footpaths and cycle paths within steps of Menstrie Castle.

17th Century Italian Gates lead you to the Castle Keep, which dates from Norman times.
Beautiful Gardens surround the Castle. This is our magnificent bank of Rhododendrons in May or June, beyond the Castle's main lawn.
Beautiful Bedrooms - this is our most popular family room. First floor, overlooking the central courtyard.
The Tudor Bedroom with a fine Elizabethan bed
Traditional and modern bathrooms - this the Bathroom for the Tudor Bedroom
A charming viewing spot beneath the colourful rhododendrons.
A springtime view of the Chapel Lawn.
The Orangery - can be used for dancing and breakfast and other meals.
The Guests' Sitting Room. An excellent meeting room with wifi and 'Sky Q', and a DVD player.
Atmospheric view of the Great Hall's heraldic mantelpiece.
Manicured gardens - the view looking East from the Castle, with the Chapel and, across the valley, the village of Bickleigh.

A view towards the village showing our large field (suitable for recreational activities) the further side of the river, and the outdoor wedding lawn, which can also be used for outside theatre or music.
Wisteria in abundance on the trellis near the Knot Garden.
A different take on dining in the Orangery - 2019.
The Castle from the other side of our bridge over the River Exe, with the river in the foreground.
A Classic Car Weekend house party
Fun with inflatables on our stretch of the River Exe
A medieval weekend - themed House Parties are popular

All set for a Wedding Breakfast in the Great Hall. The Great Hall will accommodate up to max 70 for this purpose and it is a lovely setting.  We also have the designated 'Wedding Breakfast Room' which will seat up to 120.
A view down the Castle Lawns, from Watchtower hill .
Almost an aerial shot, showing the castle, Old Court (1435) which was one of our buildings, our big field beyond and the village of Bickleigh in the distance.
The Chapel lawn gazebo - this is specifically used for Garden Weddings, of which we are asked for several every year.

This is the Orangery, set up for a birthday party.  It is also used for breakfasts and when completely cleared it is a most excellent Dance Floor.  Easy access to the back gardens and the Tennis Court, which can be floodlit.
Wisteria in all its glory on the Castle walls.

The Wedding Breakfast Room set up for a 2023 wedding.  This is a 1st floor room with disabled access.  It will seat max 120 for a meal.   As it is very private and has excellent wifi reception, it also makes an excellent conference room.

Medieval EXETER CATHEDRAL (9 miles) is one of the finest examples of Decorated Gothic architecture and has the longest nave of its kind in Europe.  Find peace there by attending Cathedral Evensong, where the superb choir wll provide inspiration.
Wimbleball Lake - a great venue on Exmoor (14 miles) for watersports of all kinds.

The wonderful West Somerset Railway, at Minehead, Somerset.  At 18 miles, the WSR is one of the UK's longest heritage railways.  Drive either to Minehead (top end of the line) or Bishops Lydeard (near Taunton) for a great experience.

Putsborough Beach on the Atlantic Coast near Barnstaple.  Saunton Sands,  Croyde Bay, Putsborough and Woolacombe are all wonderful, expansive sandy beaches offering excellent surfing swimming and other watersports.

Dartmouth, on the South Coast, is famous for the Royal Naval College,  river trips, fine restaurants and sailing.  Home to the Dartmouth Steam Railway (which arrives the opposite side of the river) and the Royal Dart Yacht Club.
Dartmoor in winter.  Nearby Dartmoor National Park is famous for wild ponies and a wld high landscape ideal for trekking and exploration.  It is also famous for its 'Tors' (rocky outcrops).

Close to Tiverton Parkway and has a lovely pub only 10 mins walk away. They have a great tennis court we played on and they mowed one of their large fields for us to play games in. The Rooms have ample space and would thoroughly recommend.

items.comments: This is a fantastic space for large groups. Sarah went out of her way to help. The breakfast was first class. It was a completely unique experience. Close to Tiverton Parkway and has a lovely pub only 10 mins walk away. They have a great tennis court we played on and they mowed one of their large fields for us to play games in. The Rooms have ample space and would thoroughly recommend.

Thank you Bickley Castle for a lovely welcome on arrival, welcoming the dogs and the  freedom you kindly allowed us, and ensuring we could enjoy our BBQ under the shelter of the archway.The beds were extremely comfortable and great surroundings, a great place for the surrounding walks.   A big thanks from us all.

description.summary:
Bickleigh Castle is a fine Grade 1 listed property comprising the ancient Keep, Saxon Chapel, picturesque thatched cottages and some 60 acres with the River Exe running through it.  

Our delightful castle bedroom and cottage bedrooms  include spectacular views and comfortable beds . With exclusive use of the Castle and grounds, why not make our Castle your home for 2 days to 2 months!

Nightly price is for 16 self-catering (max settable). We can sleep up to 40 but the price will be higher.
description.space:
Located in the beautiful Devon countryside with a fine stretch of the River Exe running through the grounds, Bickleigh Castle is the perfect retreat for all seasons.
If you are looking for a peaceful, restful or romantic break, you have come to the right place. You can have a self-catering weekend.

The picturesque location has inspired many a writer, poet, artist and historian and it really does take you away from everything. 

With acres of gardens and grounds to roam, a 'secret garden' with an orchard and pond, a moat plus a beautiful chapel and Castle, there is plenty of space for you to explore. We also have an excellent hard Tennis Court, and plenty of space for an informal game of cricket or football.  For a relaxing end to the day, why not jump into our Hot Tub and relax with the bird song and wildlife all around?
 
We are very conveniently located just 20 minutes from Exeter and Crediton and only 10 minutes from Tiverton. We are easily reached from Tiverton Parkway and Exeter St Davids Railway Stations.

"Some came to soak up the grandeur and exclusivity of Bickleigh Castle, and others for its warmth and intimacy. Whatever the reason, each guest is guaranteed the most perfect stay "
description.access:
All guest areas can be accessed, including the gardens, grounds and recreational facilities and the various Reception rooms in the Castle and other areas. There are, however, a few private areas which may not be used. 

Guests booking through Airbnb will have exclusive use of the estate with the exception of the private areas; the estate will not be open to the public during a private exclusive use booking.

There is a very large amount of free parking, and, by arrangement, some garage space can be made available for special vehicles such as Classics.
description.notes: VERY IMPORTANT NOTE:  The listing is for 16 people but we can accommodate up to 40 ;  the amount quoted is ONLY for 16 people therefore, and any additional people are charged on a per head basis.  Furthermore, the quoted price is for self-catering. We can, however, provide full or part hotel services if required, at additional cost.
description.neighborhood: Bickleigh Castle is in a particularly beautiful and unspoilt area of the Exe Valley, yet only 8 miles from Exeter, 4 miles from Tiverton, 9 miles from the M5 (Junction 27) and 30 mins drive from Exeter Airport.  The Exe Valley may shortly be designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. There is an excellent range of eating places in the area.
description.transit: It is probably best to come by car, or hire a minibus for the duration. However, if coming by public transport, there are good train services to Tiverton (2 hrs from London)and Exeter St Davids, and frequent bus services.  The area of the Castle is suitable for walking, cycling, and kayaking on our river. For fishing you require proper equipment and clothing. We can arrange for you horse riding and clay pigeon shooting.
description.interaction: We will keep as high or low a profile as required. Usually we lay on some degree of hosting.  Staff, as mentioned elsewhere, are available.

hosts.about: En amour avec l'Estrie, heureuse de vous partager cet enthousiasme avec vous!

recent.comments:
Nous venons de passer un séjour inoubliable dans la magnifique maison Ryder. Dès le début, la communication avec Vincent était exceptionnelle, nous nous sommes sentis accueillis et bien pris en charge.

La maison en elle-même était tout simplement parfaite pour notre groupe. Avec ses espaces vastes et bien conçus, elle permettait à chacun d'avoir son intimité tout en offrant de grands espaces communs où nous pouvions nous retrouver entre amis. Que ce soit pour des repas conviviaux dans la grande cuisine, un après-midi de jeu et de tennis dans la cour ou une soirée de jeu de société, tout était pensé pour notre confort.

Chaque détail était soigné, et nous avons particulièrement apprécié la propreté et le charme du lieux.

Un grand merci à Vincent pour nous avoir permis de profiter de cet endroit merveilleux. Nous recommandons vivement ce logement et espérons avoir l'occasion de revenir très bientôt!

Maison très atypique, avec une ambiance dépaysante,  idéale pour un séjour en famille. Les enfants ont adoré la maison et les nombreuses opportunités de jeu. Terrain de tennis très sympa. Nous avons beaucoup apprécié notre séjour.  Vincent est très réactif et accommodant.

Nous avons passé un excellent séjour. La maison avait toute les commodités nécessaires pour accueillir 10 personnes. Nous avons apprécié le grand terrain ainsi que le terrain de tennis. Il y a un petit marché à quelques mètres à pied pour se dépanner. L’aération est difficile lorsqu’il fait très chaud en été par contre. Le décor unique de la maison offre une belle expérience malgré la chaleur que nous avons eu.
It was cool 👌

Super sejour! Vincent et Claudia sont disponibles et répondent rapidement en cas de besoin. La maison est magnifique, on se sent chez nous. Propreté impeccable! Nous n'étions pas encore parties que nous avions hâte d'y revenir. Merci a Vincent et Claudia pour ce sejour de rêve!

Caroline et Roxanne

Nous étions une dizaine de personne avec un bébé de moins d'un an. Tout s'est très bien passé, la maison a beaucoup de charme et nous avons adoré passer l'après midi sur le cours de tennis.

Je recommande les lieux

La maison de Vincent est incroyable ! Nous y avons souligné le cinquantième anniversaire d'un ami et il y avait tout l'espace et tout l'équipement nécessaire.  Quel plaisir de se prélasser dans le spa ou de disputer quelques parties de tennis en sirotant un gin dans les chaises Adirondack.  Le lieu est un personnage en soi, une maison pleine de caractère ! Nous avons beaucoup apprécié finir les soirées au salon du grenier.  De plus, malgré la déco à l'ancienne, tout le luxe moderne s'y trouve, du lave-vaisselle aux surmatelas en mousse-mémoire.

Avis aux amateurs de vélo : il y a de superbes circuits de gravel bike à faire dans le secteur, si le dénivelé ne vous effraie pas trop.

Vincent est un hôte généreux et attentif, nous n'avons manqué de rien !  Nous envisageons déjà un prochain séjour !

description.summary:
Rent a whole manor and its 28 acres of land, including a private tennis court and a swimmable private river. 

This house, also known under the name of "Witch Bay Castle" is one of the most beautiful ancestral houses in Quebec, built in 1880. The house was completely restored in 2000 and the work carried out has given it back its majestic and sumptuous character. houses of the time.
description.neighborhood: Located in one of Quebec's most visited regions, the Eastern Townships, the Maison Rider offers a versatile experience for all tastes! You will have nearby gourmet experiences, nature outings, spas, ski slopes and much more!
description.transit: Less than 20 min from Magog, 30 min from Sherbrooke, 1.5 hours from Montreal, 2.5 hours from Quebec City and 20 minutes from the USA.
description.house_rules: À moins d'une entente à cet effet, aucun usage commercial ou à des fins de tournage n'est autorisé.

gallery.caption: View From the Quarry, where the stone was taken from to build the castle.

recent.comments:
Without a doubt, the best place we’ve EVER stayed!!  The pictures give you only a taste of what it’s like to stay there.  The renovation of the castle is unbelievable- they’ve fit bedrooms and bathrooms into the most wonderful corners of the castle!

Most of our time was spent at the castle itself instead of going out and doing things.  There’s a full kitchen so do yourself a favor and cook a nice big family meal and enjoy it in the great room!

The bathroom with the bath, all the way up on the 5th floor, is an AMAZING feature.  Bring some bubble bath for an unforgettable way to unwind.

For parents- make sure to let your kids use the key to unlock/lock the door.  It’s such a cool feature of the castle.  

Build your Ireland trip around a few nights  here.  No one in your family will ever forget your stay!

items.comments:
Without a doubt, the best place we’ve EVER stayed!!  The pictures give you only a taste of what it’s like to stay there.  The renovation of the castle is unbelievable- they’ve fit bedrooms and bathrooms into the most wonderful corners of the castle!

Most of our time was spent at the castle itself instead of going out and doing things.  There’s a full kitchen so do yourself a favor and cook a nice big family meal and enjoy it in the great room!

For parents- make sure to let your kids use the key to unlock/lock the door.  It’s such a cool feature of the castle.  

Build your Ireland trip around a few nights  here.  No one in your family will ever forget your stay!
I can't even begin to describe this amazing place.  To stay in such history and the restoration was incredible! The location is simply lovely.  Fantastic experience for my family!
The castle was an amazing, memorable experience for our family! It was stunning, and the kids loved walking to each room and exploring. Castle hide and seek is a must!

Grantstown Castle is an amazing experience you and your family will never forget, go!  The castle is 15th century rustic, yet has a refined elegance that it a tribute to the wonderful restoration and interior design that was performed extremely well. My family of 5 had more room than we could have ever imagined. The kitchen was used to make one of the best dinners during our stay in Ireland. The dining room was lovely then we retired to the great room upstairs to enjoy playing cards next to the fire with wine and Irish whiskey. It has everything you need for a peaceful, once in a life time, castle experience.

Our stay at Grantstown Castle was one of the highlights of our trip to Ireland. The land is so peaceful and the castle was historic and beautifully restored, yet had all of the creature-comforts you could need. We enjoyed family game nights and it was easy access to surrounding towns, though we enjoyed eating “at home” to take advantage of this beautiful castle. Thank you to Alison and all for sharing this piece of Irish heaven with the world!

This is an amazing castle stay! It was so cool and fun. Our family had an amazing time just exploring the castle and soaking it in as well as the surroundings. So beautiful and peaceful. The castle is quite large as far as rooms and all go. We are a family of four and had more than enough room and could have had a few more join us and not felt cramped. Very spacious. Oh, and it’s a castle! It has been remodeled to be sure you have all the comforts you need while still being in a legit castle setting. Loved it! There are a lot of stairs to get to the rooms and it is a tighter spiral staircase. But again, it’s a castle! But those with mobility issues would have some challenges as all the bedrooms are up the stairs. That is not a negative on this place at all, just information. We all loved it… especially the kids (15 and 12). Highly recommend!

This is an amazing and meticulously restored tower house.  My 8 years old son loved everything about it (especially seeing the real swords and the wearing the play crowns) as did the adults (especially the great hall and the battlements). The 75 stone steps were great fun (and a good workout), though would be challenging with very little kids or folks with limited mobility.  A high highlight of our trip to Ireland!

description.summary: Built in the late 1400s, Grantstown Castle has been lovingly restored and mixes medieval architecture with modern comforts. The Castle Is Rented In Its Entirety And Caters For Up To Seven Guests. The castle is comprised of six floors, connected via a stone and oak spiral staircase. There are three double bedrooms and one single. The castle has great battlements which are accessible at the top of the staircase and host amazing views of the surrounding countryside.
description.space:
The castle is located in a rural farming area with stunning views of the surrounding countryside. It’s quiet and peaceful and perfect for relaxing. There are 3 double bedrooms, one with an en suite half bathroom. The fourth bedroom, which is very unique, is a small single room. Besides the en suite half bathroom, there are two full bathrooms (one with a bath, one shower), and one other half bathroom. The “Great Room” which was traditionally used for entertaining is the largest room with a beautifully hand built stone fireplace. Look up from the Great Room to see the Minstrels Gallery. Feel free to go up and serenade your loved ones! There’s a large table in the Great Room perfect for playing games! There are playing cards and some games available. There is a modest but functional kitchen on the bottom floor. The kitchen has a stove top, oven and microwave for cooking and has a stock of tea, coffee and hot chocolate. 

Grantstown castle was built during the first part of the 'Tudor' period. It is thought that the building date could be as early as 1480 but it was certainly in existence during the  reign of Henry VIII. The first documented evidence is found in the much cited "Ormond Deeds" of 1549, when the castle was owned by the very prominent 'de Burgos' family.
We have left a printed comprehensive history of the castle in a black folder in the Great room.

There are two prisons (oubliettes) within the walls of the castle, access to one of these (in the Great Room) is covered with reinforced glass which allows the room to be viewed. The light switch is behind you when looking down, behind the bench. Please turn off light switch after viewing.
The original entrance to the other prison is covered with a stout timber hatch, that can be seen when climbing the stairs.

The rooms in the castle are accessed by a spiral staircase, 72 steps to the first level of battlements. The staircase is well lit 24 hours a day, but is not for the faint of heart, or those who find stairs at all difficult.
description.access:
Guests will have full use of the castle in its entirety.

The castle can accommodate a maximum of seven people as there are three beautiful double bedrooms and a very unique small single room. 
Absolutely NO additional guests allowed IN the castle. Only the guests booked in to stay are permitted inside. Anyone found to be breaking this rule will be asked to leave immediately. 

Whilst every effort has been made to make the castle safe, please be aware that some doorways are rather low, and the staircase has very high steps, is narrow and tricky and not accessible for the less-abled or small children. Children should be accompanied by an adult at all times on the staircase. Please take care, we want everyone to have the most enjoyable experience when they visit.
description.notes:
Check in time is 4pm, check out 11am.

No smoking allowed anywhere in the castle, including out on the roof. 

We do have Wi-Fi on site, however it is not 100% dependable in the castle due to the thick walls. 

We live in one of the small cabins beside the castle (the middle one!). If we are here we would love to meet you and you’re free to call in if you need anything at all. If we are not there and you need anything we are just a phone call/message/email away, don’t hesitate to contact us.

Grantstown Castle is a very old stone building built in the late 1400s. There are a few ancestors of the original inhabitants still here today…. Spiders! We make every effort to remove them from the castle, but it’s impossible to keep them out, so you may see the odd spider or some webs, despite our best efforts and constant cleaning. It’s just how it is in a castle!! 

The castle is a large old stone building with walls as thick as 6-7’ on the lower levels. Therefore, it maintains a slightly cooler temperature. The castle has underfloor heating. Many people are surprised how warm it is inside! The thermostats are set to keep a constant comfortable temperature. But this will not be like Room temperature in a house. If the temperature outside drops, it can take the underfloor heating at least a day or two to catch up so it may be a little cooler.

In the winter months, when it's wet outside, the small single bedroom can get damp. We do have another comfortable fold up single bed on the "Minstrel's Gallery" that can be used instead if necessary.  

There are towels available for use.
description.neighborhood:
Grantstown Castle is in the middle of one of the two arms of the Golden Vale. The farmland in the area is amongst the best in Ireland and is largely used for dairying in this area but is more mixed wider afield. 
Six mountain ranges can be seen from the battlements on most days. The largest of these are the Galtee mountains . Further south and 'behind' the Galtees are the Knockmealdowns, The Comeragh mountains to the South East, Slievenamon to the East, the Devil's Bit to the North East and the tips of the Silvermines due north.
description.transit:
The castle is located on a very quiet road. It’s narrow , so take care driving in! 
It’s a lovely area to go out for a walk. You can stroll along the country roads or travel a bit further for some hiking in the nearby mountains. 
It’s just a short drive to the towns of Cashel and Tipperary. You will find everything you need in both of these towns, shopping, restaurants and traditional Irish pubs.
description.interaction: You can walk down into the “Quarry” from which the stone was taken from to build the castle. To access the Quarry, walk to the back of the property (past the three cabins), and go through the small black gate to the right. There is a beautiful arboretum to enjoy with a glorious view of the castle. The property line is the driveway of the cottage.
description.house_rules:
Check in 4pm, check out 11am. 
We kindly ask that guests keep the castle clean and tidy. Do not leave any excess garbage outside of the waste bins or dirty dishes outside of the dishwasher. Any additional cleaning required will be charged for.
Strictly no parties, gatherings or events. 
Absolutely NO additional guests allowed IN the castle. Only the guests booked in to stay are permitted inside. Anyone found to be breaking this rule will have their reservation cancelled and be asked to leave immediately. 
Weapons on display must not be removed from the wall. 
Absolutely no smoking inside or out on the roof. Any evidence of smoking will result in an additional cleaning fee. 
No eating or drinking (besides water) in the bedrooms. 
Do not open any windows. 
Keep all doors closed.

location.address: Blairgowrie and Rattray, Scotland, United Kingdom

Example page of an Fully organised Itinerary provided to guests

hosts.about:
Happy to help and willing to be involved in your stay as much or as little as you want. 

We can host a party for you or set up a retreat of the local golf course, organise a walk, hire a minibus to transport everyone, prepare any dinners you like (for an additional cost). Hundreds of weddings have been held at the property and all our experience is accessible to you.

Please contact us for specific requests.

recent.comments:
Lovely and quiet location. Great, big house with three levels and a courtyard area. Lots of character. Offered to set up pool table/ping pong table. Great outdoor space with front lawn/patio and courtyard area. We played Highland games outside. Two dining rooms. Lovely lounge and good bar area. Kitchen was huge. Would be good to have an easier coffee machine. Lots of parking.

Some bedrooms are nicer than others but all at least decent. Would be good to have pictures of all the rooms. A couple of the rooms in the main house were amazing and very big, and nicer rooms in the main house. There are 17 bathrooms (two single rooms share one of them). It was good to be able to have flexibility surrounding bedding configurations. We had a big group with some children and worked out really well. Travel cot and small single beds for kids. Hair dryers and irons floating about. 

The host was open to receiving constructive criticism at the end of the trip which we gave and seemed open to improving things which was good. 

Overall, a great stay. Thank you! :-)

A couple of the rooms in the main house were amazing and very big, and nicer rooms in the main house. There are 17 bathrooms (two single rooms share one of them). It was good to be able to have flexibility surrounding bedding configurations. We had a big group with some children and worked out really well. Travel cot and small single beds for kids. Hair dryers and irons floating about. 

The host was open to receiving constructive criticism at the end of the trip which we gave and seemed open to improving things which was good. 

Overall, a great stay. Thank you! :-)
Absolutely amazing. Will 100% revisit

A group of 22 adults and 8 children under 5 stayed here for my mum's 60th and it was perfect. Nick was very helpful in answering all my questions in the lead up to our stay. The directions were great. The house itself is lovely. We opted to cater ourselves and the kitchen was easy to navigate with essentials provided (oil, tea, coffee, etc). Everyone commented on how much they liked the house. I would definitely recommend staying here. I just need an excuse to come back!

We had so many positive experiences at Altamount Manor.  Just to name a few...

Breakfast was delicious and always on time 
Coffee / tea was offered whenever we were home 
They offered bar snacks to those relaxing/working in the bar
Nicholas + Cynthia  were very helpful with recommendations for restaurants and things to do nearby
The laundry service was very efficient. They even cleaned our muddy boats after a day in the field.
They  set up an in house massage for one of our crew 
The packed lunches were delicious and always ready to go on time 
The outdoor bbq lunch was also great.
The formal dinner on the last night was set up beautifully in the dining room
From Beginning to end, the service was wonderful.
They were accommodating to our guests with dietary restrictions, both gluten free and vegetarian
Everything was always ready when we needed it to be
Ample parking
Great location, only a 5–10 minute walk into thetown of Blairgowrie, 1.5 hour to EDI and 1.5 hour drive up to the highlands
The bar was well stocked and they were willing to go out and get anything else we needed
They outfitted the kitchen with dinner and late night snacks for those who did not want to go out
Nicholas, Andrew and Amy were all wonderful hosts
The rooms were cleaned daily and we were given fresh towels
There was ample space for all of our guests and film gear
The house itself had a fun Scottish manor vibe, in fact we were greeted by a suit of armor at the entrance every night
The town of Blairgowrie was adorable and the people were very friendly
The nearby Tesco was handy for stocking up on supplies, gas, and cash
All in all, the perfect place for our stay in the Highlands

Great venue for house party or wedding. Nick is a super host. The property is big and can sleep 30 comfortably.  Thoroughly recommend it.  If you want a designer smart property this is not that.  It a lovely big house to have a great gathering.  Food was excellent.

Perfect wedding Venue. Nick went above and beyond to make sure that we had a perfect wedding weekend. We had 21 family members staying in the house and there was plenty of room for everyone to have their own space as well as enjoy the common rooms together. If the venue is within your budget and is  available during your days I highly recommend booking.

We have just returned from a lovely weekend at “The Manor” There were 30 of us altogether celebrating a surprise 80th birthday party for my Father-in-law. 

Andrew was very welcoming on our arrival and helped us with the surprise when my Father-in-law arrived. He was always on hand if we needed anything and would reply to any requests immediately. With help from Tommy they cooked us a nice meal on the Saturday evening and did all the dishes and cleaning up afterwards, which was lovely. 

We especially loved the bar area and open fires in the lounge and dining rooms. 

The bedding and bedrooms were clean. They have recently decorated 2 of the bedrooms and put in 2 new en-suites. If they carry on doing this in all of the other bedrooms it will improve their standard from good to very good.

This ex hotel house is perfect for a large family get together. 

Thanks again Andrew for being such a welcoming host and Nick for good communication before our arrival with pre plans and visit.

description.summary:
Exclusive Use Luxury Retreat for Large Group Stays

Beautiful historic building (built in 1795) set in the heart of Perthshire, fully renovated and offering all the unique features of a traditional Scottish Manor as well as the comfort of modern equipment and facilities.

Essentially, this is your very own private hotel with or without staff, it is your choice depending on your wishes and budget. All bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and the Manor has a wonderful atmosphere for a group gathering.
description.space:
McArthur Manor is a Georgian Mansion of approximately 15,000sqf that was built in 1795 and has been renovated throughout with new bathrooms and furniture. This special building retains many of its original features and will grant you so many opportunities to give your invited guests an unforgettable experience for any type of stay, from a self-catering get-away, to having a fully staffed and tailored packed of services so that your invited guests don't need to cook, clean, do laundry or worry about a thing.


--- McArthur Manor House & Courtyard Comprises ---

★ 15 en-suite bedrooms over the Ground, 2nd and 3rd floors, each decorated in a unique style honouring Scottish towns & cities.
★ Private concierge available upon request.
★ Self-catering or staffed services available.
★ Pool table & Table tennis table set up when not arranging a special event.
★ Sky TV with Movie Package.
★ Cafetiere's & fully stocked tea/coffee station 
★ Bottles of water & treats in bedrooms
★ Bluetooth integrated sound system in downstairs communal areas.
★ Commercial high-quality WiFi network throughout the property.
★ A spacious breakfast & dining space split into two adjoining rooms with large windows along with an open fireplace and separate log burner.
★ Your very own traditional Scottish Bar to welcome you and your guests for drinks and chats anytime during your stay.
★ Pull your own pints of beer when ordering a barrel from us.
★ Sizeable, high-ceilinged and very inviting lounge adjoining the bar with a cosy fireplace (the ideal place to relax with a cup of tea in front of the fire, sitting on one of the chesterfield sofas and looking out on the gardens).
★ A fully equipped commercial kitchen.
★ Second prep kitchen
★ Our incredible Terrace Room (with direct access to our lovely patio), a vast and versatile party/entertaining/game space, capable of seating 100 for a formal meal, themed party, or can be set up with a pool table, table tennis, bouncy castle etc. (approx 1,700sqf)

--- Adjoining Courtyard ---

★ Three of the bedrooms located in this space
★ Situated directly at the back of the building - Straight access from the ground floor without leaving the confines of the property. This is the converted stable block for the Manor.
★ Secluded & secure walled garden with a grass picnic area - Fantastic sun trap and sheltered from any wind.
★ Garden furniture and large drum BBQ with charcoal - enabling you to enjoy outdoor meals.

--- The Front Outdoor Space ---

★ Half an acre of front lawn available for outdoor games and gatherings (space for a marquee, which we have in stock if required).
★ Garden patio with seating for 32 on cast iron antique chairs.
★ Grand bandstand on the front lawn for special events and photographs.
description.access:
All the space is yours to enjoy as you have access to the entire property.

Prior to your arrival at the Manor, we send out a welcome pack enabling you to specify the bedroom configuration as some beds moved and split into singles to best suit your individual group requirements.

The accommodation comprises 12 en-suite bedrooms inside the main building and 4 ensuite bedrooms in the adjoining courtyard.

The communal areas include our entrance hall with tea & coffee bar, breakfast/dining space, kitchen, traditional timber spirit bar (with pumps), lounge, function space (terrace room), ladies/gents toilets and outdoor spaces at the front and the back of the building (courtyard garden, front lawn with patio and bandstand).
description.notes:
Included:

* Commercial WiFi network (never be out of signal in any part of the building).
* Sony surround sound system and 55" TV set up with a chromecast connected if you fancy a movie night.
* SKY TV in the lounge with cinema package
* Integrated sound system that plays in the common rooms downstairs that you can control via Bluetooth from the bar.
* Each bedroom has a private bathroom, towels and hand soap.
* Hair dryers, irons & ironing boards are available to all.
* Bottles of still and sparkling water left in rooms, along with a few sweet treats.
* Board games as well as outdoor games are at your disposal.
* Tea & coffee as well as general kitchen sundries such as aluminium foil and seasoning.

Extras - Make your trip to Scotland memorable and unique!

All facilities are available for an additional charge, please contact us ahead of arrival to make arrangements.

Upon request:

* Concierge service and itinerary planning for the entire or part of your stay, to ensure things run smoothly so you can make the most out of local activities and our own events on-site.
* Airport collections.
*A cook is available to prepare your breakfasts and other meals.
* Formal meals for special occasions.
* Afternoon Champagne Tea.
Tea and coffee served throughout the day.
* Beer and Cider Kegs in the bar.
* A bartender can be supplied to serve your own drinks along with providing all mixers and soft drinks.
* A fully stocked and chargeable cash bar can be run during your trip.
* All kinds of entertainment or activities on-site can be booked in advance with our trusty partners (DJ & Karaoke night, Casino nights, Mini Highland games, Archery, etc.)
* Luxury Scottish Gift boxes can be prepared for your guests and left in the bedrooms.
* VIP red carpet arrival with cocktails.
* We can stock the Manor with everything you may need, so there is no rushing to the shop on arrival, including; Fully stocked bar self-serve bar, fridge and food items, or even a scratch-cooked large tray of a hearty dish to put in the oven to avoid stressing about meal prep. Toiletries can all be provided and anything else you may request…
* Our team is very friendly and on hand, if required, to look after your guests if needed in any way.
* Your invited guests can enjoy their drinks in an inviting traditional Scottish bar where a Keg of beer can be left for you to enjoy - you can select from Kronenbourg 1664, John Smiths or Magners Cider (you can purchase more kegs from us with up to three being able to serve at any one time - there are 3 taps).

PET OWNERS:
Please note that guests with pets must stay in one of the courtyard rooms as they are not allowed in the main house.
description.neighborhood:
A two-minute drive, or five-minute walk, from the Manor and you will find yourself in the heart of Blairgowrie. A little town with picturesque narrow streets and a welcoming one-way system. Blairgowrie offers visitors plenty of bars, restaurants, cafes and shops, traditional food and local pubs or modern options available (Subway).

The river Ericht is absolutely beautiful and runs through the town, offering the perfect setting for a short hike and with
the cateran trail on our doorstep for greater adventures.

Restaurants & Shops:

Along with a number of restaurants and shops around town, Blairgowrie also boasts a large Tesco and a brand new
retail shopping centre with a Starbucks Lidl, Home Bargains etc.
Tesco is about 10 minutes walk from the house so you can get anything you like (open 7am -11pm). The retail centre is
a 5 mn drive.

Local activities:

The countryside surrounding the Manor and Blairgowrie has some of the most famous Golf courses in the world close at
hand.

You will also be able to take part in a whole range of activities all year round: Skiing, fishing, shooting, mountain biking, hiking (Blairgowrie being the main start point for the 60-mile circular Cateran Trail that walkers can follow around the historic drove roads used by cattle rustlers). Or you can always try 4x4 off-road driving, quad bikes and even tank driving!

Attractions:

Blairgowrie is a charming little town with lots of character right in the heart of Scotland. If you are coming from abroad, you will enjoy discovering the fascinating country that is Scotland with its rich history and its authentic culture.

There are plenty of local attractions drawing visitors from all over the world, such as Whisky Distilleries, numerous Castles, Lochs, wildlife and a beautiful rural landscape. 

Some local events include golf competitions, Highland games, Bagpipe marches, Festivals etc. Visit Scotland pages will have details for all local events happening in the area or you can visit the Tourist information in the town centre.
description.transit:
There's plenty of parking in front of the house and another car park by the courtyard door at the back.

Local bus transport to Perth is regular and taxis are cheap in the area (£25 to Perth which is about 16 miles / 25 mins
away).

The private driveway up to the house is large enough for a coach if you book your own transport here with a group.

Edinburgh airport is approximately 1hr and 15 mins to the South travelling up the M90.

From England travel up the A1 to Edinburgh-Perth or M6 to Carlisle-Glasgow-Perth.

Extra:
* A Minibus or Coach can be hired to accommodate groups of all sizes.
description.interaction:
There will be a member of staff on call at all hours should there ever be an issue you need help with. Feel free to contact us for any further information or if you require any additional hospitality services.

Catering, hosting parties, decorating to your specific theme, organising excursions, airport pickups and on-site activities are all services which can be discussed. Some groups ask us to plan their whole itinerary and book everything, so they have not a finger to lift and can enjoy the Manor plus what Scotland has to offer, without dealing with cleaning or managing  attraction tickets/transport etc.

We look forward to welcoming you and hope you will enjoy your stay at the Manor.

Nicholas & Cynthia
description.house_rules:
- Full use of all bedrooms and all Facilities
- Follow the house manual conditions on arrival
- Be considerate to neighbors and the property
- No smoking in the house

gallery.caption: Dunskey Estate: an enchanted 2000-acre wonderland full of secret gardens, secluded beaches, serene lochs, and endless possibilities.
Dunskey Estate: an enchanted 2000-acre wonderland full of secret gardens, secluded beaches, serene lochs, and endless possibilities.

Autumn is one of the most picturesque time on the Estate. The lights seem to diffuse into the changing colours of the leaves, and the crunching underfoot makes for an all-sensory experience when you walk in these woods.

The Water Nest at the lower loch is a spacious and stunning place to admire wildlife on the water. It is also the perfect spot for yoga. In the summer, the ease of access into the water will encourage many swimmers!
The grand pillars of Dunskey Main Gates, standing guard for over a century.

Dunskey is the ultimate manifestation of your wild imagination. Come to us with your ideas, and we will find a way to deliver. From mind blowing off-site meals to the most spectacular photoshoot in untouched wild beauty, you'll find it all here.

Dunskey Estate built this incredible 16-hole golf course with commanding view of the Irish Sea, and donated to Portpatrick Village. A charming walk along the coastline takes you from your door to your buggy.

Whether it's a foggy morning or an afternoon bathed in golden light, discover the rocky Scottish coastline at one of our three beaches. Maybe you'll get lucky and run into one of our resident seals sunning in the late afternoon warmth.

Dunskey’s magic can be felt by all. Yet each guest possesses a unique key to unlock his or her own enchantment. Here, we urge you to jettison conventional holiday-making and immerse in this hidden gem.
Dunskey Estate: an enchanted 2000-acre wonderland full of secret gardens, secluded beaches, serene lochs, and endless possibilities.
More than anything, we love sharing with you all the astonishing glories and quiet sublimity of Dunskey Estate. It is our greatest wish to for you to be as besotted with Dunskey as we are.
Aerial view of the walled garden. During 2021, sections of it will be undergoing tender and thoughtful regeneration. If you do not mind it looking not-at-its-best we'd love to show you parts of it.

The maze, walled garden, and matured woodlands are a short leisurely stroll from your door. Throughout the year, deers, rabbits, pheasants, squirrels, and so many woodland animals are about that it's practically living in a Disney movie.
We have a boat ready for you to use on the lower loch. Take with you a picnic lunch and a bottle of bubbly for a ridiculously fanciful lunch.
In summer, the Estate is blanketed with riotous rhododendron, from pale yellow and fuchsia to the darkest violet. It certainly transform a countryside frolic into a sensual and immersive journey.

PHYTONCIDES should be our household word. Referring to airborne scents and oils released by trees, these chemicals are known to be a powerful antioxidant that can decrease cancer proteins in the human body. Tree-hugging: let's make it an activity.

There is an enchanting walk from the Estate to the Lighthouse, then circle back along the most dramatic coastline of the Southern Upland Way. Here you'll find untouched wild beauty, a ship wreck, and overwhelming beauty.

It's hard to fully capture Dunskey's magic. From Jurassic - era plants to untamed landscapes, you'll discover joy and wonder everywhere on the Estate. This babbling brook, for example, gushes down to the waterfall, and is lined with ancient ferns.

The site of Dunskey's origin: the 11th century castle that stands on the cliff's edge. The family eventually moved from this abode and built anew after an unspeakable tragedy. Our guided walk can provide you with all the colourful history.
Just as Killantringan Lighthouse once guided ships safely home, the lodestar of Dunskey magic will be your compass on this blissful rural escape.
More than anything, we love sharing with you all the astonishing glories and quiet sublimity of Dunskey Estate. It is our greatest wish to for you to be as besotted with Dunskey as we are.
Dunskey Estate: an enchanted 2000-acre wonderland full of secret gardens, secluded beaches, serene lochs, and endless possibilities.
View of the Upper Loch. Surrounded by matured trees, ferns, and the home of our two resident swans.
This breathtaking loch, often an amazing viewing spot for migrating geese, is but a short walk from your front door.
In the spring, the loch banks are covered in daffodils and snowdrops. A parade of ombre color rhododendrons turn the lochs into a lovely magical painting.

This is one of the three waterfalls on the Estate, but this view is afforded to those who are brave enough to enter the cave. Endless adventures await you, no matter your age or level of courage (ours is close to zero).

The Director of Photography for "Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves," told us that had he known about the Dunskey woodlands ahead of time, he would have brought the production here. It's true, these botanical cathedrals are a balm for these times.

Quite often, our lodges are covered in flowers or are surrounded by trees. Come nightfall, these matured woodlands ensure that you'll hear not a sound murmuring beneath the window other than foraging hedgehogs and scurrying hares.
Spelunking off Turtle's Back Landing is one of many popular activities at Dunskey. At low tide, you'll discover many swimming holes, though you may have to share it with some of the local octopuses.
In the spring, the loch banks are covered in daffodils and snowdrops. A parade of ombre color rhododendrons turn the lochs into a lovely magical painting.
The Southern Upland Way courses through Dunskey Estate, and along this path, you'll encounter friendly "coos" and all the lovely wee sheep.

As Mufasa says, "Everything the light touches is
our kingdom." Well, at least for the entire duration of your holiday at Dunskey anyway. Feel free to reign over your kingdom and run about like a wayward royal.

Dunskey: the Ibiza of Scotland? The Maldives of Wigtown? Anything is possible with a good wetsuit on! Turquoise clear water, white sands, and sea-glass stillness. Who knew this kind of hidden paradise exists on this Estate?
At Dunskey, rural bliss meets soul-melting sunsets on the beach: it is the perfect life for any aspiring mermaids wishing to escape the urban grid.
The beguiling grounds at Dunskey have inspired many elopements and celebrations. We always know just the perfect spot to make your vision comes alive, and trust us, the possibilities are endless.
Upon this 2000-acre Dunskey Estate, miles of uninterrupted high skies, with sheep dotting the meadow, will be enough to temporary stop the wayward feet of the greatest wanderlust.
Come and rediscover childlike delights, such as kite-flying and wriggling your toes deep into the sand, all at secluded beaches on this splendorous estate.

The most dazzling memories will be made here on Laird's Bay, in our little corner of the world. Allow yourselves to be spirited away to endless coastal walks and evening tipples of hot toddies as you watch the sun slip into the ocean.

In early spring, the loch prepares itself for the explosion of rhododendron that will create fireworks off its banks. Here, the mirrorball surface stays calm for the eventual riot of colours heading its way.

The Dunskey headland marks the natural border with charming Portpatrick Village. The Southern Upland Way continues along this part of the coast, lined with wild heather and gorse, scenting your steps with hints of vanilla and musk.

This stretch of road is near one of our lochs. It's where you'll witness incredible sunsets. In the spring, the cows play in this field. They absolutely love music, so bring a portable speaker and watch them gather round for a listen.

At low tide, adventurous foodies may wish to forage for winkles clinging on the cragged shoreline. Steam them with lemongrass, and dip in a mix of garlic, fish sauce, brown sugar, and chili for the most detectable treat.

Was William Wordsworth standing in this very spot when he wrote, "And then my heart with pleasure fills / And dances with the daffodils."
This is one of the most incredible spots at Dunskey, where it is entirely carpeted by daffodils in springtime.

No matter the season or weather, you are guaranteed to have a magical time at Dunskey. We believe that somehow, even the lights here take on a different quality to the rest of the planet. Come and explore this wonderland yourself.

Whether it's a foggy morning or an afternoon bathed in golden light, discover the rocky Scottish coastline at one of our three beaches. Maybe you'll get lucky and run into one of our resident seals sunning in the late afternoon warmth.

Wild bluebells underfoot will enchant and transform every single second of your walk at Dunskey. These incredible tiny flowers, when crushed, bloom exquisite and slightly musky scent of iris, vanilla, and green moss.

The Director of Photography for "Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves," told us that had he known about the Dunskey woodlands ahead of time, he would have brought the production here. It's true, these botanical cathedrals are a balm for these times.

The national animal of Scotland is a unicorn, and it is the only nation with a mythical beast as its emblem. We can't think of an animal more fitting for our magical grounds and the compassionate experience we provide for all our guests.
Ever feel the need to simply run away from it all? Look no further, Dunskey Estate is quite possibly the most enchanting get-away to soothe the spirit and invigorate the soul.

John Muir said, "In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks." It's no secret that wild rambling walks are at the heart of all Dunskey stays, and we wonder if Muir himself came up with this insight from within our grounds.

Golden lights cascade over the lowland coast to highlight surreal beauty, so rarely unspoiled by human activities. We encourage the most compassionate and immersive kind of staycation: one where nature is at the heart of it all.
Geometric intersection of beauty and grace traverse through all parts of Dunskey Estate. Where will these paths lead you on your journey away from the bustle, and into the calm?

In the winter at Dunskey, for the truly lucky, the mythical Scottish mist can linger for a visit. Whispers of air trail through the trees, enveloping it all in a kind of awe-inspiring peace you didn't know can exist alongside the cold.

You'll find historical relics throughout Dunskey Estate, including these ancient pillars that guarded the old pathway leading to Dunskey House from the 12th century. Imagine--these gates were wide enough for a double-horse carriage!

No matter the season or weather, you are guaranteed to have a magical time at Dunskey. We believe that somehow, even the lights here take on a different quality to the rest of the planet. Come and explore this wonderland yourself.

Down into the woods we go. This fairy glen leads you along a babbling brook on a path that's covered with wild flowers and fern. The path ends at the stone bridge that crosses the waterfall, and finally crescendos at the beach.
In summer, the Estate is blanketed with riotous rhododendron, from pale yellow and fuchsia to the darkest violet. It certainly transform a countryside frolic into a sensual and immersive journey.

PHYTONCIDES should be our household word. Referring to airborne scents and oils released by trees, these chemicals are known to be a powerful antioxidant that can decrease cancer proteins in the human body. Tree-hugging: let's make it an activity.
Run along the brook to the sea, linger on the Upper Loch at dusk to listen to the birds and observe the swans groom one another. Note how your shoulders relax throughout this rural arcadia.
In the spring, the loch banks are covered in daffodils and snowdrops. A parade of ombre color rhododendrons turn the lochs into a lovely magical painting.

You'll find historical relics throughout Dunskey Estate, including these ancient pillars that guarded the old pathway leading to Dunskey House from the 12th century. Imagine--these gates were wide enough for a double-horse carriage!

Golden lights cascade over the lowland coast to highlight surreal beauty, so rarely unspoiled by human activities. We encourage the most compassionate and immersive kind of staycation: one where nature is at the heart of it all.

hosts.about:
We are a small but mighty team with our hearts set on sharing with you the most glorious hidden gem in this rural corner of Scotland: Dunskey, a 2000-acre estate by the sea, where world-class heritage meets modern splendour, surrounded by secret gardens and endless wonders. 

Everything we do is rooted in our three values: compassion, innovation, and transformation. We strongly believe that the first steps towards spectacular hospitality is taking care of our team and environments. Here, you'll meet the incredible Dunskey stewards who sincerely wish to share with you the joy, beauty, and warmth in all that we do. Most significantly, you will find extraordinary thoughtfulness in every moment of your journey here. 

We are also a feministic company with a laser focus on sustainability. We use re-fillable products wherever possible. Our heating system is nearly at 100% sourced from renewable energy. We compost 100% of our food waste, and our water comes from a fresh spring. We continuously strive to do more and do better.

Our ongoing other projects include policy advocacy in immigration and anti-human trafficking, working on turning out the votes in America and fighting against voter suppression laws. Seeking social and racial justice is a constant, though sometimes painful, anchor in our lives. We would like everyone to read the two novels, The Overstory, by Richard Powers, and, Ministry for the Future by Kim Stanley Robinson. When not heartened by the possibility of collective action to address climate change, we like to cook a ton-load of Vietnamese beef noodle soup and plot the next magic mushroom trail on the Estate.

description.summary: Wake up to sights of cranes gliding across the rolling hills that stretch to the ocean. The world beckons outside your window at the Velvet Upperground, the penthouse apartment inside Dunskey Castle. Scottish mist may linger nearby, evoking lyrics by the Velvet Underground, "I've been set free and I've been bound / To the memories of yesterday's clouds." Lavish interiors, two oversized-bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms, and underfloor heating ensures you will be soon floating on cloud nine.
description.space:
Established by a dapper industry magnate and Member of Parliament Charles Lindsay Orr Ewing, Dunskey Castle infuses intelligent luxury and historical romance into every second of your spectacular stay. The Castle, completed at the turn of the century, showcases unrivaled technology of its heyday and historical architecture of enormous proportions. 

Enter the Velvet Upperground through your own private entrance at the Castle's East Wing door. Take your exclusive elevator to the top floor of the Castle and open directly into the most surprising space. Throughout this penthouse apartment, physical features will bring alive the patriarch's globetrotting influences and the rich history of Scottish merchants at the cusp of the Industrial Revolution.The incredibly spacious corridor showcases one of the few lightwells in the Castle, where diffused sunlight is gorgeously diffused. Here, you'll find one of the original cast-iron bathtubs from the Castle, now filled with plants, with salvaged mirrors that cover one entire wall. 

The open-plan living area features two commanding floor-to-ceiling bay windows with built-in seats. From here you'll have the most magnificent view of the tranquil fields, the idyllic Portpatrick village in the distance, and of course, the wide stretch of the ocean. Lounge on cream linen three-seater sofas, or cozy up with a book on the curved velvet fainting couch, in front of the art-deco gold coffee table, with a glossy golden silk-and-wool rug to cushion your feet. A mural of trailing vines hangs on the main living room wall, bringing inside hints of the Estate's botanical wonders. 
Cook up the most gourmet meals inside this modern kitchen, featuring a state-of-the-art induction precision-cooking stove top. Meal preparation is made easy with the artisan butcher-block work surface and the breakfast bar, where your friends can perch on mustard velvet grommet stools with a glass of bubble in hand. 

The piece-de-resistance, of course, is the master suite called Sojourner Truth at the Velvet Upperground. An outrageously oversized room that seems to flood with lights even on overcast days, this bedroom is truly one of the most incredible spaces in the Castle. One of our most treasured beds is here: a cream lacquered canopy bed, hand-cut to follow the designs of stained-glass-windows, will ensure the most wondrous slumber. The room is also designed to evoke a sense of a conservatory, showcasing window-pane mirrors, oversized prints from glasshouses, and botanicals in muted shades of green and gray. One of the best features of this suite is the built-in bathtub, allowing you to have the most relaxing soak with heavenly views over your shoulders. The original Baronial fireplace with its hand-glazed burnt-amber tiles is also here, flanked by mid-century armchairs sourced from an antique market in Vietnam. 

The second bedroom, named after Rosa Parks, is a golden retreat. Here, you'll find a lovely grommet velvet bed in the color of sunshine. A mirror chest of drawers adds a touch glamour to the bedroom. Boudoir-style curved dressing table with its vintage table mirror is a welcome spot for writing home that postcard about Dunskey. Green velvet armchairs by the window invite you to linger for more reading and less doomscrolling. The bedroom, of course, comes with ensuite bathroom with a whimsical French-shutter window into the suite, and large amount of space for storage.
description.notes:
We have a non-refundable policy for this listing. 
Guests can book a Non-refundable reservation for a 10% discount, or book a Strict reservation at full price. The lowest price will appear in the page for this listing, and guests can then choose the price accordingly. 

Non-refundable means guests can only get a refund of the taxes and cleaning fee if they cancel before check-in. This applies to all cancellations including those with Covid-related reasons.

We allow one pet per stay. We do charge 60gbp/pet per stay as we must deep clean to remove allergens for future guests.
description.neighborhood:
You're not simply staying in a Castle Estate: you are staying on one of the most beautiful spots on the planet. Dunskey Estate boasts two waterfalls, two lochs, and three beaches, with the most magnificent walks along the craggy Scottish coastline. This pleasure ground will be completely yours to explored, including a private walled garden and a maze. You will have the time of your life, I promise.

The walled garden with its glass house is a romantic and peaceful retreat on the estate. Two lochs nestle into the hills and rhododendron banks. Wander along the glen walk past a rushing waterfall, and a babbling brook, to the two beaches to spot dolphins and seals. Dunskey Golf Course and the picturesque Portpatrick Harbour is two minutes away. Fishing expeditions from the beaches or on our two lochs are available. 

Portpatrick Village has a public tennis court, putting green, golf course, beaches, and many restaurants. It is a very family-friendly destination.

gallery.caption: St Benedict's Abbey now called the Highland Club
Club lounge with snooker, wi-fi and games
The Boathouse Restaurant: wonderful views of Loch Ness.

The fitness studio has all you need to stay fit during your holiday.
There is a treadmill and cross trainer in addition to the cycling and rowing machines. A multi-gym completes the studio for an all round fitness room.

hosts.about: Retired civil engineer.

recent.comments: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at David’s place! There was a little confusion on our part with check-in and trying to find the office but we got it sorted out. Beautiful facility and grounds and located right on Loch Ness. Fort Augustus was within walking distance and there were plenty of food options, coffee shops, and small boutiques and souvenir shops. The apartment was very clean. The kitchen had everything you would need to cook meals. We really appreciated the instant coffee, milk, and sugar. Super clean bathroom. We did not get a chance to use the pool, club lounge, sauna or tennis courts but it all looked nice. Overall a very nice, unique stay and we would definitely stay here again.

items.comments: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at David’s place! There was a little confusion on our part with check-in and trying to find the office but we got it sorted out. Beautiful facility and grounds and located right on Loch Ness. Fort Augustus was within walking distance and there were plenty of food options, coffee shops, and small boutiques and souvenir shops. The apartment was very clean. The kitchen had everything you would need to cook meals. We really appreciated the instant coffee, milk, and sugar. Super clean bathroom. We did not get a chance to use the pool, club lounge, sauna or tennis courts but it all looked nice. Overall a very nice, unique stay and we would definitely stay here again.

Uns hat es in der Wohnung  von David sehr gut gefallen, das Anwesen ist sehr schön, können es jedem weiterempfehlen. Die Umgebung ist auch gut für Wanderungen,sehr schöne Natur,Fort Augustus ist ein Reise wert .
Great value for money and the perfect location

The Highland Club is a fantastic place to stay, with an exclusive feel. David’s place is a great low cost access.
Fort Augustus is a busy location in the summer, but the club is really an oasis.   Local shopping for groceries is basic, and there aren’t many good eateries around - but this seems the case all over the rural Highland locations.
Enjoyed staying at Davids place.  Very clean. Great location. It was a treat in the highlands able to use the indoor pool on a rainy day.
Incredibly unique stay, there is a difference in the stay depending on the new vs the old wings. Beautiful property, very walkable town.

Nothing compares to staying in a castle with a view of Nessie (she can be pretty shy). Great amenities, incredible town. It was right next to the boat tours and the little restaurant was lovely. The canal was pretty awesome too (my engineer husband had a field day). Drove all around Loch Ness and David’s place was definitely an incredible and unique way to see the Loch!

description.summary:
Glen Mor: luxury 4 star apartment in renovated Abbey with wifi, swimming pool & sauna, tennis, barbeques, , mountain views. 
Less than 10 minute walk to town centre pubs, restaurants and staircase of locks on Caledonian Canal. Watch boats go through the town centre.
1 hour drive to favourite tourist sites (Urquhart Castle, Eilan Donan, Skye, Glen Affric etc).
description.space:
The apartment has a king size double in main bedroom. Accommodation comprises an open plan living room with kitchen and separate bedroom.  The bedroom sleeps 2 people on king size double bed.

The Abbey was completed in 1880 and used as Benedictine monastery then as a school run by the monks till 1993. The buildings retain most of their original features.
Glen Mor apartment is situated in a later addition to the site that was used as the school chemistry building which looks onto the Abbey Moat House. Guests have access to the main Abbey building where the pool and club lounge are located.
description.access:
Please note that the apartment is on the second floor, up 2 long and 2 short flights of stairs, so unsuitable for those with impaired mobility. 

Glen Mor guests have full use of the Highland Club facilities which include: swimming pool, sauna, steamroom, gym, club lounge with full size snooker table and board games, table tennis, croquet, outdoor tennis court, barbeque and picnic areas. Facilities are shared with other Club guests - some may require booking at busy times.
description.notes:
Check-in is after 4pm to 8pm
Check out is 10am at the latest
Late check-ins charged as follows: 8pm to midnight £30, after midnight £75; this is a charge by the property manager and is payable on arrival.
Towels are provided for the pool and the apartment
description.neighborhood:
Fort Augustus is a lovely village located in the heart of the Scottish Highlands on the banks of Loch Ness. The centrepiece of the village is the staircase of canal locks which is part of the busy Caledonian Canal - having a drink by the canal and watching the boats negotiate the locks is one of my favourite ways to pass the time. Cruise boats leave from just outside the Club.
There are several pubs and restaurants within easy walking distance (5 minutes) in the village. The Boathouse Restaurant is in the Abbey grounds is currently closed but beautiful views up Loch Ness, are still available nearbty
description.transit:
A car is recommended for easy access to more distant tourist attractions, but not essential as there are many local walks and cycleways. 
Local town centre pubs and shops less than 10 minutes walk.
Free parking is available on site.
A lockable container is provided for bike storage or bikes can be hired locally.
Buses run North to Inverness and South to Fort William from Fort Augustus.

Parking is available for guests in the Abbey Grounds

Fort Augustus,
PH32 4BJ

description.space:
Feel like the king and queen of the castle in this romantic retreat with open fire, heavily carved four poster bed and Victorian bathroom. . Ground Floor:
Open plan living space: With beams and flagstone floor.
Living area: With wood burner, TV and DVD player.
Dining area.

Turning stairs to...

Turning stairs to...
Bedroom: With four poster double bed.. LPG central heating, electricity, bed linen, towels and Wi-Fi included. Initial logs for wood burner included, remainder available locally. Grassed area with garden furniture. Private parking for 1 car. No smoking.. The romantic retreat of Hen Wrych Hall Tower features a heavily carved king-size four poster bed, Victorian style bathroom and an open working fireplace. Less than 5 minutes’ walk from the North Wales coastline and beach, and a mile from local pubs, restaurants and shops. It is ideally situated for sightseeing, there is a golf course nearby and walks within local woods and hills. Bodnant Gardens, Conwy and several castles are within short driving distance, and the pretty Victorian seaside resort of Llandudno is easily accessible for the day.
Grade II* listed, this castellated gate tower is set into the original curtain wall of the Grade I listed Gwrych Castle, and overlooks the 500 year old Hen Wrych Hall, once home to the poet Felicia Hemans, whose famous poem was The Boy Stood on the Burning Deck’.
Downstairs the cosy living area provides a delightful space for relaxing and a wood-burning stove will be a pleasure to return to in the winter months after a busy days sightseeing. A hand-carved mahogany staircase leads up to the first floor bathroom fitted with a sumptuously deep slipper bath and original Thomas Crapper toilet cistern. The attention to detail continues as you reach the second floor and the master bedroom. Here you will find a spectacular, heavily carved, Elizabethan-style four poster bed, the perfect complement to this romantic retreat.
Gwrych Castle is ranked as one of the most important castellated houses of the picturesque style in Britain. Originally completed around 1822, the castle, its associated towers, lodges and park walls were designed by Lord and Lady Bamford Hesketh and Thomas Rickman, the architect and architectural theorist. The ground floor of the Tower still features one of his original cast iron windows. The wooden front door is also original and traces of scratched pictures of period sailing ships, possibly left by Napoleanic prisoners of war, can still be seen.
Extensive renovation work was carried out by the present owners in collaboration with the local Conwy conservation officer. Unique features such as the camber headed front doorway and original bread oven have been preserved and a specially commissioned metal window was added to match the Rickman window downstairs. The 2020 series of ’I’m A Celebrity Get Me Out of Here’ was filmed in the estate.
Free WiFi

There are low banisters at the property.

This property is marketed by Awaze Vacation Rentals (UK) Ltd. Before booking this property please read the house rules carefully.  We act as an agent of the owner of the property and when you book this property you will be entering into a contract with the owner of the property and we have no further liability to you.    The owner of the property may have house rules and information at the property, which you should review carefully on arrival.  We try our very best to provide accurate information in this listing but as we are reliant on the owner of the property we're not responsible for any mistakes or omissions.
  
Maximum occupancy – you must not allow more people to stay in the property than is stated as the maximum occupancy. All guests (adults, children and infants) are included in the maximum occupancy.

The property must be kept clean and tidy and left as you found it – if extra cleaning is needed, we will charge you for it.  Do not use the property for any illegal or commercial purpose and you and your party must behave in a responsible manner – anti social behaviour will not be accepted.

If you damage the property you will be liable to compensate the owner.

Pets are allowed only if indicated on the listing

Smoking, including E-cigarettes, is not allowed

You can ask us to make a change to your reservation but we have the right to charge up to £53 for each change.

If you have any specific access requirements please contact the host asap.  If the owner feels it cannot properly meet your needs, your reservation may be cancelled.

hosts.about:
I'm an aerospace engineer at an exciting New Space company. I travel for conferences and to explore the world. I love taking solo trips as well as group trips with my friends and loved ones.

I'm a clean, quiet, and respectful guy so please be assured that I will take great care of your home!
I'm a data engineer, working for NASA Jet Propulsion Lab.

My family and I love the outdoors and spend most of our time living in the mountains. We decorated the Castle as our home and hope to provide guests an unforgettable mountain cabin experience. We're excited to be sharing our home with you!

recent.comments: Gorgeous, expansive place with tons to explore, best for large groups. Liping is incredibly nice and responsive, we will definitely come visit her again!

items.comments: Gorgeous, expansive place with tons to explore, best for large groups. Liping is incredibly nice and responsive, we will definitely come visit her again!

This castle is absolutely awesome! From the second you walk down the walkway to the castle you feel like you’re entering an enchanted forest with the Castle in the sky and beautiful pond full of Koi fish. The design of this castle is so cool, especially when you climb the stairs up to the tower at the top of the castle. 

Plus the tall ceilings with the giant kitchen, giant dining room with a granite huge dining room table…it’s just awesome! Plus make sure you walk on the trail in the back in the enchanted forest. It’s got such beautiful trees. 

Not only was the castle in the sky amazing but the hosts are some of the nicest people I’ve ever met! I can’t say enough about this castle and the people that host it. Book it, you will be impressed with the experience that is like nothing you will have in a normal Airbnb house!
Amazing property! Hosts are incredibly nice and helpful with any needs or questions we had!!

They’re so nice!!! Response quickly!

description.summary: With Disney-inspired architecture and peaceful forested location, the Castle in the Sky is the enchanted mountain getaway you’ve always dreamt of. Relax by the koi pond, or enjoy the mountain scenery from the Keep or many viewing decks. The Castle not only provides the rustic cabin feel but also shares the comforts of a modern home: highspeed Wifi, TV streaming, smart thermostats, and more. We are excited to share our home with you and hope you will join us for an unforgettable experience!
description.space:
Smart Home -- keypad lock, mesh Wifi, Nest thermostats (heater only), remote pathlights
4 bedrooms -- comfy beds, clean sheets, viewing decks in every room
3.5 bathrooms -- showers & bathtubs with towels
“The Keep” -- a tower with a 360 panoramic view
Living room -- 58" TV + Roku + 2 couches/sofabeds
Dining Room -- 8-person dining table with chandelier lighting
Kitchen - restaurant-grade stove & oven, stocked with cooking essentials, coffee maker, water boiler, dish washer, rice cooker and more 
Courtyard -- cushioned seating, BBQ grill **need to request BBQ prior to arrival**
Pond area -- koi are fed from automatic feeder (hibernating in winter)
Backyard -- private trail leading to National Forest
Parking Situation -- Parking on flat surface, room for 3 cars, street parking will result in towing/ticket
Cleaning -- the Castle is professionally cleaned after each stay
description.access:
- entire Castle except marked storage areas
- backyard trails to National Forest
- the Keep and all viewing decks 
- front deck area
- (restricted) the guesthouse across the front deck is reserved for owner's use
description.notes:
-----------PLEASE READ BEFORE BOOKING-----------

FYI: 10 is the MAX number of guests unless we allow the exception.

As this is our home, we prefer renters who are respectful and willing to provide some information about their stay. Please message us with 1) a short blurb about yourself and your group, 2) your reason for staying, and 3) the ages of any guest under 21 years old. If you would like to request additional guests beyond 10, please message us. They may be allowed for an additional fee of $40/person/night. We reserve the right to deny your request if you do not provide sufficient information or we believe you not to be an ideal guest.

Special Concerns:
- [COVID] we close off dates before and after a reservation (usually weekends only)
- [COVID] commonly touched surfaces are cleaned thoroughly with bleach
- in the winter, the roads will be icy and snow chains may be REQUIRED (search Big Bear road conditions)
- in the summer, it can get hot during heatwaves and like most cabins, we DO NOT have AC, but don't worry, there are fans available and it cools down quickly when the sun sets
- there is no ice maker (bring your own if needed)
- please request the BBQ grill prior to arrival if you plan to use
description.neighborhood: Running Springs is a peaceful mountain town with all the necessities: gas station, restaurants, ski rental shops, and more. It is the first town on the way up the 330 and serves as the perfect location for traveling to the surrounding areas: ~10 min to Santa's Village, ~20 min to Lake Arrowhead, ~15 min to Snow Valley Ski Resort, and ~30 min to Big Bear (pending traffic).
description.transit: The surrounding town of Running Springs is accessible by foot (10-20 min walk), although driving may be more convenient.
description.interaction: We will be available for questions anytime via phone or email. In addition, we will often be staying in the guesthouse on the other side of the property, in which case you can say hi or ask us anything!
